text: They have amazing food. Our favorite are the desserts, especially the raw cheesecake. It's not just for vegetarians/ vegans - even my grandpa who eats meat everyday was loving the Philly melt......until we told him it wasn't beef :-)

What a find! Heading back to Tucson we were searching for a place to grab lunch and we landed at this fabulous little place. Quality ingredients, skillful preparation and wonderful presentation made our meal enjoyable. We sampled the breakfast burrito, avocado and egg sandwich, fresh juices and a Milky Way coffee. The fresh veggies, tepary beans and were tasty and nothing was over cooked. There were no salt and pepper shakers on the table- they weren't needed because everything was seasoned just right! The comfortable, light and inviting atmosphere completed the experience. We will be back!

Pomegranate is definitely one of the best veg restaurants I've ever been to and has to be my favorite. They have a vast menu with a variety of options and even have a separate seasonal menu, plus weekend specials. Since moving to Arizona I have eaten here at least 25+ and have yet to be disappointed.   They use fresh and local ingredient that are always flavored/cooked to perfection. You'll want to save room for dessert (be careful the meals are filling) because their pastry display case is to die for. And on top of all their amazing food, the staff is always super friendly.    They have the 3 best qualities any top restaurant needs, great food, great service, and a great atmosphere. I would 10/10 recommend this for anyone whether you're vegish or not. All of my non-vegan friends that I've taken here were in shock that it tasted so good and filled them up!! Take a look at their colorful instagram and you'll see why I rave about this place.  I have never written a yelp review nearly this long before but I don't think I'll ever find one thing wrong with Pomegranate. If I could afford to eat here everyday, I 100% would.
Slow service all while the front staff was flirting and chatting with each other.  Good food, just hard to come back when service is so poor and your paying a decent cent for the food.

I tried to give this place a chance, but after the second time of slow service and mediocre food, I'm done. I understand sometimes service can be slow due to lack of staff/big parties, but it would be nice if the staff would communicate with there tables as they see them sit there forever with drinks and no food! The waitstaff seemed out of sync and unorganized. I ordered the scramble and it was definitely NOT worth the wait or money. My advice: if you go, make sure you have the day off because the wait time is serious.
I was so happy to find this terrific cafe. The food was flavorful, and the staff were attentive  and helpful. Great place,  I'll be back!

NOT Gluten Free!  I requested a gluten free avocado sandwich. The sandwich was brought to the table with the the statement "we are out of avocados." I took 2 bites and realized something was wrong. I went back to the server and asked if she were sure it was a gluten free? She came back to the table with a plate of bread and said "no, not all the way but here is gluten free bread for you." I handed her back my original plate shocked And she walked away. No I'm sorry. No what can I do. Very ignorant as to what gluten free means. Eat at your own RISK!

I'm obsessed with this place. My boyfriend and I eat here at least once every two weeks but sometimes more often. After relocating to this area from Northern California i was bummed there wasn't more organic/vegan/healthy places around and I'm so grateful this place is close(ish) to my house and the food and juices are always delicious.
Fantastic meal. Had the Athena bowl and it was amazing. It had a side of kalamata hummus and macadamia nut pesto. So many flavors that meshed deliciously!

I love this place. Sadly my family does not so I either need to eat alone or do takeout. The hummos is unique and light...I had a salad with what I think was cold quinoa. This opened the wonderful world of quinoa to me.   I love the pommegranite on the salad. So perfect. And the pesto was nummy as well.   I had a gift certificate the first time I web here. It was from a silent auction at our church. Subsequent visits made me realize the cost prohibitive nature of this wonderful cafe.   If I win the lotto I will visit this restaurant weekly.   Really wish they had some coupons or discount dates or frequent visitor program.

What a great place! Our wait was a bit long, but that's to be expected at noon and with so few vegan options in the city. Every thought my we had was bursting with flavor. At the end our server thanked us for our patience with complimentary truffles. Can't wait to eat here again and again!

As a vegan and  a local I knew I had to try Pomegranate Café. And while I am thrilled to have another vegan-friendly restaurant in my area I can't help but feel disappointed.   We went in here for breakfast not long ago and the joint had a nice atmosphere and the staff was super friendly.  Here's the thing, though. While I was satisfied with just a fresh (moderately priced) vegetable juice, my girlfriend wanted to try their avocado sandwich. This thing runs you $7.50 and is tiny! More a bite than an actual breakfast, this item was definitely not worth it. Perhaps their other menu items have larger portions, and I would be more than willing to try Pomegranate Café again. But for my money, I'd much rather go down the road to 24 Carrots for breakfast.

Food is good however, to go order process is a nightmare! Hands down the worst take out process I've ever experienced. (Actually downloaded the yelp app just to post this review! It's that awful!) But at least most of the staff is condescending, so there is that!  20 mins to get cupcakes with two people in front of me. Wow!

QUICK AND HEALTHY, BUT I'M STILL HUNGRY :(  The Pomegranate Cafe is a cheery place to have a quick light lunch - emphasis on light.  I was excited to see so many leafy greens in a lighted refrigerator case - these would be showcased in my lunch as I had the soup and salad combo.  The Ultimate "un-chicken" Ceaser Salad and a butternut squash and chickpea minestrone cup of soup had an wonderful variety of colors and textures to make my mouth sing - but after finishing, I admit that I was neither stuffed nor satisfied.  So I got a Larabar from the Trader Joe's next door.    Overall, I'd like to go again to try something else on the menu, but I'll definitely go on a day where I need or want to eat something light.

Please attend this place if you like waiting 20 minutes to be seated when there are multiple open tables. Then get seated at dirty table and then the waitress sprays you with the table cleaner. Waited over 50 minutes for the food that never came and 4-5 "your food will be right up" before walking out. We ordered breakfast and they offered us chips and salsa till our food got there. It was lunch time by the time our breakfast didn't show. If you like that kinda of service be my guest.

Delicious flavorful vegetarian restaurant the best I've had in phoenix. Prices are higher than most buy for all organic ingredients it's understandable. I would recommend this so long as you know it's 25 percent more than everywhere else.

We ate there our first day of vacation, Russell was our server.  It was fantastic. We had to return on our last day of vacation and we brought more people.  Place is so great we wish we could bring it home in NH. Awesome! Our friends ate the cakes and said it was the best they ever had.  I'm gluten free and there were several choices. Great, great, great!

I love this place!  I noticed a lot of people there and wondered if it was worth the trip.  I wasn't disappointed.  On the day I went, I had a vegieburger and it was really good, came with a salad and blue chips. I brought half of it home and had the other half for dinner.  I also ordered a drink that was cherry and chocolate (delicious).  I am a big fan and would go more but it is a little expensive.  Also took a slice of the chocolate pomegranate cake (their signature dish) and it was really outstanding.  I shall return!

Pros  Food is always good and fresh - Five stars  Cons - One Star Long wait - I am talking no in store and it took 20 min to make 1 smoothie , 1 Latte and 1 Juice  We have tried .the business 5 time and never been out the door in less than 20 min

Pomegranate Cafe is okay.  I ordered one slice of pink cake, one blueberry cheesecake, and two lemonades.  The total was $26.  I checked the receipt to figure out what I ordered. I get that all the ingredients are fresh and local, but I was still shocked.  I expected the food to be amazing because it was so expensive.  It was okay not amazing. The lemonade was not that good.  It had a bitter and spicy note that threw me off.  The pink cake was a little soggy.    The decor is weird.  I can see what they are trying to do, but it would create a nicer atmosphere if they would get rid of the florescent ceiling lights.  The staff is totally spaced out.  They remind me of the Cheba Hut employees before they became a national chain.
Love this place. So glad they have the extended hours now. Food is unbelievable delicious and healthy.

Absolutely excellent! My favorite organic, vegan, gluten-free restaurant in all of Arizona!  I especially love their raw options and everything I've ever ordered off the menu has been amazing ~ a definite A+. Great atmosphere and service and we come here at least 3-4 times a month, for our "Pomegranate fix". Can't get enough! Thank you Pomegranate Cafe ~

First visit*   Terrible service. If you dont mind that. Enjoy!   Many people experience terrible service here. Read the reviews. I dont feel alone anymore.  The manager was frustrated that we asked for a plate and silverware.  They made the mistake of not seating us. Then the MANAGER came to my table with NO PLATES ..to verbally tell me they wont serve me again if i make the mistake of ordering at the counter.    I politely shared that i told them we were ordering in. I decided to tale my family and leave. I already paid 55 bucks on food   Yup! I was shocked too.  Wow.

I'm a long time Pomegranate visitor. It's one of the only options currently for plant-based eaters, especially since Sage closed in Phoenix. The food is decent, though expensive, but i've definitely had better in other states. It takes a while to be seated on a weekend at Pom, and even longer to get your food.

I had great service and the food was excellent! The juice is really good, the abundance is my fav. The cute short waitress with long brown hair and blue eyes working was very polite and informative. Definitely coming back.

Best vegan food in town without a doubt. Even my dedicated carnivorous friends love the flavors, textures and overall experience. Service is very good as well, this is my second review and I have to give full credit to the management for turning this place around in terms of service. The food was always awesome and is still amazing.

This place is great. I went out on a limb for this place. I was heading to chandler when I wanted something fresh and light. So I yelped my way in the direction of my final destination and found this delicious little spot.   I had the Tacos Raw and the lime-ade to drink. The tacos were AMAZING! The lime-made was ok. It was a bit expensive for what it was. I really liked the concept and set up of the restaurant. I'd recommend this place to my friends. If it weren't far from where I lived I would definitely go back regularly.

I really enjoy this vegan restauran, not only do they have vegan items but raw items as well . I love the drinks, smoothies, juices, and all their food but they lost a star due to their desserts. I love they have vegan and raw desserts but they lack flavor, so this disappoints me with them.....but I really do enjoy everything else. Drinks are a little pricey which is unfortunate but I will treat myself with one when I am here.  They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner here BUT after 8 pm to the last hour open, you can only order food from the counter and everything is served in plastic (take out containers ) that you can eat outside or towards the front even though they close at 9.  My son says the gila nachos are best he has ever had. He LOVES them !  They have a happy hour that you can try some of their small bites / plates til 6 pm, Mon -Fri. Definitely worth it if you want to try some things from the menu.

I am in LOVE with this place. My husband & I went on Saturday after I discovered this existed. It's 50 miles from my house & SOOOO worth it!  I plan on asking if they will make some vegan desserts for our upcoming wedding.  The staff was super friendly and the food & desserts were amazing. We had a dragon-fruit cheesecake & also an almond joy bar for dessert. I had a supreme burrito for lunch.. it was Muy Bueno!  Highly recommended even if you're not vegan.

They seem to use good ingredients but everything is "sloppy" - kind of like backpacker food - thrown together.  I had the street tacos which were quite good but the mushroom sliders just didn't work somehow and the tuna melt sliders were gross, really truly one small bite gross.  My server seemed completely indifferent to a returned full plate of food and asked if I wanted dessert, so just to reinforce the fact that I was still hungry I said "yes".  Still not one word of reaction, yes I could have said something but most well trained staff would have asked without prompting.  Poor food and bad service - this place isn't for me, never again.

Such an amazing atmosphere as soon as you walk in. I was greeted by smiling happy faces which were genuine! I ordered the tacos vivos, recommendation from the lovely knowledgeable girl working there, I also got an abundance drink which was made to perfection!!! I have no complaints about this place! I will def be referring friends to this unique and healthy place!!!!!!!! The food was amazing, the staff was sweet and KNOWLEDGEABLE they could answer any questions and helped me even if I was being a little indecisive, and the atmosphere just added the cherry on top, the energy and vibe in there was just great! i cant say enough good things about this place!!!!! If you have any questions the pretty redhead girl knows what she's talking about!!!!!!!!

Love this place.  Local, organic, vegetarian/vegan.    The food is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for here.  You can tell that they put in the time to make each dish an experience.    My favorite item thus far is the Smoking Tempeh BLT.  It comes with a great salad, that would suffice as a meal on its own.  But the sandwich was fantastic.  I thought about it the rest of the day.  The Arizona Roll is another great item.  It's Nori seaweed stuffed with almond spread and a mix of vegetables.  The almond spread is especially delicious.  The roll is served like sushi, with soy sauce and wasabi.  The loose leafs teas here are really good too, as are the fresh juices.

This place can be nice or terrible depending on what time you go. I usually order the avocado and green chili cheese crisp. My most recent expierence was really disappointing. Before my recent vistit and any time I've gone there they always got my food out looking excellent, taste is amazing (however not consistent). The wait time doesn't bother me, I'm paying for good food I don't mind waiting. I ordered a TOGO of what I usually get and a smoothie that I've gotten before that I really liked. When I got home the smoothie had an after taste of barf, and the food was not good at all. I've gotten it a lot of times before so I'm not sure if they changed the vegan cheese on it or what happened. But it had this orange colored chesse on it and it didn't do the food any justice, didn't taste great at all. I ordered the vegan cheese, but it really looked and tasted like normal cheese. I am really disappointed, I spent a good amount of money on what I thought would be good food. I didn't spend the money so people could mess up on my food/drink. I would have rather them tell me they fucked up my order and spend the extra time making it right rather than getting it out as quickly as possible. I find the best service is around 4-closing. The morning service is just not that great.
This place never fails to impress me AND NO, I AM NOT A VEGETARIAN. Why do you ask?

Amazing. It is indescribable how great it feels to go to a restaurant where I can order anything on the menu without having to ask if it is vegan...AND the food is delicious. Just scrumptious. Currently sipping on a pitaya (dragonfruit) mojito that is unique and beautiful as well as tasty. Menu is made from scratch and you can taste it. Vegans rejoice! Now if only I could get them to move up north to Prescott..........

Food tastes great. You can tell that there has been love put in it. We have been vegan for 3 years and it's often hard to find good vegan food at restaurants- luckily we live in Southern California so it's not much of an issue here, and luckily Pomegranate didn't disappoint! I got the blueberry streusel french toast which was delicious, but tiny portion! Hubby got the nachos which were really flavourful, and he enjoyed them a lot. He got the turmeric latte- you can definitely tell that it's fresh turmeric, not powdered. Definitely an acquired taste but since we both enjoy turmeric at home, we loved it! I got the jnantik mocha which was amazing. I'm still dreaming about it now, and can't wait to come back to Phoenix to have another one!  We loved the food so much we even got some to go- the seaweed salad and a raw collard wrap. Both were good! I would definitely get the salad again, it was so different to anything I've ever had before.  The only cons are that the food is expensive (maybe foolish of me but I expected prices to be a bit less in Arizona compared to LA since rent, cost of living etc are cheaper), and the portion sizes were kind of small (maybe just what we ordered). But I do understand that the food is organic, non-gmo, etc, which I really appreciate!   Can't wait to come back!

I have had my ups and downs with Pomegranate, but mainly ups. They seemed to have a new manager my last visit and things seemed to have improved. I enjoyed sitting outside eating. I had the Strawberry Pom Milkshake. I tasted the Maca Magic, but preferred the Strawberry Pom. We had the Mac & Cheese and possibly some type of burger with pineapple I think. I can't 100% remember what I had to eat, but I enjoyed it.

I was pretty sceptical about this place from the other reviews that I had read on Yelp. It turned out to be a great place to eat. The only thing I would tell this restaurant to change is to get a bigger location because the place was packed when I went in for lunch.   As far as some of the issues that were mentioned in previous reviews, it looked like pomagrante cafe worked to fix them. No more paper plates and the restaurant was kept pretty clean, especially with how busy they were. While I was there another customer had dropped something and anywhere else it would have stayed there until they slowed down, not here though one of the employees who was delivering food to tables cleaned it up and was busing tables inbetween dropping off food. I was impressed.  There are some things in other reviews that are still true. Food does take a while there, which I think was mainly because of how busy they were. Plus portion sizes were a little on the small side, I felt that they were plety big enough to calm my appitiete, which was what I was going for.   As far as vegitarian/vegan places go, this one rocks. Check it out.

I just heard about this place from my hairdresser today, and made a beeline for it. Let me just say it was wonderful. The people were extremely friendly and helpful, the food was OUTSTANDING, the ambiance was warm and inviting. They also had a huge selection of teas and coffee's. Their signature pomegranate tea is homemade by the owner with agave. Super yummy! I HIGHLY recommend this little gem to the veggie and non-veggies out there! Yum, Yum!

My favorite vegan restaurant in the valley, hands down!!   Everything from the breakfast burrito to the handcrafted desserts are simply divine and will leave your taste buds craving more!  I wish this restaurant was closer as I would be there weekly, if not daily.  Well worth the drive and the money if one desires an unforgettable culinary experience.

Very creative food options for those who are vegetarian, vegan, raw, etc. Love that they are organic and make everything fresh! Many many options as well. Love the feel of the place! The vegan cheesecake was so delicious! That was our favorite! Love to support healthy, local places!

I love the food.  Really it is good but.... you better be relaxed when you go there because it will not be fast.  They do have a menu now so that is good.  The drinks are expensive but I had the Hibiscus Cooler and it was awesome.  Try it, you'll feel healthy for the rest of the day.

LOVE THIS PLACE. Today was the first day I had ever tried this little gem and boy, was I happy! I ordered a Pom Latte with caramel, pesto Caesar wrap and a rocky road bar for dessert, which were all so yummy!! The place is so clean, open and fun with a great atmosphere. People would stop by our table to check up on us to make sure we were okay, and our server was very kind. My party also ordered the dragon bowl and Kung pao wrap, along with the lemonade and pomegranate green tea, and pecan and lemon bars. Everything was EXTREMELY good and I'll be more than happy to go back! :) a tad pricey but for the quality, amount of food and the fact that it's all organic and vegan/vegetarian without GMOs, it was definitely worth it!

Let me just start by saying that it took a few times of going to this restaurant for me to really appreciate it. I was convinced if I found a few items on the menu I loved it would make it completely worth it, there are not very many vegan restaurants like this so I was willing to give it a second and even third chance if I had to. The menu is a tad bit big so it was hard to decide what I wanted to try, and some of the descriptions for the food were off. For example, I ordered the curry and expected something like a traditional thai curry but it was more of a rice bowl with curry seasoning.  Their vegan mac and cheese is amazing, I also love anything that includes their home made bread. I actually usually order the english muffin pizza off of the kids menu because it is the perfect portion, it costs less then the typical meal here, and it is simple. The Jnantik Mocha is amazing, and so are the deserts!

I need to start by mentioning that the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. Also, the menu is fantastic. Not the actual food, but the menu itself. The dishes are simple and there is enough variety to appease just about anybody. The main problem with this restaurant is the execution of these dishes. The food is bland, vegetables are soggy and wet, and the meat substitutes are poorly prepared and undercooked. I have been a vegetarian for 16 years, and I eat mostly vegan. My diet consists mostly of fresh vegetables, so I am no stranger to this type of cuisine. The ingredients used are fantastic, they just need to better season and cook them. If that were to happen, 2 stars would be added to this review. The other star would be earned from making the dining room more comfortable. Every table was filthy, and I mean filthy. Crusted old liquids and crumbs adorned them all. The thermostat is dangling from an electrical wire from the ceiling in the middle of the restaurant. The wall paint is splotchy and unfinished.   While this review is very critical (as reviews should be), it is not intended to damage this restaurant's reputation. The owners have a very solid idea, but it is obvious that there is an absence of a talented chef. If the Pomegranate Cafe invests in paying more attention to flavor and a more inviting atmosphere, they will have a 5-star restaurant.

If you want to eat healthy food that makes you feel better after eating it- you found your place. The only opportunity for them I see is that sometimes the owner can be a bit cold toward their customers as you see her walking around. Aside from that please don't let that stop you from going - it is truly the best vegan/vegetarian food you will ever have.
Pomegranate Cafe has an excellent choice of foods for vegan diners. We have always enjoyed their food and the service is fantastic.

It was my first visit and probably my last.   On the plus side the food was delicious. Tiss a shame that the taste and presentation was not the only piece of our experience.   On the minus side the first choice of meals was unavailable, however I was given the option to wait while they went to trader joes next store to grab soy chorizo. The portions small, we waited 15 minutes for one coffee, and  30 minutes for the other.  my 4 dollar mocha missed the yuminess mark, and my wifes cup of joe was not delicious enough to remind her she had wanted it before eating most of her meal. At a half hour wait we went to check on coffee two, when it was delivered it was not with a smile or apology, but with annoyed a toss the cream onto the table in a huff during delivery. The shop uses mason jars or old fruit jars for glasses, neato recycling effort,  Bright burgundy lipstick on one of the water jars not as welcome. We watched the inattentive staff ignoring orders to go out from our seats.  I was definitely not feeling the service or care love of the staff. Unfortunately the vegan wife left very unhappy with the 40 dollars spent on breakfast for three, leaving still hungry, and feeling poorly treated.

Ugh. What a mess.   We went to this cafe Sat. night for a friend's 30th birthday. Let's run through the whole event. We arrive at 7 with a somewhat large-ish party (8 people) and they weren't too busy - well more than half the tables were empty. We went inside and one of the staff members helped move a couple tables together to seat everyone. 15 mins later, a waitress comes by with a tray of waters. She literally threw them at us. They were slammed down on the table with such forces that water spilled out the top. No apology, no offer to clean them up. Waitress looked like we personally had run over her dog, scowling and glaring at us. So, not off to a great start. Another 15 mins passes and she comes back to take our drink/appetizer orders, again gruff as can be. Ok. Maybe she's having a rough day? Whatever. Another 20 mins and she comes back to take our food orders. She brings out the drinks and appetizer about 10 mins later - mind you, it's been an hour now since we were seated. 45 mins later (no joke) she comes back to tell us that one of the ingredients for a dish one of our party ordered is unavailable. They ran out. Ok, whatever. That happens. But it took you 45 mins to realize this? Oh, yeah. And by this point, we still haven't received food, our waters have never been refilled, no one has checked up on us to make sure we're doing alright, and the bread that we ordered for our appetizer still hasn't arrived. Another 30 mins passes and finally our food arrives. It felt like they just dumped hot sauce all over everything instead of actually trying to make things taste good. One of our party members had to send her food back because it was simply too hot for her to eat. Again, no apologies, no recommendations for something else... she did offer to at least remove the food sent back from the check. So around the two hour mark, the last dish for our party arrives. Normally, I don't have the patience to sit around and wait for food this long but it was my friend's birthday, she picked this restaurant, and I'm going to be patient for her. But after two hours of waiting on terrible service, I was at my wit's end. A couple people order desserts to go. The desserts tasted pretty good so at least they have that going for them. But they brought them out on plates, not to go. It felt like we had to repeat everything for them a few times just so they could get the orders right. After another 20 mins, the waitress comes back out to finally check on us. We ask for the checks and try to figure out why our service was so terrible. Her excuse? "Well, we're kind of busy" - (by this point, we're one of three tables remaining) "all of our food is cooked fresh" - (half our plates were "raw" food, no cooking required and every other restaurant cooks their food fresh, too, and it doesn't take two hours to get it). Very lame, very unapologetic excuses. Every time we looked for our waitress, we saw her standing around talking to other staff members. So busy. She comes back out, 20 mins later, with the checks and offers to take 10% off because "we were so patient with them tonight". Whatever, it's a gesture. However, still no apology. Maybe she thought that since we were getting the discount an apology wasn't necessary? I couldn't tell you. The icing on the cake of all this? Our waitress was the restaurant's MANAGER. If Stormy (our waitress/manager) is working when you go, don't bother. You will wait around forever for your food and she'll treat you like you're the one that screwed up for coming to this establishment. Suffice to say, I will never be returning to this cafe. Over 2.5 hours just to get food and basic service? I could have gone to the grocery store, cooked all the food myself, made it better than them, not have to put up with absolutely dismal service... and it STILL would have been cheaper than going to this place. This location is poorly managed and there is just no excuse for that.

What a fantastic breakfast! My husband and I were searching high and low in the Ahwatukee area for a good breakfast spot. We recently moved to the area and are not into the chain restaurants or fast food joints. Pomegranate Cafe fit the bill perfectly. Breakfast was healthful and delicious with lots of flavorful ingredients like avocado, kale, pesto and nuts. We had the Green Garden Protein Bowl and the Breakfast Burrito- they were both a huge hit. Cassie, one of the owners, was delightful and helpful as we were making our selections. The restaurant itself is colorful and cheerful. We will definitely keep the Pomegranate on our 'must eat there often list.'

The family and i come here all the time.  Today they seemed a little off their game compared to past experiences, but the managers awareness was on point, and she made sure we were all happy before we left.  They need to put their biscuits and gravy on their menu permanently!

I just tried this restaurant for the first time. It was delicious, I ordered the raw vegan sushi and a raw dessert. I thoroughly enjoyed my dish and I also tasted my dates dish which was the raw wrap and that too was yummy. Great service, nice clean atmosphere. I will be returning many more times! BTW I am a raw vegan and have been a vegan for 8 years so I have tried my fair share of vegan and raw vegan restaurants!

I absolutely love this place!!  I am not a vegetarian, but this is one of my favorite places to eat.  The food is consistently amazing and the staff is always super friendly.  Great for breakfast, lunch and dessert.  My favorites meals are the California Love Wrap, Tacos Vivos, Elephant Curry Bowl, Arizona Roll & the Lumberjack Sandwich.  Honestly though, everything is amazing.  Their juices and smoothies are excellent too...my favorites are the Greeña Colada and the Braveheart.  All of the desserts are amazing, but my favorite is the raw Snickers bar.  The coffee is excellent too!  Some people complain that it's expensive, but I think it is well worth the money for quality ingredients.

I was glad to learn that the entire menu is vegan unless you ask for eggs/cheese to be added.  The food I had was just OK.  Ordered the "Bountiful Bowl" which consisted of black beans and rice, carrots, avocado, and peppers.  I am an athlete and consume a lot of food, but even considering that, I think the portion size was rather small.  Disappointing.  Left the place still hungry.  My wife had the soup of the day and the Caesar salad which were better than my bowl, but again, the portion sizes left something to be desired.  I might go back and give this one another chance, but I'm in no hurry to do so.
great place!!! the products are fresh and organic. huge different between this restaurant and most places out there. enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!
The menu is chock-full of amazing ingredients that are tasty and nutritious. They are a bit pricy but worth the money.

It takes 47 minutes to get an appetizer. And an hour and 20 minutes to get two orders. The bread on the sandwich was dry and crumbled off immediately after first two bites. The mixture of taste was on the sandwiches was not what I expected, I couldn't even finish it. The price is doubled than a regular cafe. It's bizarre. I paid for two meals that tasted awful and expensive. My husband and I were not satisfied with the food at all

I was so excited to try a new place with vegan food, but my experience was completely ruined by the horrendous service. The food we ordered was decent- we tried the nachos (which were okay, but kind of soggy and used a lot of fake vegan cheese) and a veggie bowl (which was much better but not something you can't find at most vegetarian places). The service during our meal was not particularly fast, but average. However, after our meal, we paid and ordered dessert from their counter up front. We expected that we would pay for it and they would hand it to us from inside the glass case. No- instead we waited over an hour for it. I spoke with someone behind the counter after half an hour, thinking they lost the order (why they needed an order to hand us something from behind the counter is beyond me), but the person said we need to wait and would be called when our order was ready. After about 45 minutes, I thought maybe they weren't going to hand us dessert from the display but were instead making it from scratch. Again, no! I was getting ready to walk out of the restaurant and never return when they called us to the counter and handed us our order (a slice of cake) from behind the counter in a box. Why I had to wait over an hour for that is beyond me and I was incredibly angry. Additionally, I was checking my credit card statement after our visit and we were charged an extra seven dollars (presumably for a tip) after we left a generous, undeserved twenty percent tip at our table. We will never return to this establishment and would definitely not recommend it to anyone.

Just found out about this great vegan cafe and took my guy there for a birthday treat. WOW I must have been asleep to have missed this gem tucked away in a strip mall!!  The smell of freshness, a funky and warm vibe are what I noticed right away!  Great food, Pillsbury wines, delightfully hand made desserts and great service!!

Went for lunch today and was blown away by the amazing flavors of the quesadilla as well as the humus and veggies.  Leslie was so sweet and so good at describing each item, food and drink.  The lemonade was savory to the last drop and extremely thirst quenching.  I would recommend this to anyone regardless of whether you are vegetarian or not as I am not.

We are not vegans or vegetarians, but enjoy all kinds of food!  We have wanted to stop in for several months now and just found the opportunity.   Nice atmosphere, but the tables were a bit crowded together. We were the only patrons in a Tuesday at 10:00am.  We enjoyed the Lumberjack sandwich with egg & cheddar cheese, Maple Granola w/vanilla yogurt and a kid's bagel with avocado, lettuce and hummus. Pomegranate soda and two coffees to wash it all down.  Everything was fresh and flavorful!  The price was right on for such quality ingredients.   We'll definitely be back to try more great items! Maybe take a dessert or two home.
Food is great. BUT.. Completely over priced. And to top that off they recently  raised the prices!! Food comes out different portion sizes every time too..kinda frustrating.
I absolutely love this place...one day I will open my own raw/vegan/juicing cafe...but until then...this will do. I only wish they had a Scottsdale location. The RAW TIRAMISU is to die for!
Some of the Best Vegan food not just in Phoenix but  in the entire USA....and I am a adventurous vegan chef and have tried it all!!!!

Today was my third visit to Pomegranite Cafe. Good to see it's grown favorably in the last year and a half with unique organic foods. The staff is friendly but unfortunately there is an issue I'd like to address.  I have a lung issue with cleaning sprays. After each customer leaves their table a staff member quickly comes to spray the table down for the next customer. The tables are very close together. When I asked the staff if there was an order to the spray I was told "absolutely not." Naively, I believed her. The spray burned my lungs and I immediately left my table to move about twenty feet away. Lungs still burning I returned to my friends at the table about ten minutes later. During the meal I found it hard to enjoy conversation with my friends for fear the staff would sneak in a spray. When a second staff member came toward the neighboring table my friend spoke up for me and said, "No spray." The staff member (male) respected that and did not use spray. A few minutes later the first staff member came to a table out of my  view and quickly sprayed at which time my friend said, "No spray, please" but it was too late. I immediately left the restaurant. This lung issue was just diagnosed this year. No one wants to be "one of those people" but unfortunately now, I am. Staff members should be respectful of the customer. I was not respected by the first staff member who sprayed twice at my request twice not to spray. Say what you will, but burning lungs do not make for a restful or healthful lunch, despite the menu.
The breakfast burrito was so good!!! Would absolutely come back and recommend to a friend.

Came here while driving cross country and sad that I don't live down the street from this place. I would eat here every single day if I could. This was the absolute best breakfast and the best vegan breakfast I have ever had. And they made the best coffee I have ever had. The wait staff was so nice and so knowledgable. Keep up the fantastic work, best breakfast  ever. Definitely eat here!
Absolute awesome place. We got the parfait, holiday hot chocolate, curry bowl and lentil walnut burger. Nice customer service.
This quaint little place is great!  Awesome selection of healthy vegetarian and vegan food, and everything I have eaten there has been delicious.

If I didn't live so far away and could eat here every day I would gladly become a vegan (except, of course, for some brisket from Little Miss BBQ from time to time!)  Definitely worth going out of your way for.  Everything on the menu is excellent.  If you can't decide what to get, then go with the Rainbow Wrap and Root Veggie Fries.  I've been a big fan since they first opened. They were amazingly great back then - and since then have gotten even better (and bigger - their original restaurant was eventually so well received and so busy they found a way to expand and more than double the size of the kitchen and restaurant!)  It's inspiring to see the hard work and vision of the owners be rewarded by ever bigger crowds of happy customers (thanks!)
Love this place! The sushi rolls are awesome...! Everyone is very friendly...Highly recommend!

Super friendly, helpful, and attentive staff.  This cafe is so adorable too.  I was really impressed with all the delicious sounding menu options. I could hardly decide!  I got the Elephant Curry Bowl which has roasted vegetables and curry sauce. I chose the tofu and quinoa options. Yum!  I also got a shot of the Brain On which comes with a Pom juice chaser.  My friend and I stayed and chatted for a while after our meal and they brought us a chocolate truffle!   I can't wait to go back.

This is the perfect spot for vegetarians and vegans! All of their dishes are creative, healthy and flavorful which can be hard to come by for us non-meat eaters when dining out. I first came to pomegranate cafe about 4 years ago and have seen it evolve into a bustling cafe with more options being added all the time.   I have tried multiple menu items and am always satisfied. I tend to lean towards their specials board and raw specials on Friday which always prove to be delicious. I would recommend their daily soup with a TLT Sunizona sandwich if you're going with the permanent menu. As a caution it is a bit pricey but many are willing to pay since everything is fresh, homemade and they source as much produce as possible from local farms. It can also be quite busy during weekday lunch hours and the service may be slow during this time. With that being said it is always worth the wait!

On the one hand... I love the ranchero skillet. Its freaking delicious and I have had it more than a few times. Its super filling, and the last time I ate it, I even got full halfway through it and had enough for leftovers this morning. Its well worth the $10.50 it costs.  On the other hand.... If I buy a piece of $6.00 cake, I expect to get fresh cake. Not the leftovers from yesterday that are hard, dry and stale. We took a piece of cake to go to eat later and was given a piece leftover from what I can only assume was from the day before that was hard and unappetizing. We did not enjoy it at all. If you must insist on selling day old cake, sell if for less than the asking price of the good, fresh cake. Its almost thievery to sell a product of less quality for the same price as the fresh product.

OMG!  OMG!  OMG!  I could not believe how delicious my meal was.  I had the Kale salad and Eggplant burger.  YUM, YUM, YUM!!!  Then I had the Papaya pie. It has a coconut base.  OMG!  OMG!  OMG!  YUM, YUM, YUM!!! I mean, ya ever watch Check Please where they do the close ups of the food and it looks sooo delicious and the reviews the people give are so enticing...?  Well, that's EXACTLY what my meal tasted like.   I wish I was being filmed so someone else could do the drooling!

I went to Pomegranate Cafe today during their lunch rush and it was a fantastic experience.  As soon as I walked in I was greeted with a smile by the young gentleman behind the counter. We were seated promptly and brought waters and menus. A moment or two later another person came over and asked if we had been here before or had any questions. They told us about the 100% organic and seasonal menu. The Meatloaf sliders were AMAZING. They had the familiar taste and texture of meatloaf. I couldn't believe they were vegan and made from scratch!  I love this place and will definitely be back again. The food is worth the wait!

The food is excellent and the wait staff are super friendly but man is the service SLOOOOOOOOOW!  I realize that they care about every dish but, their wait times are ridiculous.  You can't be in a rush or on your lunch break when you go to this place.  It is also quite pricey compared to anywhere else as you are getting organic quality food.  Other than that, it is good food.   Everything I have had here is good.  This last time, I got the rainbow wrap but, instead of having it wrapped in kollard greens I got it in a spinach tortilla.  Very good, healthy and filling without feeling too stuffed.

Absolutely amazing! Don't be put off by the pricing it is absolutely worth it. No froo froo meals here- you will leave full, if not stuffed!  So refreshing to find a place passionate about providing quality, fresh, vegetarian food! My mother and I were overwhelmed to actually have a menu where we could eat everything! Not just a side here or there but full, flavorful amazing dishes!  I got the avocado sandwich, Ma got the Lumberjack. Absolutely fantastic!  Service was a little slow, but they were busy and we needed the time to choose, so we were fine with it.   We will definitely be back! I only wished I lived closer! :)   Try them- thank me later!

I signed up for a Yelp account just to write a review for POM. CAFE. I wrote an email to them asking for a donation for my brothers fundraiser we were holding and I only gave them 3 days notice due to the sense of urgency for my brother.  Cassie from POM wrote me back right away and was so generous in her donation. They even delivered to our event location. She went above and beyond to help a family in need.  Along with her kind heart the food and desserts were incredible.  There were several meat eaters there and they all complimented the veggie wraps!
Good healthy food with a very friendly staff.  If your vegan or vegetarian this is the place to go.

Pros: Their food looks and tastes awesome! Just looking at a plate from Pomegranate makes me feel healthy. So far everything I have eaten there is absolutely delicious (and I'm not a vegetarian). Their pastries, smoothies, and juices are great, and today I just tried their daily quesadilla...wow!  Cons: As you will see from other reviews, it is very pricey. My quesadilla and a slice of cake was $21 (no beverage included). The other problem is that the wait can be annoying. I typically wait about 10 minutes just for a fresh juice, and yet today I ordered the quesadilla and it was ready in 5 minutes. Maybe it is a sign they are working out the kinks. I wish this place would provide waiter service and use the counter only for takeout orders. That would really speed up the process overall.  Great, local, organic, amazing!

The food was good...when it finally came. Visited here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and his parents. It wasn't overly busy, there wasn't a wait to be seated and not every table was full. When we were seated by The host, they were out of menus. We sat for a little with only one menu and then had to ask for more after being asked if we were ready to order. The waitress brought us waters but didn't ask for a drink order.  Once we ordered our food it took 45 minutes for us to get our food. The waitress didn't come by to tell us it was going to take awhile until we asked where our food was. When we asked what was taking so long, the waitress informed us there was only one cook. One cook on a Saturday night!! The food was good, not great and it definitely didn't make up for the bad service.

My wife and I were extremely excited to try out this restaurant.  Especially since we have heard a lot of good things about this place and the yelp reviews were fantastic.  Unfortunately we extremely let down. We waited 50 minutes for our food (we had the time we ordered on our receipt). As we were waiting we watched others that ordered after us receive their food. We were also amazed at how quick the 'to go' orders were coming in and out.    Finally our food showed up! My wife ordered a breakfast sandwich that she said was a sold 4 out of 5. Unfortunately her potatoes were cold... to the touch cold as if they were sitting out for 20 minute, the waitress  however did offer to microwave them for us though. My breakfast burrito wasn't bad. I wouldn't say it was mind blowing or bad.   Lastly on our way out we heard the waitress apologizing to an older couple that have been waiting as long as we were. They were offering to give them free drinks and a choice out of the desserts to compensate them for their time.

I've been to Pomegranate at least three times already, and each experience was excellent. I absolutely adore this establishment.  I love the vegetarian/vegan menu and I love that everything is fresh and local!! What makes this place so special is that it is VERY clear that the owners and employees take pride in their work. Everyone is genuinely kind and helpful.  Oh, and the food/drinks = bomb.

I hate to have to give such a low review but it's mainly because the service is just so slow. The food is good but without good service it really ruins the experience. I dearly hope that this improves so my family and friends continue to enjoy POM.

What a great café! Incredibly fresh food that tastes amazing and is probably quite good for my body. I had the garden burger and my favorite part - without a doubt - were the huge slices of avocado on top. I also had "Cassie's latte" to drink. I loved it because it wasn't bitter. (Therefore if you like your coffee bitter, DON'T order this drink.)  The menu items were a little on the pricey side (luckily I wasn't paying) but I was definitely full after my meal. I hope they're able to add dinner hours someday!

Hands down the best place for clean eating in Phoenix. So so so yummy, I'd eat there daily if it was close and I had $13-25 bucks to shell out on every meal. They're expanding their space once again, but I wish they'd open a second location in Arcadia, folks up here would eat that ish UP.   Service can be pretty slow at times, but I can tell they're making an effort to speed it up, and honestly, I just don't care. Good food takes time and hipsters operate on their own internal clocks, so just expect it or gtfo. Soup and salad lunch is always a good choice if you really need to get in and out in an hour, otherwise order for pickup, make sure to pay over the phone, and take it back to the office or even monge on the patio.  I love the Rainbow Wrap, and the Falafel Caesar. Kale Salad is a good standby too. I wish they'd do a slightly refined dinner service on Friday and Saturdays with a changing menu, but I appreciate that they stick to their strengths, breakfast and lunch. Honestly, I haven't even tried 90% of the menu, but I can say without hesitation that it all is good.  And O, thee breakfast. I've only been there once for it but damn was it tasty.  If you wanna get your inner hippie on, get to Pomegranate. Seriously the best green eats evar.

The food was so-so, but what turned me off was the service. We got there on a Sunday afternoon around 1 p.m. The place was busy. We were told it was a 30 minute wait for a table inside. It was 114 degrees. We decided to take a table outside in the shade. About 10 minutes went by and a few other people came and sat outside. Five minutes later the hostess came outside and told one of the other people who came after us that there was a table available if they wanted it. Our table was right next to theirs. So why did she ask them and not us. But those people decided to stay outside. I went in to use the restroom and there were 4 tables ready. I told the hostess and she said she did not know. Whatever, we got a table inside. what a waste of time. Poor quality and poor service. If I could rate it a big fat ZERO I would.

I placed an order through Door Dash. After a while I got a call from them telling me that my original order wasn't available, so I told them my second choice. When the Door Dash delivery driver arrived, he was told that my second choice was also not available, and that if I wanted to order anything else to-go it would be 45 minutes. This was AFTER I'd already waited nearly an hour for my order.   I understand that Door Dash employees aren't the actual customer, but they represent us. They are there for us. And the fact that the manager of this restaurant, that I so loved going to, treated him and me - by way of my delivery driver - so poorly makes me want to never visit again.   UPDATE: After much back and forth between Pomegranate and Door Dash, it all boiled down to this from Pomegranate:  "You should ask Door Dash to refund your money for today's poor service." (And I did get a refund from DD without having to ask for it because DD apparently cares about its customers, so ...)  Wow.  Passing the buck. Thanks for looking out for yourselves and not your customers.

We've been to this restaurant several times over the last few months. The food is always fresh and filling. The staff is courteous and accommodating. Today, though they were serving only a limited menu, they made a parfait for my husband to bring home to me, since I am stuck at the house with a bad cold. It can get really busy there, but worth any wait.

Cinnamon rolls are great! Made with spelt, which I can eat despite having a gluten intolerance. They use lots of organic ingredients and are accommodating to changes. Eating out often gives me a migraine the next day but this place never does  - I think because all their ingredients are natural. It's often busy but staff is very nice. Just don't be in a hurry when you go.It is pricey but you get what you pay for. Lunches are so big, I usually split with a friend.

It's good to have vegetarian/vegan/raw options in this neck of the woods; they're not that common.    Raw food can be pricey; some of the key ingredients are expensive and if the kitchen is making items like "raw cheese", it's labor intensive.  The food was good to great.  i had the raw tacos and got my daughter the kids scrambled eggs, which seems like a good value for the nice sized portion of eggs, about a half an apple, two pieces of wheat toast and an ice cream cup.  Here's the part that was off-putting:  Standing at the bountiful raw/vegan/gf pastry bar, waiting a bit for the ice cream to-go, I wondered aloud to the manager/owner/hostess (not sure) about how the raw chocolate-looking items were processed.  She explained a bit how it was from "raw cacao powder" mixed with etc, and asked at some point in the exchange if I was familiar with raw food diet.  Not quite sure how that was relevant to my question, but it set a bit of an us/them polarity to the conversation.  And yes, I've done 2 longish stints of raw vegan diet.    I pressed on the processing of "raw cacao nibs", as I've visited a couple of chocolate farms and the processing I learned of included roasting the beans; they're inedible otherwise. She replied that they weren't roasted, and they're certified raw, and "oh, you haven't heard of raw cacao powder?".  Again, fairly irrelevant to my question, and yes, I know it's a common ingredient in raw desserts. Maybe it seemed like I was questioning the integrity of the restaurant, which caused her to be so defensive, but I was asking in the spirit of learning a bit more from a (hopefully) educated raw food professional. I shutdown when she mentioned the beans weren't roasted, bc I know enough about the process to know that they HAVE to be.  It was good to dig a little bit more into the  subject online today, to find out that the questions I asked are actually active debates within the community, ie:  http://nourishmylife.wordpress.com/2013/04/24/raw-cacao-vs-cocoa/  Raw food eating, i think, necessarily causes its participants to be more mindful, and therefore, more educated about their eating and food sources and the processes involved and sourcing.  I would love to see Pomegranate, and its staff, as true educators of this type of eating in the very suburban suburbs that the restaurant is located in.  Unfortunately, this wasn't my experience today.
This place is so epic!  A vegans dream restaurant! The place was decorated super cute, and the drinks/food were exceptional!!

Wow that was worth the drive from California. Everything was great we all got different things and tried them all. I can't wait to try my Togo burrito.  We had the lumberjack , pumpkin french toast, avo Sammy, and the brunch special  all were equally amazing. We got two juices both so good . I wish we had one in so cal !

Very good fresh food. Little expensive as expected from a place serving healthy fresh food and also vegan options. There was a long wait. We went on a Sunday morning. The juices menu was very tempting :). We ordered pancake, scrambled eggs, and avocado egg sandwitch. Avocado sandwitch was very yummy. Kids were happy with eggs, pancake, and coconut ice cream.

I should start by saying I am not vegan or vegetarian I just enjoy clean, healthy, local eating and small family business. Pomegranate cafe has delicious food, amazing staff and service and a family oriented family feel. Highly recommend this place.

I am a not a vegetarian, but I do enjoy vegetarian food and eating healthy.  I finally convinced my husband to come here with me.  I had a combo with soup and the Athena wrap.  The lentil was was okay, but the Athena wrap was really good.  My husband got the breakfast tacos with eggs (I don't remember the name of the dish).  He really liked them, and they were super filling.  He didn't even finish both of them.      Staff takes for granted that you know what is going on.  It's confusing for new customers on where to sit, where you pay or if you refill your own water or not.  The menu also doesn't list all the ingredients in dishes and the servers don't know.  I asked specifically what was in the lentil soup and wasn't told that it has onions.  The food is really good, but the customer service could use some improvement and the prices are a tad expensive, otherwise it would be 5 stars.
We went here for lunch on Sunday.  We ordered a Buddha's Bowl and a Philly Melt. The portions were satisfying and delicious.  We'd definitely come back here again for brunch.

While the food is decent the service sucks. Personally I hate the place but I'm dragged here each weekend to endure the conversation of a kid working here who tells me that 45 mins is a standard wait for a breakfast burrito. No more. Today was my last visit. Note--Not all the servers are bad. A couple guys here are really good. I know everyone wants to enjoy a mock sausage scramble...but step up your game on service.  Oh and get high chairs with buckles for infants that work.
A fan. Love the place, the staff, the food. Never been disappointed. And I go there at least 3 times a month. Vegan, gluten free, delicious, healthy.
This place is great! Costumer service is awesome especially Samantha she is the best here! I am so glad she is back!! She makes my day!
This is the best vegan place I have ever been to.  It's high vibe people and high vibe food that is creative and delicious!

An incredible restaurant! I've been going to Pom for years. My favorite dish this month is the Bountiful Bowl. YUM. I think the service has improved over the years, and I like the recent addition of table service. The desserts are to DIE for, and ALL vegan. You must try the Brazilian Brownie and the Chocolate Pomegranate Truffle. The owners are super sweet and are always around. You can tell they love and take pride in their product(s).  I would like to give them five stars because they're awesome, but the last two times I've felt like the portion was smaller and they completely left some ingredients out of my bowl last time. They did promptly remedy the missing ingredients. I hope they don't do what every other restaurant does and keep charging the same or more and lessen the quality and portion size!   This place is a MUST For vegans and non vegans!

Amazing experience I first need to start with the fact I'm newly vegan and my husbands not vegan at all the menu was foreign to us and I didn't know where to start we drove 30 minutes to try this cafe and it was well worth it our server Stephanie promptly brought us water made sure we completely  understood the menu  made us aware of specials.let us try some amazing soup made sure we were aware of brunch specials for the weekends and happy hours that they offer  and even all there yummy looking sweets she made a point to make us aware with no pressure to buy  she catered to us it was a 5 star experience I will continue to rave about this place and my amazing experience  I will definitely  be back

One of my favorite dishes as a meat eater was Shepherds pie,  so since I no longer eat meat I decided to try it vegan style.  All I can say is that it was warm, satisfying and delicious.  I was pleasantly surprised at the depth of flavor.  As far as the cost at Pomegranate's it is pricey but on the other hand you can feed two people with most dishes they serve there.  That includes their wonderful bakery items.  I have eaten there on 3 occasions and each time I have been more than happy with the food.  My only complaint is that it does seem to take a while to get your food which is okay due to the quality, but if you ask for something else, extra during your meal it seems like you may never get it.  Then suddenly when you have about given up here it comes.  The staff there could not be nicer but they seem somewhat spread thin.  Oh and I want to mention almost everything in their desert case is gluten free and the gluten free bread there is delish.

Service is amazing and so cute inside, however I've never been able to order a drink here that I liked! Weird textures on their seasonal lemonades and coffees. They say it's an "acquired texture"... Must be!

I love pomegranate cafe for all the gf options and allergy consciousness. I do wish they were not entirely veg however. When I bring other people there they have no idea what to get even if they love veggies and salad. However i won't be going as much anymore. Their prices are exorbitant now with the expansion $14 for a garden protein bowl. A total of $50 for 2 entrees (the protein bowl and a special fish tacos) and 2 drinks (a smoothies and a kids choc. Monkey shake). I can go to other restaurants and get 6 entrees (much larger) and drinks for the same amount.

I have been here several times and I will say the portion sizes seem to be shrinking. We went a couple of months back for a simple breakfast I had coffee that was cold that I sent back twice and I ordered a simple over easy egg with their grain toast anyway It came out to over $20. I had asked for a slice of tomato lettuce and some onions --I was up charged for the slices, onion &  lettuce. Also used to have a delightful kale salad but the last time I ordered it the portion was small and it was mixed with other random lettuces anyway it was very expensive and disappointing at best. It does not have to cost a fortune to be organic and healthy --not sure how this place does so well.

Food sucks for my taste. But the drinks are where it's at. Everything is really fresh and healthy so I'll give them that. BUT $15+ for a drink........a smoothie none the less not even a mixed drink is way to much in my book.....

Honestly the best place in town for anything vegan or vegetarian. You will have a completely new perspective on how flavorful and dynamic food without animal products can be. The love radiating from those who work there only adds to the environment, and my guess is that its all that yummy food and juice. Take a shot of E3 Live from their awesome juice/smoothie bar, and just see how your day goes. Also I don't know of a single other location with two full racks of completely raw, borderline beneficial for your body desserts. With a menu just redesigned last week it is most definitely worth stopping by soon.

Went there for breakfast while visiting Phoenix. Hubby had the banana bread french toast and I had a delicious vegan breakfast sandwich I can't remember the name of. It came with a side of "hash" sweet potatoes, which I'd normally love, but they were over salted. Service was great - when I told them about the problem with the side, they took 25% off the price of my breakfast, without any protest at all. Very sweet and personable staff all around. I also had a cinnamon roll and a latte - both delish. I will certainly visit again next time I pass through Phoenix!

We eat here often, and really enjoy the food and the staff.  But come on, turn down the florescent lights and turn up the heat.   And it's time for some decor--the garage sale chic is wearing pretty thin.

Highly Highly  recommended!! The staff is very friendly and helpful and the food.... WOW!! So Tasty!! I wish there was a place like this in every town big and small. Fresh juices, tasty smoothies, yummy espresso, beautiful desserts, raw and vegan simple food. This is how food should be. I can't get enough.  The best part is, a mother, daughter run and own it. I love when the owners are hands on getting dirty. You won't be disappointed!
This place is awesome! Love having a local vegan eatery that serves LOTS of fresh, house made specialties. The food is bomb, the coffee drinks too and the deserts are simply amazing! TRY IT ALL!

This vegan restaurant is by far the best restaurant I the Ahwatukee area. They have a great place to sit outside sprinkled with live cactus flowers on each table. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. What truly takes the cake is that they now we've an option of take out or dine in. The food is absolutely AMAZING.

Had the basic breakfast.  Scrambled eggs. It took a long time for the food however server was cordial.  My issue was the eggs were so over cooked they were a green gray color very un appealing.  The side of fruit was more like a garnishment (sparse).  Too pushed for time to complain and wait for re do.  When you leave most of your food on the plate should be a cue for server to inquire

Let me explain something to you: I am a man. I like to eat MEAT, and I don't want some fru-fru ingredients that I've never heard about. Don't try to serve me brocolini - just give me broccoli. Or better yet, just give me a small tree because I am a man and when I eat, I mean business.  Due to this, I avoided the Pomegranate Cafe for a long time, because what am I going to do with a tofu burrito? That's not real food. And a taco made with walnut meat? Walnuts aren't meat - they're wood. I don't want that.  Anyway, my wife talked me into coming here, and I have to take everything back. This place has serious flavor - flavor that would scare lesser men. I had a burrito without any meat in it - not even eggs, and it was both filling, and really, really delicious. Also, they have some pretty wild deserts here, so even if you're not willing to try bread made of cauliflower, try the chocolate cake, or even better - the banana cake.  Do know that they are slow - like... extremely slow. If you have the time, it's worth it, but don't come here if you've got somewhere to be afterwards.  Also, they have fake bacon, which is nothing like real bacon. I'm not saying it's bad - just don't order it if you're like me and expect what you're used to.  Other than that, enjoy! And I recommend sitting outside - they've got a lovely patio and a basket full of squirt bottles to ward off any adventurous birds.

My family tried Pomegranate Cafe for Easter Brunch and were extremely impressed. Before I get into the food, let me say that I'm not a vegan or vegetarian. In fact, BBQ is one of my hobbies. Don't let the vegan menu scare you off. The food was absolutely fantastic. They do offer eggs and cheese if you need to get some protein and our server knew all about the menu and ingredients.   My wife and son had the banana bread French toast. My wife is allergic to strawberries, and asked to leave them off. Andrew, our server, actually noted on the ticket that there was a food allergy to ensure no cross contamination. Very grateful, and other restaurants could learn from that practice. I had the cheddar biscuits with vegan chorizo gravy. It was outstanding.   Can't believe I took so long to try this place. We'll be back...especially to try the mushroom and poblano street tacos!

UPDATED REVIEW on 10/30/2017: Cassie, one of the owners, reached out to me the same afternoon as my original review (below) and apologized, which I greatly appreciate! She really went above and beyond to make sure that she understood my experience, and we had a nice conversation about the cafe. She was honest about areas of improvement, and explained to me the reasoning behind some of the policies. I was also offered my order at no charge, so I had a chance to actually try them. The cinnamon rolls are MASSIVE, and are quiet good. Thank you, Cassie!  At this point, my impression of the cafe has certainly improved. I was already favorable with the tone of customer service at Pomegranate Cafe, and after interacting with the management, it's all the higher. I'm glad to try more dishes and pastries in the future, and will recommend PC to my vegetarian and vegan friends. :-)  ------  ORIGINAL REVIEW from 10/28/17 - one star: I want to start by saying that the staff is incredibly friendly. Very personable. But aside from them, my experience with Pomegranate Cafe was poor.   I was given a gift card to PC, which I had never tried before, so this was my first (and frankly, last) experience there. I had called ahead of time to place a small pickup order for the next morning. Nothing major, just six cinnamon rolls. I'm told that it's going to be an extra $20 because it's considered a "rush" order for not ordering 48 hours ahead of time.  Little weird - and steep - but fine...the gift card will cover it.   They ask for payment information, and I tell them I'll be paying with a gift card. That's not accepted over the phone, and they won't place the order until it's paid for. Okay...so, we get special permission from the manager to order my six cinnamon rolls with an assurance that it will be paid for when I pick them up at 8:30 the next morning.   I arrive at 8:30 on the dot, specify that I need to pay, and the guy (super nice) checks to see if the rolls are ready. They're not. Apparently, they burned the cinnamon rolls and need to remake them. But I'm still going to be charged the $20 rush fee, and they won't be ready for pickup for another HOUR. This was not going to work, since I had placed the order specifically to get them on my way to a 9am meeting.   Long story short: the order was cancelled, I've still never eaten there, and I guess the corrected cinnamon rolls are now orphans.

The food here is fantastic and the staff is very friendly. Looking at the other diners' plates, it's hard not to want to try everything on the menu. I've had the dragon bowl, curry bowl, green burrito, several salads, and a vegan baked good or two... all were excellent. Their order taking and table service process on the other hand is a complete disaster. All orders are taken at the register and you are given a laminated tarot card of sorts to identify your table to the server. I've never been in a restaurant that takes so long to ring up orders. I'm not sure if it's because the menu isn't conventional and people always have questions, or if it's their iPad POS system or if it's the fact that they have to sort three separate pieces of paper in order to keep record of open orders and sales. Either way, it results in a huge backlog of customers. The tarot card system is sort of funny because there are always servers walking around in a fog with food or drinks in their hands searching for these cards or someone with an expectant look in their eyes. More often than not, you'll be offered food that you haven't ordered before you get the food that you did. Lucky for them, they put out great food, and I'm able to view these frustrations as mere quirks that match the staff's friendly, quirky disposition.

Harvest hash is incredible - ask for their house made BBQ sauce on the side.  Vegan raspberry banana bread French toast!!!  Sooooo good! It's a busy place on a Saturday morning but they work fast and everything runs smoothly. A gem!!!

Everything I've eaten here has been amazing. So far I've had the jackfruit tacos, dragon bowl with tofu and kelp noodles, raw rainbow wrap,  raw everything bagel, love wrap, hummus, and several desserts. I always leave full and happy, knowing I've eaten something made with fresh, delicious ingredients. You can't go wrong with ordering anything on the menu. I could honestly eat here for every meal without getting bored. They're constantly adding new, phenomenal dishes as well as offering daily specials. The staff is knowledgeable and will answer any questions you have. They will also go out of their way to accommodate changes or picky eaters. Did I mention the delicious food? Seriously, check it out, you won't be disappointed.

Honestly one of my favorite restaurants.  Pomegranate is place I can go and literally order anything and know it will be good for me. I have some issues with dairy and gluten so its nice to know that I can order lunch and not feel gross after I eat.  I usually get the burger special they have which never disappoints. I also love the breakfast protein bowl and have tried some of their raw selections - all so delicious! Everything is homemade, organic and a lot of the food is locally sourced.   Yes, this won't be an $5 footlong but like others have said organic, fresh food is pricey. I buy it for my kitchen. I would rather pay more to eat food that is good for my body and that is truly natural. Thanks Pomegranate!!

I happened upon the Cafe yesterday for the very first time.  Having newly found food intolerances, among them gluten, garlic, yeast, casein, dairy - I was very pleased to see the offerings on the menu  that met my needs.  I ordered the Buddha Bowl as a Wrap.  I was intrigued by the TEFF wrap, a nice alternative to corn and rice for us gluten-free folk!  It was incredible!  The food was very freshly prepared, flavorful, and above all "legal" for me!  The homemade veggie chips were tasty too!  I will look forward to returning there again soon!  Thank you, Pomegranate cafe!

I am so happy I now do not have to drive all the way to Tempe or downtown Phoenix to find a place which has healthy food to support my dietary needs. This place is awesome!  They are just coming out of their newbie stage so give them a chance as they are getting busy and also still learning like a new place should. But truly this place is a winner, great food, and wonderful herbal teas and smoothies. They also have raw food amazing cakes, and gluten free choices.  Give it a try....it is not fast food so be patient and enjoy! Hope they keep the same familiar faces as regulars  like to see familar employees. Susan~ Awatukee Resident

In reading other reviews...some were not so good.. but I really like this place!    Service was good, yes, a little on the slow side...but worth the wait!    Food is fresh and amazing!  I've only been there twice and plan on going many more!

I love the freshness and natural components to Pomegranate's menu.  The food all has an organic and earthy taste that is delicious!  I will continue to go back again and again.  Only downfall is that it is VERY expensive!
This place is awesome!!! The food is sooooo good and coffees are great as well. Love the deserts too :) I do wish you were open a bit later each day as well

If I could give this place a 10 star I would. This is the only public food place in the world that I trust 100% with my food.  I stumbled across this place about 1.5 years ago and instantly fell in love.  Their intent behind the food is what keeps me coming back.  The energy in the place is fantastic.  They know what they are doing and build up the community along the way.  I will always recommend them to anyone who is health conscious and understands the importance of locally sourced food.

The worst part about this place is choosing what to order. They have a large, creative menu & everything is good. You also feel good when you leave because everything was healthy! They have very friendly service as well.

I like their Patio very much and the principle concept of the place. We used to go there regularly last year. But then we stopped since our enjoyment started to drop out of several reasons: very variable quality of the food and drink items, coffee is very sour, tea is served with cups half filled, very pricy and getting pricier and pricier (a kids milk costs 4 dollar, making it also not a family friendly place), high prices are not reflected by high food quality and good taste of the food, the inside is very loud due to use of juice makers in the open kitchen (I know this is common in usa, but it is just LOUD), sweet items are too sugary to the degree that sugar crystals are felt between teeth, and I find also that service does not reflect the price (for a 6 dollar drink-in latte plus sweet, I would like to have it brought to my table, if I sit outside and not wait 10 min at the counter, before I sit down, almost dropping two items and my bag in my hand while opening the door).

We ate here for the first time the other day, and the food is out of this world amazing! I ordered the Sunshine Wrap with Tofu and Root Vegetable Potatoes, and I have been dreaming of it ever since. Simply delicious! Definitely five *****stars***** on the food.  However, if you are really hungry and can't wait to eat, this is not the place to go. It took us 40 minutes to get our food which seemed a lot longer than the staff anticipated because they were very apologetic and even gave us a free dessert of our choosing.   The staff was very, very friendly and accommodating, but the wooden chairs and benches were beyond uncomfortable to the the person with back problems who had to sit for an 1-1/2 to eat. I left there just about crippled and had to immediately head to the chiropractor.    All in all, I recommend this place just for the food alone. They really have some great food and take pride in their menu.

I will try this again.  The interesting food on the menu excited me, but the actually food was disappointing.  I tried the kale salad and it was mediocre.  I tried my friend's BLT and it was good.  I will try again, but my first experience wasn't the greatest.

I've been to Pomegranate several times over the past few years since it has been open. I'm always trying to give this place yet another chance because I genuinely want it to get better but it unfortunately never does. On every occasion that I've been here the customer service is beyond terrible. It's generally the same staff working, including the owners, and every time they've been rude, unpleasant, and unhelpful to a point where I feel extremely uncomfortable. The reason I've tried giving this restaurant more than one chance to redeem itself is because of the quality of the meals and ingredients that are used on the menu. The problem? It's overpriced. I understand they're using great ingredients, but I do all of my grocery and dining at places that have the same exact high quality standards that don't cost nearly as much as Pomegranate does. Some of the items I have bought were decent but I've had a few meals from them that made me sick immediately after. I love the idea behind Pomegranate so I hope that over time they can improve their menu, prices, and customer service skills.
Everything about it except for the amount of time it took yo get our food. The lavender coffee was amazing.
Service was really friendly, but the food was a little overpriced. Not my favorite vegan place but still worth checking out (:

Too bad they put pepper in most entrees. Root beer was tasty. Mac and cheese undercooked and very little broccoli. Waiter very accommodating. Second time here. Potatoes were so peppery my husband could not eat them. Bacon Tempe too salty also. Desserts looked yummy though. Lime lemonade with blue berries was too tart and sour.

I stumbled upon this cafe on a Saturday afternoon. When I walked in the hostess was very friendly and sat me right away. She brought me water that was cold and had fresh cucumber- yum. I was excited to try the eggs and since they stop serving those on Sat at 2, i was eager to order. The wait staff kept walking around, helping other tables, cleaning off tables, etc. no one asked me if I wanted a drink or if I was ready. No one stopped at my table. After 10 minutes, I left. Service is EVERYTHING people. Good service will trump a LOT and there was not good service this day. May try again, but disappointed!
