I am from Northern California where some of the best vegan and farm to table restaurants exist. I was happy to find this home away from home. BUT my only criticism is that everything that is sweet is WAY to sweet. They need to learn how to balance the flavors to make up for the of animal fat. Most new vegan restaurants do this and it's a shame because that's all you taste-sweetness. The savory dishes I've had are amazing! Just be prepared for way too many raisins in the zucchini muffins and super sweet parfaits.

This place was a huge surprise and a huge relief!  Being a foodie, and quite the fan of healthy food, this place definitely lives up to those expectations.  If you've ever been to San Francisco, then you'll definitely get that feel when you enter the cafe.  It's got a great atmosphere, and the menu is by far the best when it comes to serving healthy "organic" foods.  I know that many places in the valley claim to serve healthy food, but serving "all-natural" and locally farmed foods doesn't necessarily mean it's healthy.  People that are true foodie's know exactly what I mean.  I ordered the Dragon Bowl with quinoa and it was delicious.  I'm excited to try this place again.

Food is awesome! Nutritious, fresh, flavorful. Five stars even though service is a tad slow and prices are high -- but that makes sense because fresh meals take longer to prepare and the ingredients cost more! Thank you Pomegranate!!

Okay, if you actually like the taste of good whole foods and fresh ingredients this place is an Oasis of goodness. If your looking for a place that says they make natural foods but uses 2nd rate ingredients and comes up with recipes to hide the fact by using spices to cover it up your better off going somewhere else. My family took me here when we were visiting, and it is wonderful. I had the Pesto Presto sandwich and it was divine! I also tried my family's strawberry fields salad and Arizona rolls. They were all really good. The vegetables were fresh and high quality and the price for the portion and quality was a good price. I was amazed that they had a couple of options for people on the raw foods diet. The juices are different, but surprisingly refreshing. This place is a great example that eating well and health can be tasty and satisfying.

We live about 25 miles from this restaurant, so it took us many months to find an opportunity to eat here.  After a strenuous hike at South Mountain Park, I forced my boyfriend to take me to Pomegranate Cafe for a late lunch.  I saw this restaurant on Check  Please,  Arizona several months ago and since we are watching our gluten and animal product intake, I was excited to try it.  My boyfriend is French, and graduated from culinary school in France.  So, needless to say, he is freaking picky as hell.  Taking him to new restaurants that I choose can be a nightmare.   So, on to the food!  I had the lumberjack sandwich, and since I was really starving, I ordered the kale salad as well.  The boyfriend had the omelet of  the day with fresh herbs and veggies.  EVERYTHING was delicious!  It's a miracle!!  After the complaining about not being able to order a cold beer after our 2 1/2 hour hike, he shut up and ate everything, commenting on how good it was.  This is nothing short of a miracle!  The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful.  I'm in the service business, so I really appreciate that.  The ingredients are top notch, and thoughtfully put together, and so good.  The hash that's on the side of the sandwich and the omelet was so good, I would have just had a big bowl of that!  For dessert, we had the Caribbean pineapple coconut cheesecake and a chocolate pomegranate cake ball, and a chocolate macaroon.   The French guy loved the cheesecake, and he's an expert on cheesecake.  All the chocolate desserts were super good and the coffee was great, too.  I will say we tried Green vegetarian restaurant about 2 years ago, and that was a disaster.  We also went to Santa Monica last summer, and tried Real Food Daily, which we thought was kind of bland.  So to get the boyfriend to try another vegetarian place was rather difficult.   We might actually be back!  Like I said, we live far away, but we could make a day out of having lunch, and then hitting Trader Joe's next door!  So convenient!   Thank you, the staff at Pomegranate Cafe, for putting out such a quality product.  You guys are great!

I really liked this place. The scrambles are great but I have a problem with the management. My wife had a bad experience with a pick up order and instead of owning the mistake they tried to push the blame around. So now the wife won't go back so now I take my family of three to The Coronado once a weekend for our traditional breakfast out.   All they had to say was sorry and we'd still be loyal customers.

This place is a favorite of mine. The service is great. I've never been greatly disappointed by anything I've ordered here. They have some delicious raw dishes. They also have scrambles (vegan or with cage free eggs). The breakfast potatoes are really tasty - they are made with kale and sweet potatoes. You can order things vegan or you can get eggs and/or dairy if you want. The presentation is beautiful. The raw desserts are to die for. If you're needing gluten-free, they can also make anything on the menu gluten-free. Sometimes (weekends) they have a biscuits and gravy special that is one of my favorite things. It is a little pricey, but I don't mind. They do have a rewards type card you can get, and earn points for free drinks.

We are whole food plant based, no oils ordered the Arizona Rolls. The nori wraps were so tough you could not cut them let alone bite them. The flavors were good however. Disappointed in the quality. Service was ok. Wait time very long.

Pomegranate never disappoints with their food and friendly staff. The prices are reasonable and there is so much to choose from. Every time I go in there it's always really busy but the food comes out within minutes and its delicious. In practice of being a vegan or at least a vegetarian, they make it very easy to stick to a healthy diet. I usually always get the avocado sandwich which comes with egg but I substitute it with the tofu option and it tastes exactly the same, if not better. Every meal usually comes with a side and they make their own juices right there in front of you, which are also super healthy and delicious.  The Pomegranate staff is super friendly and I wouldn't want that place to do anything different.

Holy cow this place is so impressive. It took me forever to even decide on what to eat and drink. This cafe elevates whatever you want to eat to the next level with so many flavor bombs, layers and excellent combination between savory, umami, sweet and refreshing. No restaurant works as hard as this cafe to create dishes that you couldn't even try at home. There is no predictability here.

The Pomegranate Café was recently named "Best New Restaurant" by Phoenix Magazine, which is a lifestyle rag for urbanites with dollars to burn.  The restaurant in question is in Chandler, home to many of these people.  However, Pomegranate Café is family-owned and vegan-friendly, so I had to check it out.  Everything on the menu is vegetarian and can be made vegan.  There are also gluten-free and raw options, so there's something for everybody.    The restaurant serves breakfast foods like tofu scrambles, French toast, and breakfast burritos, but when I went, I chose a vegan BLT from their lunch menu.  It was made with delicious smoky tempeh "bacon," and the addition of avocado was nice.  My hot date ordered a pesto sandwich, which he declared pasty but tasty.  Neither sandwich was huge, but they come with a spinach-pomegranate salad and some veggie chips.  You get a full plate of food, and everything is extremely fresh, but I wasn't too stoked on the salad, though my hot date liked it.  It would have been nice to have a choice of sides, like some fries or potato salad or something, but that was not the case.  We also split a berry smoothie, which was pretty tasty.  It was no tsoynami, but...what is?  They also had a good selection of vegan desserts, such as cookies, donut holes, cakes and even cheesecake.  We got a slice of chocolate cake topped with pomegranate seeds to go, and it was delicious.  It's so rare to find dairy- and egg-free desserts.  The atmosphere was bright, clean and cheerful.  It was an enjoyable meal for sure.  My main gripe about the place brings me right back to my first paragraph: everything was sooo damn expensive.  Sandwiches are $8-$12, the smoothie was friggin' $7, and the slice of cake was $6.    So, if you wanna splurge and try a new vegan place on the far east side of town, it's definitely worth a try.  But unless you're one of those rich people that can afford things, you might want to bring a friend and split some stuff.  The food is tasty, but I don't think I'll go back because I wouldn't dream of spending that kind of money on a meal these days.
Wonderful healthy flavorful place. The bowl I had was a taste bud's dream. Right next to Trader Joe's was a bonus.

I will start off by saying that the food was amazing! But I am so disappointed in the service. I called in my order at 11:40am and asked if it would be ready for pick by 12:05 and they said yes. I get there around 12:07 and my order is not ready, they said they needed a couple more minutes...so I waited...and waited..and waited. At 12:20 no one had informed me about the status of my order, I felt completely ignored. I stand up and ask what is the status, they tell me they need 2 more seconds and offer me a free desert as their apology. 12:32, my lunch is over and my food is still not out, I tell them I want my money back and she tells me to give her one more minute, runs to the back and come running back with my food. It is really a shame that their customer service was not good today, I was a 1st time customer and was really looking forward to it, kind of crappy that their service ruins how amazing their food is, especially when you have a 30 minute lunch.

Only experienced with ordering cakes from here. We ordered a carrot cake for Easter Sunday one full week in advance. With the cake paid for in advance($70) we show up the day before Easter only to find out that they lost our order! $70 cake paid for in advance and they lost the order for a huge holiday. Pomegranate cafe offered to give us the display cake with a piece missing to make up for the lost order. A day old cake that is missing a piece does not make up for when you are charging that much. They threw in a piece of chocolate cake and some scones to make up for it but when you charge a high price and have people pay in advance, you better have the order ready.

I went here today and enjoyed it quite a bit. The food is fresh, healthy, and still manages to be indulgent. The vegetables are local and taste so good. The flavors they achieve are something special.   For my entree I had a tahini eggplant burger. It came with lots of greens (I think arugula and kale?) as well as some type of creamy sauce and some other toppings like tomato, sprouts, etc. The bun was flavorful and had good texture, something that is unusual for most vegan buns. It came with a side of potato coins (fried potato slices) and house made BBQ sauce, hummus and veggies (hummus was Indian spice flavor and the veggies were bell pepper, cucumber and a whole purple carrot). The hummus was sort of strangely grainy and chunky, which was not what I was expecting. It ended up tasting nothing like hummus really, but was still good as a veggie dip. The vegetables were crisp and fresh.   We ordered a tiramisu (layers of coffee cream, date nut layers and cream) which was incredibly delicious. I am not vegan and normally approach vegan baking with a lot of skepticism as it is often far out of my comfort zone, but as long as you have an open mind, you'll be pleasantly surprised with what Pomegranate has to offer. The tiramisu tasted like coconut, coffee, cream and HEAVEN. The layers of date nut stuff were slightly chewy and had a vaguely caramel like flavor. It came with some chocolate sauce and strawberries and was on the whole really good.  However, there are some downsides to the experience. The atmosphere is cute enough but it was crowded, noisy, and the space is not that large. The decorations are bright and cheerful but it had a vaguely cafeteria-ish vibe due to the tables being very close together. Water is self-serve. You order at a counter and the service is similar to other fast-casual places. We ordered the tiramisu for dessert and it never arrived, and we had to go back to the counter to ask for it. We waited for another long time and finally someone came to tell us the tiramisu was frozen, and that we could eat it frozen or try something else out of the dessert case.  While it wasn't a problem for it to be frozen, the whole losing our order and then not having the item in the correct condition was frustrating. While at the counter, another person had the same thing happen to their group as well.  The prices are also really high for the portion size. I get that the food is really high quality, and it certainly tastes like it, but my burger was the size of a regular burger and cost $12. With tax and tip my bill came to more than $15 just my entree and a glass of water. My friend picked up the tab for the dessert, around $4-5, and her breakfast platter entree was $10 so her bill was about the same.  Overall it was a good experience and I liked the food, but for the price, I am hesitating on whether to go back or not.

Wonderful! I wanted to go out to eat with a friend who is gluten free and this place hit the spot. She felt like she had so many options and went with the mac n cheese. I really love the atmosphere of the place. The only confusing part is if you should get a number from the register, or sit down and have your own server. I highly recommend the grilled cheese with veggies, delicious!

This is a great addition to the restaurants on 7th! I went with my mom, a vegetarian, and we had an awesome meal. Normally it's hard to find options that she enjoys and Pomegranate Cafe was overflowing with them! Everything on the menu looked fresh and delicious. We both ended up ordering bowls but are excited to return to try the rest of the menu!

The food is absolutely delicious! Try the banana bread French toast! OMG! It's heaven! And their smoothies are amazing! I found this place looking for a healthy breakfast. I drive over an hour just to eat here.
Suhhhh good. Tad 'spensive, but worth it for the quality of ingredients.

Amazing vegan food!! So far I've loved everything I've eaten here! Nothing is sub-par, you can tell they put a lot of effort and time in everything they make, with fresh ingredients!! I adore the atmosphere as well! They've expanded a lot and now include an area where you can buy produce, grab and go items, and little trinkets. The fried tofu avacado breakfast sandwich is amazing, definitely try it! The staff is also incredibly friendly and knowledgeable! Pricing is also more expensive but you get what you pay for.

Excellent menu of diverse foods. Great place for anyone with any food allergies or that practices or interested in a healthy organic diet. The staff are nice and the food is excellent. It's pet friendly on the patio and the atmosphere is nice and its location you can't here Chandler traffic at all.

I hate giving this place a bad review, because the concept is so great.  Healthy food in Ahwatukee.  We were excited to go try it.  But since I'm so sensitive to things, we just got some appetizers to see how it went.  It was delicious.  A little too delicious (the hummus, I think was the main culprit).  We got into the car and went to the nearby park.  I started feeling sick.  Lightheaded, sleepy, out of breath, thirsty as hell.  My friend got a runny nose and headache.  He said "I get a runny nose and headache from MSG".  I was like "yeah, I get all these things I"m feeling, from MSG, too."  Now "healthy" places like Whole Foods can and will claim there's no MSG in their food, because they use some other kind of glutamate, which is the same thing by a different name (ie hydrolyzed yeast, etc.).  There was no denying it, when we got the symptoms at the same time.   We thought back and realized the hummus was over the top tasty unlike a hummus I've ever had before (except once at a Farmer's Market, and they used MSG, too, listed as "spices"). They must get a star, I will give that to their organic juice I  got once before because it tasted great, and I felt great afterward.  But it was a bit on the expensive side.

I love this restaurant go there any time I can get over to that side of town. Can't wait for the new one to open in Gilbert. The BEST vegan, vegitarian food I have had around. What a great concept and love the new makeover of the place. The owners are doing their best to always improve their food and service so give them credit and patience and be respectful of the staff and the customers. Very home like atmosphere. The deserts are pretty amazing too.
I love this place! Most tasty tea in the world. I highly recommend to everyone! Don't be afraid of vegetarian food!

Stopped in for coffee and WiFi,  great spot, cute atmosphere and friendly staff. Menu is perfect for those with food restrictions, though I am not. Variety of salads and sandwiches. The man next to me ordered a burrito -likely a breakfast one? Not aure.. it was enormous. .I bet 6 inches around, stuffed with goodness it appeared. I'll be back to try the menu that's for sure. !!!

I regret writing this because I used to constantly recommend this restaurant and frequent it. I had multiple pictures on my instagram of their food and beverages. Being vegan I want to always support vegan restaurants but the experience I had tonight has literally put an awful taste in my mouth.  A close friend of mine recently became sick after eating one of their burritos and I honestly didn't believe her. That is until tonight when I took my family here to have dinner. My father had to use the restroom at the restaurant to vomit and the rest of us felt sick to our stomachs. I threw up as soon as I got home.   Why didn't we tell the server? Well we had a conflict with not our main waitress, but the waitress who brought out our food. My father's order was not placed correctly due to miscommunication and the waitress had the worst attitude offset by her snide comments. After that ordeal we didn't need the headache.  The food is also very expensive. Save your money.   Overall? As rude as it sounds if I wanted to feel ill after eating, have terrible service, and waste my money I'd just go to the McDonalds in the same parking lot.

Loveeee this place! Best food ever and SO healthy. I recommend the tacos but it is big you could share it easily.  Super yummy. Wonderful service!!!  Going to be ranting and raving about this place for a long time to come!!!
Fabulous coffee, juices, smoothies, and other drinks.  Definitely of the organic, natural, healthy variety.  Love it!  Did not try any food, so can't comment on it.

I love Pom with all my heart. Never leave this cafe disappointed! The food is beautiful, DELICIOUS, and colorful! I love the staff because they give their All when it comes to service. And they are helpful, friendly, and work hard to keep you satisfied. Your tastebuds won't be disappointed!! Try the beautifully crafted desserts, soups-Try It All!! One of my favorite spots to study, take my friends, and I enjoy the positive vibes!!!
Loved it.. Tried smoothies and juice, they were really fresh. Also they have wide variety of menu. Everything was really tasty and innovative items.

Delicious, well crafted, healthy food! The options were many and it was hard to decide. Lots of substitutions in case you're vegan, gluten free, etc. Cucumber water, smoothies, juices, and even a huge case of vegan desserts! Peaceful atmosphere and wonderful service. Loved it all-new favorite breakfast joint!

Went here over 3 months ago. Very delicious and plant based. I would highly recommend trying this place out. They have a variety of drinks to try from! Also the ice cream is amazing as well. The pricing is a little high, but well worth it!

love this place, food is so freaking fresh and good. best thing on the menu is the thai dye salad- seriously so good! except it used to be the mermain salad which i thought was better, so i always add kelp noodles to it to make it more like the old version. the only thing with this place is their service is a little slow, so we only go here when we know we have plenty of time to hang out, never when we are in a rush!

We went here Sunday and waited over 40 minutes to get our food. It wasn't terribly busy. It was very pricey and in addition I got very sick and threw up all night into the following morning from food poisoning there. I couldn't even go to work the next day and had a fever of 100.6. I will definitely not be back!

Disappointed in the service and attitude. We used to frequent Pom when they first opened. The owner was always around and she ran a great place. Last three visits soured me visiting again. Still good vegan food, but the bad service isn't worth the drive.

We are not vegans but transitioning to a more plant based diet. I thought the menu was extensive almost too many options but decided on the omelet special. Everything was very tasty for my meal, but my husbands buffalo "chicken" wrap was beyond spicy. Our toddlers' meals (Mac and dairy cheese and grilled dairy cheese) were terrible. The pasta was mush, needed salt and tasted strange even though it had real cheese. Her side of broccoli was supposed to be steamed, but was pretty much just as crunchy as crudité.   The service was just a hot mess. Our waitress was kind and friendly but it too over 40 min for our food to come out, with hungry toddlers...not fun!  It seemed as if there were tons of employees but not many doing anything productive. While changing my baby in the bathroom, we asked for soap since the dispenser was empty. No one ever came back with a refilled soap...so had to wash our hands with just water after a #2 diaper.   I'd go back and try something else and perhaps a dessert, but the service was just slloooww especially on a weekend.

Bland food, 3 of the 5 of us agreed across our variety of pasta, protein bowl, and tofu hash scramble.  They reached for salt; I ate a few bites of my scramble, concentrated on the Cartel coffee instead, and enjoyed the lunch group's conversation.  Great concept, place is definitely busy and popular w/ the Ahwahtukee those-who-lunch crowd.  Friendly service, while bussing the tables.  Finished the scramble the next day, with a good dose of chipotle sauce just to give it some oomph.
I can't say enough great things about the quality and variety of the menu. The knowledgeable staff is always friendly and attentive and will not steer you wrong. Just go! You won't regret it!

cool menu with fresh ingredients, cool concept. One big problem is they are EXTREMELY SLOW! Service and way to expensive. If you plan on going here for lunch break between work you my not get you food in time before you need to go back to work. Plus everything is very pricy, 12-16 oz drink will run you 8 bucks! If you order a meal you will easily run you over 25 bucks.

I absolutely love these types of places, the varieties, atmosphere and mindset. Went here Sunday for brunch and it was very busy, aside from the very long wait to be seated and for our food, the service was great and the food was very delicious! I love the lattes and will definitely be coming back.

Wow. Wow. Wow.  Ever have a sandwich that actually makes you sad that you cannot finish it?? Yeah.  That is this sandwich. So damn good.  They took the menu so I didn't get the proper name but it was something like grilled "cheese".  I live out of town and I will be dreaming about this sandwich until I get back here.  Dear sandwich with pesto, veggies and toasted "cheese", will you marry me??  Oh yeah, potato salad...you will be our maid of honor.

I was wondering when someone would catch onto the fact that we needed a good, wholesome, health food restaurant out here in Ahwatukee!  So many flavorful options on the menu (including delicious smoothies!), which is impressive considering the vegetarian/vegan push.  Prices are reasonable for what a great quality of food you get and the service is always friendly and knowledgeable.  Thank you Pomegranate!

Great raw and vegan selection.  Brownies and lemon bars are to die for!!!  French toast specials are amazing.  Kale salad is still my favorite.  I do wish they had more paleo options.  I also wish the servers were better educated on dietary restrictions in relation to the menu options.

Pomegranate Cafe is popular-and for good reason. The all-vegan cafe with a few egg and dairy options for less-strict vegetarians had a line out the door, with 10 people ahead of me, when I arrived for Sunday brunch. And that line didn't decrease over the entire hour I was there.  It might be the reputation the suburban success in Ahwatukee, Ariz., has garnered as one of the very rare restaurants that serves a vegan brunch every day of the week. Or, it could just be the spectacular food. (I saw at least one culinary institute coat and I can assure you, these people know how to cook.)  Be forewarned: Dishes here are too numerous to choose from. You'll be compelled, more likely compulsed, to come back.  My dining companion and I had the In Season Scramble-hers with dairy and eggs, mine without.  Both were delicious and accompanied by "harvest hash" (a surprisingly balanced medley of potatoes, sweet potatoes, kale, peppers and other veggies) plus toast and homemade jam.  I consider this simply an introduction to the restaurant, which boasts a tantalizing array of vegan desserts (make no mistake: The baked-goods counter is food porn at its best-resistance is futile), not to mention smoothies, raw dishes and lunch offerings that would have any foodie's palate irrevocably aroused.  I'm coming back for the Raw! Lasagne, "Today's Burger" (I had plate envy of the diners next to me), Wild Western Tacos and mmm, mmm, mmm, like everything in the dessert counter. (Please, chocolate cake, be there upon my return). If you live within 25 miles of this place, it's worth a trip simply as a dining destination.  To view the menu in depth (warning: not for the faint of willpower!), visit http://www.pomegranatecafe.com/pdfs/menu-2012-fall.pdf.

I love , love this place, I was so nerves about going vegan. The staff there was so knowledgeable and answer all my questions about the food and ingredients. The breakfast food was very good! Taste way better than non vegan places. The buffalo wings are amazing! I will be a regular here.

I feel conflicted about this review.  On the one hand, the food was quite tasty.  I had the happy hour "chicken" wings with the sunflower ranch and a Jnantik latte to drink, while my pal just enjoyed a Brazilian brownie for dessert.  On the other hand, our server misgendered my friend calling us both "ladies". I found it quite odd and we both just looked at one another quizzically waiting for her to correct herself perhaps. Nope. It was really quite strange.  I'd definitely come back and try more food, but perhaps they could just say "hey there" or "how are you two today"? Take the gender out of it so they don't make their patrons uncomfortable.

Taking reservations on holidays so all the people who don't typically make a reservation and just stop by and drive over an hour to get there can not eat due to 1.5 hour wait time. It's ok though going somewhere else. Pomegranate usually has horrible wait times just to get what you order anyways so I'll just spend my money elsewhere.

Came here because I am vegan, although my partner is not. We both enjoyed the atmosphere, food and service.   Pomegranate Cafe's ambience is inviting. Tables outside as well as lots of seating inside.   My honey and I got the BBQ jackfruit Mac n cheese and the Harvest burrito. The Harvest burrito donates $1 of purchase to wildlife which is the reason we decided to get it.  The jack fruit was delicious! My omnivore boyfriend was dumbfounded how yummy it was (mostly the fact jackfruit taste exactly like pulled pork).  The Harvest burrito was a miss, we were both pretty disappointed. The quinoa overtook the whole burrito instead of adding to it.   We came on a Saturday night and the service was pretty slow, but the servers seem like they all help each other out so no one has to wait too long.   Over all super cute! Like any other vegan and/or locally sourced place your dollar won't stretch far. Burrito, Mac n cheese, a shake and two desserts was $50 not including tip. $$   Side note: I got the Snikkers bar, but don't let it fool you the description is that of an Almond Joy bar! I did not read the description and fully expected something of that similar to a known Snickers bar. Nevertheless it was yummy!

Unfortunately, I will never dine at this establishment again. The service I received from a waitress was horrible and very unprofessional. I was made to feel that my business was not wanted and that I had no business making a special request. There is a male supervisor that is very kind and professional there that knew the waitress was giving me horrible service. On top of that the food is overpriced and not very flavorful.

If you are vegetarian/vegan or even just looking for healthy food that still tastes amazing, look no further! The food is phenomenal and the staff is so friendly! Everything about this place is amazing!!  Update: I'm so sad!! This place is no longer good... the last six times my family and I have been here the food has been mediocre. Just came from this place after eating crunchy, cold and char-tasting pancakes and their pancakes use to have the best pancakes in the valley vegan or not vegan. I used to loveee this place! Very upsetting... this food is now everything non-vegans say vegan food tastes like... flavorless cardboard.

Go to this Cafe whenever I am in Phoenix area.  They make great Vegan food and drinks.  Rodrigos rocket fuel is soooo good.  I get it minus the espresso.  I love the Grilled Cheese Napoleon with vegan cheese, very good.  I am already looking forward to my next visit to Phoenix.  I will be there.

I love this place, they have amazing food!  I love trying new things and this place always has something yummy and new on the menu.  The only bad thing I could say is that it's pretty expensive (hence the reason why I didn't give 5 stars).  I only eat here maybe a few times a year because of that.

Holy cow. Shame on me for taking so long to write this review. The place is earthy, a bit hippy, and plenty friendly. Oddly out of place in the urban jungle that is the Phoenix metro area, but definitely welcome.   Some of the menu is raw, but I'm often up for trying new things, so I ordered the bagel sandwich (no onion). This is without a doubt, one of the best vegan dishes I've had in a restaurant, the bagel was more like a flat bread, and the filling was just the right about vegetables, including sprouts and vegan cream cheese. Fantastic.   I'd also ordered a too large bottle of organic ale (excellent too) , and gave the rest to the neighboring table. Finally, I risked the dessert. It was OK, but it didn't matter, the rest was amazing.   Sadly my short time in Chandler meant that I wasn't able to go again. I'm sure I'll visit again one day. I just hope it's not 114 out.

Wow, the food was really really good.  I ordered the brunch special: breakfast quesadilla with tofu chorizo and pumpkin latte.  The food was seasoned so well.  Everyone in my group enjoyed their food.  Busy busy place, but worth the wait.  I will definitely be back!

Waited an extremely long time after placing our order and ended up leaving and going to Mod pizza instead. My daughter also has a nut allergy which made finding a safe meal choice a little nerve racking considering everything has nuts in it here including the kids mac and cheese. Waitress was very nice but the wait just killed it for us.

I'm not sure if it's just me, but does anyone else have a hit or miss with the salads lately? :( I remember ordering the naked burger once and the kale salad that comes with it was so dry and the kale was almost yellow? Then I've ordered the native cobb to go, twice, and the first time it was missing the guacamole and even when mixing the dressing it was still so dry. The second time I asked for the dressing to be mixed in and it was still dry? Don't get me wrong, I absolutely love this place to bits and rave about it! I'm bound to return, but it kind of sucks making the 40 minute drive to treat myself to food from here and I get my meal only to be mildly disappointed.

I am allergic to gluten and eggs, so it was nice to find a place that supported food allergies. However the food was over-the-top happy. That's the only word I could think of to describe it :-). Everything is organic , but they go further in making the ingredients only available in its alternative form. For example, organic maple syrup was the only option. Coconut whipped cream was the only option.  Much of the food tasted like cardboard. I had cranberry pancakes that were free and egg free, vegan, and they were not good.  For someone that has severe allergies and likes alternative ingredients, this would be a good place to go. Great atmosphere, good patio to sit on, but more expensive than the average.

It is hard to find great vegan food, this place is fantastic! I love the ambiance. The rest of my family eats meat but even they loved it. I was nervous about the kids liking it but they also devoured their food. Definitely a place to return to!

One of my favs! Good vegan food. Good selection. Great soups! Try the mint lemonade. Yum!! Service with a smile. Tasty desserts! I had the pomegranate chocolate cake and it was the best cake I've had in awhile! Fresh fruit is great for those calorie conscience. Outside patio is good for a casual setting.

If you're into healthy, organic/vegan, fair-trade food, this is the place to go! It's generally always busy so I wouldn't say come here when you're in a rush. I have tried several things on the menu and am never disappointed. I'm only giving it four stars though because yes, it is a bit pricy. Still- worth it!

I love this place!  Great service and folds.   I loved the hollandaise  sauce.   The pom cooler was way too sweet so i watered it down.    Only bad side-  i do not like their baked goods.  I tried the below:  Almond joy- tasted like it was made with old days Fudge brownie- also tasted like it was made with old dates.   I couldn't eat more than 1 bite.   Pistachio  cookies- THE BOMB!! I love these Pesto scones- these were just ok.  I love the flavor but way to dry.   They crumbled in my hand.    I will be back though i will stay away from the juices & baked goods.

we need more places like this. whole, healthy foods, gluten free, vegan. yessssss! if you're looking for fries and gigantic, unhealthy portions, look elsewhere. the prices are in line with what you get, which is fresh, delicious, healthy, real food.
Great food, great ambiance worth every penny! Choices abound, freshly made authentic flavors, etc...highly recommend it.

Let me start by saying I am not a vegan or vegetarian and that is probably why it took me so long to hit this place. That said, I regret not having come earlier. I tried their cashew nachos and was blown away. I never knew replacing meat with cashew nuts would be such a winning combination. Then came my blueberry lavender smoothie, blown away again. Lastly came my main dish, an avocado sandwich with house-made focaccia bread, eggs (they gave me the option of no eggs) and a pepita (pumpkin seed) pesto. Blown away yet again! Three (positive) strikes means it is a 5-star review here!! Must go back!!
Good food but the price are a bit too high for the value you get. Do wild flowers bread if you want salad :- )

The food was good, not great. The service was decent. 2 Juices, French Toast w/eggs, nachos, and a bowl of yellow curry with rice and veggies came to ~$70. The food and service deserve 3.5/4 stars, but you do healthy eating and the planet a disservice with food priced like that. There is no way the ingredients used cost more than 10 dollars. If they cared about the planet they would set a price point which more people can afford. I hope they at least pay their servers 15-20/hr. That being said I would never mention any of this, if I didn't see all this big talk of helping the planet and animals out in their menu. But if you're going to use that as part of your schtick you'll be judged on it. People Planet Profit, talk is cheap.

Don't believe the hype!  I'm a carnivore that is still impressed by a great vegan or vegetarian meal. I gave Pomegranate several opportunities to see why it was ranked at 4 stars. The final time was the last straw. This place failed on all accounts.   This review is for the last time I was there for breakfast, which was a few months back.   1) The prices are way too high. For some reason, restaurant owners seem to do this to make patrons feel like it is higher quality. Far from it in this case.   2) The food took forever!!!  It wasn't that crowded. But they had plenty of staff and it's not incredibly involved food to make. Most of it is not even cooked!  3) Even though we were there for ages, we were rarely checked on by our waitress.   4) By the time our food showed up, it was cold!  I'm not a huge fan of cold scrambled eggs.   5) This last part still blows my mind. My girlfriend ordered a blended drink with her meal. Several sips in she had a major reaction. She grabbed her mouth in pain. There was a sharp plastic shard in her drink that sliced into her gums. I asked for a manger who explained that it was probably from the container of one of the ingredients. She then proceeded to give us a gift card that had $25 written on it. She did not offer to cover our $70 breakfast!!!  The real kicker is that we went to redeem the card later on 2 frozen drinks only to find out that the gift card value was only $15 even though she had written $25 on the card. The drinks that we ordered were both so gross, that we threw them out.   Trust me, don't believe the hype.  Just because it's trendy, doesn't mean it's good.

Gluten free options!    Have been going here awhile and finally decided to write a review.  The atmosphere is cheery, bright and casual.  If your looking for meat of any type this would not be for you unless you want to trip something different.  The raw tacos with the walnut meat are very tasty.  In fact anything with the walnut meat is good.  The bountiful bowl is another winner and you can have quinoa or brown rice in it.  They have many different excellent juices or smoothies to pick from as well.  Since they have a lot of raw desserts it gives a person who is gluten free many delicious options.  My favorite is only made on Fridays and is the tiramisu.  With the exception of the crust is even rivals the gluten version as far as flavor goes.  They are a bit pricey, but since quality matters to me I don't mind paying for it. Should you go always check their hours first because they change at times as they have experimented staying open for dinner.    Customer service is very good.  They want your experience to be good and have you return.    The one recommendation I would make is they really need to keep the bathroom clean!  They have one unisex bathroom with just a very small trash can that is often overflowing and unsightly.  It is actually a good size bathroom, but they have no shelf or some type of table for ladies to place their items on.  They have a small hook on the wall, but if you don't have something with straps then you have to place it on the dirty floor.  Also really please clean the sink.

Another year has passed since my last review and the Pom is still the best restaurant around. Whether you are vegetarian, vegan or not this is a wonderful place to get some grub. The entire staff is incredibly friendly and helpful whenever I venture in for breakfast or lunch.  There are lots of new faces here now, but the service and friendly vibe are all still in full force. They always seem to know everyone. They have a dedicated following, but they are just as nice to new comers. I try and bring all of my friends and family even though none are vegetarian.   They have seriously killer breakfast foods. The top being the Lumber Jack Sandwich though their breakfast specials have never disappointed me. Be on the lookout for their special pancakes and the vegetarian "Sausage Biscuits" and gravy. My personal favorite lunch food is the RAW Tacos which have walnut taco meat ( yeah I know it's still fantastic).  They are the offspring of amazingly delicious mexican food and a salad.  If you don't know what to get just ask. They are always super helpful at explaining things and making great suggestions or just get something from the vegan desert case everything is awesome.  Try:  - Lumber Jack Sandwich - RAW Tacos - Mocha - Breakfast Specials - Passion Juice - Chocolate Banana Muffins - Snickers Bars - Hummus

I recommend eat here when you're dining in, NEVER order to go. The wait is ridiculous when you order to go. I had to wait nearly an hour on a Tuesday around 6:45pm.   I've had brunch and juice here before and it's been delicious. Last night I ordered sandwiches and they were quite gross. I also ordered a cupcake and I gagged it down just because my bill was about $45. I probably won't be back except for their juice or brunch. Way too expensive for the taste of food.

Even meat eaters will seek this place out if they are adventurous enough to give it a try. Vegans will Love love it.  Everything I've had has been excellent. Some faves: * TLT *Vegan  grilled cheese  napoleon  * salads...ALL of them!  Native Cob with "chicken" is a standout * elephant  bowl * CA  Love Wrap * sliders & quesedillas no matter what the fillings are!   The best part....no animals have to die!
Much improved over first visit! Had the vegan fettuccini Alfredo mushroom . Very tasty.
Phoenix location is Open!  Was feeling a bit low energy today but came here and feel much better!  So glad I don't have to drive to Ahwatukee!!

Sunday morning brunch is best the time to come here. Such a happy, calming atmosphere and love that they move at a slower pace here so it really forces you to be present for a whole meal. It is busier on weekends for brunch but worth the wait. All their food is amazing and made with great ingredients. Coming here is like going to a wellness center, just doing something good for myself. Love their pancakes and breakfast sandwiches. Really filling and delicious. So far I've tried lemon blueberry pancakes and rocky road. The rocky road pancakes were so good but be ready to share because they are super rich, chocolatey, and basically dessert. I got tofu scramble so I could have a bite of something savory too. Besides their brunch menu I've also tried their desserts. When you walk in they have a case of raw cakes, muffins, cupcakes, and chocolate desserts. I usually don't like raw desserts much but everything they have is so good.
I highly recommend Pomegranate Café. The food is delicious and the people who work there are nice.

This place has the best dang chilaquiles ever! Also fresh lavender kombucha. Service is excellent! The food is so filling too, that's good wholesome food for ya  I wish they had one in Scottsdale coz it's a drive but TOTALLY worth it.
A new favorite!!! Delicious! Fresh & full of variety. Especially enjoyed the raw tacos & vegan pizza. Pricey but its all organic and a better serving size than some other gourmet joints.

The four of us were very excited to try this place as one of them had been to another location.  Long story short......food was just ok.....th service was terrible.   It took forever!!!!!!  Waitress would walk by and not even acknowledge us.....I was facing the kitchen and saw 3 plates of food sit on the counter for over 15 minutes band fore it was brought out. It wasn't even that busy!!!  Sorry ....won't be going back.  Too many other options!
The food is ridiculously overpriced. $10 for a smoothie? You have got to be kidding. It does have a nice ambience though and the food is decent, but way too greasy.

If you are vegan or a veg-curious, Pomegranate Cafe is the best hope you have to stick to your new-found diet.  The staff and owners are passionate, intelligent, and incredibly hardworking.    Look folks... in order to be able to make as much fresh food as this place does, it is going to cost a lot on overhead.  Just to carry all of the fresh veggies and fruits for smoothies and juice has to be a fridge jenga feat on it's own.  Most restaurant owners do not care enough about their regulars to make this a reality.  To be completely honest, Pom is undercharging on most of their pastries and juices which is why I am totally blown away by their customer service.  What's that?  You used to eat cheesecake while watching Oprah in the 80's but you can't do it anymore because your trainer said that those days are over?  Well, then you should eat the delicious RAW VEGAN CHEESECAKE at Pom (shhh... it's made of nuts and other goodies).  What's that?  You like to go to Whole Foods and pay 10 dollars for juice?  Pomegranate is faster, cheaper, and they use local ingredients when it is smart to do so.  Conscious capitalism indeed.  Oh, you like to eat in unique, vibrant settings?  This place has beautiful colored walls, an open view of the juice bar and clear fridges so you can dine and feel like you are part of the action.  While most places will hide what they do to YOUR food, Pom offers more transparency, so you can rest easy that your food is being prepared with great service and with fresh ingredients.  What is this green stuff?  Look, I have eaten a lot of the stuff here, but STRAIGHT UP, you have to try something that has the cilantro pesto.  This sauce will gussy up any Mexican food dish, a spark for the tip of your tongue, with a small lemon tang, and a nice fresh smooth and soothing swallow that blooms with spice and heat.  And this sauce is a beautiful baseball field green.  I didn't even know that this was a culinary possibility until I ate here.  I noticed that there are some reviews on here about bad service, but I was informed that the space was remodeled about a year ago.  Most of the one star and two star reviews were from before the remodel, which shows how much focus and attention the owners (a mother and daughter that currently work at Pom) and staff have really put into growing as an establishment.  Please, do yourself a flavor, and stop in for a juice or treat if you happen to be in the neighborhood.  You can either sit down and eat a full meal (appetizers, course, desert, coffee), or take a quick juice or pastry to go in minutes.  It can't be easy to offer so many types of service AND be all natural plant based.  KUDOS TO POM FOR SETTING THE BAR HIGHER.  Nom Nom Pom.
Can't wait to come back and try their brunch! Loved the vegan and gluten free options. Desserts were outstanding!

I have to flip a coin to decide between this place and Chakra 4, and even 24 Carrots down the road from Poms. They all are similar in options and prices, but I prefer 24 Carrots as they 100% vegan and a quite bit friendlier. Service can be hit or miss, and there is an older lady that growls at us sometimes -- and I am not the only one that has imagined this. She's been out the last several times I have visited, so I'm happier about that. Yes, they are pricey, but in line with their competition. Parking can be a PITA during the weekend. Seems to appeal to the ladies brunch crowd, but the estrogen decor is not out of control.

One of my favorite restaurants! This place is absolutely amazing. The food is healthy and delicious. I haven't tried everything on the menu, but the gila monster nachos and veggie wraps are amazing. I hope they open up more locations in the valley!!!

Local, organic and delicious! I've been a frequent customer for years and the food is always delicious, and the staff is always friendly and personable. There's no way you'll regret giving this place a try!!

For those of you who just like your facts/ info short and sweet, here you go: -It is a locally owned (family owned too) & operated cafe! -Located in Ahwatukee (...imagine that!...of all places;-) -Offers a truly magnificent selection a FRESHLY made items:  tea, fresh squeezed juice, coffee, brkfst foods, lunch items, ("healthy"/wholesome) treats / desserts, and so very much more... -Very reasonably priced items -Great helpful, energentic & informative staff!    -You DON'T just have to be a "healthnut" to eat here (which it's certainly okay if you are...BUT It's a great place to hangout for tea, coffee & "people watching" too!) - Free wi-fi (yeah-true- Starbux has it, everyone pretty much does - BUT Pomegranate is way superior overall in every aspect!) -For more info see their website at:  www.pomegranatecafe.com  - especially for hours, location & menu!  For those of you that need a little more info / aka a bigger -nudge- to be persuaded to try this great place...check out my long winded love letter -oh, I mean overview. I hope you find it to be honest, humorous & helpful:  Pomegranate Cafe' is sincerely a WONDERFULLY delightful place! ....& it is truly a DREAM COME TRUE! The the newly decorated window of this awesomely vibrant, yet quaint and cozy cafe reads 3 simply lovely words:  *Local* Seasonal*Organic   The day that I saw this sign I knew I was in love...or- that a small piece of heaven had quite literally landed in my "backyard" (-aka it's just a few blocks from my home! yippee!). I then sighed with an unmistakable sense of  "finally, a breath of "fresh air!"...in a world of lack luster fast, processed foods- a place I can go to be free from it all...close to home.  A locally owned cafe of this high quality caliber (again they organic, seasonal and even some Live/Raw items), comfort and affordability I feel is very a rare thing...Not forgetting to mention that  this cafe is NOT located in Downtown/ Metro PHX...It located in Ahwatukee! It's right next to Trader Joe's on 38th & Chandler Blvd!     This place will be mos def. be my "hangout" from now on, whenever possible- until I either leave PHX, or pass into another life! I am only 30- so I hope that it isn't the latter! By the way, in jest- I told the owner, Cassie that if I could I would love to just sign over my paycheck to her, & I meant it! She would only have to share it with a few other fave places like Changing Hands Bookstore,Trader Joe's,W.Foods & Agritopia(& Joe' s BBQ), (& the local farmer's mkts.)! Well, since that isn't possible of course I will just have to continue to support this little awesome local business in any way I can!  Which bring me to the last, but certainly not least... Mentioning of he cafe's {glorious} offerings! Seriously. I mean this...Sincerely superb!!!! Everything on the menu is so very fresh and equally fresh tasting! I would be hard pressed to think that anything you could ever order from Pomegranate to be any less than perfect & enjoyable!   My very first visit, on their {soft} opening day- I had a severe cold and the nice young lady / staff made me an herbal tea called "Vitali-Tea." After that very 1st visit- I was truthfully dumbfounded and struck down by the very feeling of unadulterated *love* embodied by a physical place! I counted the days until I could make the time to visit again! My 2nd visit was actually just yesterday. I hadn't eaten anything in the morning, it was way past lunch & and I was extremely hungry! I was also very tired from a company mting- which was in freaking Peoria! (grrr!)- & as I passed by Phoenix's demure skyline (*i'm from NWI/ Chicagoland area*) my tummy & mind wandered through the "Roosevelt Row" area of metroPHX... However, I was drawn closer & closer to home in Ahwatukee, not just by the promise of sleep but also by the overwhelming desire to visit Pomegranate once again. I stepped in the Cafe' with a big appetite and little desire to spend a great deal of $...Pay day, bills and such...pending...a horrible concoction...So I decided on the quiche of the day which came w/ a (phenomenally fresh) house salad. I then splurged and opted for some energy in the form of a cup of fresh-squeezed juice drink called "Laughter." I broke out my net-book, sat down to eat....And my mouth was over taken by the fresh flavor of each individual item that I ordered as I ate it. Complete taste bud loveliness...and overload at the same time! I kid you not! I even had tea & dessert! I sat for at least over an hour, eating slowly enjoying eat bite. Computer screen blank. I just read the drink menu instead (...also i forgot my log-on password btw-lol!)..yet...I was still amazed as I throughly read through each drink description. The drink offerings / menu are the size of a "normal sized"/8x12 food menu. The mind blowing variations of teas, fresh squeezed juices & even elixirs on both front and back.  And that's just the drinks! The food is amazing!  "Love" awaits you too! ;-)  Gottah go!  Sincerely, S.

My absolute favorite restaurant! I frequent here at least 5 times a month. They have the best green juice, chai latte, iced tea and ALL the food!!! There has been nothing that I don't love. My favorite is probably the power bowl because they make the BEST homemade pesto. Also, their sweets are INCREDIBLE and gluten/dairy free!!! Amazing! I wish I could afford to eat here everyday lol! Just a little tip......the service can be kinda slow because they are making you extra fresh and delicious food but just know that going in. It is not a quick dining experience but totally worth it :).
SUPER APPRECIATION for local produce distributors in the form of edible ARTWORK.   If you value yourself, I highly recommend Pom everything!

This place is great if you are vegetarian or vegan... or just want a vegetarian or vegan meal. However if you're just looking for a breakfast/brunch place... I think it's overpriced. Went on a Saturday, the day before Father's Day at about 10am and the place wasn't crowded. The service was adequate and it was good vegetarian fare...
Food is amazing - the deserts are out of control. You can feel good about downing really tasty food and sweets. Love that you guys opened in PHX!

So far I've only been to this place one time but it was pretty awesome. I had a caramel latte and it was the best latte I've ever had. This place makes their OWN CARAMEL!  Heck yeah! The coffee guy was super friendly and remembered the friend I was with and everyone else who worked there was also very friendly. Go check this place out!

Tried the new location today for lunch. Pom teas, hummus app, dragon bowl and "chicken" taco bowl (can't remember the menu name). All AMAZING! The service was great, so if they got off to a rough start as other reviews had mentioned, it was fixed today. We had the lemon bars for dessert. Fresh, filling, healthy. Both my friend and I were so full but couldn't stop eating. Even if you aren't a vegan, this is good stuff.

Vegan, gluten free options, organic! Excellent place, great food, deserts and juices. In the past I've had hard time finding good food in Phoenix. Not now, definitely added to the list of places I will eat at.

I've been here a bunch and the food is always delicious. It's a bit on the pricey side for veggie fare, but I just tell myself I'm back in Los Angeles and get to enjoying my iced Pom milk latte with my $14 breakfast bowl. The coffee is really great, especially when it includes their house blended non-dairy milk. I tend to like the breakfast options more than lunch, the Pom Muffin, bowls, and scrambles always well cooked and tasty. For lunch, the nachos....are not good so avoid those, and get one of the salads, bowls, or sandwiches instead. Service can be a tad spastic, and you do have the sense that the regulars get way better service post-yoga class than any newbies in town. They have a lovely pastry/dessert case up front, too, so grab a gluten free power bar, a cup of coffee, and get prepared to eavesdrop on people extolling the virtues of hot yoga and wheat grass.

Organic, seasonal, vegetarian and local - music to my ears!  Plenty of indoor seating and quite a few tables outdoors (though you can't sit outside if you order alcohol...just yet. I overheard that they will be building a contained area).   Extensive menu full of vegetarian and vegan options. I was spoiled for choice! I asked the server to recommend a smoothie and he suggested the Greena Colada - great selection; it was delicious although rather pricey at $10 for a glass. Yikes.  For eats, I ordered the Big Kahuna burger (sweet potato and black bean) in a collard wrap with root veggie fries and pom bbq sauce. Again, I thought it was a little pricey at $14 but I have to admit that it was tasty and filling.  It might not be a place that you could afford to eat at regularly, but it definitely is worth a trip once in a while. Tasty food, incredible selection, vast drinks menu (including a few organic beers), and we had a super friendly and helpful server. Oh, and their restroom is cute!

I've been waiting for this place to open and finally got my chance to visit it this morning.  In fact I'm sitting in it right now.  The name attracted my attention.  I'm all for Pomegranate anything (When pomegranates are in season, I generally eat 2-3 a day..yummy)  I'm having their Compassion (one of my fav words) juice...Fresh organic beet, orange, ginger and carrot juice, freshly squeezed...The glass is a deep red luscious looking juice with a slice of lemon riding shotgun.  Very tasty... Come and get one!  The rest of the menu looks very interesting as well.  A fresh beet, baby arugula and goat cheese salad sounds like it belongs in my belly.  Soup of the day is a creamy carrot and parsnip.. I just had my steel cut oats with goji berrys, ground flax seed, almonds, raw cacao nibs and mila at home.. If it wasn't for that, I'd been grubbin' some of this grub!    I mean.. are you getting hungry yet!  I know you hate visiting Ahwafakee but if you find yourself in my part of town for any reason.. drop in on this place.   This one's a keeper!

Yummy for vegan all natural organic eatery. I've been here before but didn't get a chance to eat so I finally made a point to do so for a late lunch. Where to start? Menu: food menu and drink menu (healthy drinks) were plentiful! I had no idea what to choose for either of them. I finally decided to go for the supreme burrito and the blue lagoon smoothie.   Supreme burrito = grilled spinach tortilla stuffed with brown rice, kale, carrots, zucchini, other farm veggies, beans, cheese and guacamole and cashew sour cream. Smothered with enchilada sauce with a side of purple cabbage ginger slaw and a couple slices of oranges. Not sure if I could really taste that but sounded so unique! This can definitely fill a hungry man's stomach if he's not the type to eat healthy food. $14  Blue lagoon smoothie = blueberry. pineapple. Spirulina. Chia. Kale. Coconut h2o. Brain on (helps focus. de stress. Lifts mood). Topped with a couple frozen blueberries and a couple squares of pineapple. This was surprisingly  blue-licious!! $14 - yes $14 for a drink!! Better have had given me all those health benefits!  Baked goods = seasonal pomegranate cake and their thick chocolate chip with oats, walnuts and choc chip! $8 and $3 respectively.   All in all this place was quite delicious and healthy. Servers were nice. Waters were given in jars and to go cups. You can enjoy eating outside as well as inside. One part of my food had a possible hair but I think I will try to ignore that part..  Minus that tidbit of un-welcomed thing I will give it another shot. The desserts and drinks are begging me to come back.
Siiiiiigh, I wish it were in my neighborhood. But I still drive half an hour just for their curry dish and rainbow salad. MMMMMM!!!!!!

Pomegranate's savory dishes that I've tried have all been amazing.  Their sweet dishes, on the other hand, are hit or miss.  Their Love the Whales Mac & Cheese bowl is probably the best vegan mac & cheese I've ever tried.  The portion size is huge and I split it up to last me three meals.  Their raw tostadas were absolutely incredible.  Every time I go there I look for this in the raw case, but alas, I've only been able to find it once.  Again, a very generous portion.  You can easily get leftovers from most of their meals.  The quesadilla was also good, and the tofu scramble is all right.  Tasty but nothing special.  Their coffees, however, have all been...well, bad.  I've tried a latte, a mocha, and the coconut caramel latte.  The coconut caramel latte was all right, although definitely not a favorite.  The latte and mocha were leaning toward the nasty side.  Their pancakes and French toast are a bit dry and not as fluffy as I would hope.  The cinnamon rolls, on the other hand, were great.  The chai muffin was all right, but cloyingly sweet.  In short, stick with any savory items you find on the menu, and if you're craving sweets or coffee, go to Nami instead.

I am so excited for this place! I was just talking with Brady K. about how the Valley needs more breakfast/lunch cafes with character, and for sure Pomegranate Cafe delivers.  They have an extensive juice and smoothie menu, a plethora of unique teas, and ubber yummy breakfast, lunch and confection options.  Best of all, they use local, organic produce from the farms at South Mountain, and make all items on premises...including their almond milk!  Seriously, I love it!    Make sure to say hi to Matt when you go in.  He manages the joint, as well as bakes and makes the almond milk.  Best of all, he is great with names and conversation, so you will feel like you are old friends and you have been going there for years even though it just opened about 6 weeks ago.    For this visit, I had the white peony tea, which has a very delicate flavor and an essence of apples.  Brady K. ordered the Wild Western Tacos, and oh, my, God!  they looked awesome.  Huge portion.  Two stuffed to capacity spinach tortillas with scrambled eggs (or tofu is an option), zucchini, avocado, heirloom tomatoes, sharp cheddar.  Pomegranate Cafe offers good home cooking taken to the next level.  Imagine you had a professional kitchen with all the goodies and could just get nuts with ingredients and creativity.  It's kinda like that.  The kind of food people make because they would actually eat it, not because it's a job.  I can't say enough about this place.    Also, all drinks ordered to stay come with a yummy little cookie.  It's the little things that make a place great!  Today's cookie was an almond cookie made with maple syrup and the almond pulp left over from the latest batch of almond milk.  When I asked Matt if he had culinary training, he just said, "I like to do stuff."  Simple answer, and the awesomeness of his enthusiasm to create is apparent in everything we experienced about this place.  I can't wait to go back!

It was the first Breakfast stop on my little tour of PHX. EVERYTHING was ALL so VERY FRESH!!!   Started with a fabulous "Americano" to quench the tired off, followed up with "The Avocado Sandwich" and joined by an amazing "Rainbow Salad."  To this day, it was the BEST "Sunflower Ranch" dressing I've EVER had.  If only, I had room for dessert. :)  Perks: Parking Lot, Prices, Portions, Clean Bathroom  Eating Out With A Girl #EOWAG #EatingOutWithAGirl dot com

We've been here twice for breakfast. What I love most about this place is that it is 100% Vegetarian with almost everything on the menu having the ability to be made vegan by replacing things like cheese and sour cream with a vegan option (I've never been anywhere that actually offered vegan sour cream so that was exciting!). The first time I tried the Lumber Jack - it was okay, but I think the texture of the tempeh bacon is what threw me off. I also tried their cowgirl cookie the first time and it's phenomenal! ALL of their baked goods are vegan (and some are raw/vegan). The second time we went I had their breakfast burrito w/ vegan cheese and vegan sour cream and it was excellent! Also, the teas they serve are amazing. I suggest the white peony - perfect, lightly fruity, breakfast tea. We will be back to try lunch!

The food there is really good!!! The service there is not so good as the food tho. They are very busy most of the day so it reflects on the service over the phone also....almost always they put me on hold when I can them. Overall I love going to this place :)

First time here.  I ordered the mushroom lentil walnut "burger" on a bed of mixed greens.  The food was good though a little too salty.  The prices are high and the food took quite a long time to come out. My colleague and I were on a lunch break and ended up barely having time to eat and pay before having to return to work.  My only other comment is they should have all nutrition info. for each of their dishes.  I specifically asked for the info, and after checking, the server told me they did not have this info. available.  That's frustrating when trying to watch my intake.  Decent food but not sure I'll go back.

There are variety food on their menus, I love the creativity and diversity. I ordered Power Kale Salad and  AB& J Bow , so delicious food with fresh vegetables . For to keep fit ,you may come here and enjoy!

Happened to be in the area on Sunday wanting to try out a new vegan place. Yelp app led me to 24 Carrots which said it was open but was actually closed! Luckily, Pomegranate Cafe was right down the road so we ended up stopping in to try it out.  Great menu and friendly staff. The food was good. We got our food before we got our drinks, which makes sense when you're ordering fresh squeezed juices... so had to wait a bit to start eating. The man was thrilled to find out that they offered a dairy version of the breakfast burrito so he could still eat healthy but didn't have to eat completely vegan.   My fresh squeezed orange juice and kale salad (kale, tomato, beet curls, carrots) was a nice, clean and healthy meal to start off the day.  The space was decorated cutely, and they even offer a few products for sale which are great products, such as Sun Warrior vegan protein powder. Will definitely return to try out a few more menu items!

My husband and I are just a joy to cook for. He's gluten and dairy intolerant, and I'm a vegetarian. Pomegranate Cafe has us both covered with numerous menu choices plus a great dessert case.  I first tried this place with Laura L., and I was delighted with the lumberjack sandwich (tofu and regular cheese) and sweet potato hash . The sandwich was great, and despite the name, it was a reasonable size. I also had a nice latte along with my breakfast. At the time, I paid with a gift certificate so I didn't pay attention to how pricey it was.  I returned for lunch while my car was being tuned up, and I got a massive burrito filled with quinoa and veggies. It came with a lightly dressed salad on the side. I brought home a carrot cupcake for my husband, and he thought it was great. My lunch, latte and dessert was nearly $30.   Perhaps Pomegranate Cafe isn't a great value, but all the food is delicious. It's an excellent choice for those of us with special diets.
Food is tasty, but over priced. It's simple things put together. Service took long for one meal to go. A nice place to have a Sunday brunch though.

I got to check our Pomegranate Cafe for the second time ever yesterday (I know - I can't believe I've only been twice!) I am gluten-free, dairy-free and egg-free, so their menu is pretty much a dream for me. They pride themselves on being able to adapt all menu items for customer's allergen needs, which means that if you are gluten-free, you have an ENTIRE menu full of options! Plus, as most of you know, the entire restaurant is vegetarian and mostly vegan (although they do serve eggs and real dairy for those that prefer it).  I got their "Raw Green Rainbow" salad, which came with their homemade, dairy-free cashew ranch dressing. It was incredible. My mom got the "Garden Green Protein Bowl" with tofu scramble, roasted root veggies, their homemade gluten-free seed toast and homemade POM jelly. We both devoured our food.  Of course, I knew that I wanted dessert, so I stalked the dessert case, asking tons of questions until I could decide which one I wanted. I ended up with the "Gluten-Free, Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Brownie," which was doughy and delicious. Out of all 4 rows of their dessert case, there were 3-4 items that weren't gluten-free - the rest were!  I truly recommend this place for all of my vegan, gluten-free, allergen-friendly seeking customers. I know that feeling of only being able to order 1 thing off the entire menu when visiting most restaurants, but Pomegranate Cafe brings light and life to dining out for those suffering from food allergies, food sensitivities, and/or those with limited diets.  It's worth the trek down to their location in South Phoenix/Ahwatukee area, even if you reside more North. Believe me - It's a one-of-a-kind experience and worth every bite! Gluten-free foodies, unite!   My only request for future is that they offer gluten-free/vegan cakes like the ones they have in their case that are only vegan (not gluten-free). They are so beautiful, fluffy and decadent looking, I would gladly buy a few slices to take home

My favorite vegan place in Phoenix. The menu is huge and I have loved every single thing I have tried. Personal favorites are the Mermaid Salad, Gila Monster Nachos, and Caprese Quesadilla. You can't go wrong with their brunch specials either. Yesterday I had a cherry mimosa made with prosecco that was divine. Don't sleep on the desserts either. Make sure to try one of their cookie dough desserts - truffle, brownie, etc.   One note: their service is slow, so expect a leisurely dining experience. IMO this is worth it for the high quality, tasty vegan food.

The place was really cute and the food was good. The host took a few minutes to acknowledge me which wasn't the best, but my waiter was great. The only other downfall was that there was a long hair in my food. I would totally give it another try though because the food options looked great.

Not worthy of a near perfect rating, that's for sure.  Had the lumberjack. It was okay, nothing to write home about, needed extra flavor and spice. Very bland.  Took twenty minutes to get our food. Seemed like a long time since you order and pay and then sit down and wait.  Lastly....Price! Holy crap!

First ones in the door when they opened. A couple came in 5 min later. They were served immediately and after 10 minutes,  my 7 year old had to go request a server. Still no other patrons,  25 minutes later,  the couple had drinks and such,  we had water that was refilled 3 times.  No drinks, no food,  not acceptable. (Quote from 7 year old) when I asked to cancel our order, the server was annoyed and offered no apology.  Will never visit again.
So many options! Nice boho environment with tons of yummy 'guilt-free' options for brunch, lunch, dessert, snacks.. etc.

Albeit a little pricy, Pomegranete's cafe is the place to go for fresh, delicious vegan food. And you don't have to be a vegan to love this place. Everything is fresh-made, so service can be slow sometimes (and often it gets busy in there, so it's not a good combination) but it's worth the wait. With constant additions to the menu, there's always something new to try. I definitely recommend stoping by.

I'd been awaiting the opening of this new location for months. I've never been to the Ahwatukee location, but have heard rave reviews and have lusted after their menu for awhile. When we finally got to try this place, it was frankly disappointing. Granted, they had only been open a few weeks, so there were likely lots of kinks to work out. However, I'm not in much of a rush to go back, for fear that it will still be disappointing.   It took a long time to be greeted and offered water. We then wanted to order cocktails from their drink menu, and were told they didn't have their liquor license yet. It turns out their food menu was also much smaller than the Ahwatukee one that I'd seen and been excited about.   We each ordered an entree and shared an appetizer, and found all of them to be pretty unremarkable (coming from a vegetarian who loves creative meatless options. Plus they all came out at different times, and in the wrong order. And then the bill was very high for such a lackluster meal and experience.  I hope this place improves, because we need more vegetarian and vegan options in the valley. I was hoping this would be my new go-to restaurant, but not so far...

What makes pomegranate special is the good service and wonderful outdoor setting the food is unique and delicious and a break from your typical bakery and sandwich themed restaurants.  The food is very hearty and filling and they have large portions. We got the burrito Bandito, and the grilled cheese sandwich, along with a coffee and iced tea. For dessert we got the chocolate cake which was vegan super dense and delicious. Sitting outdoors on the patio was very enjoyable, there are pigeons around that seem like they are regulars here as well and are fun to watch. They have fresh desserts made from scratch. We had to take ours to go because we got full off of just the burrito and even then had leftovers. The service was excellent, I highly recommend the pomegranate café to anyone.

Ok. I visited here on Sunday morning. There were 4 or 5 people other than us in the restaurant. We ordered latte's and a breakfast omelette.   My problem is the length of time it took to receive the latte's. It was nearly 30 minutes. This is ridiculous. The latte was ok but compared to a place like Cartel in Tempe it was substandard and not very robust.  The food was delicious and saved the service and drinks. My fiancée and I spoke about it and will give it another try and hope for better front end service.

I got the Breastfast Burrito sans eggs and tofu because of allergies.. It was amazing!! Their fruit bowl is versatile and fun. Noisy-ish if you're dining in, mostly because of the juicer (yes they juice your drinks right there..) but think of it like a cafe. Fun and original! Great varieties and options for vegans and people with allergies!
So good! Healthy and delicious food in a friendly environment. Great place to come if you're health conscious or like delicious food. We'll be back for sure.

I love everything about this place - the food, juices, staff & ambiance all kick ass. They've continued to expand their dining area over the years to accommodate more customers and now have full service waiters so you can sit down and take time to look over the menu. My fiancé and I ordered the breakfast pizza special which was amazing. It had this homemade croissant-like crust with scrambled eggs, hash, tempeh bacon & a delicious cashew cheese that has a little kick to it. I would definitely go back and order this again. It's a good size to split w/ someone and have room for juice still. If you're looking for outdoor dining they have a good size patio and its located next to Trader Joe's which makes it convenient to grab a couple groceries after you eat.

After a few straight days of eating pretty poorly, the fella was craving a healthy meat-less meal for breakfast. A quick yelp search for healthy food with gluten free options led us to Pomegranate Cafe. I had a few of their desserts at Sips and Sweets last year, but had never made it out for a full meal.   Tucked away in a shopping plaza, Pomegranate is shockingly spacious. They have a good sized patio that allows dogs, with big roomy tables. At 9am on a Sunday, it was pretty full but not crowded, and the handful of open tables meant we didn't have to wait to be seated. Walking in, the hostess stand is to the right hand side just inside the door. It makes for a little bit of an awkward situation when there are more than two parties waiting to be seated, as there's not much waiting space. The hostesses seemed a little disoriented and scattered, but after a few minutes we were sat and waters (with cucumber!) delivered.   Our server also seemed a little bit flustered, but came over to take our order pretty quickly. I opted for the Avocado Sandwich with Farm eggs (+$1), and the dude had the Sunshine Wrap in the green collard leaf (he can't have gluten) and the rainbow juice. My avocado sandwich was great; all of the flavors played together really well, and in my opinion, sprouts are grossly underrated. My chief complaint about the sandwich was the bread. While it was DELICIOUS--seriously, I love any and all bread, but this was top-notch--it wasn't a hearty enough bread to hold the weight of the sandwich. I ended up abandoning and deconstructing it because the pesto was exploding out of the bread. Plus, while very yummy, this amount of pesto really just wasn't meant to be spread directly on an already weak bread--spread that love between the eggs and sprouts, yo. Super tasty, but not structurally sound. But I cannot fault them for my own sandwich neuroses, I fully realize that I have some irrational hangups. The fella said his wrap was really tasty, but had a similar problem with the wrap's ability to contain the innards. The rainbow juice was excellent.   After enjoying our meal, we took a stroll on over to the dessert counter so the fella could pick out some treats; dairy free, gluten free treats are pretty hard for him to find, so he jumps at the opportunity every chance he gets. We were waiting quite a while before we were helped, and then the employees helping us seemed a little... indignant. We ordered one of the snickers bars, which was clearly labeled in the case; it was very poorly explained to us that what was in the case were actually almond joys, and snickers would not be ready today. That's fine, we weren't upset and we weren't looking for an apology or anything, and totally understand that this kind of stuff happens. But the perceived annoyance towards us was a little off putting, when we were just trying to pick a couple things up and head on our way. The whole process probably took 15-20 minutes.   Overall, food was excellent but a little pricy. Service could use a bit of help. We'll probably be back, but hope the dodgy service this go-around was just a fluke.
New fave vegan spot! Everything is amazing. I've tried the burger, nachos, scones and brownie with cashew butter. Coffee and drinks are delicious as well :)

This place is seriously one of my favorite places to eat! The food is so good and the service is always excellent, I'm not vegetarian but I still love their food! Their espresso is also absolutely AMAZING! I constantly recommend this place.

Last time I was here I left a 3 star. The owner responded right away & made things right. Today I am here & the food was exceptional as well as the service. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. I drive from north central Phoenix & it is always worth it!! Yum!  Cookies & deserts are the best outside of Denver or San Francisco!
Good and tasty all healthy options, great vibe. A bit expensive but good food is worth the money. I'll definitely go back.
