This spot is one of my favorite restaurants. I love their new expansion and extended hours, especially their happy hour with healthy nachos. My go to breakfast items are the Pom scramble with amazing jam and the avocado sandi. I am salivating just thinking about them.   Every coffee drink I have had is amazing as well and so original!

My daughters brought me here and we keep coming back whenever I am in town. Clean, healthy, big portions, and made with love. I'm from KY so of course the prices seem high, but the food is worth it. Pay attention to the specials. Smoothie, juice, latte, dang so many fun choices.

Absolutely amazing!!!!! I had the Wild Western Tacos and they were flavorful and absolutely delicious. One of the best vegan meals I've ever had (I had it with tofu) and I am definitely coming back! Our waitress, Shelby, was absolutely wonderful and made it a great meal.

I saw this had just opened and decided to give it a shot. I went alone so they sat me at a big group table with strangers. Awkward--I had expected they'd have a bar or a plan for single customers aside from sitting with strangers. Service was so incredibly slow...but it wasn't the server's fault. The juice people were slugs and the kitchen seemed to cook one person's meal at a time.   I ordered a bowl sounded basically like a taco salad but add quinoa and sub the chicken for a vegan option. That vegan option, it turns out, was straight up salty walnuts. Because when I think guacamole and salsa, I immediately wonder where the walnuts are. It was godawful. Half the bowl was occupied by tortilla chips (which I didn't want), and the salad greens were piled to one side where no sauce could possibly be maneuvered to engage them. The whole thing was confused, difficult to eat (the utensils are some weird wood things that don't really work), and incredibly overpriced. Verdict: 2 hours of uncomfortable silence sitting with strangers just to pay $25 for a glass of OJ and a half cup of quinoa with black beans (the only part I could actually eat).   I wanted to like this place but...just yuck.   Fun fact though, you can take home a vegan bread loaf for a mere $17. Are these people insane?
Good variety of fresh, healthy, and organic food.  Friendly people and excellent taste.  It is nice to go to a place where the food is different and good while the staff likes working there.
Amazing fresh and authentic food! Great quality and a must try!! Love to come here!!   Great vegan and gluten free options too. Not so kid friendly as far as dishes go but gosh love the food here!!
Yum! Went twice during my three day long trip to Phoenix. The menu is quite extensive, something for everyone!

What a great addition to the list of Ahwatukee food options!  I've been to Pomegranate Cafe a few times now and have left happy each time.  Perfect for that pre-grocery shopping (at Trader Joe's, next door) meal so that you don't go starving and buy WAY too much food.  As the slogan states, and everyone else has mentioned, Pom Cafe is "indulgently healthy."  Fresh, organic, vegan, even raw food options.  Breakfast and lunch, juices, teas, elixirs, espresso, and baked goods.  Walking in, the atmosphere is calm and relaxed.  Walk up to the counter, check out the chalkboard for the specials and browse a paper menu for the rest.  Place your order at the counter and try not to be tempted by all of the delicious looking desserts calling your name.  Sit down at a table and they'll bring you your food.  If you feel like helping out and clearing your table, great!  There is a busing station on the back wall.  Or leave your dishes there and they will clear it for you.  The staff is friendly and energetic; you can tell they enjoy working there and giving you fresh healthy food and drinks.  I have tried a few different menu items and it addition to enjoying good tasting, healthy, vegan food, the portion sizes are quite generous and very reasonably priced.  I have left very satisfied stomach (meaning, I'm full) but not that heavy "oh-no-what-did-I-just-eat" feeling in my belly and my conscience.  Feel good and taste good healthful food!

I'll be very honest.  The produce here is pornographic.  Brightly colored, clearly fresh and fragrant, it looks like it belongs in a commercial and I want to know how to get my hands on my own sexy produce.    Definitely one of those hipster our-forks-are-vegan places but it doesn't matter.  The food is terrific and the dishes are flavorful, creative and healthy.  Save room for the x-rated dessert case.  Even if you're full, you'll want to take something home.    It's a shame I live on the other side of town but I could be easily convinced to swing back by for a jaunt to the Fruit/Veggie Red Light District.
Great food but I can't tolerate poor service. Called in order and was told they were busy. Would be 20-30 mins. Order took an hour. Unacceptable.
Good food, okay service, overpriced. To bad, because I would love to go more frequently. Again, simply overpriced.

I used to come here for breakfast when I lived in the area. We usually split the green bandito burrito with kale salad as the side. The salsa that came with it was so tasty -- I would always ask for an extra side!   We also split the berry parfait as our dessert and that definitely hit my sweet tooth. I can't really speak on anything else on the menu, since I get the same thing every time! Highly recommend them both!   I was honestly surprised how tasty the food was. I feel like some healthy places tend to be bland but this was definitely packed with flavor!

Pomegranate is the local superstar of vegan/vegetarian food. I go at least 2x per month and have never had a bad meal. Recommended dishes: breakfast club is my favorite. It comes on the house biscuit/English muffin and this is a must try, but I also am in love with their house multigrain bread so I'll also get it on this from time to time. I also recommend any of their breakfast scrambles/omelettes. French toast is delish if you're in the mood for sweet breakfast. I'm in love with all of their breads. You'll also want to grab a latte. I usually go for the standard Cassie's latte. Desserts vary and are all good so save a little room. Strangely enough breakfast is so good I've never made it for lunch or dinner, but I have no doubt the meals are great. Customer service is generally great although sometimes they get really busy and appear slightly understaffed. This is one of the few places that I don't feel the need to add the qualifier of its good...."for a vegan/vegetarian place." This place is good no matter what. They are opening a central Phoenix location sometime in the next year are so; luck you central Phoenix peeps. Next time I'm there I'll remember to update with some pictures!

I love this place! For me, their dessert bar is heaven on earth! I can never have dessert anywhere due to my severe dairy allergy and so this is such a treat for me! Everything is so good. I will drive miles out of my way just to go and get a cupcake after the gym or some scones for the next morning. Try their chocolate pomegranate cupcake and their chocolate pomegranate truffles. Their cowgirl cookies are so yummy, too. Oh, and the best part is you can order a cake!! a delicious, moist vegan cake! I will finally be able to have a birthday cake! Portions are pretty small for the tab you pay, I don't really leave full (especially if I go after a workout). I understand most restaurants serve huge portions of bad food and so we are used to over-eating, but I am a pretty small/petite woman and it definitely doesn't fill me up, but I'm so happy to have something healthy and yummy available that it is still one of my favorites.

Had lunch here on a Saturday. The tables were about two thirds full. After we placed our orders it took quite a while to get our food. One of the orders was for a kid's meal (macaroni and cheese). The menu clearly states that the meal comes with fruit and vegetables and a cookie. After the waitress delivered only a bowl of macaroni and cheese we had to remind her that the meal included additional items. She tried to explain that there were no additional items. We objected again and pointed out that the menu explicitly stated what was included in the meal. She finally agreed to bring us the other items. As far as vegan cuisine is concerned, the food was not particularly impressive.

Love this place.  Reminds me of the vegetarian places in northern California. I can't say enough good about it.  They will do vegan or vegetarian but don't expect animal meat here (they do have eggs and dairy cheese available as well as tofu, tempah, and other high protein items).  Everything is fresh, fresh, fresh. You get a fair amount of food (often we take some home). The bread is outstanding made from ancient grains.  The food has wonderful taste combinations (e.g. a side salad of cabbage and carrots had fresh ginger in it that made a big difference). How they prepare the food and the taste combinations is what really makes the food great.  They will customize things for you when they can, drinks and food, and can easily accommodate the standard food allergies.  Their hours vary, sometimes they are open in the evenings, sometimes only breakfast and lunch.  Weekend brunch is the busiest so there might be a wait and occasionally on a later evening they have been slow but brought out free tortilla chips which was nice.   They have all sorts of coffees & teas & specialty drinks (hot & cold),  and a case full of deserts, so they are also good to stop by for a coffee.  Dogs are welcome in the outside tables.  One last nice plus, they are a drop off spot for organic farmer co-op shares - sunizonafamilyfarms, where you can get a standard share or pick and choose each week what items you want to order.  We used to stop by about once a week, enough the staff got to know us.  But now we get a farm box and are there a couple times a week - just a nice side effect.

I had been wanting to try this place for awhile but their Ahwatukee location is too far from where I live so I was super excited to hear they opened a new location in Phoenix that is not too far from me! The food was amazing!! I had the mermaid wrap with potato salad and my non-vegan boyfriend even loved it! It was super fresh and like nothing I've had before! I also got an almond joy bar to go from the dessert counter and it totally satisfied my cravings for something sweet. We will definitely be back often, this is my new favorite vegan restaurant by far!

I. Love. This. Place. I live in San Tan Valley, so this pretty far from me. About 45/50 minutes. That didn't stop me tho. The food was hot, fresh and full of flavor. It is kind of expensive but you're getting good quality food. The avocado bfast sandwich is my favorite!! The macadamia pesto has a great flavor with their seasoned tofu and the avocado just makes it blend so well. I'm craving it all over again. And the hibiscus cooler was sweet and refreshing. I would definitely drive here again, it's so worth it to me!!

I recently visited this place for the first time, the drinks were great, we ordered two of their smoothies, the food was a bit cold considering we ordered hot foods. Our server was chatting it up with a customer, didn't really check on us.  We didn't receive a check, after waiting for a long time we decided to go inside to find out what was going on, our serve was talking to the same customer from outside, then she finally let us know that the credit card machine was down, we had no other choice but to wait, we waited for about 20 min before we could leave.   This is was a terrible experience, employees don't seem engaging, don't show empathy for what happened and aren't very communicating.   Overall, I give this place a 1.

An excellent addition to the dining corridor of 7th Street in Central Phoenix! This family owned and operated cafe has a charming casual interior as well as outdoor patio, very warm and friendly service, and flavorful and satisfying vegetarian and vegan fare made from seasonal local products. And almost everything on the menu can be made gluten-free upon request.
The food is amazing !!!! I loved everything about it ! One of the best vegan places out here in chandler . Our waiter Justine is such a sweetheart !
Amazing. Good raw food selection and great live music on Saturday evening! They use all local and organic ingredients and have cool seasonal drinks and food.

POM never disappoints! We had the nachos, mushroom street tacos and happy hour cheese crisp for dinner and all three were amazing! The chili con queso on those nachos is stuff made from the heavens!  We enjoyed after dinner cappuccino and Cassie's latte, with a couple of truffles and the cookie dough brownie. Again, these sweet treats were the perfect end to a wonderful dinner!  I've had the Thanksgiving dinner and treats before but this was the first time sitting down for dinner. I can't wait to go back!

they have a great selection of salads. i find their breakfast selection to be soso, but lunch is good. their salads are portioned as an average salad portion for a "large". i was still hungry after downing a "large" salad for $14. but im just going to assume that their ingredients are a higher quality than most non vegan places so im willing to fork over the extra cash. it is serve yourself water, but the waitresses bring you the food after you order at the counter. you can also wait for a waitress to approach you but its faster and hence better to just order at the counter. they do check up on you after your food comes so that is nice. also parking is easy because it is in a strip mall next to trader joes.

Over priced breakfast poor service consitently. I have been here 4 times now. Vegan options are good very social employee's with each other lots of conversations  going on about everything but my meal which comes in late 3 out of 4 times.  NEVER order off menu they will make you wait as if to punish you for it. And if your a verstic expect to be referenced as "honey or sweetie" by some young girl who maybe all of 24 years old. I am also not  a fan of uncomfortable seating.hitting my knee on a round barrel table nearly broke my knee cap. They are very impressed with themselves and less concerned about your dining experience. Too bad.

Won't be returning again. Service has much to be desired with slow service just to place your order. Really felt ignored.  Second, screwing up on simple beverage order, and  not informing me that the entree I ordered is not available, and substituting another entree 180 opposite to what I would order! What ever happened to addressing the customer by saying " We ran out of your chosen entree, could we interest you in something else?"  But no....  Third, the price for two to have entrees and 1 appetizer was $52.00. And trust me this place is shabby and lacks comfort and decent servers. My wife and I are frequent customers of The CuttingBoard in Mesa AZ. We were told Pomegranate was the same perhaps better. We think not! The CuttingBoard rocks and service is exceptional. Save your money and humility and stay far away from Pomegranates. They are lucky I gave them 1 star.

This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Everything I have ever tried here is fresh, delicious, imaginative and healthy. Weekend brunch specials are always amazing.  The desserts are worth driving from north Phoenix for.  In fact, everything is worth the drive. My absolute favorite thing is the grilled cheese Napolean, lots of delish veggies, homemade bread. Yum!
20 minutes for a California wrap and a lukewarm Maca Warroir Mocha with chocolate all over outside of the cup at a cost of $20. No thanks.

This restaurant almost killed me! As a vegan who is allergic to cashews I am very careful when I go to a vegan restaurant because I know cashews tend to be hidden in a lot of vegan creamy sauces as a cheese substitute. I asked about cashews before ordering, and I asked again when my food arrived. I was assured that the vegan ranch was sunflower based, but when I put it to my lips they ballooned up and were immediately on fire. Thank god I didn't actually put anything in my mouth or swallow a bite of food. I walked up to the kitchen and asked the waiter again, and he still said it was sunflower based, along with one of his coworkers who agreed. I asked him to ask the chef to be sure (because I knew I was already having a reaction) and he finally went to go check. Sure enough, THREE of the items I ordered had cashews. Vegan ranch in my appetizer, in the wrap I ordered, and cashews in the potato salad I ordered as my side. 1. Who puts cashews in potato salad? 2. I ASKED THREE TIMES! The server kept repeating over and over that he was on vacation for 20 days and they changed the menu around while he was gone.  Fine, but then why didn't he check with the chef the FIRST time I asked? He tried to charge us for the full meal even though I was too busy wheezing to eat. My husband refused to pay for food that I was too sick to touch and asked for the manager. The waiter took my food off of the bill but would not get the manager. So here I am posting on Yelp in the hope that someone from management will see this and realize how serious food allergies are. If you're going to hide nuts in almost every dish on your menu and not educate your staff when you change recipes then you really need to have an allergen guide on your menu so customers can help themselves. I was able to treat myself quickly for the anaphylactic reaction that this restaurant's negligence caused but the next person might not be so lucky. I might not have been so lucky if I had actually swallowed a bite. If you have food allergies do not go to this restaurant because they do not take it seriously.

This is a great "health nut" restaurant. The food is high-quality and tasty. They have a couple of raw entrees on their menu as well as vegetarian dishes. The place is busy, so their food is always fresh due to the quick turn-over of food. The  food is high-quality, so I would say the prices are fair. Anyone who shops at Whole Foods can appreciate the cost that went into this food.

You get what you pay for. People complain about the price, but they make almost everything in house, many of what you're eating is sourced locally which is very important to me, and it's all organic and non gmo. Which in the real world, are very expensive things in which they need to offset the cost. My favorite ever was the buffalo mac and cheese, among all the dessert goodies. Service is always an issue here I know, but the food makes it worth it. I am a regular customer and it's nice to stop by from time to time and enjoy a nice meal. The happy hour menu is kick ass.

Fun and funky that you almost forget you are in a strip mall. For those with dietary restrictions you have great choices that are healthy and flavorful.  Everything we have tried thus far has been delicious.

The food is fantastic. If it wasn't for the food, this would be 2 stars. I love eating here, but they have slowest service on the planet. It isn't just one waiter or waitress, it's all of them every time. I keep coming back because the food is fantastic. One time my boyfriend and I waited an hour for our food. I don't know if it's a lack of training or what, but please please please do something to make your service more efficient.

This is a great place to go if you're aiming to eat healthy! This cafe offers raw, organic, gluten free options too. Their ingredients are extremely fresh and their dishes are beautifully plated for a casual cafe.   We tried the pesto presto sandwich, which consisted of avocado, sunflower sprouts, tomato slices and pesto on a whole wheat baguette. They give such a generous amount of avocado it is SO good, and the pesto flavor is perfect and not too over-powering. The tortilla soup was the best I've tried yet. We also had the BLT on whole wheat toast. They use tempeh bacon and it was delish!  We also tried the "donut holes" - if you check-in on foursquare (1st time only) you get a free donut hole.  Well, they were definitely not the donut hole I was expecting - basically a ball of organic raw type ingredients...of what I'm not sure but the two flavors they had resembled the taste of a Lara Bar - just in a ball. :)  Only downside is that it is a little pricier for their sandwiches/ lunch. But definitely worth it!

The food and atmosphere is great but the service is terrible!  Even when it was apparent we were looking for our server, no one came by. The server would finally come to our area, and take the order at the table next to us but didn't bother to check in with us. She ignored the hand gesture and the verbal request. We have been here 5+ times and the service has been terrible each time. But ... there are few vegan options with good tasting food so we come back.
This place is amazing!! I am about 95% raw vegan and this place is so delicious. LOVE raw Friday. The desserts are to die for and well... I have not tried anything that was not Fa-Boo!

Delicious! Vegan food done right. I absolutely loved their raw tacos and Greek goddess pizza. We shared a large cobb salad (which was huge!) and we still took some home! Very healthy and yummy. I had some room for desert and coffee (coconut milk/oil fans celebrate!!) and it was just to die for! Their brownie cake is the ultimate cheat day delight

This place is so yummy! I really like the vegan cheese quesadilla and the Mac and Cheese.. my friend who isn't vegan likes it here as well! Will be coming back Sunday, I just can't get enough of this place! So very good!

I have been wanting to try this joint for over two years and I finally took the plunge to drive 30 minutes for lunch here. Walking up I was told to wait to be seated. It took another 10 minutes to have someone come over and give me water. The part that bothered me the most was the girls were behind the counter complaining how slow it was. They waited another 10 minutes before the waitress actually came over to me. At this time I ordered a $4 nitro cold brew coffee. I attempted to order my lunch at the same time but she walked away mid-sentence.  The coffee was 3 star taste, but I think it would have been better had it been colder. Perhaps I should have asked for ice, but it's odd to have nitro on ice.   When she came back I ordered the $13 buffalo "chicken" wrap. It came out rather quickly. Their fake chicken is spot-on! I really enjoyed it. Unfortunately it didn't taste anything like buffalo but rather bbq. It was even the color of bbq - maybe I was given the wrong one. Had they had a vegan cayenne-based hot sauce it would have been a lot better. I make vegan wing sauce at home all of the time, It's very easy.   I ended up eating it like a salad because the burrito fell apart. I dumped the contents out, drizzled the ranch, and embraced it as a salad. Their sunflower seed ranch is the bomb! I'm very impressed with how much it tastes like ranch despite being vegan.   I've read other reviews and it seems like the trick around the slow service is to order at the bar and then sit down.  I really hope they open up a Scottsdale or Phoenix location as long as they improve upon their service.

Ok so this place is the definition of "my cup of tea" for me. My friend had mentioned it to me and said I would love it and with her love for food maybe being as much as mine I trusted her and she has yet to disappoint.   I called in for pick up and the woman on the phone was so nice and delightful. She said that the wait was only going to be about 10 to 15 minutes which I was very surprised about being a Sunday morning and a holiday weekend. So I ordered the wild western tacos and an abundance juice. the total came out to be $27 which at the time I thought was rather high. When I went to pick up my food the guy at the counter was very friendly and I just instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and environment of the place.   I tried my juice in the car on the way home and honestly it was just okay. For $9 I was expecting a little bit more. The tacos however were AMAZING and such a huge portion which I love so I can save for later.   Five stars. You guys rock.

im so happy there is a closer location to me, so I can come more often! that being said..ill probably wait another year for this one to become more established. The service wasn't as good as the first one. You can tell they are literally training all new people it seems like. Which isn't bad..but I'd rather spend the same amount of money, for better food, and service..I really was just not happy about spending more than 14 bucks for a burrito I could have made better at home..lol but over all my favorite restaurants in az! I know they are trying so I will come back later(:

Finally a restaurant I can go to and be completely happy, and satisfied being at no matter what! out of all vegan restaurants I've been to in Arizona, this IS the best. no competition what so ever. I would go here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. the food is so delicious, and REAL, you can TASTE the difference. they are using real organic food...thank you for that.      they also have one of the best staffs I've ever seen at a restaurant. the people are never rude, and thats all I care about. it is kinda expensive, but you pay for what you get! and that is QUALITY! which I don't mind paying when the food is fresh, delicious, and worth my money!! I believe more restaurants should look at this one, as an example of how they should be...it really is that great.
Tastey, healthy and fullfilling. Love to eat here and so glad there are other options besides fast food.
Definitely a place for vegetarians. If you're a guy that likes pasta hamburgers wings lasagna etc then this is not the place for you.

Pom has wonderful food and the atmosphere is nice however today was not as positive as my previous visit (7th Street location). We were greeted on entering and seated after a couple minutes then waitress "Natalie" asked if we had any questions about the menu and took our order. After about 20 minutes, I asked Natalie if we could have our drinks and her response was "I'm at the mercy of....we are short staffed". After another couple minutes, she did bring our drinks. We continued to wait with no additional interaction with the waitress although another lady came by to ask if we were still waiting on food and she would check on it. No word from her or the waitress even though Natalie did walk by several times. On taking in the activity, we noticed the kitchen prepared dishes piling up on the counter. It appeared to be so many that they were running out of room to place the finished dishes. Granted, they were busy however prepared food just sitting on the counter was concerning. At close to 45 minutes with no word and no meal, we were increasingly frustrated and while not their concern, I had taken a couple units of insulin prior to entering the restaurant in anticipation of being able to eat. At 45 minutes though, with mounting frustration and being alerted to dropping blood sugar, we decided to leave. Needless to say, it was immensely disappointing and very frustrating. Appearances can be deceiving so with the crowd attending the restaurant and lack of service, we can only assume this was either mismanagement of the restaurant, kitchen, and staff plus there not being enough staff or this was just a difficult day for them.
Great vegan options, but be prepared to wait 45 minutes  to get your food after ordering

What's the big deal. Food tasted mediocre and over-priced. I had a some egg-like dish. Place looked nice with outdoor seating and colorful inside, that's why I tried it. But expansion seems over-zealous. Waste of money. Try "Green", it's super tasty.

Who knew eating healthy could taste so good. My wife absolutely loves this place and has gotten so much inspiration for our habits at home from this place. For me it's 5 stars for the food and atmosphere.  Only downside is its not cheap. You'll shell out to eat here. I do suggest their smoothies, excellent.

Pomegranate's quality is second to none. I enjoy the lumberjack for breakfast and the bountiful bowl for lunches and dinner. Have also tried their pancakes which are amazing. There is always great ambiance with pleasant music playing, self aware and health conscious people inhabiting, and fascinating employees. My only complaint is the price. Most of the types of juices made here are offered elsewhere a little cheaper. But the quality is truly their greatest value and for that, I will continue to come back here every time I swing by good ole Ahwatukee!

My vegan friend and I went here last night.. it was so so fabulous! We ordered the nachos, side of potato salad,  Mac and cheese and tacos.. of course it was totally vegan, with perfect raw ingredients as well, and absolutely delicious! ( I'm eating the cold leftovers now!) The staff is very friendly and helpful, happy and smiling!  As being veggie since 1997, and vegan since 2008, I will say that this restaurant will rival any that you'll find in Los Angeles, and I cannot wait to go back! Pomegranate Cafe will be a permanent home for me!!

Love the nachos here the walnut meat is super yummy. They also have great coffees juices and desserts. I like the snickers bar!!they are all vegan too! So no dairy. Yay! Can't wait for our next visit.

I love local/whole food cafes with focus on bringing good quality foods! I was asked to try Pomegranate Cafe with friend whom frequents this place on regular. We came in after hour long hike on South Mountain with rumbling tummies for some good food! We were greeted and sat immediately with menus and cucumber waters. I was in awe of the trendy decor with mason jar as light fixtures and community style seating.   Reviewing the menu, you understand Pomegranate Cafe has a passion for bring locally sourced foods with bust of flavor in Vegetarian style. I was amazed all the different selections of salads, wraps, sharables, burritos/bowls and drinks to chose from. I chose the nachos and my friend chose a burrito. My nachos came with "meat" plant based meat that brought it whole another level. It tasted really good. My friend enjoyed her burrito as well. She mentions that we should come back for breakfast as they have good menu. I took note of the brunch hours for weekend, 8-4pm with special items as noted on wall.   Pomegranate Cafe does also have market attached for locally sourced items if you need to grab anything before leaving. You have come experience this gem.

Finally a raw food cafe that isn't in Tempe.  Love their drinks and raw food menu.  Just wish their prices would come down bit.      This is the type of place I could eat at everyday.  I know it is good because the afternoon lull doesn't happen to me when I eat here.      I do NOT go daily, due to pricing, but I would like too, because I would simply live longer eating here.  Your body buzzes with clean energy (non-caffeine) after eating here.    If you are a person who wants to be nice to your body.  Splurge and give your body what it craves....Enzymes.      Who knew raw food was the answer to avoiding afternoon coffee.......?

OMG!  For once I feel at home with restaurant food.  As a vegetarian for almost 30 years, and now going vegan, This place is the bomb! (Excuse my dated expressions.)  I had the falafel salad and it was sooo good. The waiter asked me if I wanted a take home bag after I had eaten half of it, (It was a huge salad.) but I told him no, that I would eat it all. And that I did.  I consumed this huge salad and enjoyed every last bit.  The prices are pretty good, but I"m cheap, so anything over $5 is a little high for me. (Which is absurd, I really need to work on that mindset!)  I also had some sort of juice.  I can't remember what I got I just remember it being like the drink of the gods.    As far as atmosphere, well, to be honest I thought I was back in the late '60's early 70's.  (Yep, I'm that old!!! But please don't tell anyone.)  Even though I'm an old hippie, it's hard for me to see young ones...now....in 2015.  Anyway, God bless 'em, right? The only thing I wish, I wish they were open at night and had alcoholic beverages.   I loved this place.  The food is marvelous....check it out!!!

It should be said that Cassie and Marlene Tolman have done an important thing for the valley food scene.  Restaurants focused on organic, healthy, and environmentally conscious products are relatively easy to find in various urban parts of the valley.  The suburbs on the other hand are typically a parade of chains dishing out high volumes of product that often only pay lip service to those who seek out sustainably produced and harvested foods.  By locating their fledgling business in Ahwatukee, the Tolmans have taken a gamble on spreading that business model to very edge of the valley.  A gamble that has clearly paid off.  Pomegranate is a fairly lengthy drive from my apartment, but I've really enjoyed sampling some of their foods at various food festivals here in the valley (the PHX Vegan Festival being the most recent).  Looking to get the full experience of Pomegranate, I made my way here for breakfast on Saturday morning.  On the southeast corner of 40th Street & Chandler in the Safeway shopping complex, you'll find Pomegranate by virtue of their fenced in outdoor patio lined with tall wooden tables and umbrellas.  Inside the restaurant is a beautiful array of color (pink being the most dominant among them) with the the sit down restaurant on the left and a small market on the right selling a variety of food and non-food products.  I came at the opening expecting a busy Easter weekend crowd (which sure enough filled the place within an hour).  I grabbed a table in the corner to take it all in.  The menu as noted earlier is focused heavily on organic and sustainable products.  No GMO products allowed and the bulk of the food is vegan (with some vegetarian alternatives available).  They source locally, compost their leftovers, and much of the menu changes with what's available in season.  The first menu item that caught my attention was the Chimpanzee Bowl.  Granola, banana, seasonal fruit (in this case, strawberries), and what they call a "superfood mix" (I picked up on a variety of nuts as well as some coconut and dried berries).  Douse it with their "Po" Milk (essentially milk made from various nuts and seeds) and you've got a giant bowl of granola, nut & fruit cereal.  I loved this.  Clean fresh flavors with a balanced sweetness from the fresh fruit (including the dried berries).  Footnote: The cafe donates $1 to the Jane Goodall Institute (a global wildlife and environmental conservation organization) for every Chimpanzee Bowl ordered.    I also ordered something they only sell during weekend breakfast hours.  One of their giant cinnamon rolls.  Came out to me fresh out of the oven.  This isn't the biggest cinnamon roll I've ever seen (The Machine Shed in Iowa still holds that title), but its pretty large (I'd guess 4"W x 4"L x 2"H).  The cinnamon roll was okay, but didn't knock my socks off.  I was expecting a smoother texture coming straight from the oven, but it was a little nutty and grainier than I wanted.  I prefer cinnamon rolls where the breading and frosting do most of the talking, but that's just me.  Lastly, to wash it all down, I got one of their juice drinks called The Rainbow.  A mixture of beets, apple, kale, ginger, orange, carrot, and cucumber juices.  As intriguing as it sounded, the flavor was absolutely not my thing.  I guess I was expecting the fruits and the cucumber to be a little more dominant but all I could really make out were the beets.  If you love beet juice you'd probably love this drink.  I only got about halfway through mine before I just couldn't handle it anymore.  Total price for the food, drink, tax, and tip came to about $35.  Having dined at plenty of vegan and vegetarian establishments in my time, I'm fully aware that restaurants focused on sustainability can (and often do) mean paying a premium.  Still, for many Pomegranate Cafe likely wouldn't be an affordable every day (or even every week) option.  Based on the response they've received from the Ahwatukee community it seems as though plenty are willing to make the journey here, which I'm glad about.  As more restaurants look to innovate using a sustainable model similar to what the Tolmans are using, perhaps the price point will be such that places like Pomegranate can reach a larger audience.  From my own experience, Pomegranate is great in spots, not so great in others, but completely committed to their model of sustainability.  I would come back for a quick bite for breakfast or lunch if I were in the neighborhood, but probably on a special occasion basis only.

Wow, this place has amazing food!  It is so refreshing to see vegetarian food with variety, flavor and creativity.   I wanted to eat every single thing on the menu, and so did my friend.  We decided to start off with the hummus of the day (Butternut squash), and split two meals, the vegan tacos and the burger of the day (Sweet potato and Mill).  The tacos were filled with a spiced walnut "meat" vegan nacho cheese and sour cream and served in red cabbage cups.  They were soooo good, I would have never thought to use walnuts as meat substitute, brilliant! The burger was another big winner! It had a jalapeño curry sauce that was so flavorful, and it paired nicely with the sweet potato and avocado. On the side were yummy baked fries with homemade barbeque sauce... still licking my lips!  I'll definitely be back, again, and again, and AGAIN!

Oh, that burger was so so so so good!  I was worried about the mixed reviews at the new location, but I took a chance.   I was quickly seated, the service was great, and the food was wonderful.  I got the burger with root vegetable fries and it was amazing.  As an added bonus the manager even offered to replace my fries at any time because he thought they might be a bit too done, but I thought they were perfect.      Everything about the restaurant was perfect.  I highly recommend it.

3.5 --Decided to try this place based on reviews. Was thinking it would be busy but when I walked in not too many people. I went to counter said it was my first visit gave me a menu. Lots of items on the menu. Opted for seasonal omelet, egg whites, cheese, hash, toast. They do offer vegan choices(vegan cheese, tofu). It took a bit to receive my coffee (served gentleman behind me first) and my meal. The plate was plentiful and very fresh. The hash were a potatoes, squash with rosemary. Different but good. The omelet was also fresh but not quite enough cheese. The veggies were squash, carrots (orange, yellow, purple). All in all, I would give this place another shot. Love the freshness...My meal was $14
Pomegranate Cafe is my favorite vegetarian restaurant! The food and the service is always top notch.

Great place to eat with friends. I highly. Recommend them. The food is freshly prepared in ample quantities. The delightful combination of herbs and spices enhances the modest of dishes to new experiences. The menu all around is good.

They have some of the best vegan and gluten free desserts I have ever had! My wife and I have stopped in to pick up dessert about 10 times since they opened. Am I embarrassed about that? A little. But, eventually we will get around to trying the food. So glad they are in the neighborhood!

We are not vegetarian, but heard good things and it's right in our neighborhood, so wanted to check it out. I tried the lemon poppy seed pancakes with strawberry compote and they were very good! My husband had the dragon 'burger' and he really enjoyed that as well with a side of hummus and veggies. The juices and smoothies seem interesting, but I'm not sure if I'm brave enough to try them...We liked the atmosphere and we will return to try more new things here!

The food is pretty inconsistent but the desserts are great. They are very slow, understaffed and not so willing to customize orders. The service is an issue with some servers being nice and some not so much especially when you only order off of happy hour menu. Not too willing to come back! It used to be 4 stars but went down to 2.

From the passionate vegan,  or the foodie wanting to try something new, or even someone just wanting a healthy meal this place has something for everyone! Even the hardcore carnivores come here and don't miss the meat ;) I have been going to the Chandler location any chance I get and the vibe and atmosphere is infectious with good vibes! Cassie, the owner is such a delight! She is always open to listening to any tips or menu items that were a special that you want on the menu permanent. I HIGHLY recommend the blueberry lavender smoothie! It has a hint of house made lavender syrup and it always a good one on a hot Arizona day! The Green Bandido bowl is also amazing! Their weekend brunch specials are delicious! The green juices have no ice so you're getting your monies worth!   If you plan on heading there on a weekend be prepared for it to be busy! If you're in a rush on the weekend this is not a place to go. Good quality food takes time and it requires some patience as the hard working staff do their best to get the food to you fresh! Come in enjoy the company you keep and fill up on healthy eats! You definitely won't leave being hungry and there is something on the menu for everyone's taste buds! They can also accommodate food allergies for almost anything! Love love love the Pom!

I have been to this place a couple times to get juice that is fresh-squeezed. It's kind of a place for New Age earthy crunchy people. The fresh squeezed juice is good but way overpriced. I just make my juice at home in my juicer. At almost $10 a pop for a glass of fresh squeezed juice, I will go without it.

very good food, and healthy. Nice staff. The atmosphere is very cute and nice. The ONLY thing is that it takes forever to order and they only have one person on the register to take customers, this can easily be remedied by having 2 registers, but since there's only one, it takes 15-20 to order when it's busy (which is usually the only time I can go).

Really enjoyed this place. Great service, lovely atmosphere, and lots of good vegan options. The nachos were very satisfying and the curry bowl was nice. Had a nice cocktail too, now that they have their liquor license. Portion sizes are huge! Plenty of seating, inside and out. Parking is easy in the big lot.

I like this place because it's one of the only places around here to get a coconut milk latte.  They also have AMAZING gluten-free and dairy-free treats, and kombucha. Win, win, win.  AND it's right next to Trader Joe's...win!  However, their hours keep changing, so I never know how late they will be open.  Also, it is very confusing as to whether you seat yourself and someone will take your order, or if you go order and then sit down.  Last time I was there, I saw people doing it both ways. I had ordered and then sat down, and the servers ignored me, but seemed to wait on everyone around me.  It's also expensive and usually crazy busy.  But I continue to come here for the coffee and raw/gluten-free treats, and fun health-foody finds like maca powder and mason jar glasses!

OBSESSED. Can't get enough.  The desserts. The food. The coffee. The love for community.   My only complaint is the cafe isn't anywhere remotely convenient for us but that's not their fault. Given the 8pm closing time, the hours are a little less-than-convenient but again, if we lived closer this probably wouldn't pose a problem. Please open a location closer to Central Phoenix!

The entrees are amazing and so are the deserts and drinks.  Have been going to them since they opened.  It is one of my favorite hang outs to lunch with friends or myself.  I enjoy doing work on my laptop at their atmosphere.

A truly excellent place!  The food is great & the staff is amazing.  I don't love everything on the menu, but love many more items to make this place a 5-star rating.  If you get lucky you may get to have the raw lasagna that is a special only... it's amazing!
Very interesting place. I got the magic coffee which was tasty . To me it's like whole foods made a restaurant. It's very nice and I will be back to enjoy the food.

Outstanding!  In an area full of restaurants serving either A) Stuff that's just plain bad for you, or B) Stuff that's mediocre, or both, Pomegranate stands out. Every dish is yummy AND it's good for your bod! Love this place. My only complaint is that service can be un-even. Mostly it's fine, but on busy days the staff can get a bit overwhelmed, it seems to me, so they get a little stressed and you have to be patient with them.
I visited this establishment when I was on vacation. I wish I lived closer so I could eat here more often! My daughter LOVED it too!

This place has amazing food, lattes and atmosphere. I visited this location when they first opened and wasn't impressed. Obviously their were some issues with training and quality workers with great customer service or lack of leadership. I love the Awatukhee location. Today's visit was wonderful. I was greeted with a smile and was sat immediately. My server was also very polite and answered all my questions. I ended up ordering the veggie burger with fries. I also ordered a vanilla latte with there Pom milk. Omg, soooo gooood! They make the syrup in house and use organic coffee beans. I'm happy I keep coming back because service has improved and food is always mind blowing. This place is for those who are either cutting meat out of there diet or cutting back on meat consumption. Those who want to eat organic, locally sourced delicious food. Everyone should at least try it. It's a great place to start eating fresh vegetarian dishes.

This place is absolutely fantastic. I ordered an iced coconut hazelnut latte which is obviously organic and had a milk alternative, and the bandito burrito. This is hands down the best burrito I've ever eaten. Everyone here is extremely friendly and they have a nice outdoor seating area. I wish I lived here so I could become a regular at this place! 5+ stars for this place!
I love this place! Great vegan food and desserts. It is a bit of a drive for me, but it's worth it. The people are friendly and service is great. I love supporting local businesses.

I met a coworker here last week knowing that she tries to eat vegan/vegetarian.  The restaurant is very cute, service is good and the Sambazon Sunset smoothie was beautiful and so delicious!  I wish I could drink one every day...it was that good!

Healthy, happy, ethical eating with a cute atmosphere! Meals are affordable and generous portions. The drinks and desserts are slightly pricey but well worth it. The staff actually holds conversations with you. While it can get loud from high powered blenders, seating in the back or outside is enjoyable. Food will come to you very quickly! Don't go at peak times like the low-star reviewers probably are (give them a break, food service is hectic when you're a full house!). I'm definitely going to be ordering future birthday cakes from Pom! PS- Try the Spicy Buffalo Chikn Wrap, Arizona Rolls, or chocolate cake! YUM.

Just tried to eat lunch here (1PM on a Thursday). Waited five minutes to be seated (plenty of tables open). Waited another ten minutes with zero staff interaction and decided to leave. Service is just terrible. Which is too bad, the menu looked good and interesting.
Place is a little expensive but it was kinda good. Customer service is pretty cool and I enjoy the organic vibe.

I stood up at the front for probably about 10 min and finally the male server helped me out.  I sat at the table probably for about another 8 minutes (I got bored so yeah I timed it) before I was greeted, the girl gave me a water, "how are you?" Then ran off. Did not give me any option to order at that time or ask me what I actually wanted to drink.  About 15 minutes later she came back to take my order, never asked me what I actually wanted to drink.  I came to this place because I called that morning to ask them if they had vegan pancakes and the girl on the phone told me every day until 12... then my server told me oh that's actually on the weekends. Cool, so I drove 30 minutes out here for poor service with out pancakes lol   I know you were understaffed the day after Christmas. There were two servers handling the entire restaurant but as a bartender I know the difference between slow and good service and slow and poor service. Very poor service. No one asked my how my food was, I had to get up and refill my own water glass and I had to stare down my waitress with my card in my hand just so I could pay.   I wouldn't be opposed to trying this place again but unfortunately I had a terrible first experience.  The concept and decor seemed very appealing.

I absolutely LOVE this place.  The food is consistently amazing, high quality and fabulous tasting.  The owners genuinely CARE about the food, their staff, the clients and it shows.  Thank you for being my favorite cafe.  Keep up the awesome work.

Really cute restaurant fun upbeat place.  My problem was the service, I waited 40 minutes for my food and the people who ordered after me had already been served their food.  Finally I just left and a waitress, not mine ran after me in the parking lot demanding I pay for my food.  I just turned around and said, I was never served my food, and I'm not going to pay for my water.  She looked at me confused and tried to say but your food, and I just walked on.  Unfortunately this was my first trip and I never got to taste the food.  Big fail on the restaurant.
I really enjoyed my first visit to Pomegranate Cafe. I ordered the blueberry French toast and it was delicious and filling! Service was very prompt and pleasant! I will be back!
So delicious. My veggie wrap was packed with fresh, crunchy veggies with a slightly sweet sauce. Will definitely be coming back!

Quaint environment and great for vegans and vegetarians. Prices are steep but quality is good too. I ordered a breakfast plate from their board (no price listed) and a pomegranate tea - was surprised at a $22 bill.   Now, I'm not vegetarian so my perspective comes from a "likes to be healthy" meat eater. Eggs were good. Veggie bacon wasn't for me because I really like the real stuff but I think vegetarians would love it. Pancake special was tasty with fruit, sprinkle of chocolate  and nuts in it. Pomegranate tea was only okay and apparently cost $4-$5. Service was minor - very little interaction with those of us sitting at the bar. Decor was cute.   Overall - I'm glad it's here for all my vegan/vegetarian friends but would only come back with them. The price was just too high for my simple breakfast needs.

I live very close to Pomegranate Cafe and I'm surprised I haven't stumbled across this gem sooner! I love the nature and ambience of the café, it's very low key and everyone that works here seems so happy and so proud of this place. I got this super power smoothie with added protein and it tastes phenomenal. The place looks Beautiful with a lot of great artwork and unique furniture. Overall I would give this place a 10 out of 10. This is going to be my new spot for organic food and a positive atmosphere!

Please open a location downtown!!! I'm never in this area but have wanted to try this place. It's on point! the chai latte is wonderful. Just enough spice and sweet and smooth with their homemade but milk. Salad was soooo good. And the soup: eggplant chowder. Flavorful and delicious. Love it!

I just had the best experience at Pomegranate Cafe! This was my first time and the cashier and the owner went over the menu with me and provided suggestions on what to get. It was a hard decision because everything sounds amazing. I finally settled on the Athena Bowl which has tabouli, hummus, pesto on a bed of kale. The flavor was amazing and the pita bread was great for the hummus and pesto. I must also say that the restaurant is so adorable! They have the cutest tables with great center pieces. I noticed on the way out that they have herb boxes out front amongst the outdoor seating. The desert case is to die for and I gave into temptation and left with a slice of carrot cake AND a brownie. I know, I was really bad! The thing that impressed me the most about this place (besides the vegan food) is that they are so nice! Everyone there was so social and made me feel right at home. I really hope that they open up additional locations and put one in North Phoenix.

Fantastic burger, that really hit the spot! I had a great server that loved my hat "vegan vibes" (you can use the code SYDNEY15 for 15% off!)   Recently moved to downtown phx, but I will be making trips back to my old neighborhood to hit up this spot.
Amazing food and customer service. I ordered the summer breeze juice which was refreshing and the smokin blt. So good. Tasted better than actual bacon. I'll be back again. Highly recommended.

Hi everybody!  This is a tough review for me because I shop at trader joes almost exclusively and my wife and I watched and waited for this restaurant to open. Granted it has been open for awhile it took us some time to get to it. I am not really sure it was open many times as we passed and were hungry. Finally we checked the menu and CHACHING!  So we moved it to the top of the list for trying and we were excited to come. As we only eat out on shopping day. Maybe too much. As usual whenever we eat at any restaurant we asked our "vegan" questions. We were told that someone there was a vegan nazi and if it says vegan it is, and this is very good.   I will say that i do trust that Pomegranate Cafe serves what they say they serve and the food was very high quality and very delicious. We shared the lentil burger ($12) that was on the menu board behind the counter. I really wanted to try the desserts but decided to wait till next time.  Everything was going great and we waited patiently for our food. Granted it was busy so it took a little time and this also is ok.   Here is where my problems begin. Bellieve me I do not want to give ANY business ANY time only 2 stars.  Trust me i just don't and i feel bad for doing so however, I did say on my profile that the reviews i do are very important to me. I am the kind of person who does not mince words and you will know where you stand with me. If i see something i do not like i will say so.    That being said  Now I will say that I have worked in the restaurant industry since i was 16. I have done every side job known to everyone who has set foot into a kitchen. (explained later) I have helped build business for many. Though I do not have any degrees or anything I have seen many meals being sent to customers in many differents ways, and styles. Some were good, some were bad, some were happy, some were mad. But they all ate and they either came back or they didn't. Currently I work in not one but two very popular digs. I work very hard to make sure my customers are happy, and i know how hard it is to work in a small family place. I worked at a local chinese restaurant for 6 years and barely got  a day off.  Do not get me wrong there is nothing wrong with the food here. my issue is with one small thing or two.   Why does a new business in the realm of Pomegranate (a higher class cafe which serves vegan food) charge a plate splitting fee which i believe was $2.00. Then give us our food on a paper plate. Please, this is ridiculous. We always split our food no matter where we go. It is pratically the only way you can stay healthy these days. Not to mention we believe that there was no more food for this charge. (for example: if there were more chips or pickles or fruit, then i do not have a problem with this fee. however I would say when asked to split. " OK, no problem, however there will be a $?.?? charge, and for that you will recieve ....) if i would have known this i would have gotten it to go and this review would be totally different. And in my humble opinion it is not a good idea to charge this fee in an uber difficult restaurant "genre".    Believe me there are lots of people like me who want food like this. Do not make it harder on yourself by adding on fees which really are not necessary! Are you not making enough money off of $0.25 worth of lentils?  I also have to say that I had trouble choosing something to eat from the menu, because many things were scratched off. ???? Were they out of that item? I think the thing that bothered me about this was there were so many that i wanted to try but could not. I saw many that had promise, as I am a vegan nazi and i really was stoked to eat here. It is my kind of place almost to a t. Too bad that did not work out.  Now for the side job part.   While we waited for our food i noticed that this restaurants dining room was not very clean. the floor looked as if it had not been cleaned for a few days, the windows were very dirty, and the window sills were covered, and i mean covered in dust. Complete with cobwebs. From what i could tell the kitchen was clean.   Here is how I see it. Please do not serve a $14.50 burger on a paper plate EVER! To me this says that the staff does not want to do dishes, If something is on your menu keep it there, when people find something they like they will come back no matter how much it costs if they know it will be there. Clean your dining room! it is uber, uber ,uber important that your customers see a clean dining room. it does not take that long and it will go very far impressing your customers, especially when you are first getting started. When a restaurant does not take the time to clean thier dining room they most likely are not cleaning thier kitchen as well. I hope this is not the case with Pomegranate because I really would like to try more food here. I only will know by stopping by again.   Thank for reading.   Late, Greg

The food is good! But that's it!  Worst services I have had. Been there 3 times and every time my "server" if you even want to call them that didn't do anything but take my order. Today I went and waited 20 mins to have my order taken. Then another 25 just to get my drink. It was an hour from the time we got there to when we got our food. Very slow and our server only check on us once. Asking if I got my drink. Isn't here job as our server to bring our drinks and food out. I understand it can get busy but it wasn't. I watched drinks sit at the window for well over 10 minutes. And food sat at the window for 5 minutes before the cook yelled at them to take it out. The last 45 minutes of us being there and eating our server didn't once and ask how how we were doing. I watched her do side work and roll silverware. Someone else cleared our plates and brought was our check, then another gal checked us out. Very disappointing. They did comp my drink and the food is good but when you have bad service 3 times in a row. It doesn't matter how good the food is.

The food here is always outstanding and I love the creativity and diversity of their menu. This is the go to place for healthy meals and/or delightful vegan, vegetarian and raw food dishes. They also have a wonderful selection of juices, smoothies, coffees and teas. I've always had great service here. Overall, it is nice to see a locally based business growing and thriving in the "Tuke".

I just dined here and am writing this as I am leaving the restaurant. We were really excited about trying this restaurant because we're vegan and really enjoy trying out new places. We heard great things about pomegranate cafe and so we made the drive out here. We got two coffees, a hummus side, the green goddess, and the green bandito as a bowl. My entree was the green goddess and it literally tasted like nothing while the potatoes were very very cold. My friends food literally tasted like a baby ate Mexican food and then threw it up onto a plate and that's how it was presented to us along with taste. Her food was mild on spice but had absolutely no flavor. I had to ask for salt and pepper for my food, but even then was only able to force down half of my burger because I covered in so much hummus for it to actually taste like anything. My friend ate maybe two bites of her food when I left over half of my food on my plate still hence our plates still had almost all of our food on it.The server was a Indian girl who asked us if we wanted boxes for the rest of our food and I said no because we didn't like it. She did nothing to try and make it better or right, and didn't offer to have it remade or anything. I paid $45.07 for food that I literally wasn't able to eat.   The reason why I'm posting this review however is just to warn others. Go to Pita Jungle or Green to eat vegan, the food actually has flavor and is a lot better priced. The servers will actually take care of you and the experience will be better.

My husband and I have been hearing about Pomegranate Cafe for the last year, but really never had the chance to try it. Okay - I shouldn't lie, I think we were hesitant because it is a vegetarian restaurant, and we love our meet.  But we were intrigued because of the gluten free options (something that is critical to my husbands health).  Now I am super sad that we waited so long.  We have been missing one of the best restaurants in the Valley.  Both my husband and I had sandwiches for lunch last weekend.  I have never had such distinct flavors in a sandwich before.  It was beyond delicious!!  Maybe getting rid of the meet is critical to really letting my taste buds do their work!!  After lunch my husband and I split their gluten free Tiramisu, and it was HEAVENLY!!!!!!    The staff was super friendly, the service was quick, and the place is very cute and clean.  We will be back very soon (most likely this weekend)!!  I can't wait to share it with all of my friends!!   YUM!!!!!

Ate at Pomegranate last night.  Food was ok, but took forever.  Restaurant was not that busy!   We were told by waiter that there were lots of takeout orders (there weren't.)  we were also told by cashier that evenings were not busy during the week and service would be better.  We should have left and found another restaurant.
Local. Organic. Raw. Vegan. Gluten Free. Fresh and Tasty. Coffee/Toddy. Raw Deserts

Prices had increased a little, from when they first opened.  But the shakes and juice mixes are really fresh and tasty.  The guy behind the counter, the manager I think would make interesting concoctions, they made something called morning dew one afternoon, with like mint leaves and some other ingredients that was left to bake in the sun.  I had a slice of their really nice pomegranate chocolate cake and it made my day :)  Its next to Trader's Joe and is near the Ahwatukee area, so it attracts a nice variety of people, ranging from young sporty types, to family spillover from shopping from trader joe's, to groups of friends catching up.  I don't know how good the food is, but most of the people who came seem to like it.  I think if you are looking for a nice play to chill and have a cold refreshing juice or shake and catch up, this would be a nice place to go.
40 MINS WAIT!!! Dont go here during peak hours. You have to ask for the same thing 10 times. The waitress kept forgetting to bring creamer for the coffee. An expensive place too !

Enjoyed this place but be warned it is crazy expensive.  My sister had a $14 hot tea and I had a $9 fresh powerade type drink.  Both not very big for what you get.  It was yummy but you have to be in the mood to splurge.  Kids did not like the french toast which is much more like banana bread served with syrup.  They also weren't thrilled with the mac and cheese which is white and quite bland.  I absolutely loved my tacos with tofu and guacamole and roasted vegetables.  I will for sure order it again.  We had 2 adults and 3 kids for breakfast.  The total with tip was over $100.  Ambiance is fun and service was wonderful and friendly.
Pomegranate Cafe deserves 6 out of 5 stars. I'm not a vegan, but the food here is incredible. The cakes and other desserts are also worth getting.

Meh....this place went through some major renovations. And while I appreciate it being a healthy option, I think it's sort of ridiculous for the prices. Parking is always hell on the weekends so beware!
Best vegan option in the valley!  Love that I can go out to eat and still be healthy.  I almost always order one of the specials... love the variety!

I really wanted to like Pomegranate Cafe-- there are so few family-owned and family-run restaurants in Ahwatukee, and I can't even think of another exclusively vegetarian/vegan restaurant in the area. However, I'm not going to sugarcoat this at all: the atmosphere and the service are severely lacking, and the food is overpriced. For starters, there are not nearly enough tables, and for some reason, whoever designed the place chose to use a bunch of six seater tables instead of the standard four, so you end up with two or three people at a giant table and a waste of space. The space feels small, cramped, and stressful, especially during lunchtime hours. Furthermore, I was standing in a HUGE line of people waiting to order my lunch, and instead of helping expedite the process, one of the owners was standing around chatting it up with a group of women. I then got to wait 30 or 35 minutes for my food. The food was okay, but I have definitely had better-- I had a Philly Melt, and it was $10.50 or something like that. It wasn't worth the price or the wait. If you want good vegetarian/vegan food and don't want to spend this much or deal with the cramped atmosphere, go to Green. If you don't mind spending this much and want a way better atmosphere, go to True Food. I don't think I will be visiting Pomegranate Cafe again.
Added teary beans to the breakfast tacos. Excellent. Next time I would even order them without eggs.

Love this place, great vegan food with so many flavors. Happy hour menu is on point with food and drinks as well. Going to be here more often thanks for the great service and good! Love the way this place is coming along!
The only sad thing about Pomegranate is that I have to drive here from San Diego to enjoy their gastronomic delights!  Keep up your amazing work...

This place is amazing! I love the fresh, healthy food - thought it was delicious. And I have to say, I like all kinds of food - not just vegan/vegetarian. So props for that! The "donut holes" (don't be deceived by the name) are delicious and I loved their new "Island Drink" (green and fruit). I've had a TON of food from this place and always enjoyed it.  Now, a note too the not to great reviews that i read. Everyone, of course, is intitled to his/her opinion. The prices are a little upwards of what you expect for a cafe, but the woman at the counter said that EVERYTHING is organic/local when they can. Which accounts for the cost, I believe. I like to support local goods/family owned.  This is not fast food. Go here planning to spend a leisurely lunch/brunch. I also like to go during the off times, around 10am is usually good or for a snack at 3pm.   So it's true that you have to work around a couple of things, but I love this place anyway. Who doesn't want to eat food with heart?

Love Pomegranate Cafe! My favorite meal has to be the elephant curry bowl, so full of wonderful flavors and textures. Don't even get me started on the drinks and desserts! I pretty much can never leave the shop without my cowgirl cookie and the rocket fuel protein smoothie...they are perfection. In fact, every dessert and smoothie I've had here has been absolutely delicious. My only con would be the prices. I have a hard time NOT indulging here, so a full meal can make a bit of a dent in my purse. The quality and service here does make it worthwhile, though.

On a 20 day full body cleanse and our diet is a raw food diet.  The Pomegranate Cafe is the place to go.  They over a good selection of vegan choices to choose from and the raw items were very good.  The only drawback is the raw list is limited to only 3 items as a main dish. I had the tacos vivos served on a red cabbage leaf which was very tasty and tasted just like tacos. The side salad was awesome as well. See photo of the taco vivo. My wife had the AZ roll, if you like sushi you will love the AZ roll with the texture and taste of Sushi. Also had the lemon bars afterwards, wow taste like the real deal.  Enjoy the stop and the food.   The place is clean, great work staff. And reasonably priced.

I saw that Pomegranate Cafe was one of the best new restaurants in Phx, so i went to Yelp to read more about it. I had lunch there this week- had the Super Green Kale Salad and thought it was fantastic! The flavors were so complex and yummy, i swooned over every bite! I left there feeling healthier!  People have commented that they felt it was pricey but worth it! I felt i totally got my mone's worth, and didn't even think about price.  Marlene and her daughter go to such extremes to discover new ways to make their recipes taste so delicious, and being all organic and  so incredibly fresh, i would've paid more than I did for the experience!  The cafe has such a friendly, neighborhood feeling, and the perfect place to go after shopping for groceries at Trader Joe's!  I highly recommend you give Pomegranate a try! You will keep it on your list of delicious, healthy eats!
Great place, wonderful service, food was excellent, juice was amazing,would highly recommend.

One of my favorite places to eat in the valley hands down. Always fresh always organic. Can get just about anything gluten free or dairy free. The Dragon Bowl is awesome! The owner and her daughter run this place and both are very sweet. The staff is very knowledgeable about allergies etc.. go here and try it ! You will love it!

Breakfast and lunch cafe with good coffee (each order receives its own French Press!). It's a vegetarian cafe, but don't let that scare you away. The food is very good.  I blindly stumbled upon this place without a clue as to what it was about. So, as I was perusing the menu -- scanning, scanning -- I was anxiously asking myself, "Where's the meat?!" Ahhh...ok; there is none. I played it cool though, like I knew this fact already, and I ordered the In Season Scramble for $8.  When my meal arrived (see picture), I was blown away! This was hearty...and delicious! Meat be damned! Who needs it? This was great stuff. The portion was generous; the flavors were exciting -- fresh and yet savory. Even the toast was very good. Oh, and the Harvest (potato & sweet potato) Hash...excellent!  The coffee was good too. They give each order it's own French Press with a mini hourglass: when the sand runs out, press down and enjoy. The coffee roast is a lot lighter than what I typically drink. It wasn't smoky or bold; instead it was light with pleasant fruit backnotes. It wasn't bad, but perhaps a hearty French Roast in the French Press would be perfect.  Overall, I'm a fan. I'll be back. I can put aside my carnivorous ways occasionally and support the Pomegranate Cafe's local, organic (and flavorful) philosophy. I wish this place the best.

I feel blessed to live right down the street from Pom. If i had money and time to burn i would eat there everyday. Great peeps, quality and choice organic ingredients. Not too many places in the valley where you can get kombucha beer, 100% raw treats and 100% organic infused teas and juices in one spot.
So far I've only had their fresh juices and the black bean quinoa salad but everything was excellent! It did take a little while to get my order but it's called the slow food movement for a reason.

I have a love/hate relationship with this place. I have been here at the Phoenix location 5 times now and to the Ahwatukee this past Easter...I'll get into that experience on their Yelp page though....As for this location, every single time I've gone whether I'm dining in or placing an order to go there has always been a mistake with my order! Every Single Time! Forgetting some items, giving me one side when I asked for a different one, etc. Now, I think the food tastes great otherwise I wouldn't keep coming back especially since I live 45 minutes away but My God I hope they work out the kinks soon! Another issue I have is that the portion sizes are different every time. I understand that they make their breads in house which could cause some slight differences but when I'm paying $16 for a burger I hope to get more than the size of their happy hour menu. The staff has always been friendly, welcoming and very accommodating especially when handling their errors but there have been a few issues. One time I was sitting outside, order placed by one waitress only to have my "real waitress" show up and "actually" take my order...thus causing the wait for my food to be even longer, another time I was totally forgotten about!  I'd like to touch on their desserts before I end my review. I have tried two of their cakes, the carrot cake on Easter and the birthday cake. I thought that both actual cake parts had great flavor, however the frosting has always been wayyy to thick. I literally end up having to throw out half of the dessert because it's just frosting! I wish they would adjust the cake to frosting ratio. I have also tried a few of their cupcakes, the carrot cake one on Easter, a chocolate banana one and another that I can't remember the name of. Every one of the cupcakes has been really dry. I was surprised by that because I had both the carrot cake and carrot cupcake on Easter, the cake was moist and delicious but the cupcake was completely dry :/

Was really excited to try and was super disappointed.  I ordered the breakfast scramble which would of been wonderful if it hadn't been completely drenched in oil.  The staff also needs to learn how to smile and greet people.  I sometimes pop in for coffee after yoga.  Often standing there for five minutes just wishing someone would make eye contact, smile, and say hello. It's not very big or ever super busy so out of the 3-4 people working you would think one of them could look up and say hello.  Coffee is great though.  :)

Can't say enough good things about this restaurant. I am a total vegan food snob and Pomegranate does not disappoint. It's so difficult to even choose what to order because everything is amazing. The bowls and wraps are fantastic. The Elephant Bowl, California Love Wrap, and the Macro Greens Bowl are all wonderful. The tacos are killer. The desserts are sublime. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. On my most recent trip to Phoenix and Sedona I ate at many restaurants -trying to find great food and willing to pay up for it - and the meal I had at Pomegranate stood head and shoulders above anything else.

love the food at this place however, Sundays are rough there I don't mind the wait I was single person so I sat at the bar and was asked 3 times would I like a waiter after about 25 minutes of just sitting there looking around I guess it's Pita Jungle for me today

This was an exceptionally disappointing visit. We were excited to have a vegan alternative in our neighborhood but sadly, it did not deliver. At noon they had about ten tables inside and out (most wee twos but there were two families with small children) - they were out of the spinach dip already so we ordered the nachos with the walnut taco "meat" and Two wellness shots. Thirty five minutes later we got the wellness shots - the waitress explained that while there were at least eight people in the kitchen, there was only one juicer able to make the shots. Another 30 minutes later, we finally got the nachos. They were okay but had no walnut taco meat - when we asked out waitress about it, she said they had run out. It was confusing to understand why nachos with vegan cheese sauce, salsa, and a few black beans and a spoon of guacamole would take over an hour to make and why we were never told in advance the nachos would not have the signature walnut taco meat. At no time did we receive an apology for the wait, an apology for a missing key ingredient, or an offer make our visit better. There were so many details missing - staff were not attentive, water was available to some but not all, the bathrooms were not quite clean and the soap had coagulated around the pump causing it to spray all over, key ingredients for menu items were missing, and items in the menu were already gone by noon. The wall is partially painted, I assume waiting for another can of paint or someone who can cut in to finish the detail work.   Overall this is perhaps one of the biggest disappointments of new restaurants in Phoenix. I would avoid it.

I came here this past Easter with my family, we had a decent size group (6) so I made reservations before hand. I was excited to try this location (which is well over an hour away from me) in particular because I wanted to try the different menu options. I had even called ahead to ensure that they would be serving their regular menu items along with the Easter brunch menu and whoever I was speaking with that day had told me that they would be. Needless to say that when we got there and got our menus it was a let down to discover that they in fact were not serving food from their regular menu....We all ordered and when the food came most of the groups dishes were cold and the veggies were still mostly raw in the napoleon grilled cheese and harvest hash! It seemed like the plates had been ready to bring to us for a while so they had just been sitting out and getting cold before they were actually brought over. There were a few mix ups with drink orders on top of that as well. The front manager there (Daniella) had to come over and offered to have our cold meals redone. We eventually got our hot meals but mine was brought out with a completely empty cup where the bbq sauce was supposed to be! How do you bring over a plate and not notice that lol? I just had to laugh at that one though. The food was great once everything was done correctly and Daniella really saved the day. Our meal ended up being on the house which was really amazing of her to do! We got a few desserts, the carrot cake and carrot cupcake. The cake tasted great but had way too much frosting and the cupcake was totally try.

Absolutely love this place. I'm not vegan, so I do like that they have free-range eggs. Their breakfast and wraps are delicious, love the superfood hot chocolate and the baked goods are amazing. Probably the best tiramisu and its vegan, gluten free and raw. The service is super nice. I really wish they would open more locations!

I have to start by saying the food is fantastic. My main issue is that these guys can't seem to figure out how to run a kitchen. Every time we go they have a back up in the kitchen and you wait a minimum of 45 minutes to an hour for your food. Because they can't figure out their kitchen then the wait times for a table are 45-60 minutes on a Saturday or Sunday. I could understand having growing pains and correcting the issues but they don't seem to understand how to get a handle on it. This place could be a gold mine if they could turn out food faster and turn tables. If I was a server there I would be extremely frustrated because that is my livelihood and it may affect their tips (I always tip 20% or more).  I can't understand how the new location will be successful considering the problems they have at this location.
