Why not focus on one location and make it perfect before moving onto opening a new location. Such a shame because as I said food here is the bomb but you have to come with allot of patience and low expectations for service time.

Does healthy have to mean small portions? I ate sandwich  split side order of "fries" and split a desert 2 hours later I am hungry again and out about $30.   I do like the concept local veggies, meat free food and contemporary atmosphere. But $12 for a BLT and $11 for a Kale salad was a bit steep for a place where I order at the counter, refill my own water etc..    This is the crux of my issue the lack of value.   The BLT it self was decent, the Tempeh bacon was a bit sparse, the tomatoes were good as were the greens. The Side of hummus was bland and came with a few fresh veggies.  The Kale salad was good with a large flax seed chip, fresh kale and many other ingredients.  The pomfrits (french fries) were not as great mealy slices of potato under cooked in oil.  The Desert the almond joy $4 was quite decadent and tasty , however we decided to get this later on and had to wait in the slow line to order to get this.

Not happy with this place any longer. Not much as far as raw is concerned. Seems like they sold out in order to bring in the customers who want to try to be healthy. My avo sandwich was good but not blow my mind good. They need to offer the raw stuff on Sunday's too. They also screwed up order. I am not interested in coming back again.

I love the concept of Pomegranate Cafe.   It's a vegetarian restaurant that promotes healthy and clean eating. They have lots of gluten free options or gluten free substitutes, so it might be a good place to go to for people who have allergy concerns. They serve lots of organic and local produce, and have cute hip decorations. The water that they served had cucumbers in it and came in little mason jars, so yeah, trendy. It was quite busy even on a Friday afternoon, which shows that many people enjoy coming to Pomegranate Cafe.   I had the breakfast burrito some time ago, and I liked it a lot. This time, I ordered the protein bowl, which was great. I loved the scoop of pesto-macadamia-avocado topping on top of the eggs. To be honest, I feel like I might have been able to make the protein bowl on my own with lots and lots of great veggies and eggs, but I appreciated that the cafe served dishes where people could could decipher what was in their food. My mom got the Athena wrap, which she liked, and my sister got the Kung Pao Burrito; she was sweating by the time she ate half of her burrito because it was spicy.   The only downside about this restaurant was the price; it was a lot pricier than I expected it to be. To be fair, there were lots of organic produce that went into creating the dishes, so I can tell why the prices were higher. I would go more often if the prices weren't so high; overall, I would give this place 4.5 stars if possible but rounded up because of the amount of thought that must have gone to making healthy foods tasty.   Bottom line: Trendy and hip vegetarian restaurant that promotes clean eating... with flavor. Highly recommended.
Definitely liked this place even more than green. The rainbow wrap was delicious, fresh and filling.

They get super busy and mess up on orders a lot and pretty upsetting when they're. It working on the orders in which they come in!  Seems they're always slow on to go orders and making other people's food first that order way after!

If youre into eating healthy...this place is perfect! Great smoothies as well. The only reason i didnt give ot 5 stars is because the one time I went it took forever to get our food. But the servers were nice and the food/smoothies were worth the wait.

THIS IS REALLY GOOD VEGETARIAN FOOD.   The spices are spot-on and accentuate the vegetarian-based dishes, which is hard to do.  The "meat" patties for burgers are delectable and made of walnut and mushrooms.  Again, his alone is hard to ached in the many vegetarian restaurants I have eaten at.  Nice work!

My daughter and I wanted to try a raw vegan meal and we loved this place! We tried a couple different entrees and the food was amazing! I highly recommend the raw sushi roll! So good and tasty! The tacos were amazing too! My daughter tried one of their juice blends and she loved it. The servers were very friendly and efficient even though they were very busy at the time we were there. The ambiance was nice. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone that wants a wonderful raw vegan meal! You will not regret it!

As someone who is not vegan or vegetarian, I thought this place was pretty good! I went with a friend who is vegan and she was very impressed with everything. The set up inside is a bit jammed but it definitely has a local feel. I don't know if I would be back by myself but if I have someone that's vegan or vegetarian coming into town I'll definitely take them here.
Loved the Passion Juice. The ginger flavor was subtle, but it elevated the juice significantly. I had the Beet POM burger, which was good but not great. Would definitely go back to try more specials.

It really doesn't get any better than this! You could close your eyes and pick anything on the menu and you'll love it! Beautiful , healthy and creative food. The owner is so sweet and the staff so friendly. If I could eat at Pomegranate  everyday I would!
Hip, trendy, in the edges of chandler?  It's  hip but it's also really good.  The juices are creative and exotic.  The prices are a bit steep--but not for the quality.

I wanted to like this place really bad so I'll probably give it another chance but my food was not good. The menu was a little pricey so I went with the least expensive option, buffalo cauliflower (which I love and make all the time). The cauliflower I got was slightly cooked with a lot of pepper and a thin coat of buffalo sauce. It also came with veggies and a spread that looked like hummus but tasted very strange. I'll try one of the $15 burritos or sandwiches next time. Other than the food, staff was nice and restaurant was clean with cute decor. Hoping my next experience changes my mind.

I never like to give reviews if I don't have only nice things to say....but....while their food is very very good, the service wasn't the best. I have now ordered over the phone three times and every time was given "20 minutes" and my office being 5 minutes away i leave at the 20-minute mark-effectively giving them 25 minutes. Upon arrival the first time, I waited an additional 15 minutes. Second time, same scenario, waited 20 minutes and no kidding the third time I waited an additional 40 minutes to get my food. I finally went to the counter and the employee went and looked around and found my food that had been sitting there for who knows how long. Cold and soggy vegan food. I don't honestly know if I would go back.

Kinda new place but no growing pains when I was there.  Our server was knowledgeable, pleasant, and quick.  We ordered the nachos and didn't expect this thing to be that huge.  Vegans don't have THAT big of an appetite!  Definitely didn't need to order anything else after that but we ordered a chicken burrito as an entree...it ended up in a togo box.  The nachos were the best tasting vegan nachos I've had in Phoenix.  There's a place in Seattle called, No Bones About It that has better nachos but I'm so glad Phoenix had a relatively healthy vegan option for good nachos.  Our server recommended a couple of drinks and they were good.  This place is kind of spendy but totally worth it for healthier vegan options.  Way better than the options further south. I won't name names but your greasy vegan food ass know who you are.

Love this restaurant! The servers are all super nice and helpful and the food is so tasty! I went for the first time a few weeks ago after Spin class next door. A friend and I split a "chicken" burrito which was delicious and I also got the Tumeric Latte which was SO good. I've been thinking about it since! I then took my husband here a couple weeks later for breakfast. I got the Avocado sandwich which was amazing!! My husband tried the French toast which was good but a little too sweet for both of us. Also tried a caramel latte which was very good. Prices are a bit high but I am ok with that knowing I am putting good quality food in my body. You get what you pay for. I will definitely be putting this place on my small list of restaurants to dine out at.

Surprisingly good.  I like healthy foods, but I usually find vegan food to be gritty or bland or dry.  This food was more delicious than I've had at places that use fat and eggs and butter and all that good stuff.  We went back twice in a row.  The cinnamon french toast was soft and flavorful.  Tiny apple slices brought a medley of tastes.  My friends enjoyed their omelets.  The juices were a little funky for me, but if you like a kick of ginger and spices, you'll have plenty to choose from.  The decor is colorful and inviting, and there always seemed to be tables open.  The staff is young and helpful, and seem to enjoy working there.  They patiently help you navigate the menu.  Some aren't quite focused when it comes to fixing mistakes (you wanted which sauce?  um, okay, be back in ten minutes...), but it's more cluelessness than apathy.  Overall, good for a leisurely and healthy brunch/lunch.  I would definitely return.

Delicious food, nice atmosphere. I was skeptical when looking at the menu and all the vegan offerings (sometimes vegetarian restaurants try a little too hard to be creative), but this was the best sandwich I've had in a long time (Sunizona BLT). I chose the side of hummus with vegetables; also excellent. The only drawback is it's a little pricey ($13 for a sandwich and side).

Pom has continued to thrive and grow for good reason. Great service, continued quality food and a fun atmosphere with daily specials that tempt even this staunch creature of habit!   Dragon Bowl & Green Protein Bowl are still my favorites. The bean burrito for breakfast is delicious as well.   Thanks Pom for keeping up the good healthy fight!

I have a gluten intoletance and hardly eat out. My sister dragged me there and I am happy she did!  Portions huge! I had the mushroom burger on a homemade gluten free bread! Delicious!!! I was so full! As a dessert I had the lemon bar! I highly recommend it. The kitchen and the rest of the facility is clean! Food and desserts delicious. My wild cream drink with jalapenos was too HOT! I tried to soften the spice out with milk but that didn't work. A little pricey, but worth it!

I am completely infatuated with this cafe. I live in Orange County where the raw vegan vegetable restaurant selection isn't so up to par.  Yes, yes, I know it is a nieche market but asking for a fresh healthy vegetable selection when eating out shouldnt be like pulling teeth. Sure we have Native Foods, Au Lac, and 118 degrees but Pomegranate Cafe has captured my heart. The atmosphere is completely unintimidating and the owner is perhaps the most delightful woman I've ever spoken to. She is so personable and I'm pretty sure she personally spoke to every patron in the place in the hour that I ate there.   But I digress... Onward to the food!!! My mother and I ordered the rainbow wrap and the sizzling sesame salad.   The sizzling sesame salad was composed of a sesame tofu, chili spiced almonds and an orange dressing. They rely on flavors versus sauces in this dish and I found it rather refreshing. The hit of spicy and sweet is one of my favorite combinations so this one was really a win.   The rainbow wrap was full of fresh crisp veggies and I had the hummus of the day as a side. ( It was a spicy red pepper hummus if I remember correctly.) The texture was gorgeously fresh  and paired wonderfully with the crispy crunchy carrots, cucumbers, and red bell peppers. The wrap had a cashew "cheeze". Which is usually a soaked cashew puréed with different seasonings. It all danced and sung together in my mouth. Yes, I am willing to speak in metaphores because I loved it all so much.   I cook fairly similar to this at home so it's nice to find a place away from home that can treat food properly without relying on fats and butters and actually tastes good with out being 'bland' healthy.

For a veggie lover, it is really hard to go wrong with Pom. They have the most extensive veggie/gluten-free menu I've ever seen in the Phx Metropolitan area. {The menu is literally a booklet}.  It's also not just a winner because of the food. Their lattes and smoothies are the zenith of local nutritional fancy beverage (holla @ the coconut caramel latte & hibiscus cooler). You are definitely paying a steep price for some of the options here, but hey, if theyre made with the sweet nector of forbidden fire fruit and blended cashew milk, maybe theyre worth the $10? Definitely just get them because they're served in a Mason jar. Even your cucumber water here is served in a Mason jar. This place is kitschy and rustic and very instagram friendly. For the best shot, make sure you get the cactus centerpiece in {see my examples below}.   Also, a short word on their desserts: they all look nice. They don't all taste nice. Such is the reality of sugar alternatives.   OH and before I completely forgot, their happy hour is dope. Definite go between 4 and 6 for the best value on already good food. {Pom, your Nachos and Wraps are Killing IT}.

Such an amazing restaurant and the only vegan one I have so close to home. The vibe there is so amazing and so is the service. They have only "messed up" once, of the numerous times I've Been there, and immediately apologized and offered me compensation. They said the food was taking a while to come out but to be honest, I didn't even notice, which just shows how diligent they are. The food there is amazing, I would recommend the curry bowl, sushi or rolls ,as they call them there, and the coconut brownie...as a drink the coconut mocha was amazing, never disappointed by this place.

Gone downhill over the years. I'm hoping their new location opening in Jan 2018 will have the level of attention I used to love at Pomegranate cafe.   I visited recently for brunch. We were seated and they had trouble finding menus for the 4 us despite there only being 5-6 full tables in the restaurant. Then we ordered drinks and it took at least 15 minutes for them to pour a glass of wine and make an arnold palmer.   I ordered Cassie's Latte after asking the waiter if it would be super sweet. He said no. Since I'm familiar with their raw/unrefined sugar treats, I knew they likely wouldn't let me down. The latte was actually sickeningly sweet - like Starbucks sweet. As a replacement, I asked for a regular iced latte with coconut milk. This time, there was maybe half a shot of espresso in it instead of the usual two. Plus, I was expecting the style of coconut milk you buy in a carton (aka normal). Instead the milk was more akin to the full fat coconut milk you buy in a can for baking. It's not good on its own in a drink, super gross. There was another woman in the restaurant who sent back a smoothie 3 times so I think the person working the drink station was having a bad day.   We also ordered the shakshuka brunch dish and it took them 10 minutes to tell us they were out of it, requiring us to go through the menu again for a backup.   We ordered a little over an hour before they were scheduled to close for the day. We were also planning to order a few dishes to-go, at the end of our meal. About 35 minutes went by and we hadn't received our food so my husband figured it'd be best to order our to-go items at the takeout counter in front, so they wouldn't close the kitchen for the day first. The man behind the counter said we had to order from our server, despite not having seen him in nearly 40 minutes.   The food finally arrived about 1 hour after sitting down, which seems a little crazy for 4 egg dishes. I ordered soup too and they brought it with my main dish. How hard is it to run a cup of soup out in 45 mins?   We managed to order our to-go food eventually, and that came out way faster than the boxes we requested for leftovers. Saw the waiter laughing in the back with the other servers and talking about hangovers in between serving tables.   Later we tried to order dessert from the waiter but couldn't chase him down. Asked the man behind the counter, he told us once again we had to order from the waiter only.   All-in-all, it took about 1.5 hours for breakfast, which made me really impatient. Nothing they did was outright offensive on its own, but altogether made for a messy dining experience. I really want them to get it together because Pom Cafe has been one of my favorite restaurants in PHX for years.
Awesome vegan food and great staff. The vibe inside is also very cool with nice music, art, and ambiance.

Trying out the new location because we love the first one. We ordered buffalo cauliflower,  pom burger, and crispy chicken.  I wish we had more of the cauliflower. The crispy chicken (when i can find it) weren't crispy. The pom burger were good size for $16 but the bun were dry and pattie were falling apart. I wish i didn't feel like a 4 year old using the forks they had. Over all i think they still have some growing pain. The potential is there, but the Ahwatukee location definitely had better product.

Found this place on Yelp as I was looking for a hearty but healthy last breakfast in Arizona before I headed back to the East Coast freeze. I wish I had more time to try more items on the menu as they all looked so good! I should have taken a snack for the road...  First, the drinks: the cucumber water was a nice touch! The coffee was pleasantly surprising. When I saw the big dispensers and the self serve coffee I was skeptical. The coffee was GREAT. I drink my coffee black and the flavor was awesome.   Next, the food: I got the breakfast tacos with eggs (rather than tofu) and no cheese. The veggies were awesome! The salsa and the guac were perfect touches and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.   Last, the service: friendly and speedy.   Thanks for a great meal!

I had really high hopes for this place. I am very into raw/vegan food and was excited to see that they served fresh food that suited my palate.   I went this week with my son and friend and the bill was close to $35. For a small serving of food I was really surprised at the price they charged. In fact, I had a juice a two sides in order not to spend $10 on kale.   The juice I had (kale, coconut water, berries, etc) was really good. The portion size was nice and I noticed that they had other really good veggie/fruit combos. I think that if you are into juice and have money to burn then this should be your go to place.   As I mentioned before, I chose to have sides to avoid their high plate prices. The pasta salad was pretty bad. The beet salad was also very bad. The beets were cooked, which I didn't expect and there was no dressing on the salad. It was just really bland and not at all what I expected.   My son had a quesadilla and it was really small. They gave him a few carrots and half a cookie which made the $4 price tag ok. I nibbled on all of these and was totally unimpressed. No thought goes into the kids meals apparently. He gulped half of my juice, which was good.   My friend had a falafel and a potatoes that were served with a pomegranate bbq sauce. I only tasted the potatoes and sauce and it was actually quite good.   After lunch I bought some macaroons and donut holes (all raw) out of the deli case and they were ok. I liked them but they didn't wow me.   I think that you should try this restaurant out for yourself. I really hope that your experience is better than mine. I really, really want to give this place a 5. In fact, I was hesitant to write this review just because I want them to succeed. I don't this can happen if they don't improve their menu and pricing. I will not return to pay $35 for mediocre food. It pains me to say this, but my first visit will be my last visit.
I got a lemonade and a burger. It was $26. No thank you. WAYYYYYYYYYYY too $$ for what I got.

Came here for breakfast with a couple girl friends. This is such a cute place! A bright, open dining space with colorful (and slightly girly) decorations. I love the local environmentally-conscious vibe, and the staff are really friendly!  I ordered the In-Season Egg Scramble, which came with a delicious stir fry of fresh vegetables, and yummy multi-grain toast! I love their toast! Much more fun than the regular wheat toast at most breakfast places, with a yummy berry jam! My friends ordered the multi-grain toast with almond butter, which was beautifully plated (with pomegranate seed topping!) and looked delicious as well! (And is a good way to go if you don't want a large portion). The best part, nothing felt heavy/greasy!  They also have an assortment of baked goods and desserts, which looked delicious! And they have complimentary cucumber water, which was super refreshing! I'm excited to come back and try their juices as well!

I love this place. They always have the most unique specials. Definitely a place everyone needs to try, even if you're not vegan/vegetarian.  Service is slow most of the time, but once you get your food it makes up for that extra time.

Not usually a vegetarian or vegan lover, but this place is great. The street tacos were terrific. Extremely tasty and filling. Service was great. Excellent great tasting desserts. I have a flour allergy. There are many choices. Can't wait to go back when they have the gluten free brownies. They had sold out before I got there. Must have a super pastry chef. The pastries we're very popular.

Kudos for being healthy, vegan, and offering raw options. Poor value and food is only ok. I ordered the bountiful bowl because I was not able to order the enchiladas due it being "brunch hour" at 11am. Ok, no problem.  The small-ish bowl was just OK. It came with a dry, undressed salad with corn chips that tasted like they came out of a bag, and consisted of 75% unseasoned quinoa. All for a mere $14 plus tax. The cost of ingredients that went into the bowl couldn't have been more than $3.00. Service and ambience not worth $12. I left disappointed.  Skip anything with "walnut taco meat". It tastes like walnuts, not taco meat. I probably won't come back, but I'm sure this place will improve over time. They have a lot of potential but need to work on the menu and value proposition. For the amount being paid there are other, better vegan options nearby.
Awesome place.  Everything was great,  huge portions for the bowls and no meat, really cool atmosphere.

One of the biggest reasons why I love Pomegranate cafe is because it reminds me of the restaurant that I used to work at. The food is all vegan (besides eggs during brunch), the music is fun, and the staff is awesome. I've been to Pom quite a few times now and every time, I leave satisfied.  The first time I came, I tried their vegan Mac and raw tacos. I'm not a raw vegan and the tacos weren't quite my cup of tea, but the Mac was pretty good and the cupcake I had for dessert was even better.  I also visited Pom on my birthday and had the most amazing nachos, which my boyfriend and I ended up coming back for within the same week because we loved them so much. They have this killer happy hour deal where select apps are half off, and the nachos are included. So. Good!!  More recently I visited Pom alone for Sunday brunch after taking the GRE and I tried their French toast. It tastes more healthy than decadent, but I actually like that sort of thing so I wasn't mad haha.  To close, if just like to say that I'm happy to have found Pomegranate Cafe and my only complaint is that they should have a Scottsdale location.

Caution!!!! I ate there about 1 week ago and almost exactly 24 hours later I was experiencing severe stomach cramps, vomiting, diarrhea, and just felt like hell. I am not 100% positive it was from this place, but given the timing and the fact that this was the only place where my girlfriend didn't eat the same thing I did, I'm pretty damn sure. I had a vegetable juice with a salad and my guess is they either didn't wash the veggies well enough or aren't washing their hands/equipment well enough. It's been almost 1 week and I am still experiencing symptoms. Considering how sick I got from this place I will probably never eat there again. Caution!!!!  If you have been sick from this place as well, please report them to the county health department so no one else has to go through the same thing.
Amazing food accompanied by amazing service.  Also, if you're lucky, you'll get Stephanie as a server. Very attentive, kind and helpful. A great meal for vegans and non-vegans. Will be back!!
Great vegan restaurant! Love coming here. Music sometimes to loud . But food is great !
Yummy yummy yummy!  First time to his location and it did not disappoint. Order raw taco special and it provided a great expression of textures and flavors.

Love this healthy funky cafe. The servers always are able to recommend something new and delicious. I've heard people at tables next to me complaining about how thins tasted. They do a really good job at turning healthy food into something that you wouldn't usually associate with being healthy. So if your expecting the real thing then this won't be the place for you. But if you love healthy food that tastes great you'll love it. Also, really enjoy there  read made in house. My only complaint is the price. The smoothies run me $10! And a latte for $5! A little over priced all around but because the food is so good I keep coming back.

I promise I come here every time I go to Phoenix! I ALWAYS get the nachos. They are crazy good!! Sooooo, this time I got the tumeric latte and the Arizona roll! And of course, the nachos!! I usually split my meal with someone else and this time was no different. I like my drinks on the stronger side so I usually don't divulge in their alcoholic beverages. Everything else there is amazing. One of my favorites to visit on my frequent trips to Phoenix!
This place was AMAZING! The workers were extremely helpful and kind and the vegan quesadilla that I got was divine. Do not miss out on this place if you're in the area-- it is an absolute gem!

Vegans! Alas! I've finally found a place that dishes are mighty flavorful and healthy. Let's start with the elephant curry bowl with tofu and brown rice. It was incredibly delicious. Carrots and purple cabbage brought the crunch while the soft curry bathed rice and tofu almost melted in my mouth.   The enchilada style burrito supreme tantalized my tastebuds. Each ingredient playfully danced in unison among the authentic Mexican spices.   Last, but definitely not least, the country mushroom soup. Quinoa, corn, onion and vegetable broth were tied up perfectly with the mushrooms. I was never a fan of the fungus, until now. I've rescinded my hatred and replaced it with love.   Pomegranate Cafe, we will be back. I'll be longing to try other items on the menu until we meet again.

A friend of mine recently told me about Pomegranate Cafe in Ahwatukee. I didn't know that all their menu items are vegan---how cool is that? All the baked goods and menu items are vegan, but they do offer eggs (instead of tofu for breakfast/brunch items) and dairy cheese (instead of vegan Diaya cheese) to appeal to vegetarians.   We went for a late afternoon lunch today and ordered pomegranate iced green tea, roasted red pepper hummus platter, and tempeh BLT sandwiches. The tea was tart and naturally sweet; very refreshing. The hummus was tasty and served with vegetables and warm bread slices. The BLT was simply awesome. I have to learn how to get my tempeh to taste like theirs! The baked goods looked way too good to pass up. So, against my waistlines wishes, we got 2 slices of vegan cake (lemon with strawberry frosting), raw vegan donut holes and coconut macaroons to take home. I will say that the donut holes don't actually taste like donuts, but they were still delicious. The cake was so amazing that I muttered to my husband that we need to order a whole cake (I'll have to see if they offer whole cakes...it was like wedding cake-good). I wish I could have tried everything on the menu...I just have to make plans to visit often. The berry pepita french toast sounds absolutely divine...for next time.

This place continues to hit the mark when it comes to ROCKING great vegan food.. I recently had corn muffins with Southwestern gravy, roasted potatoes and a tofu scramble - OMG good.  Hubby had the most huge cinnamon roll and we both had lattes. THEN we took a bunch of desserts to a party we were attending - gluten-free and more.  LOVED that because I didn't have to cook in order to bring something delicious.  Whenever we are in Phoenix.. Pomegranate Cafe is on our "must eat" list..
Great Cafe. Seating outside wonderfully food friendly staff. Had a fresh made juice with your meal.

We usually love this place and give it a lot of support but today we had quite a bad experience. We ordered a curry elephant bowl and a casadilla. Our server waited until our food was about to come out to tell us they were out of the stuff for the elephant bowl and it will be 20 more minutes fir the dragon bowl. Very annoying. Then the casadilla came out and was very different from last time, had no cheese on it, and was kind of awful. The nachos had a minuscule amount of cheese and when we asked the server why things were so different he acted surprised like he didn't know what we were talking about.  I think we will be taking a break from this place for a while. At these prices they cant afford poor service and subpar food.   So the manger came over before we left and we told her what happened. She cut our bill in half and apologized, explaining there is a new chef.  She was very nice about it and we appreciate her listening. Also, we bought some cowgirl chocolate tarts to go and they were the bomb!
Love POM! Used to drive from Avondale to Ahwatukee just for the chocolate cake! Love the new location in Phoenix!  The Cashew yogurt was fabulous!

My absolute favorite restaurant!! My husband and I come here a few times a month for date night. We always get the Arizona Roll and Gila Monster Nachos, but this past time we also split the Baja Burger... so delicious. The whole meal was simply amazing! Thank you Pomegranate Cafe!!
Service is always a bit slow, but the food makes up for it. My Favorite breakfast place and part of their profits go towards providing children with healthy lunches. Way to go.
Great combinations of healthy food.  I'm a fan of the smoothies as well.  Kind of pricey, but not unreasonably so.
We love EVERYTHING here! The atmosphere, the staff (especially Stephanie), the food, the drinks, the desert. As vegans with allergies to gluten and dairy, there is no place we would rather eat!

I'm only going to give a three star rating because of the lady at the register was helpful and courteous otherwise I was not very impressed. Now let me state it smelt great but the food is way to pricy to want to come back. Plus not once was i greeted at the door with a "hello, welcome in" but I waiting patiently and before I knew it I was being cut off in the line by a guy looking at the snack bar and ready to pay his bill. I spoke up that I was already in line and he gave me my spot back but stood right behind me so close that I could hear his comments . then a hostess/waiter came up to him and stated "just trying to pay your bill?" he then followed with " yes and they should have moved her to someone else, I'll be speaking with so and so"  coming in as a NEW customer unfamiliar with the way this place works I was unsure of where to go or if there were several lines for different things plus again nobody had greeted me. To close this off I felt very low and that my business did not matter so I'm sadly saying I'm not going to be coming back which sucks for me because I really wanted to enjoy this place. So you got your way buddy someone else will be helping me!

Terrible service. They forgot that we were seated; the group that came in after us was given their food before we could even place our order. We had to walk up to the front to get a waiter to take our order. After we did, the waiter lost our order and was looking for it for at least 15 minutes before asking us to reorder. For the high price of the items, you would think the service would be good, but not at all. It took us nearly an hour to get our food.

Sometimes it's difficult to really feel satisfied with a raw vegan diet , but every time I go to Pomegranate's I leave more than satisfied.   The atmosphere is welcoming and delightful, although very busy during the lunch rush. I did have to share a table with a stranger last time I was there but the stranger turned out to be a great lunch companion.  This is a must for anyone who is considering (or already is) a raw and/or vegan diet.  Everything is so yummy you won't know it is good for you!

Amazing breakfast!  Service was wonderful and the food arrived quickly!  I had the cinnamon swirl French toast and it was to die for!  My partner had the red pepper and garlic scramble and it too was outstanding!  Would highly recommend this place!

Such a shame. This is the exact kind of restaurant Im always looking for. Too bad the staff are oblivious to basic customer service. I've never been in, so i asked if I seat myself or wait to be seated. This question really threw the waiter for a loop. He just didn't know how to answer. Because I was carrying my laptop bag- he was more concerned on whether or not a was giving a lecture or something. Very strange... Then I had a seat, but no one came to my table to take my order. So, I notice the "order here" sign. I got up and asked, "is this where I order?". They responded, "wherever....".    It was like pulling teeth to figure out whether I seat myself or wait to be seated, whether a server takes my order or I order at the counter. It shouldn't be so hard to spend $20+ on a lunch and drink. Long story short- I just can't support a company with staff that are that confused and oblivious as to the basic functions of their job or just basic guest service.  I've never seen a place with such confused employees. I mean, who can't say whether its seat yourself or not? Who can't say whether a server will take your order or whether you order at the counter?   Ridiculous.
Food was delicious, but the service was fairly slow. Don't go there if you need a quick lunch, but if you have the time, you'll leave satisfied.

My hubs and I love this place. The first time we found it by searching online for veg-friendly places. We found this one, came with family for his bday, and it's been a tradition ever since. Unfortunately, it's far from where we live. We were in N. Scottsdale and now we're in N. Phoenix, so it's always been a hike. But it's been a hike worth taking! The food is amazing and ever changing. We usually like to check out whatever is on the daily specials board. The desserts are equisite! We even had them make our wedding cake (berry lemon ginger vegan cheesecake). My favorite drink is Cassie's latte, either hot or cold. The lumberjack sandwich, the almond joy, the quesadillas...all amazing and vegan! (or with eggs and cheese for other tastes). Everyone is friendly and helpful. And, it's great to see the owners rolling up their sleeves and doing hard work too. Our only regret is we don't live closer to come every week!

After Matt's encouragement to return, and letting me know the pancackes I had were prepared, not according to recipe, I returned today.  And, so very glad I did!  He was working, and after a bit of discussion I decided on the "in season scramble".   He had me at "seasonal hash".   I opted for eggs, vegan cheese and requested a side of the salsa, as I do like eggs spiced up a bit it.   The whole grain toast perfect, not too seedy or bland.   The hash; a combination of roasted butternut squash, yukon potatoes and sweet potatoes forced me to devour every morsel.   The fresh squeezed orange juice reminded me to pull out my juicer, so worth the effort.   Marlene offered me a seasonal spice cookie.   Yeah, ate that as soon as I got home, Fall has arrived.    This family owned gem is in my neighborhood, I so want it to endure all the strip mall changes locally.  I will bring friends and family, one can pig-out and feel good about it.   Thank you Matt for the 2nd chance, everyone deserves one.  I look forward to many more healthy meals.  Congrats on making in the Top New Restaurants, of Phx. Magazine.  Quite an accomplishment, for the litte restaurant who does make big healthy meals, vegan or not.

Absolutely amazing every time I go. Now with two locations I can go more. I've tried most of their menu but I particularly love their Arizona Rolls. Big portions and even my picky meat eating brother loves their food. Don't leave with out taking some of their raw desserts home. The Samoa cookie is my favorite next to the cowgirl cookie.
The Pumpkin French Toast (gluten-free) was delicious.   The server, Austin, is very charming.  I highly recommend the Pomegranate café.
Very delicious food. I'm not a vegetarian, but I enjoyed the BBQ veggie quesadilla. The food was flavorful and tasted fresh and healthy. And it was plenty of food, I was stuffed!

I was skeptical of a restaurant that proclaimed a vegan menu, but I'm so glad I read the reviews and gave it a shot! I took my husband and two young sons there for brunch and we were treated to a great meal. Service was a bit slow but could say it was laid back and relaxed I guess. I had a maca smoothie that was incredibly flavorful and the seedy toast with strawberries and nutty butter. It was fantastic! The kids enjoyed their breakfast burrito and eggs/toast meals, and my husband was in love with the special he ordered, but I couldn't tell you what it was other than some eggs and lots of spicy vegetables! Eggs are an alternative to tofu you can order on any menu item for an extra $1 if you prefer. We will definitely be back!

So happy to finally have one of these in Phoenix! They have a sinful selection of desserts and the staff is very friendly. Get the cowgirl cookie!!! Rick even gave me dog cookie that they make in house for free! Oh and the drip coffee is not to be missed, Rick told me it tastes like blueberries and he was right!! I would go back just for that coffee!  Thank you guys for the excellent service and amazing cruelty free food. Photo below is of their version of a "sushi" roll. Very fresh and delicious. I would get it again.

Wonderful service! Our server was so sweet and helpful, and provided great recommendations. Our 2 year old loved his French toast, and he got run around the patio in the misters. The dragon bowl was so yummy, and big enough to share. Wish we were in town at 3 o'clock for their happy hour!

This place is amazing!  My husband and I are gluten free and dairy free. His birthday was coming up and I had yet to bake some sort of birthday cake... (Not my strong point) so I had heard that Pomegranate had a small selection of desserts that were gluten free. Desperate NOT to bake myself I went in,... Low and behold I hit the mother load of deliciousness!  There were so many options that we could both have it was amazing! Since I could not decide, we got pretty much one of everything (some items we did get 2 of) and there was not 1 thing that I tried that was not fantastic!  Even my children who crave refined sugar and corn syrup and various garbage thought everything was delicious.  It was not until AFTER they had ingested it all did I mention that they were actually healthy treats!  I cannot wait to go back very soon!

A huge improvement, a complete turn-around. As though Mr. Happy himself has been imbued into the staff here.   Upon arrival, it was empty but then started filling up. The wait staff and hostess at the counter were pleasant and very helpful.   Upon ordering we received our little flag and found our table to sit. The brownie was brought out first. Very quick this time around. Not more then 5 mins. And within a minute more, another person brought out our drink. She was gracious and very polite, making the experience so much more delightful.   Within a few more minutes, a younger waitstaff came around to let us know our food will be next. Also very polite, and not sassy.   Once again, a complete turnaround from our previous experience. All the i's dotted all the t's crossed. And not just for us, we witnessed the same pleasant demeanor for every guest that came to eat. Always someone stopping by to ask how the meal is, everything to our satisfaction. Perfect - Delicious - Very Hospitable and Friendly  4 stars is only because the restroom needed a little pickme up.   fin

First off, let me say that I love the concept of this restaurant. They focus all of their efforts on local, and organic produce in almost all of their dishes. The restaurant itself is decorated super nice and the overall atmosphere is awesome. My wife and I decided to share a wrap that was stuffed with a bunch of fresh veggies and tofu. The overall flavor of the wrap was good, but I felt like it was lacking something. I did put on one of the hot sauces that they offer and that made it really flavorful. It came with a pretty generous portion of a side salad. While I do understand that serving organic produce can hike up the prices, the price for the wrap was a little steep at $15. However, it was actually a pretty good sized wrap despite the price point. We also ordered a specialty pancake that I was not a fan of at all. I also ordered a side of chips and salsa and I did like the flavor of the salsa but the chips texture were a little off. We really wanted to try a dessert but we were pretty full so we decided against it. I would love to come back, however I would need to order something different to wow me a little more.

Love this place, so glad to have a veg friendly cafe for when I'm in town visiting fam! Love the POM milk in my coffee...and the rest of the menu,well, I pretty much wanna eat it all! :)  Also, very friendly staff which is always a huge plus.

We've been going at least twice a month since this friendly, family owned cafe opened a few years ago. Their vegan/vegetarian menu is creative and full of delicious organic ingredients. I love the Wild Western Tacos for breakfast. And for lunch either the avocado sandwich or elephant curry. (Not made from elephants.... C'mon!)  The smoothies and fresh juices are expensive but delicious. In fact that can be said of everything on the menu! However this is very much factored away when you consider their use of fresh, local, organic ingredients and very attentive service. My favorite juice is the cold and flu buster but often I just go for the fresh squeezed oj. This is the best place to get one of these I've found since moving to the valley 8 yrs ago.
Love this restaurant. My siblings are vegetarians from San Francisco and this is A favorite spot when they visit. Never had a problem here and food is delicious. :)

Best vegitiarian selection so have found.  A bit on the expensive side but worth it.  Gluten Free RED Velvet cupcake for my birthday pre order recommend. One sweet treat!  The also have baked sweet potato fries you just want to dive into.  Those alone could make a meal.  Local sourced food with green environment.  All around a great place for healthy foods disguised as sheer decadence.

We love this cafe! So many yummy options. Our kids love that they can order anything off the menu and it is all vegan.  Many gluten free options as well. Kids Mac and cheese was a huge hit and the tofu scramble delicious. If only we lived nearby.... Still, anytime we come through Phoenix we make a point to stop.

This is my second review of this restaurant. The first time I went when they opened, I wasn't impressed with the food selections and slow service thus my first bad review. But overtime, they really have IMPROVED-they vamped up the menu and the service is MUCH better. So kudos to them! My favorites are Arizona Rolls and Living Caesar Salad as well as their smoothies and coffee! I am happy to say I go there once or twice/week-their vegan selections are delicious! I'm also glad that it is conveniently located in my area.

I'm so happy that POM opened a second location and so much closer to where I live! Though I was willing to drive 45 minutes to their other location, I'm happy I don't have to anymore. And their new location has longer hours!  I love POM for everything they do ... the owner has created such a beautiful business that is trying to stick to their mission for healthy, organic, [mainly] vegan, sourcing locally ... and that's a hard thing to do. So I'm thoroughly impressed with their ability to stay true to their roots!  Their staff are friendly and nice and knowledgeable. They work hard and wear many hats, that I can see. I've always had a great experience with dining in.  Now their food, desserts and drinks! Everything is so yummy. I have yet to try something that I don't enjoy. I've tried almost everything and my favorites are:  Desserts: Cookie Dough POM Truffle Cookie Dough Brownie Superseed Ball Dog Treats (for the pup!)  Entrees: RAW Everything Bagel Buffalo Cauliflower Athena's Salad Wild Western Tacos RAW Tacos Vivos Bountiful Bowl Gila Monster Nachos  Drinks: Cold & Flu Buster Superfood Hot Chocolate POMilk Shake Coconut Caramel Latte

An update to my previous review:  I absolutely love POM and so does my pup! Their original location is cute, fun, and vibrant. They have friendly staff and delicious food and pastries. I can't get enough of their food! I've tried almost everything on their menu without disappointment. I haven't tried all of their desserts, but the ones I have tried are phenomenal.  One thing to note, if you've never been or only been a few times ... it WILL take a while for your food to come out - and that has nothing to do with their abilities. It's because they make their food fresh and more-often-than-not from scratch! So be kind and patient, because it'll be well worth it!

This place is probably as close to a 5 star rating as it can be without being a 5 star. If you like raw, organic and natural food then this is a great mix of food choices with all sorts of flavors, delicious smoothies, teas, coffee and sundry other treats. Oh and don't forget to make them work behind the counter when you ask for 2 oz wheat grass shot. Love 'em! Yes, the prices are not cheap but well made food with honest to goodness good ingredients does not come cheap. You can eat cheap at fast food restaurants and we all know all to well what can happen in a paltry 30 days thanks to Mr. Spurlock. If you want to eat healthy and enjoy a tasty meal in the process I give Pomegranate Cafe a two thumbs up! Come on by and give them a shot. Of course I meant the wheat grass shot! :-)

For a vegan, this spot is a must see. The atmosphere is comfortable and eye catching and the staff is very knowledgeable about vegan needs. We got the cheese crisp and bounty burrito.. phenomenal! Even the nachos were killer.. if you had no idea you were dining area a vegan restaurant, you'd have no idea they were 100% animal product free. And their desserts are just like the real thing.. the lemon cheesecake and peanut butter cups are awesome! Definitely coming back!

I love this place. Delicious salads.  I find it can be disappointing for gluten free eaters like me. They really need gluten free buns and bread and wraps. Health conscious people are eating gf more and more. I love the salads. They need more gf options for their foods. Great place. Beverages are amazing. I would also like to know what is and what is not organic.

My belly, heart and brain are happier after eating here. This place is the equivalent or the slightly better half of cafe gratitude in California.  We went for breakfast and was so pleasantly surprised with how good the food and service were. Our waitress was absolutely darling and made our single order pancake look and taste as good as the full order. We left feeling full with good healthy ingredients and will definitely be back!
This is one of the best vegan restaurants I've ever been to. The nachos are the best vegan nachos I've ever had, so tasty! Can't wait to go back soon.
The food was absolutely delicious! We locked our plates clean!! If you have non vegan friends bring them here and they'll fall in love.

Pretty good location...wide open spaces...great staff...wonderful outdoor seating...this describes the NEWEST Pomegranate Cafe location in Phoenix. The desserts look divine but I can't tell you much about the other food at this point. The wife and I plan to go there for dinner in the very near future at which time I will update this review. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my, Friends!!!!
Every time I come here it's a consistent experience. Friendly staff, great menu and selection, and I'm never disappointed. One of the best vegan places I've eaten in the area.

Food is great.  Price and Wait Time not so.    For 2, expect to spend over $50 for lunch.   And if you go for lunch, you will need 90 minutes, cause it really takes a while to get your food, even your 'smoothie' is gonna take some time.  Not sure why they are so slow...been to plenty of vegan restaurants and just don't see wait times like this.  Good food, but not good enough to go back when there are other Vegan options available that are quicker and cheaper.

My 7 year old and I checked this place out last weekend.  I understand this is a new location, so I will forgive some of the service faux pas. I enjoyed the mushroom tacos and give kudos to the kitchen for making them even though I ordered them at a time they weren't available. Careful of the color coding system on the menu if you go. I didn't find the place to be kid friendly menu-wise though. My kiddos mac and cheese had some odd seasoning or spice and after one bite she wouldn't touch it.  I ordered something else and let the server know that she did not like the mac.  The French toast was nominally better. I understand that vegan french toast is likely very challenging, so again, forgiveness.  The wild and green drink (I think that's what it was called) sounded delicious.  Unfortunately that didn't translate to the glass.  I like spicy and sweet flavors together so the pineapple jalapeno combo sounded appealing, but when it arrived (after our entrees) it was so intensely jalapeno the none of the other flavors were discernable.  I struggled to consume it as I was reluctant to walk away from a $9 drink.  I was dismayed when the bill arrived and I discovered that the mac and cheese had not been removed even though it was barely touched.  Nor was my beverage, despite it's late arrival.  I work in hospitality and have for 25 years.  This is not the norm in my industry.  We spent $50 and really only enjoyed one item.  I think I'll stick to flower child from now on.

I would give service 2-3 stars but everything else gets 4. I think this issue could be solved with just hiring more people, which it looks like they're trying to do anyways. Went here for lunch on Saturday and got seated pretty quickly outside, but the place was pretty packed! Service was extremely slow. Took them a long time to get one water out (room temp water with one cucumber slice). Then another like 10 minutes until the second water came out, room temperature but no cucumber. We didn't request cucumber or no cucumber so idk why. A group of 6 sat down near us a while after we were seated, they had their orders taken first for some reason. Finally our order was taken, we got 2 superfood got cocoas and a falafel con papas with tofu. They first brought out the hot cocoas, and one of them was spilled all over the cup, we had to ask for a napkin to clean up, they didn't offer to help even though they were the ones who spilled it. It tasted good and was unique but didn't taste as good when it got cold. The falafel con papas tasted delicious but one of the halves was completely ripped down the side when it was served to me. I don't care that much about presentation, it just made it hard to eat. But I'd definitely order it again it tasted really good. Expensive, but worth it for once in a while. I'd come back maybe in a few months to see if their service improves.

First and foremost, I am not a vegan or vegetarian (I did have a little stint back in high school during my XXX hardcore days, but that's another  story). I enjoy eating meat. However, I do enjoy Vegan/vegetarian food as well which drew me to Pomegranate Cafe when I lived on the east side.   To be honest, Pomegranate Cafe is an acquired taste.  It's not for everyone as with most restaurants similar. The food is organic and non processed and most dishes I have tried has an "earthy" taste.  The juices are freshly made and is exactly that JUICE. No additives, sugars necessary.  You get the full nutrients from the food you're eating/drinking.   Whenever I come here (2-3 times/mo), I usually get the Lumberjack, hearty and delicious. I get it vegan even though a non vegan is available (when in Rome).  I also order the Abundance, a mean unpleasant looking green juice that is beyond delicious.  If I have room, as the portions are generous, I'll share dessert with friends.     As I've stated earlier, this place is not for everyone.  The prices are on the higher side, but for what you get, it's well worth it. Can you spend the same amount of money and get 25 cheeseburgers from McDonalds? Sure. If that's the case, then you have wasted your time reading this review. If you want a different culinary experience with healthy food, knowledgable staff, and relaxed ambiance, then give Pomegranate a try!

I made the trip from Scottsdale all the way to here to finally try it out after obsessing over their facebook/instagram. Being a vegetarian, it is always so awesome to find an all vegetarian (or vegan) place, I only can think of a few others in the Phoenix area!  The cafe is really cute, near a trader joes which I think is a fitting location haha. Went at like 3pm on a Saturday and there was a pretty good crowd, I'm sure they get busy in there! I liked the decor and how the water was served in mason jars, pretty cute. It was so hard to decide what to order. Everything looked so amazing, totally my type of food! I ended up getting a burrito. I can't remember the name of it but it had a ton of veggies and was covered in red sauce. They used cashew cheese too which I love! The food was amazing and fresh and I nearly ate the whole burrito! Only downside: it was $15 for one burrito. I know it's all good quality ingredients and such but that seemed a little outrageous for me. Food was so good though Id come back. Id like to try something else on the menu too! Definitely a must-try for vegans and vegetarians, yummy!
Good food but very pricey. Has some falafel dish with some unknown things in the plate..lol But was good. Not the price

I sincerely wish there was a Pomegranate Cafe in Seattle.  I had a few hours to spend before heading to the airport and this was the best meal I could have ever wished for.    The cherry on top: jelly filled raw donut holes.

I didn't want to like this place, but the food was really good. I had the lumberjack sandwich. I was a little leary on the idea of the food when it came, but after tasting it my mind changed. I won't give up real meat or dairy, but I will try this place again.

Do I eat vegan food...sometimes. Do I eat processed animal product...you betcha. I always say if I could make vegetarian food / vegan food at home that taste as good as it does here maybe I'd give it a shot. I know how much organic produce costs so I'm not going to complain about the price, I just can't afford it for every meal and for those of you that want to tell me how easy it is if you put in the effort...well, I'm lazy. Long story short, food was delicious, service was great, atmosphere was relaxing.

I didnt know this was a vegan restaurant but it turned out to be pretty good. They have cage free eggs and milk so its not totally vegan as they have vegetarian options . I chose the breakfast burrito with eggs. It was huge and chock full of veggies and good stuff. I left feeling full but not uncomfortable.  They have all kinds of healthy juices and smoothie options.  Definitely a good stop  for healthy breakfast or lunch options un Ahwatukee.

Our meals were fresh, healthy, and delicious! The downside was a long wait for the meal... but yummy so worth the wait.   Our server was happy and attentive with water/orders et cetera.   The maca mocha was DELICIOUS and small for the price ($10!?)... but man, so good. I wish I had another one!  Weird it's in a strip mall, but once you're inside you forget that... especially because of the prices. Am I in Malibu? We spent $95 for brunch for 3 people (one app, 3 meals, 2 coffees)... I expect those prices in LA or NY, so that was a bit disappointing to find them in a strip mall off the freeway.   Portions are generous though. I took my leftovers home and discovered some SYSCO plastic cooked in with my tofu! Glad I saw it before I could take a bite, but does make me wonder what is going on in the back....   Either way, I'd come back! I'd comb through my food a little more carefully and savor my maca mocha a little more slowly.

Great start for the Grand Opening day at the new 7th Street Pomegranate Cafe location, nice patio seating and a beautiful bright open seating space inside. The food is looked delicious as it came out if the open kitchen. For this visit I only had the Rocky Road dessert bar and it was divine!

I have heard rave reviews about the Chandler location so thought I'd check out this one, as it's closer to my house. I realize it's newly opened but I was so disappointed. The website menu doesn't specify that the menu shown is only for the Chandler location. This location has a much more limited menu. Disappointing.  There were four of us in our group. It took nearly an hour to get our food and it didn't seem all that busy. Here's what we had: - Nori roll - meh, just OK. Nothing special. - Nachos - came out with "chicken" instead of the walnut taco "meat" with no mention made or explanation as to why. The walnut taco meat was the main reason this dish was ordered. The chicken was really dry and tough. - Crispy chicken burrito - the chicken was the same dry tough chicken used in the nachos. Not what was expected when the description was "crispy" chicken. The rice was also under-cooked making the burrito inedible. - Pom burger - the burger was good but the tempeh bacon was burnt (like completely black on one side), so it was pulled off the sandwich.   Overall, the food under whelmed us all.   The staff was friendly enough, but we had to ask for water refills. This is just a personal annoyance.   All in all, not sure I'd return to this location. But I'll for sure give the other a go.
Charming Cafe.What I ordered was excellent.A bit pricey, but that is the price you pay for fresh,organic, healthy, and delicious food.
Delicious food but took a while to get someone to take our order and the hot food took quite a while to arrive. Great atmosphere and lovely outdoor seating.

This place is FANTASTIC! Fresh juices of all sorts, breakfast and lunch.  I went here for breakfast and ordered the Pina Colada Pancakes not knowing everything was vegan (which is a plus in my book). The pineapple compote was warm and not too sweet, dusted with coconut. I liked the food here so much I came back the next day for lunch and had a curried sweet potato/tempeh bacon and tofu sammy on GF bread with a carrot ginger juice. YUM!  Next time I'll be in to sample some of the raw vegan brownie/powerbar/ball/tirimisu/cheesecake desserts!  I would eat here everyday, but I think this ma + daughter place will burn a hole in my pocketbook! It's a little pricey, but it's so good it's worth it to put some real nutritious food in your body. A+

I'm not a vegan but I appreciate the variety of trendy diets that pomegranate caters to. I like going somewhere that I know is consistent and the food is healthy and delicious. The portions are bigger now than a year ago and I think suit the prices better. The desserts can be hit or miss but mostly hit and vegan pasties are a real treat to see so kudos on that. I like the casual atmosphere and the staff is always polite, knowledgeable and friendly.

Wow we normally love this place but tonight was terrible. We waited on our server for almost twenty min... food took 50 min to come to the table. When it did - only half our food came. Another five min later and almost all our food made it out. We water finished eating and said just box up the food we are still waiting on. Not sure if it was the kitchen or the server Summer but wow. That sucked. The food was still delicious but I'm writing this negative review in hopes that some things can change because the service was just ridiculous. Half the tables were empty so they can't even blame being slammed. It was bad.

This is some of the best food I have had in Phoenix! I came here for a "snack" with a co worker while on business and was blown away by their buffalo cauliflower wrap that was vegan and gluten free. Our sever was awesome and the food was incredible!

The hubs and I went in for lunch this week and really enjoyed this place. I started out with a Turmeric latte and it was enormous, delicious, and super warming. I had the Dragon Bowl with quinoa and it far exceeded my expectations. The "chicken" in the bowl was Beyond Meat, which I love and the veggies were roasted to perfection. The real heros in this dish are the toasted pecans and the Thai sauce - both are huge flavors but neither overtaking the dish. It's just really nicely balanced and of course super healthy. My husband had the everything bagel and it was just way too much food to eat. The bagel itself was more like a bagel chip but dense, so when you bit into it, it didn't break it just squooshed everything out of the sandwich. It was good just really messy and hard to eat. The salad that came with it was a meal all by itself. So overall the food was pretty darn delicious. The server that waited on us was really nice and super knowledgable but not very attentive given that they weren't busy. We'll go back and eat here anytime we're in town.

Absolutely love the food!  So hard to find a good, organic restaurant so it's nice to find one that actually makes great food!  Great variety, friendly staff.....little pricey but that's what you expect nowadays when organic is concerned.  Until the rest of the world catches up, prices will always be high for food such as this....quality;)

I tried the dragon roll + potato wedges and both were amazing! Super fresh and definetly worth the price. Plus the entire staff was friendly and helpful. The juices and smoothie bowls also looked amazing.
Food is always good but the wait takes so long...  don't go if you are in a hurry to get somewhere. Must try the Brazil nut brownie or chocolate chip cookie dough brownie for dessert. Heavenly!!!!

I've to this cafe a couple times. Their food and drinks are yummy.  I had sesame burger and my son had the teriyaki chicken.  It was a little too different for him but it didn't stop me from finishing it for him.  I would have liked a few more choices of dishes with meat but I suppose that would defeat the whole vegan cafe idea.
Expensively delicious!  The food is absolutely delicious for vegetarian style.  You need to be rich to be able to afford to eat healthy.  Who knew vegetarian food could so good and so expensive.
Still miss you guys but having fun with my new life in WA.

Not settled on a rating I want to give because this place is inconsistent. First time we went, wait was over an hour to get food for a late lunch. They weren't that busy but didn't have enough cooks. We got desserts to go, which were really good. Second time ... service was slow and spotty, lunch was excellent, but we were there for 90 min cause they were SO SLOW!! Third time, I called in order ahead of time; Told them we'd eat there. When we arrived, food was packaged to go, but we grabbed a table anyways. Food (even though we ordered) one of the same meals) was definitely not as good & just not the same.

I really like this place and they have wonderful food.  I know organic, vegan will usually cost more, but the food here is just overpriced.  I will still come because there are limited options in the east valley, but I am going to start looking for new places that are priced fair.  The smoothies alone are twice what I expect to pay.  But the food really is excellent!

Breakfast food is the best food. I order a tofu scramble burrito and my partner ordered the Ranchero skillet. I loved mine. I tried a few bites of the Ranchero skillet  and that was awesome, despite the super hard tortilla it came with. I enjoyed the earthy ambiance and love eating organic. I am curious to try this place out again. However, I am not sure how often I could realistically eat there based on the prices. Over $30 for 2 breakfast entrees, a lemonade, and an iced americano is a bit pricey.  Overall, my first time at Pomegranate Cafe was a delicious experience.

I have been talking about going to this place for months!! MONTHS.  And I finally got to go tonight, and was crazy disappointed by the desserts, food, and service.  The waitress was highly attentive to everyone but us (IT WAS NOT BUSY). She was chatting up other customers, took the order of another table who sat down after us, and never filled our waters. Quite often, she was standing idly.   She only asked us if our food was okay when it was obvious that we didn't think it was.  Now to the food...  We ordered the nachos (best part of the meal... but you can't really screw up nachos), buffalo cauliflower taco (too spicy, I'm Asian and eat a lot of spicy, but that was all spicy and no flavor), pumpkin fudge brownie (aight but boring), and a slice of pumpkin chocolate cheesecake (so bad, and it was their recommendation!!!).   After letting her know about the least pleasurable parts of our meal (buffalo cauliflower and cheesecake), she took it off our bill. So thank you! But then it took her another 15 minutes to get the check... because she just forgot. So no thanks!   Also it looks like some new waitress was shadowing her... terrible idea if the owners just want to perpetuate BAD service.  Instead of going here, please go to Trader Joe's next door, buy some groceries, and make better quality food @ a lower price AT HOME.

So, I am not a vegan, nor am I vegetarian, however, this place rocks my world! Super friendsly (and not overly cheesy) staff, BOMB food, fresh juice, smoothies, espresso and yes, even alcohol.   Raw food options that will blow your mind. The flavor profiles in their dishes are phenomenal. Whoever this chef is knows what's up!  Even if you're not into the whole vegetarian/raw/vegan lifestyle, you will be surprised at how good this place is.   I am currently pregnant and unable to have caffeine and I really miss and crave coffee. The always friendly staff is eager to recommend something new and on my last visit I was turned on to Jnantik. This is a Mayan superfood coffee substitute that actually tastes/smells similar to coffee! They mix it right in with their Pom milk (a blend of various nut and soy milks) and serve it as a latte. So not only did this satisfy my coffee craving, but it is packed with vitamins and minerals to give me a natural energy boost!

We are so happy to have Pomegranate Cafe in Ahwatukee! Every dish is delicious! We especially like the juices! Servers are always knowledgeable and helpful when choosing items off the menu! It is so nice to sit out on the patio in good weather! A great restaurant to take out of town guests to! The owner is always happy to help with donations to our local schools! Great community restaurant!
Awesome food! So so delicious I am craving it!! I gave it 4 stars because the service wasn't the greatest but it definitely won't keep me from going back.

Service, all stars. I had the spicy dragon bowl with tofu and kelp noodles ( pro tip: ask for sriracha if you like heat), and it was delish. I'll be back- likely tomorrow!  Not your average vegan restaurant ( i.e. Bland)

The ambiance is great. Love the outdoor set up even in the AZ summer heat. The inside is adorable! The mango coconut muffin is great the toast I ordered is dry. The Milky Way drink also take dry and far too strong. The service overall is good. The sever I had seemed annoyed by me asking questions (this is my 1st time here). I will be back in hopes for a better experience!
Fantastic! Fresh ingredients and a wide variety if options on the menu. For dessert we had the pomegranate chocolate cake and it was really good, but had too much frosting. Will definitely be back!

I just went to their new location last week, and I loved it. My friend and I met there for breakfast. The decor was bright, casual, and welcoming. The employees were friendly and accommodating. The food was delicious and healthy. As a breakfast lover and a vegetarian, this was a nice find. I will definitely be back!

Absolutely thrilled this place opened a central location! The Gila Monster Nachos are to die for with in house walnut meat and dairy free cheese!  I would also recommend the root vegetables wedges and the crispy "chicken " burrito !  The service was a bit slow but they have only been open a week! I cant wait to come back to this vegan restaurant .

This place is awesome what a wonderful birthday brunch. We got the nachos and they were so fantastic you wouldn't believe they are meat free. We also shared the elephant burrito and it was amazing the almond Thai sauce really hit the spot. The route wedges were delicious but definitely put us over the top portion sizes are good and feeling here. I had no problem with service and even got a piece of cake for my birthday.

I visited the new POM location with much anticipation as I've been a loyal visitor to the Ahwatukee original location.  The food was as good as always with a few caveats... we waited over 35 minutes with what looked like a very light crowd and after we received our food, my order was missing an ingredient. Also, much to my dismay and disappointment, the service did not compare, AT ALL.  A big disappointment and I will not be returning to this location.

I've been in there often due to convenient location, but, I usually do not feel good physically after eating there.  I've ordered things with cheese, but, I'm very concerned that possibly I may have been getting dairy cheese instead of vegan cheese.  They say they are vegan AND vegetarian.  But, I realize if they are offering dairy cheese & eggs on their menu, I feel extremely uncomfortable with that.    As much as they write they are organic, using local companies, etc., the part that would make them appear ethical....the very fact that they offer dairy & egg products, makes them no different than any ordinary restaurant.  Dairy products are the cruelest industry out there - even more than ordinary meat, &, it's already been proven that even a small amount of dairy causes cancer.  I need to start going back to strictly vegan restaurants, even if they are farther from where I live.  I wish Pomegranate Cafe would just let go of the non-vegan foods.  If they are supposedly so knowledgeable about health, organic, etc., they need to catch up to the several vegan restaurants who are making spectacular tasting foods.

Preface-  I am not a vegan and my wife is preggers.... This place had us pretty apprehensive looking at the menu but we took a leap and tried the vegan hash and an Athena's wrap. Absolutely amazingly good. This is easily now in my favorite restaurant list. Everything we tried was delicious.

This is the best food I have had in a while, so good!  I had the BLT with veggie bacon and it was awesome and totally satisfying.  My son had the humus and veggies, which he loved.  My husband and mother in law had the vegie burger, which they did not rave about, but said that it was ok.  It is a very cheery interior and we saw some other families come in and dine as well (always good to find more child-friendly places).  This place is truly a gem, will definitely be back!

The menu is not nearly descriptive enough. I ordered a chickpea Mediterranean salad expecting falafel on a bed of lettuce. What I got was curried chickpea cakes on swiss chard and kale...disgusting. Not to mention two salads and lemonade cost $46. Never coming here again.

Met up with a friend at Pomegranate Café early evening on a Wednesday, the place was too packed but it was steady. Since it my birthday I had dinner plans coming up so I knew that I couldn't get anything big to eat, and I immediately regretted that!  Everything just looked delish and I wanted to try it all!  After checking out the dessert display, I picked out a Brazilian Brownie, I won't lie, I wasn't sure what to expect from this raw brownie, but I was not disappointed.  It wasn't the same texture as a normal brownie, but it wasn't bad either. The brownie tasted great, it was sweet, but not too sweet, the texture was similar to how coconut would be. I was not disappointed in it at all   Looking forward to my next trip back!

The raw vegan tacos are absolutely amazing. They R made with walnuts and taco seasoning, which was surprisingly delicious. The menu items are diverse, exotic and healthy. The service was also exceptional. But I do think the young girls need to not have too much attitude and just do their jobs. Can't wait to try other food items. This cafe will be the first of my top five vegan friendly restaurants to regularly dine in.

**Vegetarian and Vegan Friendly**  Cute little café with indoor and outdoor seating. They update their menu seasonally! I happen to be in the area and caught the happy hour specials. Happy Hour includes food and drinks.   Happy Hour Portions: Raw Tacos Vivos and Falafel Slider Both items are one serving each, and a great way to taste their menu. The Tacos Vivos has every taco topping you could possibly think of, it was fantastic. And they don't skimp on the guacamole! The falafel slider is served on their house bread, and it was a little dry for me, but the actual falafel was tasty.    Entrée: Curried Sweet Potato Quesadilla This was a seasonal item, and it was far better than I was expecting. The sweet potatoes with the tamarind salsa was a flavorful combination that brought the dish together. They have house hot sauces if you need an extra kick.    This place is very popular for juices and coffees. I didn't get any but I would return for a fresh smoothie. They have a very extensive brunch menu and I would love to come back to try this. Overall, I would recommend this to a friend.   PS: If you sign up to receive text message alerts, you can get a free cowgirl cookie (it was delicious) or an iced tea.

My favorite healthy restaurant! The food here is unbelievably tasty! So much so that you won't even miss the meat! I admire their commitment to local, organic produce and the love that goes into making and serving every healthful meal, dessert or juice/smoothie! I'm a regular here now, and have visited countless times with never a bad experience. My only complaint is that they are becoming so popular, that it is more and more difficult to find seating on the weekends. They are a tad on the expensive side, but until more people start demanding organic food, the price for organics will remain inflated. A cost the business bears and must pass onto the consumer.

I love this place!  Gets very busy during lunch, and the wait for your food is long, but so worth it!  I had a green smoothie which was great, and the raw tacos.  OMG.....sooooo good!  I can't believe something raw could be so good!  I wish it was closer to my house.  There are a dozen more menu items I'm dying to try!

I am not a vegan.  I am not a vegetarian.  But man, oh man, if I could eat here every day I just might be.  I don't care if you go meatless or not, the food here is on point.  It's also great to eat something tantalizing to your taste buds and also not feel like a fatty patty when you leave.  Everything tastes impeccable and wonderfully fresh.  Don't forget to hit up the dessert case before you leave!  I'll be a customer for life.

Oh my. I can't believe I have been living in Awhatukee and didn't give this place a second chance earlier.  When this place first opened, my husband and I were stoked as our whole family is vegan. Unfortunately, back then the portions were tiny (my husband was still hungry when we left), the service slow, and the flavor was not memorable.  Today, after several YEARS (yes, years) we tried it again. Oh. My. Gawd. We ordered two of the raw dishes: the raw tacos and the Arizona roll. The tacos were INCREDIBLE. Spicy, great texture, and filling. The Arizona roll was just as filling and flavorable. I've been on a raw kick for almost a month, and I haven't felt as satisfied with a raw meal as I did today.  We spolied ourselves by getting the raw "snickers" bar and lemon bar. The snickers bar was absolutely heavenly. It was definitely enough for two people to share. The lemon bar was not as great, but had I not already tasted the snickers I probably would have thought it was bliss.  Needless to say, we feel guilty about not having given Pomegranate a second chance earlier. We were missing out. I can't wait to go back for "Raw Fridays" and Sunday brunch!

Yummy yummy yummy! I am not a vegetarian but my daughter is and I LOVED the food! I had the black bean burger with sweet potato fries and veggies with hummus. Crazy good! I also had the iced latte with nonfat milk sweetened with coconut sugar. I will definitely be back though not as often as I would like. A lunch for two as $36 yikes! The atmosphere is very comfortable bright and cheery. It was clean and smelled amazing and the staff is super friendly!
Fresh, local, and amazing. A bit pricey, but I'm willing to pay more for high quality food.

FOOD is awesome!  If you love organic healthy eats, this is the place for you. It is a bit pricey but unfortunately, organic food costs more.   It is a bit of a hike if you are just visiting but well worth the visit.  LOVE this place!

I have now been to Pom Cafe maybe 4-5 times.  There are numerous interesting dishes on the menu, and most of the dishes are heaping with food, so the prices are not that bad.  The veggies are fresh and delicious, and I love the hummus.  I've also ordered some of the rice and tofu and was impressed, although it could have been a bit more spicy.  I've ordered the hummus with bagel that also comes with veggie chips - very filling and tasty.  I need to branch out and order more things the next times I visit.  One of my friends is picky and vegan, and she now frequents this place quite often.  I recently ordered a salad with kale, and whatever the dressing that was on the kale was the most delicious dressing I have tasted in a while!  I have also ordered a veggie wrap with the "cheese" made from nuts (I think).  It was deliciously flavorful and interesting. The flax crackers that came with it weren't really enough, maybe 25 kcal worth. I also have tried their sweet stuff, and the homemade granola bars and cheesecake bites are fresh and tasty.
