The staff members are always friendly and happy to chat for a few minutes when picking up orders or trays.   There are a few things that could make the place even better.  If it's busy, be prepared to wait for a while for the food.  Sometimes the portions are big and then sometimes they are small. I was expecting a deliciously large veggie plate like last time (normal size plate) but instead got a cake-sized plate with maybe 1/2 cup veggies  and hummus.  Also, some items are pre-mixed, and peppers make me rather sick. I have to pick them out or order something else.  Sometimes, or often, things are forgotten in an order, so make sure to check before leaving.   Pomengranate has expanded the menu since my review in August or whenever, and they now have dinner. I noticed on Facebook that they have pet happy hour, which is cool for people who have dogs.
Love love love this place.  Excellent food even for non vegans!  Everything I have tried has been so fresh and full of flavor!
Intricacy, healthfulness and quality of the food couples with relaxed atmosphere and friendly service.  Wow!  Do the right thing and eat here often!

I came here about a month ago because I heard their Cakes were amazing and was pleasantly surprised to find they were even better than expected. HOWEVER, I went back this week with my family to have them see what all the hype was about only to be met with extreme disappointment. The cakes were dry and the frosting was greasy. It's like the whole bakery had gone downhill. Not only that, but our food which we had ordered prior to getting desert took so long to get out to us and was also subpar.   I am so disappointed, especially since I was raving to my family members about how amazing this place was. I'm not sure if there was a change in kitchen staff or what is going on, but I will not be returning, and neither will my family.   Unfortunate.
Have been here 2 times. The food was ok just not my type of food.  The service was slow and the girl who helped my friend and I seemed like she did not want to be at work.

This is my kind of place! A place where you can indulge but not feel bad about what you just ate... You certainly don't have to sacrifice flavor, presentation or quantity, as each menu item offers plenty of each. Had breakfast at PC on a different day and the front counter was VERY SLOW, despite there being no customers ahead of me. Courteous employees to be sure, but slow. TIP: Arrive between 10 - 11 am for a late breakfast or an early lunch. FAVS: The Mediterranean Wrap and The Scones are TDF! Overall, the food is wonderful but the prices are high ($5 for a glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice--where are we, Alaska???) and the service is slow.

Don't go on Sunday's. Overly crowded, staff and kitchen not efficient. Took 40minutes for food to come. Potato Salad had some paper/ plastic. Lady next to us had hair on her meal and had to return.   Usually pretty good but today wasn't their day.

Went here for the first time and really expected more from this place. I had been wanting to try it for a year or so and convinced my guy friend to go in with me. When we came in it wasn't too crowded. We only had to wait a couple minutes for a table which was great, but after we got seated the service was horrible. We got in around 7:30 our waitress greeted us, got us our drinks and food. After that we didn't see her for forever. Everything was so hectic. We had different servers refilling our water checking in on us, everyone seemed to be doing 5 different jobs on top of their own main job which is completely unnecessary (one server to one table doing one job is what should have been happening). When our food came I wasn't too impressed, I got the macaroni pesto dish. The veggies were great but the pasta just lacked flavor. After we finished our food we waited about 15 for our waitress to come back to take our dessert order/ give us boxes. On top of that our desserts took so long to come out. I ordered the Brazilian Brownie which took another 10 minutes to get to me (which easily could have taken 2 minutes to be taken out from the front where the dessert counter is and placed on to a plate and given to me). My friend order a milkshake and that took almost 20 minutes for us to get! When it got to him he asked for it to go since we were already there so long. After waiting about 10 minutes to get the milkshake to go I had to go upfront to ask for it along with the check. My waitress was up there working the register and handed me the melted shake that had been sitting out for some time now. We got the milkshake and the check and got out as quickly as possible. It was literally 5 minutes till close when we left.  The food is extremely overly priced as well, if it was exceptionally well I would understand but it's mediocre. I know the food I all 100% organic, nonGMO, is really Eco- friendly and has quality ingredients, but the pricing is still way too expensive. With two plates and two desserts it would have came to $ 46.00 ( $52.00 with tip) but our waitress took off the milkshake given it was so melted.  The business NEEDS to work on organization. I would suggest having a set group of people working the register (pick up orders, desserts, & making stuff for the people who come into pick up smoothies, drinks ect.) so the servers don't have to do all this stuff as well. I've worked in the restaurant business before so I understand a place being busy and lacking a 5 star service but this place wasn't that busy. They had 3-4 servers covering maybe a total of 8-10 tables. Where I worked 1 server would take on 6 tables at a time and still give the best service you could get. The servers and workers could easily give great service but it's so unorganized and the servers don't seem motivated to get things done.  I won't be coming back anytime soon.

We used to go to the Ahwatukee location regularly until the food went downhill. Today we tried the new location. Couldn't tell you about the food though because, after waiting 25 minutes, we left. There were 3 servers, 12 employees I could see, and only about 15 people in the restaurant so no excuse for the lack of service. It's a shame because my kids and I really used to love Pomegranate. The Ahwatukee location always had service issues but the food used to be worth the wait. Then the food wasn't good either. I had hoped it was because the owners were focused on the new location. But, the new location has all sorts of issues too. Not sure why the owners can't get employees who are attentive and fast. I saw lots of employees standing around and nobody paying attention to the few customers who were there. It's a recipe for disaster.

Sadly, this place has gone downhill fast. This was our favorite vegan restaurant in the valley. We would make the long drive from Scottsdale weekly. After the last three disappointing visits, we won't be back. Today the pancakes were served cold, burnt and tasting like cardboard - twice! We sent them back and they came back just as bad. The cinnamon roll was like a biscuit with frosting, not at all like a cinnamon roll. Last time we went we were served "peppermint mocha" that was coffee with a ton of mint syrup - totally undrinkable. The happy hour has reduced portions and the burgers are not nearly as good as they were. I use to crave the mushroom burger but not any more. Really sad to see this happen. Used to be a fantastic place and now it's awful.

Omg I have become obsessed! 1st meal was delicious so excited to have found a new spot I can eat and not think about how to tailor the menu items! Genius and absolutely thankful for this place when I don't feel like cooking!

This is a neighborhood cafe that many friends have raved about. I finally ate here, and it was horrible. They mixed up our orders, served us sub-par food, and charged us over $45 for 2 salads and 2 ice teas. The worst part was that I got sick from the salad. Do not eat here.
Really good! Cool staff, huge menu, well prepared and thought out.   Really a delight :-)

Loved this place! As I entered the Cafe, my senses didn't know what to do first. The smell of the food was enticing. The greeting by the gentleman was genuinely comfortable. Once seated we got our waters quickly and they were infused with cucumber.  I had the Green Garden Bowl for breakfast.  The food was delicious! If I lived on that side of town, I would be their best customer. I love that things were organic and some were vegan. What an interesting and unique place. Worth the trip!

My favorite! Their coffee, mimosas and root vegetable fries were really good! Being that I was avoiding all dairy while nursing my daughter, it was great peace of mind knowing this place is strictly vegan unless you ask for eggs or otherwise.

I am so glad that Pomegranate has graced Ahwatukee with it's AMAZING vegan and vegetarian fare. Thank you for bringing this type of cuisine to the masses and showing people that GREAT food can be made without using animal ingredients. XOXOXO

Pomegranate is my favorite restaurant; everything is fresh, healthy, and delicious. I love the Rainbow Roll and the Collard Green Wrap the best, but everything I've eaten there has been amazing. I guess it's pricier than other places you can go, but that's because of the quality of what you're eating. For anyone attempting to follow a plant-based, detoxifying diet, this place is a dream! And don't get me started on their phenomenal vegan desserts, which are out of this world. I'm drooling just thinking about their Cheesecake Bites. I love you, Pomegranate!

Tonight was my second visit. We had the tacos vivas and the nachos. Both were fantastic!! For someone who is just learning about the vegan culture and is a diehard meat eater, Pomegranate Cafe has become one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in the Valley!!!

I've been waiting to have a reason to be in the east valley just to try this place. I wanted nothing more than to be able to have an awesome lunch and write a great review. Unfortunately that's not gonna happen. We were sat right away, server came right over, super sweet and friendly, got our drink orders (my husband and I ordered two different iced teas, which they brought out with both flavors mixed in one glass? Typing that makes me laugh)  Ok whatever, no big. We order food and wait. And wait. And wait. ALMOST FORTY FIVE MINUTES FROM ORDER TO TABLE! Then. My order came out wrong. The one thing I was most excited to try, the TLT, wasn't even brought out and I had to ask for it. Oh btw ask me how many times our teas (once put in delegate glasses were refilled in the hour and a half we were there. The answer is zero) Now we're rushing and order a dessert to go, our server took like $3.00 off the $65.00 bill. Um cool thanks.  In the midst of this, I'm watching the manager (I think?) go around checking on other tables, not once did she come by our table during the ridiculous wait or after just to be like hey sorry about that.  The food was good. Didn't love the root veggies. But the sliders were yum and my kiddo loooooved the French toast. But honestly by the time it got there, we were so rushed it's not like I could enjoy it no matter how great it was.

It would have gotten 5 stars if I didn't get a stomach ache from the food! :( other than that the restaurant itself was a very nice atmosphere, felt welcoming and the decor was nice! They also had a little farmers market inside which I thought was very cool!

One of my favorite breakfast spots. The decor is hippy meets farm house, with lots of bright colors. It's very cute and girly! The menu is organic and vegan. But they will add eggs and cheese to some dishes upon request, making them vegetarian. My go to breakfast order is the wild western breakfast tacos, which I order with eggs and cheese (vegetarian but not vegan). Some of their portions are on the smaller size, but the breakfast tacos are actually huge and I never leave hungry when I order them. It's pricy when you consider there is no meat being served, but I figure the organic, locally sourced ingredients cause the higher price point. I have never been here for lunch/dinner; I'm going to need to try it out one of these days!

I'm a total meat lover so even though I own a condo across  the way I have always avoided eating here. My daughter finally convinced me today to try it out and I have to say it was absolutely delicious! Will definitely be making this one of my favorite places!!

I had high hopes for this cafe, but we have been sitting here for 20 minutes waiting for our order. The waitperson finally came and told me that I can't have what I ordered. Now we have to wait another 20 minutes. It's not that busy. Why does does it take forever to get our order?  We have to be somewhere in a half hour. I guess we're going to have to get it to go. Don't come here unless you have all day to waste.

As someone with lots of dietary restrictions (I mostly eat AIP), it's nice to know there is a place that you can safely eat! And the food is great! Service is warm, friendly and prompt. I stopped in for coffee and desert tonight. They use coffee from Peixoto which is one of my favs in Chandler. The only downside here is that it is pricey. But, I'm willing to pay for the quality and catering to all my special diet restrictions. Highly recommend.

OMG, this place is a joke. I used Postmates for the first time and  have wanted to try this place for awhile. I ordered 2 things, the buffalo cauliflower and pom burger. Where should we start. Everything was completely squishy. The fries, burger itself was like baby food, the lettuce,  the tiny thin sliced of tomato. The  bread wasn't though, it was dry and crumbling to bits. The onion was the butt so it was just the hard tiny rings left over. The cauliflower was limp and when I picked it up it just flopped over. There were 3 small cherry tomatoes as garnish and one was even rotten with a big black spot on it! I paid 38$ for this crap? It must have been sitting under a heat lamp for hours or this is just how it is I don't know but Never never again.

Beautiful people, beautiful food! This place is very unique with its menu and everything is delicious!!! Don't go home without dessert, there is always something different and absolutely divine! There's a book share outside to read, or let your kids read while dining! The Happy Hour menu has a wonderful selection (raw tacos and "wings") are a great choice! I always have a hard time picking, as all options are great!
I love Pomegranate!  What can I say, if you are looking for the healthiest dinning experience, go here!

We discovered this place through everyone's Yelp reviews and they were right - this place is simply AMAZING!  I wish I could come here more often but it seems to be our before Ikea stop to fill up before we battle those awful crowds.  Please expand your reach and open a place in north Phoenix so we can enjoy your food more often!

I'm giving it 3-stars because the food is actually really good. One thing I didn't like was the customer service and how everything was run. We went yesterday around noon, so I was expecting it to be busy. Every sit was full except for the bar so we went to sit there and basically was ignored. If, we didn't flag anyone down, I'm pretty sure we weren't ever going to be helped by anyone. When we finally flagged someone down and ordered, we waiting about 20 minutes for the food which wasn't bad timing. I am a little surprised on how expensive it was, hence for another -1 star. For 2 bowls and water, my bill came to about 30 bucks. Yikes. I could've went to Panda that was down the street and have leftovers.   Besides the expensiveness and the bad customer service, the food tasted really good and the portion wasn't too bad (although, for paying 30 bucks for 2 plates, I expected bigger portion of food). Other than that, here have 3 stars on me.

I only had a few minutes to get something for lunch but when I got there it was packed. I got there about after 12 lunch. Even though the wait was long I ordered a strawberry smoothie. The staff were awesome to everyone waiting in line. The smoothie was really good too. Next time I'll have to order one of their avocado sandwiches.

This is my all time favorite place to eat! The food is absolutely delicious with a wide variety of cuisine to choose from.   The staff are friendly, courteous, and very helpful especially in making food recommendations.   My only complaint is that I don't live close enough to eat there more often!! Please come to the East side!!

Update: I had a vegan friend visiting from out of town and found out it's really freakin hard to find a place to eat that isn't just bread, water and salad!! So bless this place for keeping my friendship with my vegan friend together! They have such a creative and extensive menu of vegetarian and vegan options that keeps both meat eaters and non happy and full. The prices are a bit steep for lunch but you pay for what you get: truly organic and fresh ingredients made to order. Service is always stellar and excellent and I'll always be coming back!  ----------  This little cafe serves up some excellent vegan food for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians...but definitely at a price. I've come here on a few occasions, usually for brunch also some lunch here and there. Everything on the menu is vegetarian/vegan so you don't have to look twice if you're vegetarian. Everything I've had has been very flavorful enough to enjoy eating your guilty free, meatless dish. My favorites have been the supreme burrito which hides the vegetarian part of it very well, and the dragon bowl. I think the entrees here are moderately priced about $15 for larger portions, however their acai bowls and juices are incredibly pricey. $13 acai bowls and $10 juice is ridiculous but that's the price you pay for all organic ingredients. Overall they make healthy and vegan food very tolerable if you can also tolerate a little hipster vibe. Love taking my out of town vegetarian friends here for brunch.
I had an issue with the service but Cassie made it right. Most business owners make very little effort to make things right, but Cassie went above and beyond.  That says a lot.

Great service. Great atmosphere. Great music. Great staff. Great food. Our server was Terry and he was awesome! If you happen to get him you will see. On top of everything, quick, and friendly. Try all of their desserts, they are quite exquisite. I had the buffalo cauliflower which had a spicy kick and the ranch dip was amazing. Next, I ordered the Avocado sandwich. The bread was fantastically toasted yet still soft. Make sure you try POM cafe and request Terry as a server. Your day will be a lot better!

Fantastic! I cook plant based at home and was skeptical at first on quality. Most vegan places used processed "meat" substitutes. I was so impressed with how fresh everything was. We went at happy hour. Started with the chickpea slider and buffalo cauliflower slider (the latter had a kick!). I got the mermaid salad and my husband got the burrito with enchilada sauce all over it. We were both impressed and will absolutely be back.

This place makes my top 3 restaurants of all time list. A friend took me here while I was visiting from Texas and OMG it is so amazing. I got the green goddess burger. Talk about mouthwatering delicious!  I desperately wish they had a location in austin Texas whet I live as, this place blows all the vegan options there out if the water by far. Or maybe if they had a cookbook!   The owner even gave us a pomegranate chocolate cake ball and another dessert when we were wit to leave just so we could try them. The pomegranate cake ball was one of the best desserts I've ever had (I'm including all non-vegan desserts in this comparison as well).  Get the kale salad too. It's amazing,  and the dressing they make in-house is sooo tasty!  I'm a little embarrassed to admit it,  but this place is so good,  I went back the next night before my flight flew out and got the same dinner to go. Yes,  It's that good.
Awesome spot, amazingly deep menu!

Had lunch here for the first time and was pleased to know that everything is organic and vegan unless you choose to add dairy or eggs to the meal.   I ordered the Smokey Tempeh B.L. T. (see pics)   First of all the portion was HUGE! Generous helping of Exotic Veggie Chips and a side salad along with a sprinkling of cherries Plus this Amazing Sandwich. I do mean it was AAAMMAZIIIING!!  Seriously, the Tempeh Bacon was practically like tender BBQ Beef Brisket, it was quite a magical moment for my taste buds.   My salad came with a side of Living Caesar dressing, which is all raw vegan ingredients, it was a little spicy for my taste so I asked for the Pomegranate vinaigrette, YUM! Sweet, Tangy and a little zing from some fresh mint it was much more to my liking.   I'm just ecstatic that there is something so Veganly Delicious ( it's my review so I will make up words if I want to)) so close to home.   4 stars for now, until I try more items, but that sandwich was so 5 stars!

All about the biscuits, and gravy here.  And the POM truffle.  Tried the Quiche, and personally it was bland, and I didn't enjoy the aftertaste of what seemed to be cashew.  I am not a fan of cashews or cashew based sauces, which may be part of the reason I didn't enjoy the quiche.  But the biscuits and gravy are so good I will be back again and again.

Love the biscuits, and gravy here.   The dish comes with a veggie hash that has seasonal vegetables.  It is hearty.  Recently, I tried the quiche, and wasn't a huge fan.  It was lacking any flavor to me.    But, i'll keep trying new menu items.  Cant like everything all the time, right?  This is a great Vegan friendly brunch spot!  My favorite dessert here is the POM truffle.  It is a decadent chocolate treat.
First off, the food is amazing. Been coming for quite some time. I was bothered by an employee who treated a non-Caucasian woman and her children like second class humans. Won't be back.

This is one of my favorite little places to eat! Everything I've tried has been amazing and the food portions are pretty big.     The only downside is the price. A smoothie starts at $9. It makes eating here (for me) a rare treat.      I love that local produce and fresh ingredients are used.     My weakness is their raw desserts! You must try the raw cheesecake or tiramisu. My go-to for an entrée is their Elephant Curry Bowl with tofu.
This is the new location. Boy, I appreciate having it in Central Phoenix. The food is pricier than other vegan joints but it's very, very, very fresh and that's worth it.

Having food allergies I love that I am not limited on what I can and cannot enjoy here.  I love everything I have tried from nachos, tacos, buffalo cauliflower with yummy vegan ranch to their awsome breakfasts and gluten free desserts. Staff is always super nice, and Happy to answer any questions. I prefer visiting for their breakfasts, always start the day feeling great.

This place transformed our life!  We are vegetarian, but wanted to give the raw thing a try.  I was very impressed with the creative, delicious meals and desserts!  My kids were even impressed.  The dishes are a little pricey, but I am willing to pay because I know that a lot of effort, time and quality ingredients go into making this type of food.  I love the food, the atmosphere and the nice people that work there.  I will always try to work in a visit here when I come to Phoenix!

Ok, service aside the food is great. I had the chai latte and soup (clamless chowder) & half salad (mermaid). Server was super knowledgeable about the menu and the vibe here is good. Prices might come off a tiny bit high but its super clean eating and I had so much food/bev that I couldn't finish.   It might be because I was eating a "quick bite" alone but service was nonexistent. I sat a long time waiting to order, to get my order, and to pay (no extra stops made by anyone... In fact the hostess saw my card out and closed my check). I was here for about an hour (not so quick) plus the "5min" wait that was more like 10-15. Again no big deal but something to keep in mind. Oh and its not that busy. There's a steady flow of people.   Overall I liked this place, could probably get my bf to try it, but I wish the service matched the ambience and the food.
Such a cute little cafe! Wonderful for my friend who eats paleo! I got the egg scramble with seasonal veggies and it was incredible! Definitely coming back again soon!

I had a great time at pomegranate cafe yesterday. The prices are high but it is worth it for what you are getting. Everything is vegan unless you specify you want dairy cheese or eggs on something. Yesterday I found out they even have cocktails! Two of us got the screwdriver with tangerine sorbet and it was so tasty! It was honestly the perfect summer treat. Another friend got the lavender sour and that was great too! As far as food goes, we all split the vegan spinach artichoke dip. I was skeptical because I like my spinach artichoke dip and I LOVE cheese. it was SO creamy and delicious! It tasted like the real thing and I was honestly blown away. It came with corn chips and this AMAZING bread that I haven't had there before. It was literally so. good. I have tried their Arizona roll a million times and it is a delicious alternative to sushi. I used to get the cauliflower buffalo quesadilla and I was sad to see they took it off the menu, our wonderful server said they could make me one anyway! Overall we had a great time with delicious food. The price is the only thing I wish I could change. I understand because it is all organic, local and vegan though. With 2 drinks each, one meal and splitting the appetizer 3 ways it was about $44 each. Regardless I will be back soon!

The food prepared by Marlene and Cassie of Pomegranate Cafe is FANTASTIC. I had the opportunity to attend a retreat that they came to be the chefs for. Everything they set out -- breakfast, lunch, and dinner -- tasted fresh and delicious. From the handmade granola accompanied with fresh-cut fruit, to the vegetarian spring rolls + peanut sauce, to the veggie burgers, to the apple + berry crisp, to the veggie penne + pesto. I know this is not a review about the cafe itself, but I am here to say that anything produced by these two ladies will nourish you, mind and body. If I ever get the chance to come out to the Phoenix, AZ area, Pomegranate Cafe will be on my itinerary for sure.

Yummy, healthy, nutritious! I've been coming here for several months for my fix of coffee, smoothie, and green goddess burger naked style. Their sauces are so delicious. I cannot imagine how they make them without dairy! Very friendly service too.

First time here with my family,we waited 45 minutes for our meal and it wasn't even that super busy. When the food arrived it looked like they just threw it on the plates without care;plated horribly,the hash from the Pom Plater were still raw,the coco whip was so watering it looked like a puddle of water and my daughter never got hers ,after the waitress told us she'll be back with it. My wife sandwich was cold,it was a Avocado Sandwich, the bread hard as a rock with 4 mini slices of green apple and a dirty plate,like no care to show pride on plating food. They told us ,after complaining,that we had a free dessert for the long wait and of course it never came. Super expensive and so not worth it. 2hrs of my life I'll never get back
Super friendly staff. I got the Strawberry French toast I think. Delicious. They have lots of GF and Vegan friendly things too! Its right beside Trader Joes.

REALLY expensive but honest food. I really have to budget in order to eat here, but often times just their drinks are good enough. I will say that although they are delicious the food left me in a funk that had me running to the bathroom (I walked there mind you). Either the wrap wasn't gluten free, or I just needed a major cleanse.

I must not be healthy or hip enough to appreciate this cuisine. I've gone with friends a few times (the last couple under protest). Smoothies are good (who can't make a decent smoothie?) but the food is bland and unsatisfying to my taste. I also believe it's seriously over-priced. The last time I was there my friend had a smoothie and I had a "bagel sandwich" (tasted like plywood) with a side salad and water. With tip it was $38. Seriously? Did I mention that you can take home a loaf of GF bread for $17? The servers are nice and the atmosphere is pleasant but I'm clearly not the client they are seeking. There are many places to get a healthy meal without sacrificing taste and going into debt.

I'm not vegan but the food was actually amazingly good. The reason this review is 2 stars is because... I saw 2 cockroaches climbing the walls. I haven't been back since. Such a shame because I have some vegan friends who love this place but I just can't bring myself to go back there. Ugh.

Great place for vegans! So many options, though a bit pricey, are very filling and delicious! We got the biscuits and gravy, and the chilaquiles, both with tofu and some leftovers for later. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the service wasn't the best...we weren't checked on - so we didn't get water refills (sitting outside in Arizona), we didn't order drinks or desserts because by the time he came back, we didn't feel like waiting any longer. I watched the two tables next to us get waited on hand and foot by their server! She was coming back and forth so much! We spent an hour there and i can confidently say 20 minutes of that at the least, was sitting and waiting for our waiter to come back and let us box up our food and leave. Some more water would've been nice too. Oh and the smoothie and juice we wanted but didn't get because it would've been another 20 minutes waiting for our server, who's name was Danny.
This place is amazing. I love (mostly) vegan places. The default is vegan and you have to request to substitute for vegetarian items. Absolutely delicious food and drinks, friendly staff, cool patio.

Pomegranate cafe is amazing for people with allergies! They are extra careful, especially if you mention specific allergies. There is nothing on the menu that I have tried and didn't like -- each dish is creative and unique, but packed with flavor. Staff is polite and the owner is a total sweetheart. I've been going here for over 3 years now and won't stop any time soon. My only critique is that service can sometimes take a while, so just set aside some time for a leisurely meal and you'll be fine.
This is just a great restaurant - great staff, and the food is fantastic. Go there, you will have a great experience. Try the daily special, it is always good.

Service seems to be lacking pretty frequently at the  Ahwatukee location. It takes a long time to even get water and I have seen servers sitting by the computers playing on their phones while I wait to get the check. Food wise, I've had some really great things and some really bad things here. My friend got their "sushi" roll, which was surprisingly delicious. I also enjoyed their raw everything bagel, rocky road bar, and raw brownie. Some of the other desserts, however, were inedible. The chocolate peanut butter cupcake was so dry, I couldn't get a piece to stay on the fork. My husband had a blueberry "cheese"cake that had an off putting color and flavor. Neither of us took more than one bite. I do love their POM house milk, however. It went very well with their local coffee. I also would like to see them drop eggs and cheese off their menu. They really brand themselves as being vegan, I wish they would take the leap and get cruelty off their menu when they are already so close!

I love pomegranate seeds so why would Pomegranate Cafe be any different?   This little mix matched spot is adorable, it's what my Pinterest boards dream to look like. Wooden tables, chairs with fresh words on them, mason jars EVERYWHERE and all fresh ingredients to boot.     I've had a sun warrior smoothie and the Raw! Tacos which were to die for. The walnut meat was spicy and delicious wrapped up in cabbage leaves. I'm hooked on their food pairings and the vibe they give off.   P. S. Their dessert selection is to die for. Lemon bars? Gluten free goodness.

This place is amazing!! Unapologetically plant based, you can get everything vegan and most things gluten free. They are also super aware of allergies and make sure to inform you of all possible sources of cross contamination. But the food here is amazing! I have never been disappointed with a trip to Pom. The meals are pricey but worth it for their flavor and portions. Just the other day I stopped by for breakfast and was treated to a lovely seasonal chai latte and smoothie bowl. Yum!!

This place is for vegetarian and anyone who want to eat healthy. I am the meat lover and I really think they do not make the food tasty. My wife loves it but I dont. But I go there often since I feel healthier whenever I eat their food. Their healthy juice is very healthy taste. The major downside is not the taste, it takes forever to make its food. This is casue they make it so fresh and healthy. If u r looking for delicious food, do not go here. But if u want healthy  food, this is the best place in town.

From the food to the atmosphere to the people who work here, every moment I have spent at Pomegranate has been Bliss. I wish they would open a location where I live, in Los Angeles. Last time I went I had the Bbq jackfruit Mac n Cheese, which is the best mac and cheese (vegan and wheat free) that I have ever had because not only is it delicious but it is a hearty portion size (unlike a lot of vegan places, Suncafe Organic, Rasa, I'm looking at you.) I also had a 'milk'shake that had caramel and jnantik (a mayan superfood that tastes like coffee) topped with cocowhip and that was a massive treat. (In LA we pride ourselves on being on the cutting edge and I don't know of anyplace here currently offering jnantik.) I took home a bunch of sweets and my favorite was the chocolate cake, though they were all great and I'm confident you cannot go wrong. I've been craving their fare since and look forward to the next time I visit my cousin in Tempe so I can come again. Can you ladies publish a cookbook please? Thanks in advance.

I doubt that I could add anything that everyone else hasn't already said.  The food is PHENOMENAL and the staff is kind and knowledgeable.  This place is run by people who have integrity and who truly care about the community.  It shows in the food and in the service.  Healthy, fun eating doesn't get much better than this.  I eat here almost every week.

This is my favorite new spot for vegan eats! Pomegranate cafe blew me away with their house made gluten free bread via their avocado toast! So many healthy options, that I cannot wait to be back. 5 out of 5!
I've been here a few times. The food never disappoints, but the service is absolute crap.
Best local produce food in town. Loved the avacado sandwich and the pomegranate pancake. Loved the feel of the cafe. Added to my favorites list.

Pomegranite Cafe is such an offering of love to our community  Everything is well thought out and offered with such care.  Pomegranite Cafe cares about our well being and for the planet   You could not possibly go wrong choosing anything from their menu In the winter I love the soups  Vegan chicken noodle with mock chicken Lentil soup The French toast and pancakes are unprecedented   I always feel good after I eat here  Great wholesome food Heavenly deserts

We must be cursed with this restaurant. The food is amazing but the kitchen has no idea what the hell they are doing.   My family has been sitting here for almost two hours and we STILL don't have our food. The last time we tried to eat here they lost our order and t took over two hours to get our food.   Do NOT come here during any time where it's busy as you will literally be waiting for hours.   I wouldn't be so annoyed if we didn't order before every single table around us but they all are eating. But not us.   We just can't waste our time ever coming here agin unfortunately.

I absolutely love Pomegranate Cafe. I'm so excited that they are open for dinner now. Perfect for a healthy Happy Hour. This place IS pricey, especially the juices, but they taste awesome. The owner is so sweet and they put so much thought into doing eating clean the RIGHT way! I am gluten, dairy and soy free and it so so cool to be able to have dessert! If I could afford it, I would go there everyday. Skip the crappy food at happy hour and come here instead, your body will thank you!

Amazing happy hour menu including miniature sliders that are delicious. I had the mushroom burger "cheeseburger " and the Tacos  Vevo's raw and they're all delicious this is the best vegan place around!

I'm not vegetarian, or vegan, but I was charmed by this restaurant.  My omelet was delicious and I loved the lemon ice water pitchers. My vegan friends who were with me loved the place and go there often. I would go there again.

I am neither vegetarian nor vegan and my bf is a meat lover. We ate there today for brunch and the food was delicious, fresh, and the service was fast. I had the 'crab' eggs Benedict and my bf had the sunrise breakfast wrap. Both were so amazing and the portions were huge. We brought half of it home and I'm excited to be enjoying it again tomorrow. We also tried two desserts, the lemon bar and the rocky road bar. Omg heaven in our mouths!!!! Daniella and Justine were accommodating and genuinely friendly. We will definitely be coming back and I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys a well prepared, fresh and tasty meal.

Pretty good. I've been wanting to try this place but it's too far. So yesterday since I was in the area, I stopped by. I ordered their burger of the day, mushroom quinoa, and it came with root potato fries and a strawberry salad. The burger was great, I didn't care for the fries, and the salad was delicious but it only had lettuce and strawberries, the description said it also included avocado and candied pecans but mine didn't. I didn't notice until I finished. A bit pricier than I'd like for lunch but for fresh, local, vegetarian food I understand. I'd go back if I was nearby to try more items and sample their dessert.

One of my FAVE local places. Let me be clear that I'm a carnivore and I cannot imagine a life without meat. But this place rocks. Their food is so creative and flavorful that you won't miss the meat! I love heir breakfasts, but their other foods are great too!! My husband and I come here for breakfast as much as possible and he loves their smoothies!! Their baked goods rock too!!
Great food options and amazing concept. But why does everyone insist on using crappy oils?

This is my new favorite restaurant. What an incredible menu and such a kind place to eat. Options for veg/an and human kind in general. We are all gentler souls for having visited this brilliant establishment. Kudos to mother and daughter dream team. SO worth the drive to Ahwatukee.

Was so excited to find this on Yelp and was even more excited when I got to the restaurant for dinner and found so many delicious looking options. After entirely too long, I decided to try the green goddess burger on gluten free bread with the root vegetable fries. Holy smokes! Best vegan sandwich that I've ever had! The fries were served with a homemade BBQ sauce which we bought a jar of.  We naturally tried some sweets after we ate. The cowgirl cookies were wonderful! The rocky road bar was a little too rich for my taste buds but my boyfriend devoured it.  Can't wait to go back and try some of the other entrees!

I mean, it's probably the best $15 quesadilla you'll get in town.  If that's not your thing you can probably score a $14 salad.  But if you're really feeling froggy, try the $13 half soup and terrible sandwich!

This place is fabulous!  We shared several dishes and all were delicious.  The employees are helpful, friendly & lovely too!  We were told the Owner tries to buy everything local, all is organic and fresh.We shared a  raw almond joy like bar for dessert & it was to die for!   Pomegranate iced tea was yummy too. So happy Ahwatukee has this wonderful, healthy delicious place to eat!  Ask for the punch card to get free drinks after purchasing a certain amount.
Breakfast, lunch it's always so good and refreshing! The Rodrigo Rocket Fuel Smoothie is one of Amy favorites!

I like the food, but the prices are very high.  Every meal comes with a HEALTHY dose of capitalism.  I just bought a 16oz smoothie.  Rocket fuel + Spirulina.  It was $17.20 with a $2 dollar tip.  Yikes...too much for me but they appear to be busy.

I am so happy to see a second location open! As other reviewers have noted, they're learning. They've messed up a couple take out orders (left off walnut meat on a bowl, made wrong salad), but they've caught mistakes and their customer service is excellent. Always check your orders before you leave! Definitely a new favorite spot for our family.  The menu here is smaller than the Ahwatukee location, but the quality of the food is great, the presentation is colorful and beautiful, and overall the food is just fantastic when compared to other restaurants (veg or not). We always order way more than we can eat.   They also have some of the best vegan desserts in the valley.

Chili, "sushi" rolls, pizza, kale salad, raw chocolate coconut bar.  All beautiful, creative, and yummy. Everything we have tried is good. This is one of our favorite weekend spots. It would be a favorite weekday spot too if it were closer. We love having so many vegan options on the menu.
Fantastic menu and great flavors. We had the salads, burgers, and nori rolls, and deserts. Everything was great and will be back for more!

Tried the coconut caramel hot coffee which was delicious.  BUT, this review is for the desserts which is the only reason I went.  We had a chocolate-strawberry cinnamon roll that was really hard and flavorless, the brownie was also really hard and strong-like dark chocolate.  The cheesecake was decent but still flavorless, although it reminded of ice cream almost.  Totally a waste of $26 for the 4 items we purchased.  I should've spent that much on gas to travel to a different bakery (say, the one in PHX......).  So disappointed.  Maybe I should've gone for the food instead of the desserts and I might have had a different outcome, but at this point, I'm not going out of my way to try this place again.

Great place for vegan food... Nice exotic flavors. We ordered quinoa with soy meat and scrambled goodness :) very pricey for the quantity so a table for two with drinks will not be less than $45... Their exotic drinks are $6 -$12 ... Definite try for once but not sure if I can keep going there :)

I was delightfully surprised with the Pomegranate Cafe.  I thought this was another coffee house, juice bar, but its so much more.  Organic, macrobiotic, gluten free vegetarian/vegan cuisine that tasted amazing.  I would have given it five stars for the Arizona Rolls alone, but my husband's chickenless caesar was just okay.  They are a tad expensive for a cafe lunch, but I will definitely return to try these tasty and healthy morsels.

The food is good, but if you're looking for a good dining experience, head elsewhere, at least for now.  I keep being excited about having Pomegranate Cafe in our neighborhood, but I certainly hope that in a few months they have things ironed out, the soft opening doesn't seem to have alleviated the glitches.  We came in and ordered hummus to start. Later, we ordered our entrees. We knew the food takes quite a bit to come out, but after enquiring about the hummus about 20 minutes later, we were told that "it'll be out right away, they are just finishing making a new batch". And then nothing happened. Eventually the manager came out with some soup (which we didn't order or were asked if we actually wanted to eat, which we didn't), and about 30 seconds later our food came out. We had Elephant Bowls, which are great. Keep in mind though that the sustainable silverware does not have points on the forks, so you have to shovel your food rather than pick it up and the knives don't actually cut anything, which is trouble for any sort of broccoli pieces larger than your mouth. Eventually we asked for the check, and looky here, the hummus was on it. The excuse "Sorry, I don't know the computer system yet". Really? If that were the case, the better option would have been to ask your manager rather than make us pay for it. Just be honest and say you forgot. In case you're curious, the hummus DID come out, after we had paid and were stuffed.  In short, great food, if it ever comes, don't expect good communication, bring your own silverware.

I'll start by saying that my family isn't raw vegan, nor do we go out of our way to always eat vegan. However, we have sensitivities to dairy and gluten so restaurants like Pomegranate Cafe appeal to us because we always leave feeling great and never wake up the next day feeling sluggish or with a tummy ache. That being said, we have tried many vegan and vegetarian restaurants and Pomegranate Cafe offered a lot of unique and delicious options that we had never encountered!  Here's what we thought of everything we ordered! --Buffalo Chicken Wrap (with cauliflower option): VERY spicy but had good flavor! Definitely not even remotely similar to the tradition buffalo flavor so I was a bit disappointed, but overall it was filling and satisfying! I ordered the salad on the side and LOVED the sunflower ranch dressing. I wish i could have that on every salad!! --Lumberjack biscuits & gravy: The gravy was great for having no dairy in it, but the biscuits were a bit dry. Hash on the side seemed to have the same extremely spicy seasoning as the buffalo chicken wrap, but was still yummy! Farm scrambled eggs weren't really seasoned or fluffy. --Pancakes: Delicious! It's amazing that they're gluten free because they were so fluffy and had a completely normal pancake texture, whereas many gluten free pancakes are heavy and dense. We were so impressed! --Magic Dragon Bowl: Super yummy smoothie bowl, a bit heavy on the banana in my opinion, which masked most of the other flavors, but that's just nit-picking. Overall it was a delicious bowl!   Service could have been better (-1 Star). It took a while for us to be acknowledged after being seated and the server only came to refill our waters once or twice. But our server was friendly and upbeat when he did come to the table which is a huge plus! The prices are also fairly high compared to many other "health-food" restaurants, but we appreciate that they source their food from completely non-GMO and almost entirely (98%) organic farms and vendors so that wasn't as much a problem for us. We're willing to pay for that peace of mind.  We also tried a few desserts! The cookie dough brownie was great but SUPER rich! I could only tolerate a few bites, but it was so good! The cupcake we tried was a bit dry and crumbly, I probably wouldn't buy that again. The strawberry rosemary scone was incredible! It pairs perfectly with tea, it's a must-try!

I really wanted to like this place.  Read great reviews, and headed down for breakfast.  Nice location next to Trader Joes.  Noticed the menu only had 4 options for breakfast, and as I am a picky eater, only 1 appealed to me.  Guess the menu changes every week depending on what is fresh.  I ordered pankcakes, my fiance ordered breakfast tacos, we both got cappuccinos.  Sat at a rickety table next to dirty veggies in a loud deli case, and drank our espresso drinks, noticing they were HORRIBLE.  Tasted burnt.  Then the food was ready.  OOPS.  Only the tacos were ready, and I had to wait ofr pankcakes.  after a few minutes, I got my pancakes.  My fiance said his tacos were only ok, nothing special.  The pancakes were served with thawed frozen blueberries, odd for such a "fresh" oriented place, as well as COLD syrup.  No butter or even the OPTION of asking for butter.  They tasted like cardboard, no flavor at all.  Terrible.  After choking down 1 pancake, finishing my burnt cappuccino, we bussed our own table, not a problem, except the garbage was overflowing, and no one helped us.  We balanced our trash on the pile, and left.  We will not go back.

NOT JUST FOR VEGANS!!!!  This place is always consistently delicious. On this trip I went solo and picked up the tacos.  Great accompaniment of some sort of "special sauce" and a faux chicken that tasted like real chicken lol.    I also enjoyed a bottle of Kombucha from the price stock.   Very good and didn't have a strong after taste others have left for me.    What I really enjoy with this restaurant is the group of amazing staff.  They are high energy people who while being extremely friendly, are very efficient.   Thank you for another great experience!

Love love love this place. I've been a Pom - goer for over 4 years starting at the other Ahwatukee location. I can't rave enough about the food. Being a vegan, it's utter heaven. And being mindful of consuming organic & local foods, it's double heaven! Love that this place considers things like sourcing sustainable bamboo silverware, has a super great RO & remineralizing water filtration system that's served for drinking water and is used for food preparation, and pays to have their food scraps composted. As if all this isn't enough, their deserts are bliss. Brownies, truffles, cakes, cupcakes and cheesecake.. to name a few. All vegan & mostly gluten free. Made with coconuts and nuts and dates and other real food ingredients. Yes please!!  Do yourself a favor and check this place out. It's a great addition to the area and you'll be happy you paid a visit :)
LOVE this place, the atmosphere, the breakfast food & especially the coffee.  We moved from Ahwatukee to Tempe but still try to make it over to Pomegranate as much as we can.
This is our favorite vegan restaurants in the greater Phoenix area. Cassie and her team take great care of their guests Serving up tasty food healthy food in the friendly environment

I'm not a vegan or vegetarian but I love my veggies and people who are creative enough to be vegan/vegetarian. My friend and I had a reservation for lunch. Right on time our table was ready, our wait staff was knowledgeable and friendly, and we got great service given how packed it was around lunch. My only complaint was being forced to pick just one dish! Everything looked and tasted wonderful. I had a beet burger (a first for me and I LOVE beets). Most beets can be VERY earthy but this was a beautiful and delicious mix of herbs and spices. They served it with a great aioli sauce, a kale salad and sweet potato fries. My friend had the walnut meat salad which was HUGE but she said it tasted great. We had the Hibiscus Cooler and Green Apple Lime Refresh. It was a bit pricy but no more so than a good sushi lunch. The portions were very generous. The atmosphere was great, lots of couples, families, young and old, and all very down to earth. They also had an extensive GF, GFO, and RAW (basically uncooked)  selection. At some point I'm going back for the RAW! Arizona Roll (vegan sushi) and Abundance juice soon.

Absolutely stunning place! The best raw rolls ever!  Delicious, well-priced, but worths it 100%. Cafe is pretty big and spacious.  The variety is generous. Although I wish they could be STRICTLY vegan place as I have heard a conversation that they can make You a non-vegan replacement if You don't like  tofu for instance.  Also, they have a dog-friendly patio, which I personally don't support, because food and pet bacteria is not a good mixture.

I came in hoping to order some food over lunch and make it back to work in time. However, it took over an hour to get my food. We were never updated by the waitress on why it was so slow and when our food would be coming out, we just played a very long waiting game.   The staff was nice and overall I'd say the food was average.

100000 STARS FOR VEGANS AND THOSE WITH DIETARY RESTRICTIONS!  Seriously though, I recently went dairy-free and it's hard to find options at restaurants when eating out. Pomegranate Cafe has an extremely vegan-friendly menu, and lots of modification options.  Best of all it's super delicious!!! Highly recommend going for brunch, and don't leave without stopping at the bakery case or grabbing a Cowgirl Cookie!  Pictured: Breakfast Burrito & Green Goddess "Burger"

I have stopped in a couple times to try their coffee and juices. Pretty unique place with a hipster meets vegan vibe. I like it. Service is very nice.  Tried their coffe since it was peixoto beans and was not to fond of their lattes as it is hard to hold a candle to the original coffee shop. The hibiscus cooler is solid! Great and refreshing . The magic coffee is very different for a latte not really my favorite . Just noticed they serve nitro coffee and will have to try next.

Place is ok. My girlfriend gets really jacked on going here and the food is always great. The service has been lacking each time we go. We usually sit for a while before anyone even brings us water, then the wait to order is forever.

I haven't been back since my last review, and I'm so pleasantly surprised. Everything looks beautiful inside and the workers are vibrant and friendly. I'm so excited and happy for them that they are expanding and I can't wait to visit again and see their growth. It truly shows how much the owners care, that they take constructive criticism and turn it around into a positive. Thanks for being my favorite Tukee spot!

The rainbow salad is so delicious. They lightly toss the greens in a subtle dressing and top it with spiralized beets and carrots, cauliflower and  avocado among other veggies and seeds...paired with some sort of creamy nut based dressing that's so good.   The nachos are delicious as well.   Tons of gluten free options for both dinner and dessert. Service is nice but sometimes the sense of urgency is lacking. Oh well! The food is what matters

The rainbow salad is so delicious. They lightly toss the greens in a subtle dressing and top it with spiralized beets and carrots, cauliflower and  avocado among other veggies and seeds...paired with some sort of creamy nut based dressing that's so good.   The nachos are delicious as well.   Tons of gluten free options for both dinner and dessert. Service is nice but sometimes the sense of urgency is lacking. Oh well! The food is what matters
Lovely! Rates are on the higher side but the dishes are unique and never eaten before... moreover its all vegan..I liked the grand chilli burrito!

Well if you're into that super healthy eating this is t he place for you! If you're into meats with flavor this not the place for you but all in all the atmosphere is niice and the mood is chill definitely not a place for me!

Short form: ordered our food (15 minutes elapse) we get our iced teas (15 minutes elapse) the tables next to us that had ordered and were seated before we got there get SOME of their food, one sends soup back because it's cold.   (15 minutes elapse) 45 minutes into this disaster, I ask for a refund and we leave   Menu didn't look that appetizing, service was awful, and apparently what they served was poorly executed.  That's enough to keep me from ever going back.  (I should have written a review that takes 45 minutes to read, yet you get nothing from it.... kind of like going to Pomegranate)
It was surprisingly good Vegan food. I had breakfast there and the cinnamon french toast was AMAZING!!!

This place is every vegan and vegetarians dream! I visited on Tuesday around lunch time and I came right before the lunch rush where people had to wait for tables and for the kitchen to catch up with tickets. They did only have 2 waiters which was a bummer but if we needed anything the front cashier would ring it up and put it on our tab. She was very friendly and it helped sitting in front of the dessert display distracting us in how delicious everything looked. Outer waiter was a gentlemen and even though he was swamped that Tuesday he was very friendly and polite. I did wait a more than I'm use to on my lunch, but..... come on this ain't no Chili's where things are frozen ahead and deep fried in minutes.

I came with a friend who loved this place  for her birthday dinner and I must say, I loved it too! This was my first time trying vegan food and I was really nervous to try since the prices are kinda high. However I loved the food and the proportions were really big! And I was extremely impressed at the desserts. I wish I could've had them all! My only complain would be our waiter who barely checked up on us and had a bad attitude. But the rest of the staff seemed really nice. I can't wait to come again with my family!

Best raw vegan food in the valley.  They are not exclusively raw, but do have a half dozen or so raw dishes on the menu daily and do a raw special on Fridays.  The quality of the food is excellent.  I have eaten here several dozen times and never had anything that wasn't good.
Best raw vegan cheesecake..ever!  The daily soup and sand was the bomb!  A must try, vegan or not, when in the area!  Highly recommend for all my macro friends!

I finally tried this place after hearing a lot of good things about it, and....it was just okay.  I was happy to see a real, varied organic and vegetarian menu.  The food was good, and fresh, but not worth the price, especially considering you have to go up to the counter and order, and don't receive any real sit-down service.

I absolutely love the food here and have been going to the original location for years. The service has always been incredibly sweet and kind but what really bums me out every time I've come to this location beverages take about 10-15 minutes food takes about 30-45... I saw my cappuccino sit on the counter for a good 10minutes before it was brought to me there were 3 people behind that counter the whole time....And it's not the servers fault when is taking on so many tables I legit wanted to ask if he needed help. I think they just need to bring on more staff or make the staff they have on pick up on guest cues.... and where is the manager to help out???

Local, Fresh, Organic, Vegan, Raw. Healthy indulgence at its finest.   Finally . . . A little slice of Unprocessed Heaven in Ahwatukee!   My favorite? The Sizzlin' Sesame Salad! Mixed greens, vibrant purple cabbage, tofu, brown rice, broccoli and carrot, topped off with chili almonds and orange miso dressing. Very unique.   Southwestern Mac and Cheese and the Bountiful Bowls were great too, just a little heavy for a work day.   Raw Almond Joy bars are delicious; even better than the original. OMG!!!!! So good.     Adorable décor! Nice remodel and expansion.     Staff is always super friendly, and the owner(s) will come around and chat with you personally which is always nice to see.   Just don't be a jackass and bring in food from Los Dos Molinos (or anywhere else)!   Don't let the vegan / vegetarian labels scare you - there's something for everyone at Pomegranate!

10/06/12  Thank you Pomegranate Cafe, Russell, and all of PC's other staff members for helping me forget, for an hour or so, that I was feeling very much under-the-weather.  l was feeling elated about my upcoming delights, I totally forgot how awful I must have looked wearing yoga pants, a Life is Good tee, a hooded zip pullover, and glasses.  What a bum!  Surprisingly, business was bustling this morning-- I've never seen PC full of people, and get this, there was a LINE waiting to order!  Because most of the tables were taken indoors, it was very noisy, so I took this chance to hide my I'm-sick-as-a-dog bum from the beautiful people and eat OUTDOORS.  But first, I had to place my order.  Since I'd already perused the menu online, I knew I was going to have the French toast, no powdered sugar, please, like I usually do, but I wanted to try something new.  The basic breakfast (egg, toast, jam, and fruit) enticed, but I quickly drew towards Kamut toast, almond butter, jam, and fruit.  I also thought I'd either try a smoothie or an elixir ($8 each), but the menu online stated to ask for an elixir menu for options.  There was only one, and it was a "female hormonal concoction" with something, I lost track, since I didn't need help with my hormones, thank you very much.  ("Not that there's anything wrong with that.")  $8 saved.  The smoothie I wanted to try contained pomegranate juice, which I correctly suspected had one or more unwanted ingredients, and for me, that was "grape seed oil extract."  (So glad I spotted those juice bottles in front of the cash register.)  Good- I was able to hang onto $8 of my money.  Last, but not least, I ordered a cappucino (Cartel Coffee) and a glass of water without cucumber.  I again reiterated that I did not want powdered sugar on the French toast, which I was told would take twenty or twenty-five minutes to be ready, since they'd run out of the bread and the next batch was in the oven.  I said it was worth waiting for, so I don't mind, and besides, I'll have the kamut toast and almond butter.  As I paid for my three items, I was told that my food will be out in about 30 minutes, which took me by surprise, but I was in no mood to make a fuss, especially when I needed to secure an empty table before someone else snatched it!  I found one outdoors, but it needed bussing.  No problem, as I found a shy and cute associate to help me.  One thing I really like about frequenting vegan/vegetarian/gluten-free venues, is how most, if not all, of the staff members are so humble, and are good-natured.  Another thing is that these venues tend to look so hippy-chic, colorful, eclectic, and FUN!  I loved the different swaths of colorful curtains, brightly-painted tables and chairs, whimsical dinnerware, and that was indoors!  Outside, I found a mosaic two-top with mismatched chairs- I sat on the one without the morsel of food on its seat.  The food didn't take quite as long as 30 minutes.  The cappucino http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6orXv_VB7xz-MpqHzSQ?select=b5c0q6siFAHnRWC5FU3TYw#b5c0q6siFAHnRWC5FU3TYw took a few minutes to arrive, and so did the lovely-tasting city water, nicely contained in a lidless canning jar.  (There's a reason cucumber slices are used to "flavor" the water, folks!)  It was about ten minutes after I started sipping my coffee that the Banana bread French toast arrived http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6orXv_VB7xz-MpqHzSQ?select=ZPZ8wSo4IPOrtAmFWejCcw#ZPZ8wSo4IPOrtAmFWejCcw, but it was sprinkled with powdered sugar!  However, Russell did not hesitate in taking it back and bringing another.  What terrific service!  The Kamut toast, almond butter, jam, and fruit plate stayed, however, so I was happy. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6orXv_VB7xz-MpqHzSQ?select=s3KbSXITa6YEFvYgGYv91g#s3KbSXITa6YEFvYgGYv91g  Still happy, even when I found out that the almond butter was the raw variety-- I don't particularly like its flavor, or lack thereof, and I only buy and enjoy the roasted kind.  It's a good thing I am not allergic to chia (still experimenting), sesame, and sunflower seeds, for while the menu did not mention these were included, one certainly could not avoid their presence on this dish!  It's also a good thing they were, since they gave the bland-tasting almond butter much-needed flavor.  The fun textures on this dish also gave my mouth something to be happy about!  The Banana bread French toast arrived about 5 minutes later, and what a marvel that was! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6orXv_VB7xz-MpqHzSQ?select=vfafsHCzso2InWi-kcDWBg#vfafsHCzso2InWi-kcDWBg  The French toast had the PERFECT crunch on the outside, a gorgeous pound-cake-meets-angel-cake consistency on the inside, and a wonderful roasted-banana scent filled the air around my face that soon delighted my taste buds!  The strawberry-rhubarb jam and agave pancake syrup added lovely velvety coats of sweetness and colors, as well.  I could've eaten the entire dish!  I'll be back!

I like to give a place a few chances before writing a review like this... I've been to Pomegranate Cafe at least 4 or 5 times now.  First their food is SO expensive for what you get.  And the quality of food is just meh - they have a few exceptional items, but for the most part, the food isn't super impressive.  Now let's talk about why they get only 2 stars... their service.  They have this large beautiful dining area indoor and outdoor - but never enough staff to accommodate how many people can fit.  The service has been extremely slow - every. single. time.  Today was a special kind of slow.  It took 2.5 hours from the time we got seated to the time we got our checks.  They offered us free desserts to take home to make up for the long waits, then get this... the server took one of the desserts off our pile (we put them on the counter behind us to save table space) and gave one of our complimentary desserts to another customer!!! And then - they ran out of that specific dessert!!!!! Like who does that?  Also they ran out of another food item I had ordered and substituted it with something else without asking if that is what I wanted.  It was literally insane.  I'm so disappointed with this place now.  I wanted to like them.  If it were only meh food, I probably wouldn't have written a review - but the combo of meh food and terrible service has crossed the line and people should know so they can at least fix the service problem!  If you know it's going to be busy (which it's is every single weekend I have been), make sure you have the staff to accommodate your capacity!!!

I love their Power Kale Salad and their AB& J Bowl!!!!  I'm a natural carnivore yet to mix up the calories, I highly recommend this place for their healthy salads and fabulous staff. They have indoor and outdoor seating and 2 thumbs up for their dog friendly patio. Only drawback to this place is I wish the weekday hours were until 9pm but other than that, it's a winner!  Tuesday-Thursday: 8 am - 8 pm Friday & Saturday: 8 am - 9 pm  Sunday: 8 am - 4 pm Closed Mondays

I love PC. A little on the pricey side but so worth it. The nachos the burger and fries are my favorite so far. I haven't tried their desserts yet but that is next on the list. Try it out you won't be disappointed.

The food at Pomegranate is amazing! I had the Big Kahuna burger and it was delicious. I often order garden burgers at other vegan restaurants, and this was the best! I usually order the Kung Pao burrito, which is out of this world good! I took one to-go Really like the staff....friendly and cool too. If I could I would give 9 Stars!

Furious and starving are the last two things you want to leave a restaurant. In the past, when the Pom screwed up an order of mine, they apologized and gave me a gift certificate (anywhere from $2-10). This I found odd, because other places I go, if the waiter or cook forgets and puts the allergen(s) in my food, I usually get a meal comped. I thought that was the industry standard. I am not saying I expect this, but I found it odd, as the first time it happened, the $2 didn't even cover the tax on the meal. Honestly, all I *really* want is my food, free of things that would cause me a trip to the hospital.  I am a regular customer; I come in there at least once a month with a group of friends. Being that I have a lot of food restrictions, I usually order the same delectable item. However, I was told to have them make it from scratch (the rainbow wrap) because they pre-make them every morning, and in the past, when I ordered it without my allergens - raw tomatoes and onions - they've forgotten, or didn't pick out all of them, and once had to remake it *twice* because the cook was totally on autopilot.  One would think that at a place like this, food allergies would be understood and accommodated without question. However, the other day I arrived with my group, and when I attempted to order, was told, sorry, we're too busy to accommodate you. So it was a question of either order something else (which I either couldn't have or didn't want) or take my life into my hands. That is just not a fair option.   As it was, I was so hungry I couldn't wait an hour or two for the line to decrease, so I left. I thought about picking up something at TJ's and bringing it back there to dine with my friends, but why? Clearly they don't want my business, so why patronize a restaurant that doesn't want to sell me food?

Good healthy food. You can taste the organic ingredients from the very first bite! However, service is always extremely slow and the place is usually very crowded. So, make sure set aside plenty of time to truly enjoy your experience

Man, I really really hate to give a vegan cafe a low rating. I have two stars simply because it's vegan. Otherwise, it's truly a bust. The Mac and cheese took 40 minutes (at a non busy time) and was cold when I got it. The j-whatever version of coffee they have along with the Pom milk left much to be desired. I am not a picky person but I had to send it back. Asked for a juice instead and it took 15 MORE minutes to get a lemonade to my table! It sucks because I drove an hour to get here but I definitely will not be back. Skip this cafe and try another one instead.  Lemonade was tasty, Shay had awesome customer service... other than that I was not a fan.

This is my first time here! Recently moved here from another state. Not a vegetarian or vegan, but I do enjoy making healthy food choices regularly. Had the Avocado Sandwich & the Island Green smoothie! Absolutely delicious!  The staff was extremely awesome in helping me decide what to order. As a former manager at Jamba Juice for 4 years, I've had my fair share in health food training & the staff definitely knows their stuff.  I will definitely become a regular here!

Awesome food every time!  We have been coming here for years and the food just keeps getting better.  The owner is passionate about her business and it shows through in her final product.  If you are interested in eating healthy you can't go wrong here.   We particularly love the southwestern mac and cheese and elephant curry bowl.  The staff lately has been particularly great!
I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Healthy, organic/local options, breakfast, great staff, and fresh squeezed orange juice

Finally!! I have been meaning to go to the place forever.  Organic cafe with great food and such a great vibe.  Love the cowgirl cookies and the hummus is amazing.  Why can't they open another location closer to scottsdale?

LOVE this place!!!! The staff are always so friendly and are great with our kids! He patio is an excellent added bonus! If you go try the walnut taco meat! One word...heaven!!! A great local joint! 5 Stars!

I am biased because my family members own this cute little cafe. However, I'm a picky eater, plus I'm a vegetarian (5 years strong). Cassie (my moms cousin) is the sweetest and smartest human on the planet. She is so creative and innovative. I've been here countless times and not once have I been disappointed. For an all vegetarian/vegan restaurant, I've got to say that they're doing excellent. I recommend this to anyone coming to the Phoenix area! I've brought my friends, and even my father, who lives out of town and is the pickiest eater, and he even agrees that the food was delicious, along with their coffee. Needless to say they deserve 6 stars. It's a busy little place and they've renovated multiple times to keep up with the growing traffic. I love Pomegranate Cafe and I'm excited to watch it flourish.

Another place that I've been dying to try! I finally made it in and am so glad I did. I had a vegan Monte Cristo on gluten free bread, with a side of potato salad.  It was so delicious  and satisfying,  didn't even miss the lack of meat(or gluten)! I also enjoyed a latte(dairy free) with my meal. A touch pricey, but not bad considering the quality of the ingredients. I'll be back, and maybe next time I'll get a chance to check out the store attached with all the healthy goodies they sell!

Didn't know it was vegan when I walked in but I walked out a happy (and well fed) camper. The menu is jammed with all kinds of delicious sounding options. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that they offer green juice shots (the bitter-but-good-for-you kind) with a pomegranate juice chaser. Nice touch! Food is excellent and very fresh. Server was incredibly helpful for my first time there. I will definitely be back!

Was in Phoenix the other day and was hoping to find a Vegan restaurant so I immediately got on Yelp and found this place. After reading a few of the reviews and getting a bit curious I decided to come in here. Best choice ever! It was absolutely delicious! I asked for a quesadilla which was amazing!!! The only thing that I wasn't a big fan of was the big pieces of; I believe it was pepper and onions, but that was my fault since I should have asked what they put in it. It was also pricey, I believe my total came out to $12, but for vegan food that you see them make right in front of you. What do you expect? It was so worth it and I hope to be visiting Arizona again soon so I can come back here! It was absolutely delicious!! I'm craving it again right now!

This little cafe is so cute in every way. They have options for both vegan and vegetarian and the rest.  The decor is kind of country incorporating wood furniture with contemporary light fixtures with vibrant and colorful paintings of plants and flowers.  We had a sweet server.  She was an absolute doll.  I usually ask for help when I have a hard time choosing and the options on the menu were things like biscuit and gravy, quiche lorraine, but the Pomegranate had it's own twist that made each dish, even if traditional american fare, exciting.  The coffee and espresso sounded so tasty but I'd already had my fill.  My compadre enjoyed the Coconut caramel latte.  Mmmmm-of course I had a sip.  I ordered the quiche lorraine  that was topped with the Jalapeño creme and was accompanied with a side salad.  Yum! It had  thick crust and I can't tell you all the ingredients but it was flavorful and a little spicy.  I enjoyed it.  The salad was a great side kick.  It was greens and shredded carrots tossed in what tasted like coconut aminos and citrus!  Yum!  My taste buds were happy!  my friend had a breakfast wrap which was ginormous!  Think cut in two and chipotle sized.  I had a great time here!  The wait time on a Saturday was fast, the atmosphere was casual and the food was awesome!  When I'm headed their direction again, I'll be by!  It was the perfect brunch spot on my road-trip from Tucson to the San Bernardino, CA area!

I went back to try their food. The place has been remodeled since I last visited, six months ago. It's bigger and can accommodate more people, but it did lose that vibe that I liked about it. Regardless, the staff was still friendly, the food was delicious, and the drinks were still good!  Drinks: 1) Braveheart (leafy greens, kale, cucumber, celery, apple, orange) 2) Some kind of berry smoothie? Both were refreshing and good.  Entrees: 1) Breakfast Burrito (Egg, potato, sweet potato, cheese, anasazi beans, salsa, seasonal vegetables, spinach tortilla) 2) In Season scramble (Egg scramble, seasonal veggies, cheese, harvest hash, kamut toast & house jam): loved the house jam! 3) Hummus: the bread and veggies were very good and fresh and the hummus was okay. It was a little grainier and had a more cumin taste but it tasted fresh. 4) Raw Berries & Cream Parfait (Raspberry cream, seasonal fruit, berries, nuts & seeds): one of my favorite parts of the meal. SO good

Order an elephant bowl, save an animal's life! I love that this cafe donates a portion of their earnings on certain items towards worthy causes. I ordered the elephant bowl partially because of this (Wildlife SOS receives $1 from each bowl sold). I also had an iced lavender latte.   The elephant bowl comes with your choice of protein and carb. I chose the walnut meat and kelp noodles. I got the order to go and took a seat to wait for my meal.   The lavender latte was made first and was light and refreshing. It had a hint of the lavender flavor but the main component I could taste was the creamy coconut milk. They use Peixoto coffee which is great since they are an excellent local company that roasts fabulous coffee beans.  The main meal took quite a bit of time to make. I think I was waiting nearly 30 minutes but all the staff members were very apologetic about it. My bowl came in a compressed paper container in a brown paper bag. I placed the bag securely on the passenger side floor mat and I was on my way home.  While driving on the way home the curry in the bowl was so watery that it spilled out of the container (Which was on the shallow side and did not have a sauce-proof seal) all over the bag, which caused the bag to leak all over my floor mat. A day later I am still trying to air out my car because curry+ hot car is not a good fragrance in a small enclosed space in the AZ heat!  The actual bowl though was a hefty portion with lots of vegetables, walnut meat, and noodles. The curry sauce that didn't spill out onto my car was full bodied and complimented the rest of the ingredients well. The kelp noodles were intriguing as this was my first time having them. They were clear, had a springy, chewy texture and neutral flavor.   The price was a little high, with my total being a little over $20 with tax. They do use high quality ingredients, use eco friendly packaging, and have generously sized portions to make up for the cost though.  While I enjoyed the bowl and latte, I would definitely not get any orders from here to go again. So, if I'm in the mood to dine in I'll try Pomegranate Cafe again.

I miss coming here. I moved from AZ, and this is almost worth the plane trip in itself for these raw goodies.  Everything is made fresh in house. You won't find corn syrup or sodas, or GMO products. Instead, you will find organic, vegan, and raw selections  that won't make you feel you are sacrificing taste for healthy.  When I'm visiting AZ, this is the first place I want to eat at. Everything here is delicious and while the menu does keep a few classics, it also rotates with fresh soups of the day, desserts, and juices to keep new tempting offerings to chose from, and my taste buds wanting more.
Ordered Bountiful Harvest bowl and a greena Colada smoothie. Both were really cooked to perfection.   Wouldn't mind visiting multiple times.
I'm in love! This place has delicious, healthy food and a cool vibe. Our new weekend lunch stop. The falafel is my favorite. The nachos are a must try. I was thrilled to learn they are expanding.

The food is good and the valley desperately needs more vegan/vegetarian options. However the service is abysmal. I placed an order for pick up and was told it would be 10-15 minutes. I browsed around and waited. After 20 minutes I inquired and was told my food was being put in a box. 5 minutes later I asked again and was told it would be a few more minutes. I left for 10 minutes, went to the store, and when I came back I asked again and was told to wait in line. I did so for 10 minutes and was told it was being put in a  box--how many boxes do I need?The hostess offered no condolence, just told me it would be a few minutes because they were busy.
