It took 45 minutes to get a to go order from a half full restaurant.   On another occasion I brought my toddler and asked for a high chair. They say is at a high top--the high chair was a foot lower than the table. Their incompetence can be comical.

I went into Pomegranate Cafe with a friend for lunch. We both ordered some Mexican style burritos and I can't recall the name now. The food was delicious, as was the dessert and the juice. The only down fall was the price. For 2 people to eat lunch it was $58! We each ordered a raw dessert and a drink to go with our food but I still felt that was a little steep.

I am not a vegan and enjoy eating non healthy food.  This place is selling unique healthy dishes and it also taste good. I ordered a mushroom burger w English muffins. It taste pretty good. But if you are expecting Red Robin or regular high calories burger taste then this may not be your option :)   This place is good for vegan, vegetarians, gluten free, and healthy eaters. Price is lil high but they use organic ingredients.

As a 30 year vegetarian, I'm so happy they opened in my hood. I like all of the options but I've had one or two dishes that were too heavy on the sauces, making every bite of a big rice bowl taste exactly the same. Next time, I'm ordering the sauces on the side! Be forewarned they are pricier than the other local level lunch spots. If they weren't, I'd be there much more often. Their smoothies and juices are off the charts expensive. $12? Um no. My meat eating friends and family like the place too!

I was a regular at Pom for many years. Quality has gone downhill recently. I'm not sure if the chefs have changed, but the food no longer has the appeal is did previously. The wait times are long and prices are high.
Been here several times.  Always enjoy the food.  Step out of the box and try something new here.
Delicious and healthy! I am a certified meat eater, but their walnut taco meat totally won me over. Everything is fresh and delicious. I'll have to try one of their desserts next time.
LOVE this place.  Perfect for any dietary needs or preferences. Cute date spot for any of you herbivore couples. Glad they're opened up late again!

After going to the other Pomegranate Cafe in Ahwatukee, I had very high expectations for this location. Unfortunately I will less than impressed with my first time here. I had ordered one of the wraps which I have had before at the other location, and when I got it I noticed it was missing a ton of the ingredients that were listed in the menu. It didn't even have the ranch dressing that it was supposed to come with. For paying $14 for a wrap, I would expect a little bit more. Our service was pretty slow so I decided to just eat my meal and not say anything. I think in the future I will make the drive to the Ahwatukee location where i've never had a bad experience/meal.
Amazing food, great atmosphere and the speed of service has improved greatly!!! Some of the best treats I have ever had in here. Kids love it too!

If there is one thing I love it is meat. But my best friend has been a vegetarian the last 7 years and recently became vegan. So this was my first time here and I absolutely loved it. I got the Athena salad which was under $10 for the small. I was surprised by how much came in it. I couldn't even finish it because I was full.  We also got a side of the avocado toast with herb bread. It was probably my favorite of all. The bread had so much flavor. We sat outside and had such a nice server. Everything came out within 20  minutes or so, and it was a Sunday. I loved everything about this place, from the cucumber water, to the amazing sweets they had inside. I had the cookie dough truffle covered in chocolate, it was so good! I loved this place, and everything was vegan!! Amazing!
One of my favorite places for vegan breakfast! Today's feast included pecan cinnamon rolls and a tofu scramble! Their secret weapon is an innocent looking pomegranate jam! Knock your sox off!

Love that there are tons of vegetarian, vegan and raw options, and the recipes are different than what you'd expect. They regularly update their menu. The first time I went there they had different types of bowls, burritos, sandwiches, smoothies, juices. They even have a bakery up front. The decor is cute, pomegranate-themed of course, but not in your face. (They even put pomegranate seeds in your water!) The backs of the chairs have enticing words like "fresh," and "natural." You really feel like a lot of love was put into the cafe to provide people with fresh organic food.   They do have mock meat but they have descriptions of what it is made out of. I had the kelp noodle bowl which had clear kelp noodles, mushrooms and marinated tofu. My friend had the sushi (no meat)... sooooo good! The employees are very nice and helpful. Unfortunately, the second time my boyfriend and I decided to go, we arrived after 4pm on a weekday, which is the time they closed. So disappointing! Instead, we had to go to the Mexican restaurant in the shopping center. I would also like to point out that the placement of the cafe is spot on as far as the trend of natural healthy living because it's next to Trader Joe's, a natural pet food store and a yoga studio.
We had delicious meals. A great place for fresh Vegan eating. Portions were plentiful and we took home plenty for another meal. We will eat there again. The staff were a big plus as well. Thanks.
Food is great here. Been here a few times with my wife and meals have all been good. It is a little pricey but you get a good size meal. Definately will be back.

Everything was delicious & there was a lot to choose from. The place is an awesome hangout- hip & earthy. We tried the tamales, breakfast burrito and burger with rainbow juice & strawberry sunrise. The rainbow juice was spicy (ginger) & refreshing. I had more energy & felt healthier after drinking it. The $9 price tag seemed a bit high for a juice but thats prob how much all the veggies cost to put in there. Can't wait to go again and try more of their menu options.
The vegan food here is delicious and good size portions! Although the service does not match the food quality. Poor service, awesome grub

This place was delicious. Me and a friend shared the big kahuna burger and the bountiful bowl. It was very good and the atmosphere is very chill. The only downside was that they were very busy as it was Saturday afternoon and so the service was a little slow.

I went to Pomegranate Cafe today and it was a total disappointment.  I show up and the place is arranged as an "order yourself" restaurant, which is perfectly fine.  The first thing you see when you walk in is a big counter, and no directions (or menus on the board, etc).  I walk up to the counter looking to order something, or learn how the process works, and the gentleman behind the counter asks if I'm dining in.  Kind of caught me by surprise because I'm thinking why is that the very first question, I just want to order food.  Let me stop and say that already, while he's polite, he's definitely making me feel like I'm doing something stupid and I should already know how the process works.  He tells me to take a seat anywhere, I look around and there are no seats available, he realizes it and he says there's plenty of seating outside.  That's good with me, I like sitting outside even in az, and he says he'll take water to me.  Ok so far not too bad even though the process is awkward and I still haven't seen anything resembling a menu.  But here's where it gets really bad.  I go ahead and take my seat outside and just wait, and wait, and wait.  No water, no menu, no greeting from any waiter, NOTHING.  Of course now I'm disappointed; I followed the directions from the guy at the counter and proceed to be completely ignored.  I felt like leaving at this point (who wants to be ignored?), but I was craving their type of food and had gone out of my way to go there today, so I thought I'd give it another try.  I walk back in to the place and speak with another nice young gentleman who after learning what had taken place proceeded to only say "oh when we're not busy we like doing table service so we'll follow you with a menu, but I think when you sat down we got busy in a rush."  That makes no sense at all of course, I was perfectly willing to order at the counter but they were the ones who asked me to grab a table/seat.  Then he did nothing except give me this card that has a link to their website and a couple of marketing tag lines.  Did not say sorry, let me take care of you now, or anything.  I stood there not knowing what to do so I just said thank you and walked out.  Extremely disappointed, because I was looking forward to trying this place after I heard good things about it.  This really should be a one star review, but I'm leaving two stars for two reasons: one because I didn't actually get to try their food (unfortunately), and two because if I leave a one star this review may not be taken seriously, and I do feel If nothing else that their management should fix this.  I understand they may cater to a lot of regulars and a certain type of clientele, but I'm sure they would welcome new clients as well.  Today they did not, despite repeated opportunities.

My son and I went here for breakfast. I was served granola with fruit that was frozen  solid. Avoid the granola, it is more granola than any human could eat and only a smidge of milk, plus it is WAY too expensive. We spent $40 on breakfast, not worth it.
Love this place good RAW options . Nicole was our server she's very nice an informative

We went on Valentine's day, which was very rainy and cold. They had barely anyone in the place but said that we would have to share a table with another couple because of reservations . They had a pricey valentine's four course meal which we did not choose from . we opted for the nachos which were good. Over priced and atmosphere felt more like a cafeteria . We probably will not be back anytime soon.

This cafe is 100% vegetarian, with the vegan option available on every menu item.  From past experiences with veggie restaurants in Phoenix, this kind of classification would probably make me less eager to try the place......  which is why I'm happy that the chef/owner instead chose to focus on the fact that they use fresh, local, and organic ingredients -- vegetarianism is more of an afterthought.  So we decided to try it yesterday for lunch.  To start, Pomegranate offers a wonderful selection of teas, coffees, and various juice/smoothie options.  I wanted something cool and caffeinated, so I ordered the toddy, which features my favorite local roaster's beans -- Cartel.  My wife order a peach iced tea.  Very good, but if memory serves correctly, you won't find any drink options for less than $2.00 or so.  Then onto the main course.  I ordered the veggie burger, which is made from a sprouted tofu, served on a sprouted spelt bun, and garnished with cheddar cheese (or vegan cheese if you prefer), avocado, tomato, and a little tiny dollop of miso mayonnaise.  It also comes with a catch-all selection of sides: salad, tortilla chips, fruit slices, and a pickle.  $10 or so.....  Here's my take on the burger:  The spelt bun was better than any other spelt bun/bread that I've ever had before.  This was perhaps the second most notable part of this burger.  The most notable was the patty itself, which had a nice mellow nutty flavor -- not trying too hard to be be fake beef and not overpowering in soy flavor.  It was actually one of my favorite veggie burgers ever.  But here's my beef with the preparation: too skimpy on the rich, fatty stuff.  There was a very thin slice of cheese and almost nothing of the single condiment provided, which the menu told me was a miso mayo.  Thanks to the avocado, it was still a little rich, but not the kind of juicy decadence that I've always felt characterizes a great burger.  And seriously, I would have liked to have tasted the miso mayonnaise, but instead added my salad dressing to the burger to make it less dry, and this basically obscured whatever taste the mayo may have offered.  The salad was just fine, garnished with what seemed like a raw berry dressing of some sort.  I had no idea that the white stuff in the plastic cup was also for the salad (apparently a living caesar dressing), until the meal was almost over.  I thought it was my mayonnaise for the burger.  Next time, I'll try to get it right and see how the salad tastes with both dressings.  We also tried the hummus, mainly because it's the perfect baby-appropriate snack for my son to sling all over the restaurant (the remarkably polite staff was also quite pleasant about bringing in a messy toddler, by the way, which is a plus).  The hummus was actually quite tasty, but somehow not in a "traditional" way.  It seemed a little crisper and fresher than most hummus I've had, which was a nice complement to the fresh veggies served with it.  My only additional request for the hummus is that perhaps the restaurant could throw in a few tortilla chips as well?  My wife tried the vegan BLT, made with a tempeh-based bacon.  It must have been tasty, because this is one of the first times I've missed my opportunity to try a bite of her dish.  She literally devoured it and then criticized me for nitpicking at the veggie burger's preparation.  I'm pretty sure she'd give this place a 5-star rating, and she may convince me to do the same on our return visit with the in-laws, who have been looking for a place like this.  Oh, one final note.  I spoke with the chef/owner after our meal, to offer our compliments and inquire about the cuisine and the marketplace, etc.  She mentioned something that should be readily apparent to most foodies, which is that the key to providing tasty veggie options is to go with a macrobiotic whole food focus -- this approach de-emphasizes the constraints and instead focuses on building a good meal from quality ingredients.  Well done, chef.

I wish I lived closer and could afford this place on a regular basis! The food is always fantastic but the price is a little much. They do give you lots of food though! It's always a little crowded and the food kind of takes longer than it should (about 30 minutes) Staff is always super friendly

I love Pomegranate!  Everything that I have tried has been amazing and the service has always been excellent!  The only downside is that the prices are a bit more expensive than other vegan places, but they offer many organic ingredients to justify the prices.  I love their bakery items and I would visit much more often if I didn't live so far away!
Great menu. I had the pizza, almond joy bar and one of pomegranate soda mixes. Everything tasted fresh and delicious.

My little brother brought me a BBQ Buffalo Salad from Pomegranate cafe today. I need some greens in my life and he suggested the spot. My salad was loaded with high quality ingredients and was quite good. And I felt so healthy eating it- everything from the power greens to the tofu tasted so yummy and super duper fresh.

It's a real bummer that this place is so far away from my part of town.  I was lucky enough to be in the area.  This place is a true vegans paradise.  If you are Vegan then you will not be disappointed with their menu.  They also cater to Vegetarians so if you're not full Vegan you will also fit right in.  Service is great and the patio is a great place to sit if the weather permits.  Don't forget to try some of there delicious baked goods.  All of which are made Vegan style.
Super yummy ! I'm not a vegetarian or vegan so I was iffy on the food at first , so glad I tried it out . Had the avo jalapeño crisp and a smoothie . Best lunch I've had in a long time .

I visited Pomegranate Cafe for lunch with several colleagues. The juices and smoothies looked amazing, but I held off because they were $9 and I'm cheap. I opted instead for the Green Bandito Burrito. The service was prompt, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Upon my first taste of the burrito, I exclaimed that I wanted to marry it and have its babies. This burrito was equal parts hearty, flavorful and delicious (quite an accomplishment for vegan fare). It arrived nestled next to a strawberry pecan salad and a side of mild salsa. The price was slightly steep, but you can't put a price on happiness. I'll be back soon.
Friendly staff, delicious food, good prices & a great happy hour.  One of my new favorite vegan spots in Phoenix!

My son and I came for dinner and we fell in love. We recently moved to Ahwatukee and we're looking for a restaurant that had plenty of gluten-free options. My son was recently diagnosed with Celiac's Disease and he's been having a difficult time with it because his diet was pretty much anything on bread. He walked right in and asked if they had gluten free food (he's 6) and the staff was so friendly and inviting to him. They didn't seem annoyed with him at all for asking if everything (item by item) was gluten free. We ordered the Mac and cheese for him and the nachos to share and I had the mushroom burger. It was all tasty! The nachos were pretty spicy, their jalapeños are no joke! I love that they're 98% organic and vegan. They're also a socially conscious business! They compost, recycle, and shop locally for their food. Such a cute ambience too! We will definitely be going back!

FINALLY, The Funk has come back to South Phoenix.  Have you ever done something one day and was more upset the next day about what you did? Well that's how I feel about dropping $45 on Pomegranate cafe for a late veggie lunch - solo. (I can imagine the heads shaking from all the carnivores. That's steak money, right?)   Yeah, I feel ya'. My support for veggie eateries is quickly waning. They are over-priced and can be quite pretentious with the creativity.  So, I was down south on a hot afternoon and really worked up a sweat. I remembered reading that Pomegranate Cafe sold fresh juice and was located somewhere near 40th St and Chandler Blvd. Had I known to look for the shopping center with Safeway and two doors down from Trader Joes....Landmarks, folks! Very important when giving directions....   PC's white and pink sign is a tad dull against the building. If I wasn't specifically looking for the cafe, I probably would have missed it and gone somewhere else to eat. But anyway, I walked in, grabbed all the menus (regular, HH, and juice bar), and had a seat. (Only order at the counter if you want take-away).   Asked for a juice right away and despite the "slow service" comments that other reviewers have posted, I wasn't too bothered by the several minutes it took for juice to make its way to my table. I pushed aside water and guzzled it down. Aahhh. I could feel, see, hear, smell, sense, taste, perceive the essence of life coursing through my veins. That must be the feeling Popeye gets  after eating spinach (mmmm, love those greens).  Why only three stars for PC? One for just being veggie + One for being freshly made + One for serving fresh juice   Fresh juice was the best part of my afternoon. I wasn't too impressed with the food. I ordered off the regular menu like an idiot and hit myself later for not giving the happy hour menu a chance. Could've saved myself half the price.   Truth be told - I should've stopped with the juice, paid the bill, and walked away. But, ooh, I spied with my little eye jackfruit tacos and jackfruit sliders.   - BBQ jackfruit sliders (3) for $12: jackfruit, peppers, onions, jalapeno cabbage slaw, chimichurri on bun.  Even though I asked for the BBQ sauce on the side, the jackfruit itself had a sickly sweetness that cancelled my enjoyment. What I really liked, though, were the silver dollar-sized buns.   - Jamaican jerk street tacos (3) for $12: jerk seasoned jackfruit, cabbage slaw, pico, baja sauce, chimichurri on corn tortillas.  Did that say jamaican? Show me the jerk who thought of that because wurnt no part of those tacos Jamaican. Spicy? Nope. All I could taste was that sickly sweet jackfruit. Created and tasted exactly like the sliders.    The jackfruit wasn't prepared the way I'm used to having it. In fact I couldn't even tell that it was jackfruit by sight because it was mixed with other stuff and only one spoonful of it was buried under the mounds of cabbage slaw and sauce.  When I mentioned the sweetness to the two staff members who checked on me they blamed the jackfruit. Really? I know what jackfruit tastes like. Even when fresh it's not overly sweet. Either this jackfruit was sweetened and then packaged, or one of PC's sauces used in the dishes was too sweet. Won't order it again.   - For dezzert, a slice of tropical cake. Good cake, real cake, but could have used more tropics and less sugary lemon frosting. AGAIN with the sweetness.  Overall, PC's dishes are very colourful and look beautiful. I'll try a wrap and/or salad next time, but I won't go out of my way to eat there again any time soon.  Four items averaged to about $10 apiece, then tax and probably a surcharge for a take out box.  You would think that would have filled me up, but actually I stopped somewhere else on the way back to central Phoenix.

I love vegetarian restaurants! I support them 200%. So glad this place exists in Phoenix. The quality of the food is beyond excellent. The meals are creative and super tasty. Never disappointed. The only qualm I have is the service. It...is...slow. Whether it's the time it takes for my meal to reach my table or the cashier taking my order to ring it up correctly. The length of time it takes should not be so long. Prices are a bit steep but most vegetarian/vegan restaurants are priced a bit higher than others. I don't mind paying more for quality. Overall this place is a favorite weekend visit. I can't wait for my next meal at Pomegranate Cafe.

A bit disappointing compared to their location on Chandler Blvd that I have been to on several occasions.  The food is great quality (a bit pricey but understanding the quality, justified the price) it is VERY child friendly & not the best spot to pick on a weekend for a few adults to try have a conversation over a meal, as it is extremely loud.  The tile floors & family style seating makes for a challenging chat!!! The wait staff friendly & efficient, I simply wish it were not so loud

Very good health food/natural food/gluten free/vegetarian/ yada yada cafe. Fun vibe in and out. Feels like it should be on Venice Beach in Los Angeles - was very surprised to find it in Ahwatukee. The Mermaid salad was a huge combo of dark greens/seaweeds/tofu - I recommend it for a guilt free dinner. Friends had GF mac and cheese and a huge burrito. All seemed to enjoy. Desserts were mostly raw and 'ehh'. I wouldn't spend the money on the desserts (because when did a healthy dessert really taste great?) There is wine, beer, cider. The specialty cocktails were a bit on the pricey side so I can't say if they were worth the $13 bucks.There is also a happy hour menu but we did not order from it.

This place is always packed! So I thought I would try it it's very Organic and whole foodie if that makes sense so if you like that type of food then this is place for you don't go when your starving cause it's always like 20/30min wait and don't go during prime hours because there's just way too many ppl !
Pretty bad experience. The service is lacking, good luck getting what you ordered!  All that healthy food must be rotting their brains!

Loved everything about this place...except for the damage it did to my wallet. I had the lucky dragon bowl and a side of the potato salad. Both items were unlike anything else I've ever tried, which isn't something I can say very often. I loved the creative approach to each of the items. The fact that they were able to create such unique flavors while incorporating vegan, organic and non-gmo ingredients is even more impressive. My only complaint is the cost of the meal makes the restaurant more of a special occasion spot than a regular in my restaurant rotation. Mostly, I'm just bummed that I can't go every week to try something new without taking out a second mortgage. I guess it's true though ... you can't put a price on quality. Try this place out and enjoy!

Amazingly great food!  The sandwiches and salads are delicious....the deserts are so decadent!  I really loved the shabby chic earth friendly decor....very friendly staff.  You have to try this place!

My little sister works here and she tells me about all the amazing food all the time!  I love this place!  The food is well prepared, fresh, and tasty. I love the gila nachos and the burritos! The staff is friendly. They often have live music playing which is nice too. I just have so much love for this place that I can't put into words.  :)

My husband and I love this place. The food is amazing. We have tried a lot of their menu and we have never been disappointed. Service can be slow due to the small kitchen and limited staff but I would say worth it overall.  We will be back time after time!

The raw chocolate banana cake was fantastic! I had the burger of the day, which was sweet potato, and it was very flavorful. As an omnivore (non-vegan?), I was very satisfied with this place. It was a bit pricey for my tastes, but I realize those food costs are high to begin with. I would recommend it!

I love that you leave this place feeling so full but not so guilty because you know everything is nutritious and healthy.I love their coffee here too, espresso has an awesome flavor! A bit pricy but hey everything is organic and like supporting our local businesses! Some of my favorites are: Green garden protein bowl All coffee drinks Chocolate pomegranate cake Sizzling sesame salad
Went on a Sunday when Pomegranate had a freshly made Coconut Lime Cake.  I have discovered a new reason to live  :) mmmmm

Went to eat here yesterday(Sunday) at 130. We had a party of four and we go to the host stand and we were told there would be a 20 minute wait. Ok no big deal however we look around and there are a number of open tables. So we sit out side in the patio and wait and wait and wait. Finally I got up and got us menus then the host came over with waters 20 minutes later. Almost a half hour later we get a waitress. We of course order right away. A smoothie bowl, cinnamon roll and a green goddess burger. The food was great which is why I'm giving this a 2 star. However we got the smoothie bowl first then 7-8 minutes later we got the burger and about 15 minutes later we got the cinnamon roll. Nothing came out together. I don't know if they make the cinnamon roll from scratch as people order but it should not have taken almost a half an hour for a cinnamon roll. Never once were we asked if we wanted anything to drink other then the host bringing us waters. The service was beyond horrible however the food was really good!!!!!
Amazing. Period. Blew my mind.  This is my new all-time favorite restaurant. The food. The service. The atmosphere. All spot on!

OMG.... The food here is amazing! I got a bowl and my bf got a burrito along witj the baked fries! The food is amazing! Portions are HUGE so beware! We couldnt finish our food so we had to take it to go but it was sooo soooo good!
If you're a vegan this place is must have. The atmosphere is cozy. The staff is very knowledgeable about vegan needs. I got the cheese crisp and bounty burrito phenomenal!  Definitely coming back!

First time having vegan and raw vegan dessert. I got the special Samoan cookies and the vegan pomegranate cake. They also threw in the vegan peanut butter cup :)   The vegan peanut butter cup is good nothing crazy, but a good starter.   The Samoan cookie reminded me exactly like the girl scout Samoan cookies. Except the consistency is wet and moist like. It's also a lot larger!  As for the vegan pomegranate cake, I was not impressed. It just tasted plain but the frosting was delicious.  Overall, they have some pretty good desserts. I need to come back and try their food!  The staff is very nice!!

This place is yummy. I had a delicious breakfast burrito wrapped in collard greens. The tahini did had a delicious kick to it. The fruit salad was awesome. I had a real egg but I think the tofu scramble my friend had looked awesome. The fruit salad on the side was fresh and tasty. I also had the cookie dough truffle which was the perfect snack later on in my day. I really enjoyed the food!  I'm updating my review because when I came back the service was so slow. It took over 40 minutes to get our order and we had kids with us. At the very least our server should have given them something to color if the weight was going to be that long. Also, no eta on order in all that time. We bought some deserts after and they couldn't break a $20. Very strange.

This is one of my favorite spots in restaurant. Everyday they have such a lovely menu. The Food, juice and desserts are so yummy! I switch up my order everytime because this place has so much to offer. The staff is always so friendly and knowledgeable. If you are looking for a fantastic treat I highly suggest the cowgirl cookies! Yum!!!

I'm so happy to live right by Pomegranate cafe!! Everything here is delicious!! So far I've had the Falafel con papas and the Avocado sandwich.. both with tofu. They both were incredible. Alsooo... I've had a chocolate banana cupcake and a coffee and omg I just love everything these lovely people make.  Don't be in a rush when you go here. Good food takes time. My only wish is that they served matcha lattes.

Gross. Gross. Gross. This place may be vegan but their food safety is abhorrent. Fruit should not be near the floor. There are standards for a reason.  Sanitizer buckets should not be next to the ice. The food is crazy expensive. The wait for food is unreal. Customer service is meh.

What's more important than good food? Good food you can eat, for me that means vegan or vegetarian options. Furthermore, food I can eat sustainably and feel good about.  A friend recommended this place and we went for breakfast. Had the seasonal cherry cappuccino which was bomb.com. The star of the show is the breakfast wraps which absolutely blew my mind.  The people, the food- all exceptional. I truly hope everyone gives this place a shot.

I'm not a vegetarian but my dad is one. He seemed really happy with his meal and I was very happy with mine too. I was able get a breakfast burrito with eggs substitutes for tofu. I need my protein in the morning. The place was packed but the service didn't suffer for it. I'd check it out no matter your dietary restrictions.

Between 3 and 4 stars. I love the idea and the ambiance was great but the service was very slow. I went here with a friend and when it comes to a point, after you order, where you have to ask how long we've been waiting to each other, we've already waited too long. And then you're thinking, okay we'll give it five more min, every five minutes, three times, we've waited too long. I ordered the lumberjack based on a lot of people's recommendations. It was good but even better without the tempeh on there. I guess it's supposed to be a bacon tempeh but I didn't care for it and in fact, I picked it out if my sandwich and I ended up loving my sandwich! I ordered the Cassie's latte too which was good but I don't think it's something I'll have often. It also got cold while waiting for the meal.
I was very impressed with the quality of food.  A great destination for those who are looking for an organic, very tasty meal.  I'd definetely go back.
I love Pomegranate but the menu is very limited compared to the other location. Maybe they will expand it later but for now I was disappointed to see a lot of the favorites not at this lovation

The kale salad is fantastic, especially the dressing! Lots of vegan and vegetarian offerings that are filling.  My only cautions are the raw desserts really aren't that tasty and most of the entrees contain too much bell pepper.  However, the cowgirl cookies are a big favorite with my husband and son.  The special lemonades are also quite good if a bit pricey (refills aren't free so pace yourself).  This is one of the best vegetarian restaurants in the East Valley and the staff is very friendly - especially Matt!

Hooray for local and organic, and did I mention healthy and delicious! This place just opened in Ahwatukee, and I am super excited. I just tried their "courage" juice  and it is so delicious. I think it has made my afternoon. The place has an awesome atmosphere and philosophy- all green, all local, and all organic. It couldn't be fresher - they were unloading containers of produce as I got there. Plus the staff is super friendly. I can't wait to try breakfast or lunch here the menu looks great, and I will definitely update on  the food as soon as I get to try it!
Obsessed! You don't have to be vegan to eat here but you might just consider it once you eat this yumminess!

my wife was excited to read about this place. surprisingly the place had been open since February, but we had hand't heard of it until this last week. awesome little vegan, raw, healthy food cafe. chatted to the owner for some time - discussed vegan cheese cake recipes  and swooped notes. very knowledgeable lady owner and very friendly staff, nice selection of drinks, snacks and main courses. the salad my wife ordered was rather large and very tasty, but couldn't be finished. I had the rice, black beans, guacamole and mixed veggies bowl - yummy.

I gave you all a 2nd try. 11-21-2015 @ 12:30PM and was again disappointed. Food was good, very slow service, actually had to stop another waiter to find our server to order dessert, who then approached in a passive aggressive manner. Dropped desert off without a word (yes we will enjoy, thank you) had to ask a different server to clear plates, get more tea. Etc. dropped the bill without saying thank you and avoided eye contact. Im disappointed because I live a block away and there are few vegetarian places in the area. But I cant abide by bad service and attitude.   Note: thank you Cassie for trying to fix the situation. We appreciated all you tried to do.

I was nervous about the service situation after reading other reviews but clearly the Pomegranate gang listened to feedback. We were greeted as we walked in and the young lady explained our choices to sit or order at the counter.  The menu was eclectic and had something for everyone as long as no one was dying for bacon. The daily scramble was tasty and filling. Despite the fact I was a square banker in a hippy kingdom, I very much enjoyed the experience and will be back.

Food is good- not the best vegan food I've tried because I've been very a few times and sometimes it's a hit or miss.  Once I got the avocado sandwich and the eggs were pretty oily (I'm hoping it wasn't better). Today, I got the naked burger with the green goddess patty which is yummy but slightly undercooked the potato wedges.  Price- a bit high for the portions (smoothies) and sizes sometimes, however the naked burger plate came with a lot!  I'll still come back but sometimes the food quality varies. Great for vegetarians, vegans or/and anyone interested in trying delicious whole food meals!

If I could give this place 6 stars, I would!  Tasty? Indulgent? Doesn't-taste-like-it's-vegi/vegan? Check, Check, Check!!  Honestly I have probably never been more emphatic about a restaurant.  This quaint little shop (although it has been expanded) has a wonderful vibe, and you are able to see just how fresh their food is. Their chalkboard of daily specials welcomes you and their glass-door refrigerators remind you that you are eating fresh, whole, and unaltered vegetables and fruits.  The cashier is knowledgeable, friendly, and greeted with a smiling face.  I ordered the Strawberry Rhubarb French Toast and a cup of the daily soup: Curried Sweet Potato. (I'm a sucker for anything sweet potato.)  I sat down with my number and waited for my food. Both dishes arrived shortly, and my mouth watered at their sight.  The french toast (banana bread with the rhubarb jam and whipped cream) was likely the best french toast I've ever had. I used to have a favorite place for french toast, but this plate left it in the dust. The banana bread was moist, thick, and came with delicious fresh strawberries. Not too sweet, and the light rhubarb jam complemented the thick banana bread to a tee. Unlike other new and healthy restaurants, the portions were not tiny and unfilling. On the contrary, I would think most people would split the order of french toast. I just wish I had come on a day with a special french toast on the menu!  The sweet potato soup was sweet, creamy, and the curry flavors accented it wonderfully.   To finish things off, I couldn't leave without trying one of their tempting cakes! I spoke with one of the owners for a while (who is wonderful), and based on her recommendation I tried the mango and blackberry raw cheesecake. Not only did this cheesecake not taste like it had no dairy, but it likely tops other cheesecakes I have tried.  I can only hope this place stays in business for years to come. When it comes to nutrition, it is vital for restaurants to be completely aware of what they are serving, for them to strive to bring patrons healthy meals, and have fun doing it! Pomegranate Cafe does not fall short; I will be back soon!

I have eaten at Pomegranate 4 or 5 times since it originally opened. I have never, NEVER, gotten my food in under 35 minutes. Keep in mind I generally order for myself, and at most, one other person. Recently I was made to wait nearly an hour for 2 sandwiches. I was one of 3 other people in the restaurant, and I was asked two times after paying what I had ordered. They offered me a "couple of desserts for the wait." Instead I received a single bite sized cookie. The food isn't terrible when they actually make what you ask ( I have asked for no olives on my salads 3 times, and always end up with olives) but it certainly isn't worth the price, or the time it takes. I have wasted several lunch breaks at Pomegranate. I've given this place way too many chances.
I loved this place !!! Food is fresh and delicious!! Menu is original, with many choices to please a family of four! Best cheesecake I had!!! Staff is nice and efficient, and very cool ambiance.

Walked in after I was done visiting the Ace hardware next door. I asked if the lot happened to have a menu that I could take, which if they didn't have I wouldn't have minded, but the hostess/cashier just looked at me with shock and confusion and told me I could look online. I ordered a 5 dollar pomegranate refresher (are you serious about that price?!). Wasn't that impressed with the drink or the service. Won't be back to try this.
Great restaurant concept!  The food was super healthy and very yummy... I'm coming back soon.

Found this awesome spot on my way to Trader Joes. First off, let me just say how impressed I am with the friendliness of the staff. Very trendy ambiance and perfect if you're into natural, healthy, vegan, and local sources.

I am not usually one to post reviews but I just had to say something after my experience here. I was visiting the area and looking for something healthy and new to try so I thought I'd check this place out. Wasn't sure what to order but the girl working, I believe her name was Shannon, recommended the ab&j smoothie. IT WAS AMAZING!! Not only was the smoothie one of the best I've ever had but Shannon was unbelievably friendly and welcoming. I'll be in the area a couple more days and definitely plan on going back because of my experience!

This place is amazing!! I'm so glad that I work close to a place that serves such delicious veg/vegan food. I have to say, it's pricey for what it is, but if you want to eat well, it's worth it. I had the Kale salad with an organic Arnold Palmer (it's not on the menu--I asked them to mix it for me). Both were delicious. It's one of those places where you pay, get a number, and pick a table where they come bring your food. The staff is very friendly and attentive. They came by a few times to see if I needed anything, and even offered me free refills. I'd come back here any day to try more items on their menu, but I'd probably have to limit it to about once a week. My lunch came out to $18 the last time I was there (not quite sure how though).   Overall, give this great place a shot if you don't mind your wallet taking a little bit of a hit. The veg/vegan options are among the best I've ever had.

Who owns this place? Met a friend, was first in line and then watched as a table of 4 and another table of 2 was seated while I waited. I ordered the hummus plate and waited over an hour and 10 minutes. My friend ordered tacos and got those about an hour in. The worst service ever. Food was nothing special. I WILL NOT return and I honestly wonder how they stay open. Lots of bad reviews. They deserve a big fat zero! As a professional I think this is a very poorly managed place with poor communication between staff. Not sure how anything comes together. They need to get a clue!

Contradiction: A vegan joint in Tukee? Flavorful AND Healthy? Good for you AND fills you up? Healthy pastries and desserts? Yup.   A locally owned restaurant in the middle of a strip mall that looks pro enough that it could be a franchise. But its comfy and calming. Everyone was friendly and helpful and it was nice to see the owner working behind the counter with her troops.   The food: This vegan had the breakfast burritos AND the Philly sandwich. Affordable -- about $10 per dish. Great drinks with juiced veggies and fruits. I had the cucumber celery apple drink called the Refresher. I had the tofu and vegan cheese in my burro which was great. The bread on my Philly was the right texture and everything flavorfully complimented each other. The dishes are creative and unique -- so much more than salads.   She had the french toast with berry compote and real maple syrup and it was all gone pretty quick. Her Adventure drink was very yummy as well.   The vegan chocolate chip cookies were a great way to wrap up the brunch.   I am definitely coming back here again and again. They've only been open since the beginning of the year. They want to expand to organic wines and dinner times. I'm looking forward to that.
You want fresh food and friendly service. Stop by the POM. Had the raw nori az roll and a snickers. Very satisfied. Tons of healthy choices to go around. I'll be back.

The interior looks like a semi-carrying estrogren crashed into the place, I mean it's nice if you are a female or a dad with a daughter who wants to discuss her life problems in a girly environ.  if you aren't and have a pastel phobia, then don't go in, just order out.  on to the food and drinks...our drinks with whisky in it were dope, the water fly cause of the cumber, and the nachos fresh as H E double hockey sticks.  Even the chicken wings were on point- like real but not quite.  Their food deserves an ovation, totally fleck.  Overall it's reps well and I'd go back again...especially at happy hour.  Yo dang ...yo check this out yo, I almost forgot try out their desserts, so yummy.  (See what I mean about the estrogen thing, it's contagious)

I REALLY want to like this place. I've tried numerous times! Their food is delicious.. especially their cakes, oh my. But seriously, the staff is not the friendliest, (at least the times that I have gone), and the service is extremely slow! :( I just can't get past that. Service is just as important as the food being served!

There is nothing better than fresh, flavorful and healthy food. My family visit the Ahwatukee area several times a year and this is our favorite place. My husband is here every day. The daily specials are always delicious and the smoothies are our favorites. The Green Warrior is my "go to" for breakfast or lunch, and The Cali salad is another meal I look forward to. Come to think of it, I've never had anything at Pomegranate that wasn't superb.  The service here is consistent and caring, and friendly. And- I think it's the best food in the area.

I jumped in here without even realizing much about this café and found it to be so charming! My son and I were both starving and we didn't want to go anywhere else and we are not vegetarians!! So we took the plunge and try to couple different things on the menu and we were both delighted. I have to say I loved the nachos! I would recommend this to anybody who likes food because they take the utmost care to put the right seasoning and the veggie combinations together to make a delightful dinner. Service and atmosphere were amazing!

I'm not even vegan/vegetarian. But this place is delicious and earthy. Trendy decor and very eclectic range of people. I feel healthier when I eat here. It's just sooo pricey. I get one smoothie, burrito & cookie for $30!!!!  That's a little outrageous. And the service is always SLOW. But friendly!!!!!

We were visiting from Tucson and decided to give it a try. The food was completely amazing! Like I told the waiter. It was worth the wait. It was Valentine's Day so it was crazy busy. But I am sure that if we would of come on a regular day we would of had the best time here. The manager was so friendly and and the staff was so kind. We had the raw tacos. And the chicken tacos. Give those a Try! So good!

Don't get the spicy vegan chicken breakfast burrito. Too hot to taste any other flavor. I think it would have been good otherwise. The hash was great! I liked the cucumber slices in the free water (I am too cheap to buy a juice for 10 bucks). Also, coffee was self serve and we sat outside, so a friend with bad knees passed on buying coffee in light of that journey.  The staff was nice.

This is an example of current high-end dining in the modern world. Forget the expensive snobby restaurants that charge $40 or $50 bucks for an entrée. The intellectual "earth conscious" choice for the evolved connoisseur of dining out is vegan.   Wake up to the only way to save humanity. Go vegan.

This is my mom's favorite restaurant in Phoenix so we always make a point to come here from North Phoenix for her birthday/Mother's Day. This year was no exception. We hadn't been in a while so didn't know a) they take reservations and b) they had expanded.   We knew being Mother's Day it would likely be very busy. As expected we walked into a very crowded restaurant. The hostess let us know it would be about 45 mins so we decided to grab a few drinks at the counter. We ordered three different coffee drinks (I forget what they were called but they were very good). Within 10 min of being there they had a table outside for us. We were pleasantly surprised!  They had a specific menu for Mother's Day so we split the mesquite pancakes (huge portions but honestly wasn't my favorite), tacos and burrito (both of those were delicious). Portions are always way bigger than we remember (definitely could have just ordered two meals for the three of us). And desserts are always on point (we typically get something chocolate to take home). We love that most everything is healthy, vegan, organic and gluten-free. We just wish they would open another location in north Phoenix!

This place is great, unless you're in a rush. The food is delicious, fresh, organic, and local. It's all vegan and vegetarian fare with lots of gluten-free options. On top of this, everything tastes great.  The biggest drawback is how painfully slow the service is. Getting seated and placing orders takes no time at all, but be prepared to wait a good while for your food to get to you.

I LOVE the food here.  It is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for.  It's a little nosy inside so I would rather sit outside if it's not too hot or cold.  I'm not really sure how they can make it less noisy.  The chairs and tables and unique which is cool but they wobble sometimes because they are made from different types of material.  All in all, amazing place and I'll make special trips from the west valley just to go here.

I'm have been vegan for many years & am very cautious about GMO's & avoid them at all cost. With that being said, I absolutely love that most everything at Pomegranate Cafe is vegan & organic & bonus stars for the raw options. I went there the first time towards the end of October & I had some kind of a burrito. I ate the whole thing, it was delicious. I then ordered a caramel coconut drink from their coffee menu along with a desert. Everything was delicious. After I was finished m I went to the bathroom to wash my hands & I am not sure what happened but shortly after I came out, I got nauseated. I puked all my lunch which is way odd for me to so b/c I NEVER vomit/puke or anything. Not even when I  sick. Maybe I was so excited I ate too quick & too much? I don't know. Another weird thing that happened was, during our lunch, I asked to keep one of the menus b/c I wanted to continue browsing through (it was my first time there) I was told I couldn't b/c they were short of menus. LOL. Odd. Then a few minutes later she gave me back the menu. Alrighty. Ha!!  My B/F said that we should not come back b/c he was sure it was the food that made me sick but I refused to believe. We went back again a couple of weeks later & I had he raw tacos. They were good. We had a good experience. Except when I ordered my caramel coconut drink from the coffee menu, it didn't taste the same as last time. Like AT ALL. I ended up throwing it away. But, overall, a nice experience.  My 3rd visit just a couple of weeks ago, I ordered the French toast and was very disappointing. There was nothing French toast about this French toast. It was a pastry, like banana bread. Totally didn't even eat it. Had a few bites but that's it. I did order the organic scramble & it was super delicious.  4 stars for now.

This is my favorite place in Arizona, The staff is lovely and they put so much love in their food I highly recommend to drive to this place even though its miles away! Its worth every dollars you spend. Thank you for making my birthday so special every year

The wait is always long (no matter what time I go it seems!), but the food is worth the wait. My favorite dish is the vegan nachos...I have gotten it a few times and it never disappoints! Do not come to this restaurant if you are in a rush or have less than an hour to spare, because you will be stressed by the wait. Last two times I've gone, it's been about 1.5 - 2 hrs between arrival time, finally being seated, and then waiting for our order to be taken and then waiting for our order to arrive and finally being able to eat our food.

Fresh organic ingredients, you can't beat. The place is pricey but the quality is there. If you like fresh squeezed juice this is your place, plus the omelets actually have real veggies in them. It's an eclectic spot with good vegan and organic options. The wife luvs the raw desserts...

Update: Finally came back to try the Mac and Cheez for happy hour and I was pleasantly surprised. I was not expecting it to be the Jalapeño one so when they brought it out I was off guard but it was very delicious! Rick was really friendly and provided great service! I will be coming back!
Solid food, I had the breakfast burrito enchilada style. Phenomenal selection vegan food that taste really good. Service was great prompt and timely. What an awesome little café.

This place has a cool ambiance, very modern and a bit hipster. They have cold brew on tap, which is a big plus in my book. the food overall was very average. I had the Arizona wrap and Anna had another wrap. We both thought they were very average at best. The kids had french toast that was very good. I wouldn't come here again unless I was with vegetarians they wanted to come.

This place is simply great. You can tell a lot of love and consideration goes into every meal. They have vegetarian, vegan, and non-vegetarian options for a TONNE of their dishes, and regardless of your preference, you won't be dissatisfied! Go on then, go try it! :)

First time at this place. One of my daughters who's a vegan recommended it and made reservation for Mother's Day brunch. The place was totally packed and we had to wait a few extra minutes to be sited, but we got a complementary doughnuts hols out of it( the hostess came to us apologizing and offered them to us as a reward for our patience) it was really nice of her.  The food was delicious. The only one who wasn't satisfied was my husband but he is not vegetarian so it doesn't count lol.  Waiter was already kind of tiered on that busy day, which is understandable, there was lots of big parties at the same time. But he was still very pleasant and polite  Overall we had a very nice time and very delicious food for Mother's Day!  Would definitely come back just with my daughter so we can enjoy our vegan food. It is really hard to find a nice place that serves tasty vegetarian/vegan dishes with lots of varieties.  Will definitely recommend.
Absolute favorite vegan restaurant ever! Delicious food, locally sourced ingredients, friendly staff, and environmentally conscious owners. This place is a gem!

Yet again, Pomegranate did not disappoint! The carrot, strawberry lemonade was fantastic, peach and strawberry pancakes with pecans and soy whipped cream were heavenly, and the veggie wrap with avocados and salsa was exceptional! Service was quick and friendly. Atmosphere relaxing and whimsical. Spot on!  PS. I've noticed some reviewers writing how expensive Pomegranate Cafe is...so I must point out that fresh, locally grown, organic, brilliantly concocted food is never cheap! If you are looking for not organic, not local, not healthy, inexpensive fast food- perhaps go somewhere like MC Donald's.

Very bland and very overpriced. Would not recommend this place.   The service took FOREVER (20mins and you pay at the counter) and the food was entirely trying to be too trendy and lacked in all aspects.  Pass.

My friend and I accidentally came here for brunch after weekend hike. Little did we know it was Vegan/Vegetarian. Now, I'm not Vegan/Vegetarian but am open to trying different things. Everything in this cute little cafe is organic or local bought. I ordered the breakfast burrito and added egg to it. It was filled with egg, black beans, kale, and sweet potato. They gave me a side of tortilla chips and salsa on the side with it. The burrito was just okay. It was wrapped very loosely - Everything was falling out. The beans were undercooked and hard. If I didn't add the egg, I don't think it would have really tasted like a burrito at all. The fresh apple slices on the side of my plate were soggy, old and seemed like it was soaked in lemon water for days. My friend ordered one of their sandwiches. It looked much more appetizing.   Our server was friendly and happy, just slow.   Environment: 5/5 Food: 2/5 Price: 3/5 Service: 4/5

I was so happy to hear Pomegranate was opening a central Phoenix location! They did a great job putting this restaurant together.   They have one of the best pastry cases at all times, full of vegan/gluten free goodness!! Along with their coffee menu, it's the perfect place to grab a drink and a treat.   I have been here for breakfast and lunch, and fully enjoyed every meal. The raw bagel sandwich is one of my favorites, their salads and wraps are also delicious! Today I got an iced super food hot chocolate (my favorite drink here, usually add coconut whip cream on top) and a Brazilian nut raw cacao brownie. I was so satisfied with both orders, the brownie was sweet but not overly sweet and had a great texture.   Service was very friendly! Asked a few times how we were doing as we sat and enjoyed our treats and came around with water promptly. I love this place!
Food is excellent but pretty long wait for two bowls.  The quality and freshness was on point.  Prices are high but this isn't fast food or some franchise with pre-packaged heat and serve meals.

This place is absolutely awesome.  I can't believe I have waited this long to make a review.  I am super lucky as I own a building down the street that I have to manage on a regular basis.  I always am stopping by here to get breakfast, lunch, a drink in between meals.  I've had a lot on the menu but some of the highlights are the tamale pie, the raw tacos are delish, the kale and cobb salads are great.  The drink menu is also plentiful, some of my favorites are the green abundance drink and the green coffee drink with berries.  The breakfast burritos are also filling and really fresh.  The prices are more expensive than other places but when you look at the quality of the food and care that goes into making their dishes it's totally worth it.  The only thing I would knock them on ( and I won't because the food is 6 stars) is the time it takes to get your order.  I've also been given other people's orders by mistake.  They are always nice about it but as they have become more popular over the years they seem to have a hard time keeping up.  Oh and lastly the deserts are really good and reasonably priced considering they are raw and generous portions.  I take them to go and they go a long way to satisfy a sweet tooth cravings you may have.  In my case I don't normally have deserts but I don't miss having one here.  They are fantastic.  I am super happy to support this place and hope they keep doing well as there is no substitute out there.

I'm not a vegan, but I thoroughly enjoyed the tempeh bacon in my Lumberjack sandwich I had for brunch.  I got the side of potatoes with the pomegranate BBQ, but I wasn't a fan of the sauce.  I switched it out for the spicy "cheese" dipping sauce, much better.  It was a great breakfast, I'd def go back there again.

I hadn't been to Pomegranate Cafe in a while. but was really craving a Cassie latte. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in and saw how much they had grown! I was so overwhelmed but one of the pastry chefs walked me through the menu and the yummy pastry case. She helped me find the most healthy options for my needs. She was very patient and knowledgeable.  I will be sure to go back more often now!

What an amazing place! It really overexceeded my expectations, everything on the menu sounded delicious and unfortunately I could only choose one thing! I came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty crowded but it took no time to get us seated. I got French toast and pineapple melon lemonade and it was amazing!! My only complaint is that the prices are crazy expensive, $6 for the lemonade and $12 for the French toast! I suppose this is the price you pay for a quality meal, but make sure your wallet is prepared!

This was my first time here and the food was AMAZING. The service on the other hand was terrible. Our server was rude. She had a stale face from beginning to end. We went to pay and were inquiring about the desserts and my friend asked what flavor of cake there was. In a rude tone she stated that they closed an hour ago and the pastry chef was gone, so we couldn't buy any. We understand you're trying to close but when there are still three other tables who just got their meals, you would think that she would  be able to answer a simple question. To top it off she kept rolling her eyes. I don't think I will ever come back here. This was absolutely ridiculous. It pained me to even leave a tip for such a sourpuss.

I have been an infrequent customer (due to the location) for almost five years.  Back then, they had odd hours, small staff, but the food was beyond belief.  I recall the best vegan nut nog possible. The high prices were worth the months of fond food recollection. I decided the other day to order one to go, however, this time the nog was bitter, chunky, and a complete waste of $8.  I threw it in the garbage once I got home. I have noticed other menu items that no longer meet the praise I have been dishing out to my friends so I will stop recommending your restaurant. I'm sure there is still plenty of good food but this is supposed to be THE place for food purists, IMO.    UPDATE  I'm happy to report that on subsequent visits since my mediocre review last year I have been generally very happy with this restaurant. They made my last complaint right and I support their mission to creat great vegan food. I can't give 5 stars yet because I feel portion sizes for the price are a little small but I'm glad Pomegranate is around supporting local foodies.  Keep up the good work!

So, I'm a carnivore, or at least I thought I was.  Never in my life would I have thought food that had no meat in it could be this darn good.  I have had the Lumberjack and the Dragon bowl and loved them both.  The staff is always friendly, despite my many, many questions.  I tried this place because of all the great reviews and wanted to be opened minded.  I am blown away guys, thanks for showing me that meatless meals can be filling, satisfying, and delicious!

Pomegranate is my favorite restaurants. I am consistently impressed by the high quality of their foods, the different specials, the customer service, and the atmosphere. As a vegan, it is hard to find restaurants to eat at, and even harder to find ones that are packed full of whole food ingredients and made on-site. An example of their exceptional customer service was on this past Mother's Day, when we did not have a reservation (and the restaurant was packed), but the workers made a point to help us find a place to sit anyways and were very accomodating to my mother's food allergies.   My last visit, I shared an amazing slice of chocolate cake (very rich and surprisingly like the non-vegan variety), two delicious juices, the raw tacos, and a loaded baked potato quesadilla. Both entrees came with an amazing kale salad. In the past, I have had brunch and dinner.   If you are looking for a healthy, satisfying (you won't leave hungry) and appropriately priced (when you consider the value you get) meal, come to Pomegranate!

I seriously love this place. I'm not Vegan but have an autoimmune disorder and try to eat plant based as much as possible. I have been to the Central Phoenix location twice in the last week and had two different entrees and one dessert. I can say that it was all delicious with no associated guilt. One entree is two complete meals for me. The portions are not skimpy.   After reading the reviews, I had to chuckle at the comments: the gravy that tasted like cashews and although not liking cashews the person still orders it and was disappointed it tasted like cashews and not actual non-vegan gravy; the walnuts that don't taste identical to actual meat; a vegan restaurant that doesn't cater to carnivores, but you still decided to go and were upset that there was no actual meat on the menu.  To clarify, this is a VEGAN restaurant besides the few dishes that you can get with eggs. If you love plant based food that tastes great, this is your place. If you are looking to eat meat or food that is not plant based, or want junk-food and/or bar food, it's probably not the place for you. Trust me, we all want a cheat meal here and there.  I am seriously grateful to have this place in my neighborhood, because it makes it easy for me to stick to my dietary restrictions when I don't feel like cooking, or if I want to eat out and not modify everything on the menu to exclude dairy, wheat, gluten, etc...

Two words... FUDEGE PEPPERMINT PANCAKES!  Oh wait, that's three. My friend and I went for their extended brunch menu and it was the special. You know me, mint and chocolate are bffs when together. It was absolutely delicious.   I appreciate they have vegan options, yet, offer real eggs for omnivores like me. Also, had a pear sangria type of drink and posted a picture. Super cute pear wedge that is heart shaped too.   Def want to be back asap!
Brunch was wonderful.  I love that there are so many choices for vegans for breakfast. All of the baked goods are vegan, too!

So I've never found this restaurant by searching for local vegan places but it did come up because my co-worker was frazzled and needed WiFi if he was going to eat lunch. My being Vegan, this worked out really well.  He had the elephant bowl and a green apple lime refresher.  He was happy with both, the food is pricey but the quantity is good for 2 servings. I had the bountiful bowl which was a little bland but they have some nice hot sauce which spiced it right up.  The quinoa was cooked just right and I was very satisfied with my meal.  We will definitely go again, the Wifi was good too!

Love the energy & food. I need to go here more often! Service is spectacular! I could definitely become a regular. I love that they have coconut cream for the nitrous coffee... Keep up the PALEO options!

My husband n I are visiting the area. Decided to try it out. Well all we tried was the water. The waiter was to busy talking to coworkers to ask if we would like coffee or smithing else to drink. He said "oh your first time here, I will be back". Leaves water n walks off to chat with coworkers. After a good 5 Minutes n no acknowledgment from anyone we walked out. According to my daughter in law they also had bad service there in November and didn't care for the food. So I guess he saved us from this over priced restaurant.

I would have rated this a 5* if not for the prices. The food is tasty & delicious & presented nicely, the atmosphere is casual, trendy, bright & cheerful. I love this place because it is vegan/vegetarian. We had 4 different meals between us and 2 smoothies and dessert to go. Everything was wonderful and the service was prompt & pleasant. We will come back for special occasions, but due to the prices ($10-12 for a smoothie, $25-30 per person), we won't be regulars.

My friend took me here. It's vegan and organic. The food here is phenomenal. We came for brunch, You can't go wrong with any entrée you get really. The pancakes here are so fluffy and so filling. Make sure you share, it's big. Oh and the Chilliquiles. Omg. It was AMAZING. Blue chips, beans, tofu and HOT SAUCE ON TOP. oh yessss. I wouldn't mind eating this for breakfast lunch and dinner.   They have great pastries here as well. Kinda sweet for my taste buds but when I do... it's good.  But why is it so farrrr. lol. The 20 min drive is worth it though.
Great place, atmosphere and customer service. The food was really amazing especially their drinks! If you ever go or live in Arizona I highly recommend this place!
Really good. Will come again. One star off for the confusing order counter vs. sit down.

I still love the food at Pomegranate. It is by far some of the best vegan food around. That gets 5 stars from me.   The service though really can be frustrating. I have been coming here a lot on the past year and service seems really hit or miss.  The food always brings me back, but I think the food saves them. Based on service I probably would have stopped coming.   There seems to be a lot of confusion with the staff. Incorrect to go orders, bringing me my cheesecake to go while I'm waiting outside and telling me that the rest of my food is going to be 15 minutes. Can you imagine what 15 minutes outside waiting in 100 degrees will do to my dessert?  Um it's going to melt.    Staff is trying, but not all of them seem like they have a clue. It comes off as too chill, too hippy dippy, not professional, and less than a 5 star worthy rating.  I want to see them take it up a notch and have the quality of service match the food.

So... I think Pomegranate and I might have more than a spring fling. I don't want to jinx it, but this could be really serious. I introduced Pomegranate to my mom, my best friends, and even my current boyfriend, but everyone agrees, they can see me spending the rest of my life with Pomegranate. Here's my recount of our classic love story, one dish at a time.  I knew I'd fallen after tasting the Strawberry Rhubarb French Toast (griddle-dipped banana bread, drizzled in rhubarb sauce, strawberries, and topped with cream) Then, the Tiramisu (coconut-based espresso, cream, and date-nut crust layers) sent me head over heels. The Breakfast Burrito left me satisfied, but didn't create that same spark that the flavorful Ranchero Skillet once did. Luckily, the hemp milk latte and famous cowgirl cookie quickly helped me remember why I committed to Pomegranate in the first place.  Our relationship moved to a new level - raw - a few months ago. The rainbow wrap was ridiculously huge and filling (much more so than the basic, but tasty, Mediterranean wrap). It was almost more than I could handle. I tossed the bland Indian sweet potato hummus it came with and focused on what really mattered... finishing the wrap. I cared too much not to. After stuffing myself into oblivion, Pomegranate surprised me with a coffee-choco-nana & coconut milk ice cream shake afterward... topped with crushed chocolate-almond pillows. Within seconds of my first spoonful, the fire was back, and burning hotter than ever.  Shortly afterwards, I fell into a confused rut, messing around with vegan meats and cheeses of all varieties. The southwestern mac 'n' cheese, much like the Philly cheese steak, tantalized me with its decadence, but left me feeling sick and low afterwards. Even the delicious, nutritious teriyaki chicken bowl, brimming with sprouts, veggies and quinoa, was only posing as Mr. Right. Tainted by the presence of faux-chicken, I shied away after only two rendezvouses. Not even dessert could lure me back, for both the chocolate cake (dry) and almond butter square (boring) were a disappointment.  It was all my fault. What was I thinking? A few weeks later, I rushed back, determined to mend the gaping hole in my heart. I downed the mushroom bisque and half a pesto presto sandwich (Kamut baguette, fresh avocado, pesto, fresh veggies) in under five minutes. Oh, how I missed the fresh ingredients, the whole foods, the homemade flavor in every bite. Still, I needed some sugar after being away. Lucky for me, the Cannoli (brûlée'd sugar shell, cashew cream filling, dark chocolate chips, and berry sauce), not only provided that, but was better than any Cannoli I'd ever had. And I've had a fair share of Cannolis in my day. What more can a girl ask for?   Pomegranate, I do.

Sarah H and I came in for lunch today because we've been both wanting to try it for a while.  The restaurant was bustling when we arrived so we waited line and ordered our lunch.  I settled on the Elephant Curry Bowl, recommended by the cashier and Sarah ordered the Daily Burger which was a sweet potato burger today and a pomegranate lemonade.  We took our table market and found a place to sit and chatted while we waited for our food.    Her lemonade came out first.  It looked like the pomegranate was fresh squeezed.  I forget her exact words but something like it was interesting.  She drank most of it, but not all.  Also, the glass of lemonade was on the small side.  Not what I would expect for $3.  Our meals came out and my Elephant Bowl looked good.  Yellow curry with lots of fresh vegetables and brown rice and tofu.  Everything I like.  Maybe I should have just ended the meal there before the disappointment set in. For a curry it was terribly bland and strangely enough made my tongue numb.  I ended up bringing the majority of it home and spiced it up a bit so I could finish it.  I had a bite of Sarah's burger and it was pretty good.  It tasted predominately of sweet potatoes and lentils, but I enjoy both of those.  She had the root vegetable fry's on the side and those were good as well seasoned with rosemary.    I would like to try this place again.  I noticed that many of the reviews were not good for many's first visit but then improved with their second.  It might be good for Abu J with his vegan/supermodel diet.  I'm curious what he'll think of it.

bomb Spaghetti Squash, Mermaid Salad, and burgers!  Also, the PomMilk is delish! Tried the superfood hot chocolate, but found it very thick and too spicy. Regardless, the food was super tasty and had great ingredients.

Creative and great food. I went to several vegetarian restaurants in the area and this was the best so far. I plan on going back several times before I leave. The food is presented in a colorful and beautiful way and tastes great.
Great customer service, beautiful decor, nice greek / american style menu. Visited here for business trip, will definitely return before the trip is over.

I have always wanted to love Pomegrante Cafe, but I have always had hit or miss food and/or service, so I never bothered to return after spring 2013.   In February 2016, after a near 3 year hiatus, I finally gave them another go.  I tried the raw tacos, a couple of street tacos, and a burger slider from their happy hour menu.  The raw taco, served with walnut "meat" was pretty tasty.  Everything else was just ok, and I found pieces of real cheese on my vegan plate, so I was thinking it may be another 3 years before I returned.  However, recently they posted items from their Summer 2016 menu, and I was enticed by their new banana split and hush puppy offerings.  I figured if I keep giving them chances, it'll eventually pay off.    We went during happy hour (which is 3pm-6pm, Mondays through Saturdays) on Friday, 29July16, and ordered a bunch of different things.  TEPARY I'ITOI HUSH PUPPIES - $12: I believe that hush puppies are a southern dish (but I won't swear to that), and from where I come, we love them.  They are fried balls of cornmeal/bread, mixed with onions and sometimes peppers.   My mistake was expecting these to taste like homemade southern hush puppies; they didn't. In their own right, they are pretty good, just not what I was expecting or wanting. Try them for yourself; you may love them! Over-priced.   TU-NUT SALAD SANDWICH - $14:  I omitted the sunflower ranch and tomatoes.  I enjoyed this dish. It was a tasty vegan tuna salad version on warm toasty bread. Only some vegan mayo spread on the bread would make it better. The seasonal side was potato salad, and theirs is pretty good.  Organic or not, for the portion, it was not worth $14; $10 maybe, but not $14.   GILA MONSTER NACHOS - $8 (HAPPY HOUR PRICE): This colorful dish comes with a huge heaping of corn chips, walnut taco "meat", beans, jalapeño, pico, and guacamole (I omitted the queso and sour cream, but the 1st order came out with both, so they had to remake it).  A deliciously satisfying dish which is large enough to share, although you may not want to. The regular price is $12. I would return for this dish any time of the day.  POM BANANA SPLIT - $10: Sliced banana coins, vegan vanilla ice cream scoops, chocolate syrup, caramel, brownies, and coconut whip cream. The description includes a Pomberry syrup, but I didn't see anything resembling berries or berry syrup. This dish was pretty darn good, but it could've been great if the ice cream didn't taste freezer-burnt. Also, the brownie had nuts in it, and this was not mentioned in their menu description.  Luckily, I am not allergic, but those with nut allergies should remember to always ask, as even the healthiest food venues don't always consider allergies when writing their menus.  Being that this dish is large enough to share, $8-$10 seems fair if it's in a perfect state (ice cream not icy and all described ingredients included).    DD got the Maca Magic Smoothie ($10), Napoleon Grilled Cheese Sandwich, with real cheese ($15!!), and the Root Beer float ($10).  She enjoyed the smoothie and drank almost all of it.  She didn't like that grilled cheese sandwich one bit and wasted my $15.  The Root Beer float was a hit; it came with 3 scoops of ice cream and a full bottle of root beer for her to pour herself.  Personally, I think the smoothie and root beer floats should be about $7-$8 each, not $10. The grilled cheese was completely over-priced.    My cousin ordered the BUFFALO HOT WINGS ($10), JAMAICAN CURRY WEDGES ($8 on HH menu; $12 regular price), BBQ Buffalo Wrap ($14), Macro Bowl ($14), Hibiscus Cooler ($6), and a Banana Split as well.  She absolutely loved every single thing that she got, which proves, to each his own.   I tried her Buffalo Hot Wings. The buffalo sauce on the wings was good, but I didn't like the texture of their wings.  She loved them.  I also tried the Jamaican Curry Wedges... LOL! No. I was expecting hella spice and flavor, but as colorful as was the presentation, it failed to deliver. Maybe under another name they wouldn't have been so disappointing? They were not bad, just not what I expected, given the name.  They certainly are not worth the $12 regular menu price. Try for yourself during HH, and save yourself $4.    Even though I wasn't 100% happy with everything, I can appreciate that the food was fresh, filling, and quite tasty.  Table service by Brittany was excellent. She was friendly and attentive without being over-present.    The main downfall, aside from location, is that they are just too expensive. If you get a drink, appetizer, main course and dessert, you're already at $50 per person! This isn't New York and they shouldn't be charging Phoenicians that much, organic or not.

We enjoy the food and ambience. However, recently with breakfast or dinner, it's been long waits to get our food. This wasn't the case before. My wife and I are becoming discouraged about coming here because of the long waits.
We got the Athens Salad and Wild West Tacos. Both were amazing ! My favorite brunch items.
Great food! Great staff. Highly recommend if you're looking for a healthy food option in Ahwatukee.

I really wanted to like this place.  I came in to grab lunch but only had 30 minutes so ordered it to go.   There were a number of people waiting for their to-go orders when I arrived.   After I ordered it soon became apparent that the others had been waiting quite a while and had to keep asking for an ETA on their order.   My order took over 30 minutes to appear and when it did, the to-go container was really dirty.   It appeared to have avocado (???) and something orange-brown smeared on the outside of the box.   When I commented on how bad the box looked the hostess offered to re-wrap my food but by this time I was already late for my meeting.  The smeared food on the container turned me off to the point I didn't even eat the food I ordered.   For a $14 sandwich this was a major fail.
Ahwatukee needs more great businesses just like this one.  Fresh, progressive, customer focused and a can't go wrong menu.

The Pomegranate Cafe is delicious! I love the GF mac n cheese, and the other day I shared an amazing pesto quesadilla on a GF tortilla with vegan cheese with my friend, it was incredible! Pricey but totally worth the trip! Great service and outdoor seating.

The food and drinks are delicious here but the food takes FOREVER. It's consistently INCREDIBLY slow even when the place is pretty much barren. I don't understand why it takes so long but I wouldn't come here unless you have 2 hours to eat/waste.

Omg I don't think words can ever describe how thankful and how happy this place makes me. Everything on the menu is absolutely incredible and don't get me started with their seasonal cakes. Man I don't know how they do it! This place makes a vegan go nuts, it will also make someone that isn't a vegan consider it!!! Incredible my favorite place.

I need to go back to this place to really rate them accurately. All I had here was a cowboy bar, and unfortunately, I wasn't a huge fan.
