It looks like a chocolatey delicious bar and was highly recommended by the staff, but it tasted like oatmeal or something....an overwhelming odd flavor, especially in the after taste. It was 5$ and the husband and I didn't eat it all, so it wasn't a great value. I noticed other items were also very expensive, they had a juice that cost 9$...whoa.  I would want to try other things here, but so far, I'm not totally convinced.
Love this place. The vlt is my fav. The cowgirl cookies are the bomb.

I agree with others who have said that it is a tremendously rough start for this location.    First, the physical space looks fantastic--big, open, airy, bright.   Second, I love what they're trying to do!  Sustainable food, not a lot of fake, overly processed fake meats, etc.   But basically everything else this morning was a bust.  After being seated, we waited TEN MINUTES for our drink order to be taken--without water on the table, even.  It was a Sunday morning and steadily busy but in no way slammed.  Multiple servers walked past us multiple times.  Eventually, when my husband's coffee was brought the server said, "We're making a new pot but this is what was left in the old one" and put down a cup about 1/3 full.  After lots of waiting, I feel like we could have certainly waited five more minutes rather than getting the dregs.   Then, she couldn't explain to me why the biscuits and gravy had to come with egg or tofu--and the menu made them (eggs/tofu) sound like a side. When they came, I liked my meal but my husband...who ordered the seasonable scramble did NOT.    Really steep prices as well.   He tried to order a $13 mimosa (on the menu) but was told they don't have their liquor license yet.  Fine, but maybe don't put it on the menu.  The people sitting next to us ended up leaving after the first two things they ordered were not available!  We're so sad about this and likely will not be back.

Soooo, this is one of my favorite places to eat in the Phoenix area and have watched it grow almost since it's inception...Food is always super fresh and delicious! Sometimes the food has taken a bit, but well worth the wait.  Plus they started bringing out chips and salsa which made me almost forget I had food coming because the salsa was SO good.  Needless to say I have brought many friends/family/carnivores here and NOT ONE of them was disappointed.
My favorite place to eat in Ahwatukee. Only down side is its expensive. But you get great food and s large quantity.  Their homemade desserts are amazing as is everything I have tried there.

We just switched to vegan/plant-strong, so we were excited (and perhaps a bit hesitant) to attempt our first outing into the world of not being in control of cooking our own food. This visit left me comforted that there was at least one excellent vegan restaurant nearby ... AND affirmed our decision to embrace this new way of eating!   I'll start out with the one (potential) negative for us -- it was on the pricey side. My wife and I eat had a standard lunch entree (me -- Elephant Curry Quinoa/Tofu Bowl; her -- Tacos Vivas & Kale Salad), and we shared a smoothie of the day (Blood-Builder -- beet, carrot, OJ, mango, pineapple), and the ticket was $30+. Now, I'm not complaining - it was wonderful food (see my much longer list of positives below!) and huge portions, but still a bit more than I would have typically expected to pay for a weekday lunch for 2. Perhaps -- and I can probably believe it -- vegan/vegetarian is going to consistently cost us more now when we go out ... and if so, and if you're used to this, then this pricing probably wasn't out of the ballpark at all. So, with that in mind, and assuming this to be the case, I didn't let this negatively impact my rating. Will we be back?! Undoubtedly, and most likely often!   Now, for the positives!   Great atmosphere -- Very inviting. Casual and informal. We visited at what was probably the height of the lunch rush on a Friday. Pretty consistent traffic, and tables were available but at a premium. A little loud, but comfortable and simply attributable to people enjoying their meals and each other's company.   Excellent menu -- I was impressed with the variety offered. Choices were described creatively and yet were easily understood. Even us newbie vegans had some questions, though, and the staff were quick to answer and provide input. Granted, it was our first visit, but I really had difficulty deciding what to order, as many options intrigued me. I was completely satisfied with my final choice (Elephant Curry Tofu Bowl) -- hit the spot on a chilly January day in Phoenix! A HUGE selection of smoothies, including a couple of-the-day options. We passed on dessert, but the display case was filled with enticing options, too!   Portion size/value -- My wife and I both were impressed with the portion size. I finished mine (no surprise) but probably could have stopped sooner and been satisfied (did I mention it was SO good, though?!). Her purple-cabbage-bowl tacos were even larger, however, and absolutely overflowing with walnut meat, greens, avocado, and a spicy baja sauce. (Can't wait to test out the walnut "meat" with our girls soon...!) She had to leave most of one behind (yes, she did offer it to me, but even I was too stuffed by this point.   Visual appeal -- Everything in the place screamed "fresh" and "healthy" and "natural"! From what ended up on our table (the bright yellow of my curry, the rich purple of my wife's cabbage bowls, and the vibrant magenta of our beet smoothie), to what kept distracting me as they were delivered to a nearby table (huge, freshly layered burgers, piled-high sandwiches, other multi-hued smoothies), and the little peeks behind the counter to the cooler filled with fresh produce and the boatload of fresh veggies and fruit that kept going into the juicer/blender. It really was a smorgasbord for the senses. (My wife and I laughed about previous visual experiences at other "restaurants" like Taco Bell, Olive Garden, etc. ... so sad what we've contented ourselves with as a culture.)   Fun factor -- Again, the place was fun and kitschy. Nothing fancy, but clean and bright and full of life. Smoothies are all served in mason-jar-like containers. Tables and chairs are an eclectic mishmash. Self-serve flavored water (cucumber+carrot, I believe?) was a nice touch.   All in all, I loved it. I left feeling good about my meal, good about how I had just invested my time and resources, good about supporting people who obviously cared about what and how they invest in their world, and good about our decision to change the way we eat/live.   Already looking forward to our next visit! (And maybe also to taking a swing at mimicking that curry bowl here at home ... wish me luck!!)

My cousin introduced me to Pomegranate and now I'm moving to AZ and into the neighborhood so I can regularly get my fix. I love eating and then feeling amazing afterward and that's what happens here.   Follow them on Facebook if you dare ... it will give you cravings like you won't believe! Everything looks amazing and tastes even better! Fresh, crisp, fruity, savory - whatever you're in the mood for they've got it.   My favorites: the everything "bagel", the daily quesadilla, and the homemade snickers bar. YUM!
This place is worth coming to check out! Very nice atmosphere and good quality food. You don't have to be vegan to enjoy the Pom Burger. I also got the young americano, very tasty!

This place is a vegan's dream come true! Everything on the menu is vegan by default and if you want dairy, you have to request it! the menu is pretty sizeable and includes everything from french toast for breakfast to some sweet treats for dessert! I had the Chick-un wrap which comes with a vegan aioli and some really delicious marinated kale, avocado, and a bunch of other yummy stuff. For dessert I gave their cheesecake a try, which was....eh. I also had their version of an almond joy which was awesome! They also have some pretty delcious looking cookies. The service was good and I'll definitely be back.

I'm in love! Their brunch options are fabulous for vegans (yay for me!) and omnivores (yay for most people I take with me!). I am crazy about the Lumberjack breakfast sandwich with tofu and vegan cheese, their breakfast burrito is amazing and kept me full all day. I try to get there once a week at least and always treat myself to one of their yummy vegan desserts. The raw cheesecake is to die for, their cupcakes are fantastic (I even got some from their wonderful pastry chef for my birthday and they were a HUGE hit with friends). I can't recommend them enough!

Fantastic place.  The food is wonderful and the service is friendly and helpful.  They are passionate about the product and it really shows.   The atmosphere is very bright and cheerful.  Left here feeling full and happy!

Ok so I've been back here several times. Still love it. Their daily specials are amazing, I love the rotating sides and smoothies. They have a green smoothie (can't remember the name) that is amazing! I took my mom here for Mother's day and they gave all the mom's mimosas :) love it. I just wish they weren't so spendy... I'm but a poor college student, trying to eat vegan when I can!

Pomegranate's is a really awesome vegetarian/vegan place, even for us meat eaters out there.  They really do a fantastic job of keeping their food flavorful and interesting, it almost makes including meat in your food seem like cheating.  I had the supreme burrito and have to recommend it as it really was delish.  While the menu may seem daunting at first and all the 'meat' in quotes seems odd, you get over it real quick once you get your food and get a taste.  If you are like me and tend to stay away from vegan places, this is defiantly the one to risk it at!  The coffee here is also good.  Now that we've had many years of the Starbucks $5 espresso drinks, the price point seems reasonable and you will find much better quality here than at a mass market place.  They also have some really interesting vegan 'cream' that is quite good.  Also, good hint for those looking for food they will recognize.  Head over before 2pm for breakfast/brunch.  Their egg based dishes are excellent, tasty and completely reasonable for those seeking traditional protein.  Only warning, the price point is a little above our normal range!  It just seems like more of a $12 instead of $18 place to me, but not enough to knock it down a star since you won't be able to find a legit comparison point.  It really is unique so give it a try and decide for yourself.

The food was amazing!  The service was horrible!  One waitress for the entire restaurant...although it was not packed it was too much for one person.  She had zero sense of urgency.... she was very sweet, but it was not a good experience.  It took forever for our (two) drinks to be made and when we finally did get them... the wine was in a dirty glass... I had to take it up to the bar myself as the waitress was taking forever to get back to our table. When we finally did get our food (it was worth the wait) but the poor service was definitely the down side of the evening.  This place could be fabulous... but they have to step up their service!

Im not vegan or vegetarian but I just might be someday because of this cafe. Curious about all types of cuisine, I gave Pom a try one day a few years ago and I have been back several times since. They even deserve some credit for inspiring me to eat healthier and switch to mostly plant based proteins. Above all else, their food is just really tasty. Everything is from scratch and is well seasoned and flavored - not something you find very much in this city unfortunately. Even as a meat eater their food is so good that I never feel like I am missing it. They do serve eggs and dairy cheese for breakfast if you prefer. The breakfast burrito here is one of the best I've had. Can't recommend Pom enough, just wish it was cheaper.

I am from out of town staying in lovely AZ for 3 months so it has been fun to explore the different food offering that this sunny state offers.  Pomegranate has to be one of my favorites.  I am on a strict diet of no sugar, gluten, dairy, grains, beans, etc. so mainly a vegan diet (doctor ordered) so finding this gem was a god sent.  My first time at the cafe I had an Athena Wrap which was actually suppose to be a bowl since I cant have grains but that was my fault because you are given options of either a grain wrap, collard leaf wrap or in a bowl  I forgot to order the bowl, it still was really good.  The lemon bar made with xylitol was a good no sugar dessert option and surprisingly sweet tasting.   Second time in,  I order the POM "nut cheese" plate and the Raw Everything Bagel (the bagel being made from nuts and vegies).  There was so much food I could not eat it all and I really tried.  The POM cheese plate offer three different types of cheeses all made from nuts.  There was a cheddar rolled in walnuts, herb and spreadable almond cheese that didn't have a name but was delish.  It was served with various fresh vegetables, flax seed crackers and strawberries.  The Raw Everything Bagel sandwich was a nut and vegie made bagel with loads grated carrots, cabbage, sunflower sprouts and a almond ranch dressing spread. It was tasty but my only complaint and it is a common complaint of many restaurants is that stack the fillings so high that it is impossible to actually take a bite of your sandwich without everything falling out all over the place.  I ended up just pulling it apart and eating with a knife and fork to cut down on the mess.  I walk out with my doggie bags and a very satisfied belly and no guilt.
Ordered and they forgot about our order. Took more than 30 minutes to get food. But once the food came it was wonderful!!

Well, my partner and I have been waiting around 45 minutes for two wraps and quite frankly that's ridiculous. It doesn't matter how good the food will be, we won't be returning. Another table of two got their food before us and they came after. One of your servers came around 15 minutes ago to tell us our food would be our shortly. I don't know how you folks run your business, but it seems like slow service is the "it" thing around here.  *Update*  Food was good. Our lunch experience was an arrival of 12:45. We got our food at 1:30, my partner asked for no onions in his wrap, it came with onions. We waited another 10 minutes for his wrap to come back. We finally ate and asked for the check which took another 10 minutes to run the card.   Overall 4/5 for food 2/5 for experience.

I've been to pomegranate cafe twice now and I am for sure going back. I had no idea I lived so close to a vegan restaurant that also has raw-vegan options and I'm so happy this place is delicious!  I got the mermaid salad last night to go and though the tofu was rather over cooked and a bit too salty the rest of the salad was delightful. I'm a bit of a salt fiend but I think next time I'll order this salad sans the tofu.   This morning I dined in for a late breakfast with my non-vegan boyfriend. I had the Pomuffin and he had the Avocado Sandwich and he actually enjoyed it! We both appreciated the freshness and portion sizes. The drip coffee is really great, I can't wait to try the lattes and desserts next time.

Not for me thank you food not up to expectations.   Two visits neither time was I impressed.   Actually I was disappointed.  Service was fine I counted ten people behind the counter.  Not sure there was more than ten customers.  My wife felt the food was fine but commented that we didn't need to come back again.  Price seemed high.

This place is very cute, the food is great, and the staff are friendly. My wife had an avocado egg sandwich and loved it. A couple of times the coffee alternative was watery and bland, however my daughter and I shared a smoothie and we both enjoyed it. Overall a great place.

After a couple of visits and a strong hope for the start of a loyalty punch card program since I plan on returning for breakfast every weekend, I feel I can confidently give PomCafe 5 stars. The food and atmosphere satisfy everything I look for in a cute, neighborhood cafe that is trying to promote not only health but the idea that health tastes GREAT.   The buckwheat english muffin has sent me on a frenzy to find a recipe and bake it myself at home because it was perfect for that lumberjack sammie. The raw collard wrap I had for lunch today was an unexpected slam dunk - hello almond cheese! And I second other reviewer's prop for the orange juice. I want to buy a juicer now.  Answer your temptation at the raw bakery, trust me. Though the only semblance the raw donuts have of a real one is the shape, they still taste delicious. Chocolate cherry "cheese" cake? One of my co-diners actually had dessert for breakfast because it was too hard to pass up.  So far I have found no reason to dock points. I will keep returning though with solid determination to get to the bottom of each plate in search of any hint of disappointment. I'm fairly certain I won't find it though.

They must have something against ice because our water was warm and gross, even when they refilled it. The food was incredibly overpriced and funky (the morning egg scramble flavor was orange chicken - wtf?) Service was slow, even when there was only one other table with customers. The interior was nice and I've heard great things, but I was highly disappointed. I'm sticking to Green and Nami for vegan options in Phoenix.

As most reviews of this place state, the food is fresh, healthy and amazing. For us gluten-free seekers, there are many options that satisfy on the menu. The inside is large and spacious, casual. Service is not great, but this place also gets pretty busy around lunchtime. If you don't like vegan or vegetarian, this is not the place for you! There are no chicken sandwiches or turkey burgers here! I love the fresh smoothies, but they are quite pricey. Smoothies come in a mason size jar with a straw so this means you're getting a very small glass for about $8. But it's one of the only places of it's kind in our area. So if fresh, different and healthful is what you are craving, you will enjoy.
Pomegranate never disappoints.  Get onto the vegan and raw vegan deserts.  Pomegranate cake will blow your mind.  And the Almond Joys are awesome.  You'll never know they are almost healthy!

Due to business in Phoenix, I came across this place through a yelp search (what else), and was so happy after my first visit that I came back a second time on my departure day, grabbed dinner and had them pack me something as an in-flight meal.  They offer a great selection of vegan and raw vegan food, and while the vegan choices do offer a few comfort food items for the meat-eating-boyfriend-types, most of the menu is fairly healthy. As a mostly raw vegan, I did appreciate their raw selections, although I admit I went weak and had to try their daily burger, which was absolutely delicious!  They also have an eclectic dessert selection, which I resisted, but looked splendid.  I am sure that I will return here anytime I am in Phoenix.

I personally absolutely adore this place. The food takes your tastebuds on a ride they are probably not ready for. The staff are always there to ensure you have everything you need and never wrong on a good recommendation. Usually when people ask me for a recommendation for a decent place to eat, it's almost Pomegranate Cafe every time.

Gluten free, vegan paradise!   If I could afford to eat here every day, I'm pretty sure I would... I haven't been disappointed yet!   The only negative critique I have is that it can be a bit too pricey for my wallet, but the quality is great!

**Bumping this down a notch from 5 to 4 stars. Something has happened to this place over the last 2 years. It used to be a 'order your food and pay at the counter and we'll bring it over to you' experience. Now they try to herd you to a table when you walk in the door, so that you can wait for someone to bring you a glass of water that you used to just get yourself and then wait for ages for someone to take your order. And then wait for ages for the bill to be brought over so you can pay. We stopped frequenting this place simply because of this new way of serving people. We typically liked to come here during lunchtime or before heading somewhere else so can't afford to wait for very slow service. On a positive note though, the food still rocks.   ----  I have been a customer since moving to Phoenix several years ago. This place is great for vegetarians, but good for omnivores too. Meat eaters tell me the Lumberjack is awesome. I'm vegetarian, and this place is a unique find for veggie food in a very meat centric city.    You can make anything vegan, just by opting out of egg and milk products. Both are equally good.   I have enjoyed the freshness and tastiness of everything I have ever ordered here.  I usually have juice and one of their bowls with yummy pesto.  The place is usually pretty busy during prime mealtimes, so expect to wait a few minutes. It's also pricey. It isn't unusual to have a bill total $40 for two people.  That is the price you pay for fresh, healthy and organic goodness.  I have never had an issue with customer service, nor have they screwed up my order. The fresh juices and smoothies run around $8 or so and if I remember right the meals are $10-$12, give or take a couple bucks.  I have only had a few of their baked goods, but they always look tempting. Gluten-free options are available too.

Loved this place! I am not vegan but cannot do eggs, dairy or gluten... I had so many options at this place even with my allergies. I settled on the scramble (tofu) of the day which was with maple tempeh and dairy free cheese (daiya), sweet potato hash, and gluten free-vegan toast. I had never had a tofu scramble or tempeh so I was nervous I was going to be left disappointed and hungry! It was quite the opposite. The portion was perfect and the food was delicious!   My husband, who doesn't have any food allergies, ordered the enchilada scramble (regular eggs) which also came with the sweet potato hash and regular toast. He loved his meal! He mentioned that the enchilada sauce was so flavorful!  We both ordered lattes, his with regular milk and mine with soy milk. They were both pretty good but def not great.   We sat outside (on a not so hot summer morning) with the misters. There were plenty of plants which made for a nice environment.
I love love love the food here! The staff is also friendly. I take all my non-vegan friends here to show them just how good it can be to be vegan
Pomegranate Cafe has delicious vegan dishes. Their desserts and so yummy. Smoothies are energizing.

I love Pomegranate. We have been eating here since they opened the fist restaurant.  The new restaurant is fantastic. That have the best breakfast and brunches in Phoenix. If you go there please try the chocolate cake.       .

Great place and it keeps getting better. Their coffee is totally awesome (comes from coffee cartel, how could it not be?) and the menu/food choices keep getting better and better. We love to go for breakfast and get tofu scrambles.  Their vegan desserts are really incredible too. We love this place!  So great to find a vegetarian restaurant of this quality.

Very delicious food and tons of different options . they have fresh squeezed juice which is really awesome . Their wraps, rice bowls, burgers and weekly specials ... everything deserves a big thumbs up !!  have been to this place 3 times and they had amazing food and service each time .  Its a little pricey for a vegetarian/vegan restaurant .

Support the local non chain businesses. Great tea, coffee, breakfast & lunch options. Reasonable prices, expect a bit of a wait. Although this family run business just opened this year, it already has a great following. In the Trader Joe's plaza. Awesome salads!

I recently became vegetarian (on my way to becoming vegan) and my best friend (who is vegan) suggested this place tonight for dinner... and I have to say my mind was blown!!! Everything was so delicious! I got the Bountiful Bowl... a sort of Southwest style taco salad. It is huge and so unbelievably flavorful. My friend got the Mac & Cheese... the portion & flavor were outstanding as well. For desert we both got the Almond Joy type bar... it was better than the "real thing" and with no added/refined/artificial sugar!!! I am officially a fan. I will be back very soon.

Hidden in a strip mall but we'll worth the search right next to trader Joe's greeted immediately by likely the manager owner within a couple minutes a young server with a shirt that said positive vibes grow here she had a million dollar smile place is only 70 percent filled which is odd as most breakfast places along the way had lines outside but great energy inside every vegan natural option you can image a bit pricey had coffee burrito with egg and veggies total 15 dollars power outlets everywhere for working on pc coffee arrived warm not hot and came with coconut sugar which is a first servers are quick to clean after patrons leave a nice covered patio out front food service was quick and quality of food good overall a solid 4 the servers energy and joy made the trip worth it alone nice high energy positive experience

This place is great if you're vegetarian or vegan. They have tons of options. The food is pretty good and they have a lot of good smoothie and juice choices. I had the chai latte with the pom milk and I loved it!! I'll come back and try the lunch or dinner options I wasn't crazy about breakfast though.

I tried this place based on a recommendation of a co-worker.  I was very excited, so we ordered a variety of items.  The food was just average at best.  The tacos were so salty I couldn't finish them...what the heck!?!?  The salads were pretty good, but nothing over the top.  I don't think I will be trying this again....expected better based on the prices I paid.

I've been to Pomegranate Cafe a couple times now.  Today I was really inspired to write a review.  The first time I went to Pomegranate Cafe, a neighbor and I popped in for breakfast.  The food was just okay for both of us.  It was nothing special.  I should mention that we both got egg dishes that day, though I can't quite say what we ordered back then.    Today I was low on groceries in the house, so I decided to bring the family here for breakfast.  My daughter ordered the pumpkin bread french toast, which came with fruit (some sliced apples and pears (I think) and a coconut milk ice cream sundae for dessert (topped with Vegan chocolate syrup and Vegan whipped cream).  She loved it, but the portion was quite small.  She is 4 and a light eater and she ate all her french toast in about two minutes.  I cannot imagine an 8 or 10 year old getting filled up on this portion size.  I ordered the Lumberjack (made vegan) with tofu and vegan cheese. The sandwich was just alright, but the accompaniment was pretty yummerific.  I love sweet potatoes and yams, so anything with them included is already a head above!  DH had the teriyaki "chicken" bowl and it not only looked fab, it was DELICIOUS.   Needless to say, "I'll have what (he's) having."  Maybe I am just a fan of mock meats!    The expansion is great, but even at 10:30 on a Sunday... The place wasn't packed.    With waters all around, our bill came to $30 post tax and tip.    *Once again, I wasn't thrilled about tipping at the register.  I need to start carrying cash for these situations.   I will definitely be back to Pomegranate Cafe!  I can't wait to try their whole menu. :)

We tried the Dragon bowl the grill cauliflower and the hummus platter. Honestly the hummus was the only thing that was good. And make sure you have a lot of time because we waited 45 minutes to get this food that was not very good

I would say this is THE vegan restaurant in the Phoenix area with the BEST food.  I love it here.  The staff and atmosphere are great and the food is OH SO GOOD!!  Ok, so restaurant is not strictly vegan, the menu is standardly vegan and you can get egg or cheese added on at additional cost, which I have to admit I LOVE that, after years of going to other restaurants that will "be happy to" make your dish vegan by taking off cheese and egg and charging you the same price.   Anyhow, I went off on a tangent and I only order the vegan options anyway.    The items on the menu are fresh, super duper tasty, and great portions.  Fabulous breakfast choices!!!!! YAY!  VEGANS REJOICE!  It is so hard to find decent vegan breakfast options around Phoenix, and Pomegranate Cafe has amazing breakfast options!!!  I cannot wait until the new central Phoenix location is opened!    Thank you Pomegranate Cafe for being SO AWESOME!
Food is amazing and staff are friendly and welcoming. Wait time isnt that bad but well worth it for the food.
